Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah648
Reviews.Content: In March 2012 we stayed with Hotel Antiche Figure. I booked with them direct, via their website - incredibly easy and reasonably priced. On arrival in Venice the hotel was incredibly easy to find and in the perfect location for exploring all the main attractions and the wonderful "true" Venitian backstreets. The receptionist informed us they had upgraded our room to a suite with a lovely four poster bed and very modern bathroom. It was beautiful, Venetian yet modern and very clean. It was in a side street and extremely private, the perfect room for those who like to feel independent from the rest of the hotel. The staff were helpful, the location was perfect and the breakfast was tasty. We will definately stay here again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: histonite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Grand Canal, opposite the railway station, and only a five minute walk along the canal to the Bus Station at Piazalle Roma. The reception staff on arrival were so welcoming and helpful, even giving us two rooms to choose from. The rooms are immaculate and well furnished, and quite spacious for a city hotel. The buffet breakfast is good and plentiful, but when my wife looked for a fruit yoghurt there were none left, but they immediately offered to go out and buy some for her, she declined, but the genuine offer was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “best in venice”
Reviews.Author: Handan_CS
Reviews.Content: great location, lovely rooms, good breakfast, helpfull staff...i'd like to go there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jason L
Reviews.Content: So let me begin by saying that we did not stay in this hotel, however we had an amazing experience. Upon arrival in Venice at 5:25 am, we realized that we would not be able to check into our hotel until 1 pm. After crossing the bridge from the train station we stopped at the first hotel we came across (Hotel Antiche Figure) and asked if we could have a cup of coffee. We were warmly greeted by Carlo and were offered a deluxe continental breakfast for 10 euro. needless to say that the feeling of desperation slowly melted away as we had a light breakfast and enjoyed some coffee. The staff was delightful and welcoming. If this is the type of service they offer to their hotel guests then I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trumpet167
Reviews.Content: Antiche Figure is a lovely hotel on the Grand Canal. The most appealing aspect of this hotel is how friendly and helpful all the hotel staff are. For first time visitors to Venice this is a gem of a hotel. Coffee in the morning is not the best, although the continental breakfast is absolutely fine. We did not have a view but the room was quiet, comfortable and warm. I would recommend this hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location; views of the Grand Canale; fairly quiet”
Reviews.Author: quiltmaven
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our choice of hotels in Venice. We arrived from Rome by train and the Antiche Figure is right across the canal from the train station. The bridges in Venice tend to have lots of steps however so we did need to hire a porter to lug our four bags across the bridge on his cart (15 euro). The building the hotel is located in is a 500+ year old small palace. It used to have frescos painted on its front exterior, hence the name. We entered this small hotel and were warmly greeted by the desk staff. Our desk clerk took great pains to acquaint us with her city as well as the various means of transportation available. We took her advice and rode the vaporetto (a water bus) all the way around the Grand Canale (6.5 euros). We then walked around St. Mark's Square and returned to our hotel on the #2 vaporetto, a speedier version of the water bus that makes fewer stops. This gave us a great overview of the city. On our last morning, we took another porter and walked to the "peoplemover" which got us to the port. Unfortunately, it was the wrong port. Our friendly hotel staff failed to mention that there are two ports from which cruise ships sail. However, some entrepeunurial gentleman at the "other" port got us transportation which delivered us to a water taxi that took us to our ship, the Seabourn Spirit. None of this cost us anything and we arrived in plenty of time at the ship. Other than that one hitch, we loved everything in our hotel. The breakfast that is included is ample and will get you going for quite a while. The staff was equally friendly at meal time. If you want to be on the famous St. Mark's Square, this is not the hotel for you. However, if you would like to be close enough to walk and far enough from the hubub, you will no doubt enjoy the Antiche Figure as much as we did. (We were in room 412 overlooking the canal with wooden beams beautifully decocrated.)

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: Michealjohn
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed in the Hotel over the Easter period and as the hotel was full we were asked if we monded staying in the annexe, just down a passage at the side of the hotel. The room was larger than the standard rooms in the hotel and had a fridge, tea & coffee making facilities. It was lovely and also quiet being away from the bussle of the Grand Canal. The staff were excellent, giving us tips & directions as this was our first visit. Breakfast was good, varied choice & everything fresh. Excellent location, excellent hotel all round deserves all the plaudits people give it

Reviews.Title: “Clean and elegantly decorated room.”
Reviews.Author: sun4h
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located just across the Grand Canal from the train station. (Note that you still have to cross a bridge by foot to get there.) The room was a bit crowded mostly because we requested an extra bed. Otherwise, it was nicely decorated and very clean (including the bathroom :-)). The staff at the front desk and the dining room were all very friendly and courteous. Not much of a view from the window as it was facing another building but we didn't mind since we did not stay in the room much. The breakfast room was a bit small so it can get a bit crowded unless you get there early. The food was above average and offered many choices.

Reviews.Title: “A well-loved hotel and with good reason”
Reviews.Author: emmaedinburgh77
Reviews.Content: It was amazing reviews on Trip Advisor that signposted us to this hotel after much research and it was even better than I expected. From the lovely warm welcome my family and I received on our arrival to the superbly comfortable room with extraordinary view, it was all fantastic. We're coming back as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Weekend in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Bowiefan
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife had a really wonderful weekend in Venice Mar 22nd - 26th, which really quite suprised me as I have never been really interested in visiting the city. We couldn't have picked a friendlier hotel, the staff were absolutely excellent and the front desk staff were extremely helpful if you asked for their help or advice in anything. It was absolutely wonderful to sit outside the front of the hotel in the evening to people watch with a glass of Spritz after a long day of sightseeing and prices were reasonable in comparison with nearby bars. The continental breakfast in the morning was very good and set you up for the day and the cappucino was probably the best that I had in the city. we paid Euro 25 extra per day to have room 112 at the front left of the hotel, which had a double aspect view of the canal across to the rail station and down towards the new bridge, which we were happy to pay. The room was excellent and was well looked after by the staff on a daily basis. If we return to Venice we will definitely try to stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Briyano
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon had just ended and my wife and I had stayed in various hotels (6 in total) in Europe. Antiche Figure is tops by a billion miles! From the moment we stepped in, we were treated like family members, hotel staff eagerly offering valuable advice on how best to enjoy our holiday in Venice. It really felt like home, and hence it's really more like a home-tel rather than a hotel. Impeccable consistent service rendered and location was superb, 5 mins walk from piazzale Roma, the main bus station. Walking distance from san marco is about 20 mins, passing through rialto bridge. Rooms are full of character and are painstaking decorated to remind you that you're in Venice. Will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great launch pad forVenice”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpea2529
Reviews.Content: We stayed here happily for five nights in March. As many others have already written, Antiche Figure is very conveniently located (close to railroad station and Vaporetto, many restaurants and sights). Our first floor room was at the basic level, but met our needs and made it easy to come and go without resort to the elevator. Breakfast was included and very nice (fruit, rolls, ham, cheeses, cereal, cappuccino etc). Finally, the staff was helpful and most anxious to know if we had any suggestions or concerns (which we really didn't). We therefore add our recommendation of Antiche Figure to the many others below.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsPetrovic
Reviews.Content: I always stay in the Antiche Figure in Venice, it's got such a warm friendly atmosphere, excellent location and for Venice superb value, I highly recommend it to single travellers, couples and families. I go to Venice regularly and having found it I really look forward to going there. It's not like you are a another tourist or business travel, it feels like I have come to stay with family for a long weekend,

Reviews.Title: “Small gem on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Fineschmecker
Reviews.Content: If you are arriving in Venice's Santa Lucia train station you cannot find a more convenient location. However there is one catch- you must be able to go about 45 steps up the bridge over the canal and then down another 45 steps to get to the side on which the hotel is located. If you have heavy luggage and / or have any mobility issues this could be a challenge. Once you arrive at the hotel- just a two minute walk, you will be greeted by wonderful stafff who will go out of their way to make suggestions, reservations, provide travel instructions etc. They do it with a smile and warm Venetian hospitality. The rooms are small, but lovely with tasteful decor and the bathrooms quite elegant (even including warming bars for generously sized bath towels.) The breakfast is very nice with some of the best cappucinos anywhere. Three varieties of cereals, yogurts, sliced turkey, ham, cheese, croissants, fresh fruits and assorted sweets should hold anyone till lunch. All in all great value in high priced Venice. The vaporetto across the bridge (yes, that one!) gets you to almost everywhere in Venice, Murano, Burano and Torcello. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: asas2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fabulous weekend in Venice which was made extra special from our stay at Hotel Antiche Figure. The people that work there are very helpful and friendly, the superior room was very clean and comfortable and breakfast fresh and plentiful. Whether you transfer by private water taxi (mooring right outside) or water bus or road the hotel is very easy to find situated near the main bus station on the Grande Canal. People watching while sitting outside with a glass of chilled presseco was perfect after a days walking around the sights! When we return to Venice this will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: SusanFromAustin
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. The location was perfect, the rooms were beautiful, and the service was amazing. We stayed for 3 nights -- and would have loved to stay longer. If we are lucky enough to return to Venice some day in the future, we will absolutely stay at Hotel Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Antiche Figure based on the hotel's previous reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed! The hotel is ideally located opposite the railway station and close to the bus station. Clearly this makes it easy to get to when you first arrive, but it also brings another advantage: wherever you are in the city, you just need to follow the signs for "Ferrovia", and they lead you right back to your hotel. That is a BIG plus point in Venice! The hotel itself has clearly been renovated quite recently, and to a very high standard. Our room was a good size, with very high quality fixtures and fittings, both in the bedroom and in the bathroom. We had a room to the side of the hotel, so no view form the windows. However, I think this made it significantly quieter than a front-facing room would have been. And if you want to view the Grand Canal (who doesn't?), just sit outside the hotel sipping a Spritz, or else spend an hour on the steps of the adjacent church, watching the world float by. The hotel staff are wonderful - every staff member we came across was very friendly and helpful. It is clear that they all enjoy working at the hotel, and I guess this stems from high calibre management. There was a good selection of food available at breakfast, and the buffet was constantly replenished by the staff. In the evenings, the hotel bar has a good range of drinks available at reasonable prices. The only things that could be improved were mentioned in another recent review: (1) it would be good to have WiFi in the bedrooms, not just in the lobby and breakfast rooms and (2) teamaking facilities in the bedrooms would be good. Neither of these are dealbreakers, though. When we return to Venice, we will definitely stay at the Antiche Figure. I recommend this hotel very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: veedubmelb
Reviews.Content: I didn't know this hotel was owned by the same people as the Canal Grande (which is supposed to be their four star one, a little further along the canal), and if I had I probably wouldn't have chosen it as its sister hotel fell just slightly short of expectations last year. But as it turns out, despite being quite a bit cheaper, I had a much better experience at this hotel. Friendly, helpful staff, spacious room (for Italy) with a bath, and a nice breakfast (although on the second day we weren't offered cappucino). Its best asset however is its location, immediately across the bridge from the train station, which will save you lugging bags down narrow croweded streets and over bridges to and from the station if you're arriving by train. It's also handy to Piazzale Roma for the airport bus, if you're coming or going that way.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Well Located and Reasonable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian W W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located opposite the train station on the Grand Canal. If you are arriving by bus , you don't cross the Grand canal but you do need to negotiate smaller bridges on the same side of the grand canal. Staff are switched on , speak Englidh well are very helpful with recommendations and local knowledge.Breakfast is adequate and the rooms are well maintained . The only problem is the noise from the canal if you are lucky enough to have a room facing the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!”
Reviews.Author: lauriebeth1121
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Grand Canal and we were upgraded to a view room at very little additional cost. The beautiful rooms and views were as wonderful as the very friendly and helpful staff. We rode the train in and the hotel is right across the canal from the train station - very convenient! Probably my favorite hotel on our 4 week tour of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Frendly and cosy place”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Convinently situatuated close to the railway station, just next the to channel, this hotel has a really friendly and helpful staff. The room was nice, all in red, a charming place. We decided to stay one extra night but as they were full, they help us finding another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Best Service”
Reviews.Author: Allan P
Reviews.Content: I have chosen Hotel Antiche Figure because of the location proximity to bus station. However, the helpful and friendly staffs truly exceed my expectation. Staffs are reception speak good english and provide you will a lot of information during checking-in. All the staffs make you feel warm in the heart as they truly offer helps at anytime that they see you. There is only 16 rooms in hotel, and they make an effort to make sure every guests (from anywhere) feel like home. They have outstanding services, the hotel will be even better if all rooms can include WIFI in room (there is wired internet in room, and WIFI in lobby), free bottles of mineral water, kettle and tea cups in room.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Customer Sevice”
Reviews.Author: Ghead0213
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right next to the water. Nice rooms. Great breakfast.The Hotel staff was very helpful with everything,giving out directions, to making reservations to the Opera,and to helping us get a water taxi at 4am. But to top it off,the evening gentleman had made us fresh hot coffee and fresh croissants. Wow, it was very nice for him to pull out the meats and cheeses just for us at 4am. We didn't eat until we got off the plan five hours later. Thanks Goodness we had breakfast that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Simply splendid”
Reviews.Author: Sacha1973
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt about why this hotel has won the 'Traveller's choice Award 2011'. It is an absolutely splendid hotel at a great location with genuinely hospitable staff. Everybody at the hotel, from reception to the ladies who take care of breakfast are warm, friendly and go out of their way to help you. We arrived very early and were given the option to upgrade for a small additional fee so that we could have a room right away. Reception staff took their time to tell us where to go and what highlights to see. When asking for restaurant recommendations, they let it depend on what type of food we were in the mood for and none of the restaurants were very touristy. I would recommend this hotel to everybody and will definitely stay there again when going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaFG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in front of the train station, which is fabulous, because you don't need to take an expensive taxi nor walk a lot with you baggage. You do have to walk to go Piazza San Marco, but while you walk you can discover the place. The hotel staff is nice and they are always willing to help you. The rooms are clean and tidy. The breakfast is good, but it could be better. There's only wifi in the lobby area, not in the rooms. Next time I'll visit Venezia I will definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look further - a must stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: caff1978
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have added but felt so strongly about this little hotel, I had to add a comment. I booked it because of the reviews and was over the moon with the place. I was initially a little worried as I am a bit of a hotel snob but my nerves were immediately put to bed. The hotel is situated a 5 minute walk from the bus station. We caught an airport bus from the airport. This is run by AVTO and cost us â‚¬5 each. Bargain. They run every 30 mins and it takes 15 mins to get to Venice. The short walk to the hotel could not have been easier. We arrived at the hotel and I was immediately impressed by the staff. Everyone is so friendly and happy. We were given a map and time was taken to show us the best walking routes and how the water buses worked. Our room was lovely. It was a standard room (red duvet) and I was worried as the photos on this site made them look a bit tatty. The room was perfect. The bathroom was also great and we could see the canal if we stuck our heads out the window! There is free wifi in reception and the breakfast was fine - kept us going! If you want a lovely hotel in a great location, which is reasonably priced with wonderful, friendly, helpful staff - please look I further. Thank-you Antiche figure for an amazing stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZEGONZ
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very well situated, just in front of the Grand Canale and the railway station. Very conveniant to get in and out of the city. Spacious and confortable rooms with marble bathrooms. Breakfast could be better and it is not worth it to pay extra for cannal views as what you see is the railway station. Nevertheless the staff is very friendly and the ambience of this small hotel is very nice and relaxing. The best thing is its location, impossible to get lost.

Reviews.Title: “First stop on European Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NevBogus
Reviews.Content: It's no wonder these guys win awards for customer service. From the moment we arrived after 38 hours of travelingto the moment we had to leave a few days later they were all fantastic. Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to a Junior Suite and it was beatifully renovated and more spacious than we expected. To keep this review short I will say that everything about this Hotel was outstanding except for a couple of tiny niggles which I mention only to show how close to perfect this place is. The heating was permanently on which made the room almost uncomfortably warm at times, however, if the alternative was to freeze then I can live with it. The only other minor issue was with the pillows which were thin, flat and extremely hard. In a nutshell, if you are coming to Venice then you should stay here. Outstanding location, people and room, we could not have asked for a better first stop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: casey6fox
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. The room was great, large compared to those I have stayed in throughout other parts of Europe. The staff went above and beyond to be friendly, helpful, and accomodating. The location is perfect as well. I traveled with my elderly grandmother who struggled to walk a bit, and we were very thankful for the location of this hotel when we say everyone else with their luggage navigating the streets of Venice from much farther away! Our stay at the hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SandSKapolei
Reviews.Content: It's hard to know where you want to be in a new city -- but this turned out to be a perfect location for us! Right on the Grand Canal, away from the bustle of "downtown"; right across from the train station; easy to catch the Vaperotto (water bus); close to several authentic back-street restaurants (fine dining without the stuffiness!). We loved our stay here. Cute corner room allowed us full views of the activity of the Grand Canal. Comfy bed, nice bathroom. Great helpful staff helped us make restaurant choices (and reservations) for dinner. Nice breakfast in the morning. Nice patio for sipping cappachino in the morning, and a glas of wine from the wine bar in the evening, great for people and Grand Canal watching. Staff was attentive to all our needs. We highly recommend this lovely hotel in Venice, and hope your experience will be as rich and memorable as ours was!

Reviews.Title: “affordable gem”
Reviews.Author: captainkat
Reviews.Content: There are so many reasons to choose Hotel Antiche Figure. A short walk across the bridge from the train station alowed us to spend our time enjoying our stay in Venice rather than searching for transportation to our hotel. Also a short walk to Piazalle Roma, the transportation hub for buses and water taxis. The hotel is spotlessly clean and our room was exactly what is pictured on the web site, very large by Italy standards and a large marble bathroom. I loved that the windows opened to enjoy the fresh spring temperatures. The staff could not have been more attentive and helpful, all speaking English and eager to help with directions, recommendations, internet access, a tasty breakfast with a smile. Close proximity and a short walk to many sites including St. Marks. This hotel is nearly perfect and a great bargain. A caution about the restaurants on St. Marks square: the prices we paid were nearly triple what they are off the piazza ($27 for two cappucinos).

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: ssw57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my husband's birthday.....the staff were so helpful and friendly with great recommendations for restaurants. Our room was on fourth floor facing the canal which was surprisingly quiet at night. Possibly the only downside is that the hotel faces the station which is not ideal but on the upside is very close to bus station and river bus stop so travelling from either airport is very easy.We took a trip to the glass factory which was arranged by the hotel and was free! We could have gone using our water bus pass but another plus for the hotel! Top tip..get a water bus pass when you arrive...so convenient and much cheaper than the taxis!

Reviews.Title: “A five star hotel at a three star price”
Reviews.Author: spryfieldCanada
Reviews.Content: If there is such a thing as a perfect hotel this would be it. Fantastic location..great staff..great price. About a 30 min walk to St Marks square. Hotel is directly accross the Grand Canal from the train station..so water busss/taxis and gondola's are easy to use. A great hotel for a visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel, all hotels should aspire to be!!”
Reviews.Author: venicevic
Reviews.Content: As usual i trawled through trip advisor to find a suitable hotel at a suitable price. I decided on the Antiche Figure due to the glowing reports.Believe me i was not disappointed, the staff could not do enough for you, for example i mentioned on the way out that it was raining, and loan behold a staff member produced an umbrella for us to use for the day! We stayed in a deluxe room facing the grand canal, the room was spacious, in gorgeous Venetian furnishings and fittings,also the bed was huge and very comfortable to boot.Tea and coffee making facilities in the room also which was an added bonus,especially for mainland Europe anyway.Location brilliant,just a short 2-300 metre walk to the bus station and half that to the train station.The overriding memory for me will be,the friendly,attentitive nature of the staff from the manager through to the cleaners! You get a sense they really care about their guests satisfaction, which is important to every paying customer.This was my fourth trip to Venice, and this is easily the best accommodation i have stayed at,also my first 5* rating.Superb!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, brilliant, brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: dizzyrascaldj
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were a group of 6, from the moment we left we were made so welcome, we were upgraded to suites, given a map and great advice of how to visit Venice. Everything about our stay was effortless. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a true gem in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: phreckles
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after doing some research on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed! The hotel is just across the Santa Lucia Venice train station. My husband and I didn't have to walk very far and we found Antiche Figure very easily. The service was excellent too. Alessandro was so helpful! He explained very patiently to us how we can explore the entire Venice. We were also upgraded to the deluxe room with a mini balcony that faces the grand canal. Beautiful view! Their breakfast selection was pretty good. They served wonderful cappuccino. Overall, we had an amazing stay at this charming hotel. I would definitely recommend you to book with Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaSt
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location near the train station Santa Lucia. This is extremely convenient for travellers ariving by train because carrying one's luggage over the steep bridges of Venice / using water bus with luggage during the busy season may not be an easy exercise. In contrast with what one may expect from accommodation near the train station, there are no homeless people or "weird people" in the surroundings of the hotel. There is no noice in the rooms comming from the outside as the hotel has new windows. Vaporretto stop is just 2 minutes from the hotel and water taxi stop is just outside the hotel. Location is clearly one of the most important assets of this hotel. The hotel is very clean and the bedlinen are changed on daily basis. There is adjustable air condition / heating in every room. There are two small rooms for breafast. There is a buffet for breakfast and the choice is adequate to approx. 5 day stay (you can eat something else each day). The staff of the hotel is extremelly welcoming and helpful with orientation in the city as well as with booking tickets for concerts etc. We visited the hotel during the Carneval. As wearing a costume was obligatory for some events occured during the Carneval and we did not manage to arrange one before our arrival to Venice we were glad that the hotel lent us cloaks which we could wear over own clothes. I would certainly choose hotel Antiche Figure again if comming back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “So romantic”
Reviews.Author: UsaTraveler2009
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Venice and we chose Antiche Figure based on Trip Advisor reviews. It was everything we had hoped for. Charming hotel. We came in by train and it was great to look across the Grand Canal and see our hotel. Venice is small enough that we were able to walk everywhere. The staff really went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect in every way. (especially Anka) Restaurant recommendations were spot on. One of our favorite days was spent visiting Burano and Torcello (a very special place).

Reviews.Title: “Still so good!”
Reviews.Author: DrPrada
Reviews.Content: Third trip to Venice and third time at Antiche Figure. Still so clean, friendly and value for money. Great location on the Grand Canal and 2 minutes from the vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully accessible from bus and train station and good value”
Reviews.Author: Beaver5
Reviews.Content: Alessandro was most helpful by email and all was ready exactly as requested, When in depths of Venice you meet people hauling bags across bridges or from the waterbus we realised how lucky we were to have found Hotel Antiche Figure, And you can get anywhere from there quickly by waterbus. Good advice and very helpful with tickets for a concert.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for cruise staying or any kind of visit!”
Reviews.Author: CatherineChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Perfect place if you are taking a cruise, or just visting. The hotel is so lovely, charming, clean and helpful! We paid a couple of extra euro to move to the front of the hotel so we had views of the Grand Canal. It was perfect! 1.It is right on the grand canal right across from the train station and the water bus stop so you can get ANYWHERE easily. 2. It is two small bridges from Piazzale Roma which is where you can take the bus from the airport for only a couple of euros. Once you get off the bus, head towards the Grand Canal. Do NOT take the large glass bridge over the canal, turn right and go over two small bridges. The hotel is right before the bridge you would take to cross the Grand Canal to get to the train station or water buses. 3. To get to your cruse ship, depending on where it is docked, you can go back to the Piazzle Roma and use the people mover or use the water bus to drop you off at the dock. We used the bus as our ship was not docked where most of the larger ships are placed. I booked this hotel because of trip advisor's reviews and it was not wrong! My travel agent wanted to book me somewhere else and the price was going to be twice as much. She also wanted to get us transportation from the airport and also to the cruise ship. If we had gone with her, the transportation alone was going to cost us (family of 4) about $700. You do not need any private transportation. The bus from the airport and the regular bus service is convenient and perfect. The front desk people are so helpful and speak beautiful English. I called them directly to find out about transportation, they told me everything I needed to know. Can't say enough good things about this hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit”
Reviews.Author: Gmarotta12
Reviews.Content: I'm looking forward to a return visit to the Antiche Figure. I totally enjoyed this hotel last year--the owners, Francesca and spouse, the servers at breakfast and the bartender were so, so, accommodating. I hope to renew my experiences there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: georgenmiller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally across the Grand Canal from the train station. You just turn left out of the train station and go one block, cross the Ponte Scalzi and then go one block to the right and voila! you're there. Super clean and great rooms. Wonderful breakfast included. The staff of Alessandro, Anka, Francesca and Antonio were all super helpful and friendly. Defintely consider this hotel when you're booking for Venice. I loved my stay here. I wish it could've been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: MeanVivi
Reviews.Content: It's just opposite to the train station San Lucia & 10 mins walk from Plaza Roma Bus station which extremely convenient for travelling between Venice & other parts of Italy. for inner city travelling, just 30mins walk to San Marco Square! With it's relatively low room charge, the services provided there are excellent and professional. City map will be provided and detail info will be explained. free wifi & one desk top available on the ground floor made us keep connected with our families. I would say that the "software" (ppl) in this hotel is excellent! of cos' the "hardware" (decoration) cannot be compared with 5 stars chained hotel but as a frequet leisure traveller, i could say that this is really a nice place to stay in during the time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our entire Europe trip!”
Reviews.Author: Vikki B
Reviews.Content: The hotel stuff everyday would ask you 'is everything ok?'. Beautiful set up, particularly the bathroom facilities. Very convenient location, right opposite the Santa Lucia station (the main one in Venice) between the canal. Good range of buffet breakfast. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: hopeanderson09
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms here, one on the second floor and one on the fourth. While they were virtually identical in decor, I liked mine better because the ceilings were much higher. I also had a gorgeous Murano chandelier--a very nice touch. We loved the silk-covered walls and marble bathrooms. Everything was clean and comfortable and so much more spacious than the hotel we'd come from in Paris. I also recommend the side rooms--I could still see the Grand Canal, but it was quieter. The staff is friendly and helpful, which is crucial for first-time visitors to Venice. We only got lost once, and very slightly, thanks to their directions. The funny thing is that we got a 15-minute orientation with map and lecture immediately upon arrival--which left us slightly dazed after our flight. Breakfast (included) was so-so and got increasingly boring as the days went on, but who cares about that? Venice is so fantastic that it hardly mattered. We were on the go constantly, not only within Venice but to the islands of Mazzorbo and Burano. To the extent that we hung around the public part of hotel, it was to access Wifi--a real pain that took lots of time and had to be accomplished from the lobby. (Apparently, they are getting Wifi in the rooms this year.) Btw, I recommend taking a water taxi from the airport unless you enjoy dragging your luggage up a huge flight of stairs and down another one on the nearby bridge. We did do it upon our departure by train (the station is just across the canal), but there really wasn't another option.

Reviews.Title: “best choice”
Reviews.Author: Choe y
Reviews.Content: I stayed antiche figure two nights and it was my best choice. First of all, all of the staff are extremely friendly and kind. When I checked in, they gave me Venezia map and explained some famous sites detailedly. Whenever I had breakfast, the lady who works for breakfast made me excellent cappuccino. The staff at reception desk are always smiling me and welcoming , ready to help me. Thanks to them, I enjoyed Venezia a lot. Also this hotel is located right across the station and just five mimute distance from the Piazza Rome, so the transportation is very convenient. And at the window of your hotel room, you can see Grand Canal. The view counl't have been better. All the things are very good! I recommend Antiche Figure Hotel to all of you planning to trip to Venezia!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; welcoming and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JJDC09
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on its location and the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. It was the perfect choice for my one-night stay in Venice prior to a cruise. Given my limited time in the city, it was important to me to be near Piazzale Roma to make getting to and from the hotel with my luggage as easy as possible.Staff was very helpful from when I emailed a question about their smoking policy (and happily learned it was all non-smoking) to when I returned to pick up my luggage after having checked out earlier that day. My room was clean and comfortable and I felt very safe in the hotel and its environs which as a woman traveling alone was very important to me. While the breakfast isn't a huge buffet, it more than met my needs and had a good variety and the staff serving breakfast were very efficient and friendly. The freshly made caffelatte was really what made my morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- the best staff!”
Reviews.Author: Janfromnorthridge
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel on the Grand Canal and across from the Train Station (which made it a breeze to catch the train on the morning of our departure!). The rooms are clean and the bathrooms are typical Italian -- marble and chandeliers!! The staff at the front desk was tremendous! Their English was better than my limited Italian. Breakfast was the usual Italian fare -- and great cappuccino!

Reviews.Title: “Well, a lamp didn't work....”
Reviews.Author: embeeStockport
Reviews.Content: Other than that, can't think of anything negative. They offered us a premium room at discount (showed us both) and we took it - terrific view, large, comfortable bed, tea/coffee making, safe, SHAVING MIRROR!!! Breakfast ample, excellent coffee from the bar. They were extremely helpful, positive and courteous at all times. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and the team running it. It's on the canal, opposite the train station but that means you aren't in any of the darker areas of Venice AND it's 200m to the bus stop for the airport. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travel_pair24
Reviews.Content: If you arrive in Venice by train this is a great place to stay. The station if directly across the Grand Canal so only a 5 min walk with just one bridge to cross. We booked a canal front room which was beautifully decorated and very stylish. The buffet breakfast was very nice and the staff were extremely helpful. I would highly recommend this as a great place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: laikador
Reviews.Content: We sent our son and daughter-in-law here on their honeymoon and they loved it and told us we had to go there ourselves. When we finally did, we agreed. It's a charming hotel on the canal, conveniently located. Although it's only a 5 minute walk from the Piazza Roma, remember you're lugging suitcases over step-lined bridges, so it's not easy. We ended up sharing a water taxi with a large group to get to our cruise ship, rather than face that walk again. But the hotel is comfortable and charming and the staff very accommodating. Even though it's on the canal, you are across from the train station, which is not the greatest view, but still a thrill. This place has gotten increasingly popular and the increase in price reflects it -- it was a real bargain when we sent our kids. Venice is incredibly expensive so the price it not outrageous, but no longer a bargain. Breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: Limelighter
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our holiday so much more special. It's a traditionally Venetian sort of place, not too big, not too small. The staff just cannot do enough for you, even giving us a map and walking us through where all the best tourist spots were when we mentioned it was our first time in Venice. And every time we went back to the hotel they remembered us and seemed to genuinely care about how our holiday was. The small bar in the foyer is great for when using the free wifi, though if you ask for a spirit be prepared for them to fill the entire glass with booze with a mixer on the side! Not that I'm complaining, considering the amount of alcohol provided, it was a bargain! The room was clean, tidy and beautifuilly decorated, and the breakfast provided is lovely and always well stocked. We stayed in one of the smaller rooms (314) but even that was wonderful, and certainly didn't feel cramped. The location of the hotel is about as perfect as you can get - walking distance to Rialto and San Marco, and directly opposite the train station, Scalzi Bridge and several vaporetto stops. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone that wanted to visit Venice. It will be very difficult to top it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanine S
Reviews.Content: I don't often take the time to write reviews --- but our experience at the Hotel Antiche Figure was wonderful. Firstly, the location is very convenient write across from the train station if you are traveling to or from other Italian cites you just have to drag your luggage up and down 1 bridge and walk a short distance. It is also very close to the bus station and taxi stand which is helpful for getting to and from the airport. The hotel staff is absolutely wonderful --- very helpful and interested in your experience in Venice as a whole. Since we went at an off-time (January 2012) when the hotel wasn't fully booked the staff suggested an upgraded room (which was lovely and comfortable) for a very small charge. Again, I got the sense that they wanted our experience to be the best one possible. The hotel is clean and comfortable and the windows surprisingly block out any noise from being directly along the canal. We had to leave before dawn to catch an early flight and the considerate evening staff wanted to make us coffee before we left!

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Ona G
Reviews.Content: I'd like to recommend the hotel to all! The staff is so great, we got excellent tips for a different Venice, learned a lot new we would have never, ever found out by ourselves.Best service in Venice ever!!!! Great cappuccino at breakfast, beautiful, clean rooms. Definetely will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RotaryJ
Reviews.Content: The location was great ... just a short walk from the train station. The rooms were tastefully decorated and clean. Breakfast was enjoyable. Staff helpful ...gave suggestions and booked excursions. Safe area...enjoyed a drink on the patio watching the activities of the canal. Five women, who wanted to experience Venice (while their husbands cycled) all agreed that the choice to stay at this hotel was a great idea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimhuber
Reviews.Content: Design with taste and elegant. They have friendly and professional staffs. The internet works good , and you have a desk enough large for working. It was just an elegant hotel for travelers who want to have comfortable stay here.Overlooking to the sea.Most of all i really the room , well arrange and decorated. Just perfect!! It was just an amazing stay in the hotel and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: redsetter60
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on tripadvisor once again before booking was in venice two years ago and wanted to another great hotle on the canal grande the friendly staff from start to finish was fantastic they made sure all were welcome the room we booked overlooked the canal and was well well worth the upgrade and the size of the room was very welcome and quiet too facilities in the hotel were all availiable even the wifi was sorted out on arrival very clean and fresh, breakfast in the morning was interesting as the first morning we went down there was sufficient seating food was enough and tasty second morning every one went down at the same time so there was lack of seating around 9-00ish but hey we went back up to the room and packed and came down and seats available so no problem location is across from the water taxi so convienent or short walk to the bus terminus to rialto was approx 25 mins depending if you did not stop at the many bars on the way for a drink would recommned this hotel to friends and would use it again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Do9aN
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for three nights for motherâ€™s 70th birthday. Overall, this hotel met all our expectations (which were already set high based on the reviews we read). Each and every staff (from top to bottom) are super professional, kind, and always in "how can I help you" mode. Very reactive and very attentive indeed. We booked the hotel from their internet site, had no problems with reservation, at check-in or check-out. They were quite reactive in responding to my emails (re transport etc.). The hotel is very strategically located, within a very short walk from train station or taxi drop out point. This is important to minimize walking time when you first arrive (as there is no land traffic in Venice). However, for San Marco square, you need to take vaporette or walk (about 20-30 mins walk). We did not think it was a problem, as there is no really ideal place in Venice (including those right next to San Marco square). I booked a room with a canal view (and preferably one with balcony), and was put initially on first floor, but then changed to 4th floor, which we found more pleasant. Plus the room with balcony probably would not have made much difference (given the size of the balcony). The windows of our room were quite small, but the side view was quite nice (despite the restoration of nearby church). The room and bathroom were nicely decorated, and very clean. The room sometimes got too hot (despite outside temperature being between 1-3 Celcius). But setting the thermostat too low (around 18) does the trick. Breakfast was not anything special, and the breakfast room was a bit small (with bar being used as an overflow room), but the friendly service compensated it. On a final note, one might have expected a small gesture (of any kind) for a special event such as 70th birthday, but well, nobody is perfect ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Cindy528
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor and clean hotel. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. Bathrooms were large and felt like home. Location was very centralized and easy to get too. Staff was extremely helpful and patient. We would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine2333
Reviews.Content: This a very late review for our trip to Italy in May but better late than never! This has to be one of the best hotels we stayed on our entire trip to Italy the staff is super friendly and helpful I think they made all the diffrence :) The breakfast was delicious and provided a huge selection. The staff always had great recommendations, the room was small however sufficient for two people. It is almost directly opposite to the train station which was great all we had to do was go across the bridge to catch our train to Florence! Also we took the bus from the airport and it was walking distance to the hotel. I cannot wait to be back! - The two canadian girls :) (if the staff still remebers us haha)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in a city that lacks in customer service made us so happy to return here each night and made it well worth e”
Reviews.Author: Kmr8778
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here in January and were warmly welcomed by the front desk. They also gave us a detailed map and helped us make plans for our stay. The staff made restaurant recommendations that all lived up to the recommendation. We were pleased with the room, the daily breakfast, and the location. Although across the canal from the train station we had no problems with noise levels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: 2020trav
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a trip to Venice, look no further. This hotel is beautiful and comfortable. We loved the place and the staff. Cheerful hardly captures the joyous acclaim we were greeted with each morning. And no question was too small or foolish--everyone on staff seemed intent on making sure we had the best possible trip to Venice. Also, the location across the bridge from the train station is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: V E
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great location! Plus great breakfast and very attentive and friendly staff... We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Antiche..!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, great location and staff that go the extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: sm10987
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with fantastic staff. We had a great stay. Location is perfect. Antonio will look after you, very friendly and always wanting to help.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, ok breakfast but great location”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0nGenie
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on reviews and it was a good choice as it was easy to find. Venice seems to be quite expensive (hotel-wise) so I we were happy with what we got. We were offered an upgrade if we paid more but after seeing the room we declined as it was bigger but was still just one room and we were not really going to be in the room during the day to appreciate the view. Breakfast was average compared to other places. Still lots on offer Rooms are well designed but bed are old and seem to sag in the middle One negative is that it was extremely warm in the rooms. We asked if they could do something about the heating but they could not as its centrally controlled. We had to open the windows as we could not sleep, it was so hot in the room. Of course its very cold outside which means someone had to get out of bed in the middle of the night to close the windows again Venice is just mesmerising and definatelty worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: klr
Reviews.Content: Central location right on the canal opposite the main railway station. We got a water taxi from the airport which took us through Venice and dropped us at the hotel front door a great first taste of Italy. The rooms were very small buts that to be expected in italy and the location.The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful informing us of the best places to eat etc

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: theresa-melb
Reviews.Content: After watching people drag their suitcases all over Venice I was so glad I had booked the Hotel Antiche Figure just over the bridge from the station. We were warmly greeted by the staff and given lots of information. Our room was beautiful with a very luxurious bathroom and overlooked the grand canal. Location is great, even had a laundomat 2mins away. Everything about our stay was just perfect. Hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Venice experience!”
Reviews.Author: BarbGToronto
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults, 2 teens) spent one magical night at the Antiche Figure and it was definitely the highlight of our trip. Venice itself was an experience not to be missed, and the hotel made our visit absolutely perfect. It is located directly across the canal from the train station. We spotted it immediately upon arrival and were being checked in within minutes of arriving in Venice. It could not have been simpler. The staff were beyond friendly and helpful and spent a good amount of time acquainting us with the city and providing maps and useful info on where to go and what to see in Venice. The location is excellent - within easy walking distance of the main sites, but far enough away that the evenings were quiet and relaxed. I much preferred this to being in the middle of the tourist area. Our room was beyond expectations - we had a room designed for three with a King size bed and a twin, but there was enough space to bring in another twin bed. The design and decor of both the bedroom and the bathroom felt very luxurious, beds were comfy, air conditioning worked well and we could not have asked for better on our visit. Venice is without a doubt on our list of places to return to.

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Richard O
Reviews.Content: unforgettable experience. worth every penny that i paid!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good room”
Reviews.Author: MML651
Reviews.Content: The hotel is actually straight across from the main train station and we merely walked over the bridge to get there - it was misty and dark but we easily found our way. The room was beautifully decorated but we found the central heating was turned up too much - they tried to fix this when we were there but we also could open windows in the bedroom and bathroom. The room was of a good size and had a separate entrance area, this contributed to it being really quiet. The hotel staff were really friendly (except for one male who had a strange sense of humour? and behaved arrogantly) - they were all very helpful. Free wifi access which we even picked up sitting outside, looking over the Grand Canal. Breakfast included hard boiled eggs which were delicious and made a welcome change from all the sweet food on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately return.”
Reviews.Author: tdandrews
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche Figure is a wonderful hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful and the breakfasts are great. The convenience to the train station is why I chose this hotel in the first place. The experience we had there would be why I would definately return in the future. This hotel is not in the heart of the tourist part of town but we enjoyed the walk eventhough the boats can get you there in no time. Venice was definately a highlight to my Italy experience and this hotel just made that experience even better. This is definately a hotel I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Lpulitude
Reviews.Content: I have to reinstate what the rest had said....it was a great stay! Yes, it is literally right across the grand canal from the train station Yes, the hotel staffs are the most welcoming of all of our stays (in Rome and Florence) in Italy And yes, we got an upgrade to junior suite for staying 2 nights promotion The junior is very venetian style decorated and it is beautiful. We both love it. What's more, it was indeed very clean and cosy. Although we need to walk a small distance to the hotel new extension block, it is all worth it. The bath comes with a 6 massage nozzles to wear off your whole day tiredness immediately. For all the first time visitor....this hotel is highly recommended as Venice's path is very difficult for moving your luggage along and the water bus is expensive - Euro 6 per way!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate location for a hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: karelva
Reviews.Content: I won't restate what everyone else has said: Great value as prices are moderate, breakfast is included and is fantastic, staff is very professional and welcoming. However, I wish to emphasize the one key benefit of this hotel. For tourists, the LOCATION can't be beat. It's simply impossible to do better: - 3 minute walk from Piazza Di Roma, where the ATVO airport shuttle drops you off. So you get off the bus, you walk literally 3 minutes, and you're at the hotel. No expensive water taxi or hauling your suitcases across town from Piazza Di Roma to find your hotel. This benefit obviously applies when you are leaving as well. - 1 minute walk to the train station (right across the Grand Canal, and the bridge is right there). If you intend to take the train to go to Padova, Verona or Milan, the hotel is perfect. Also, if you want to take a Vaporetto water bus to get to the landmarks, the Ferrovia train station stop is directly across the Canal. - 15 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge, 20 minutes to the big landmarks, like Piazza St Marco and Accademia. - Right next down the street, there is a public laundromat. If you are traveling for an extended period of time and you need to do laundry, it's right there. It's pricy: A 6 kg load will run you around 13 euros. But it's still totally worth it to me. That is truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: J_82Birmingham
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the back of the reviews on trip advisor and felt they represented it well, it was a good hotel with no major areas i would find fault, unless i was looking to be particularly critical. The hotel is situated almost exactly opposite the rail station and on the Grand Canal. For those who fly with Ryanair into Treviso airport the coach station is around 2 minutes walk away also, crossing over the bridge to the station, and then across the canal. In terms of the location it is very convenient, maybe 20 minutes walk from Rialto Bridge and San Marco, albeit the walk is not particularly easy without a good map; the winding avenues of Venice can get confusing. When we visited in winter the absence of crowds meant the avenues felt at times slightly intimidating, something i did not expect from the city. This however is no reflection of the hotel whatsoever, and there is a boat station literally one minute walk away, from which regular 24 hour boats go to San Marco, Rialto and other main areas of the city. This issue would also be the case irrespective of a location stayed in. Some rooms will overlook the canal, and we were offered the chance to upgrade from 30 Euros a night, having had a chance to look at both rooms before hand. The hotel itself looked slightly shabby i felt from the outside, although inside was immaculate. The room we were allocated was spacious, outstandingly clean and had all of the mod cons you may expect such as a mini bar, tv, hair dryer etc. There was even a chandelier on the ceiling for a feeling of real class! The bathroom was also very large and very welcome in comparison to many tiny bathrooms at other hotels. At night we did not hear any noise whatsoever. The hotel also had a small bar area, and two breakfast rooms which also had an attention to detail. The bar was well stocked with some nice wines, and always had some peanuts and crisps free to nibble on. Breakfast was a standard continental fare with croissants, cereals, hard boiled eggs, some fruit and some cakes. The milk wasn't particularly cold as a very minor criticism. Others have mentioned the excellent customer service and we found this to be true. From the moment we walked in the staff were professional, attentive, friendly and helpful. From answering minor requests promptly such as more towells, to giving guidance to queries on attractions to visits, they were first rate. They even gave some tips we were unaware of which were really useful. The staff had a smile on their face throughout and genuinely seemed to want to make your stay good. Even when we were leaving they happily stored our bags away and were helpful until the second we checked out. Overall a very positive reflection of this hotel and i would happily stay here again. My main recommendations would be that the boat is the easiest way in winter to travel to the main attractions, and if you are walking then it is best to cross the Grand Canal where the walk is more lively and less littered with narrow alleyways. The city itself closed up quite early in the evenings, although this was a reflection of the fact it was midweek and winter, but something to be aware of if anyone is travelling at a similar time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality and location!”
Reviews.Author: 28NZ
Reviews.Content: Antiche Figure was the perfect choice for us and amazingly convenient being a bridge and 200m walk from the main train station into Venice. Â We were also within a couple hundred metres from plenty of restaurants and shops.Â  The front desk (especially Antonio and Francesca) was always extremely friendly and helpful. When we arrived we were shown on a map good places to see and eat and how to get there - they were so detailed with such great knowledge of Venice that it saved us from doing a walking tour which we had planned to sign up to. Antonio also personnally showed us to our room and always went out of his way to make sure we were looked after which is not something we have seen in many hotels (whether 2 or 5 stars). Â The hotel also arranged a free of charge return trip to a Murano glass factory for a tour and live demonstration (10 min by water taxi) which was great - the only catch is that you spend some time walking through their showroom but it was more like an art gallery and there is no obligation to buy - we did end up buying a beautiful hand made bracelet! The canal view room we had was superb - clean and spacious for european standards. Â The bed was firm and comfy. Great view of the canal. There is free wi fi in the lobby and the buffet breakfast was good (freshly brewed cappucinos, pastries, bread, cereals, fruit, boiled eggs, meat and cheeses and an assortment of snacks). Â  The comfortable room and amazingly helpful front desk have made Antiche Figure one of our stand out hotel choices while on our European honeymoon in December 2011.Â

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as good as the great recommendations”
Reviews.Author: Gladcash
Reviews.Content: Having read the recommendations, we booked the hotel for three nights and it really lived up to the praise on tripadvisor. The hotel is beautifully furnished, thoroughly clean and in a suitable location as described, being near to the coach terminal from the airport, on the Grande Canal and within walking distance from St Mark's Square etc. We were met with a friendly greeting and very helpful advice on what to see and where to go, along with a very useful map which a member of staff marked with recommendations. The breakfast was continental, good choice of fresh fruit, meat, cheeses, cakes etc. All the staff we met were friendly, pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pam I
Reviews.Content: Fab location just across the bridge from the Train Station and on the Grand Canal. Venice isn't huge so you can walk or take a water taxi where you need to go during your stay. an easy walk to where the busses pick up/drop off as well. Staff was incredibly helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions and aimed to make sure we were happy and had a nice stay. Breakfast was fine (could have a bit more selection of fruit or some savory items but adequate when compared to other hotels we've stayed at). They offered us to upgrade to a room with on the Grand Canal for half price when we checked in. They showed us both the room we booked and the upgrade before asking for a decision. We took the upgrade since it was a good deal. Beds were comfortable and room had plenty of room. Loved our time here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and exceptional customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Julia341
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers! We stayed in three different cities in Italy and this hotel topped the list--from the very moment that we arrived to check out, this hotel went above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service. Even better, this hotel is truly minutes from the train station! You go over the bridge, turn right and you pretty much bump into it! The rooms are clean and well-decorated with Murano glass fixings. The breakfast had a variety of selection, including fruits, eggs, pastries and cereals. They even had a server for breakfast serve a fresh selection of coffees vs. the machines that we used in every other hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure - WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: XXX451
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Hotel Antiche Figure. What a WONDERFUL experience! LOCATION and STAFF are TOPS!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: jlittle22
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! The staff was the friendliest of any hotel we have ever stayed in. They went out of their way to get to know us and to help us have a great time in Venice. The airline lost our bags for 36 hours and the staff took it upon themselves to call the airport every half-hour to check on the status and make sure the bags were delivered. The location was excellent, the room was great, and the free daily breakfast was good. Highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juliacbeck
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant four day stay here. I loved our pretty canalside deluxe room and the location was brilliant for tourist hotspots and catching the vaporetto for more interesting exploration . It is worth noting that the hotel is near some excellent well priced restaurants too although I was not remotely impressed with the hotel's recommendation and preferred to hunt out my own using the scores on Trip Advisor. Breakfast was pleasant and varied with lovely coffee. Staff helpful and knowledgeable. Not sure what happens when you take the much plugged free trip to Murano but I had better things to do with my time than endure hard selling there is no such thing as a free lunch in Venice ...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: stevesgal
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was more than we expected. The staff was excellent! Parked our car and had a reasonably short walk to the hotel. The breakfasts had lots of choices and constantly replenished the supply as the morning wore on. The staff was full of recommendations for meals, sights to see and gondola ride tips. Venice was romantic and enchanting! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Stunner”
Reviews.Author: gerberpm
Reviews.Content: In June 2008, my wife and I arrived at the hotel at 7:15 am after travelling through the night by train, from the Black Forest in Germany. We were greeted by a friendly waitress who called the desk clerk to book us in. We were offered Cappuccino's which really "hit the spot". We could only get into our room after 11:00am but after a quick freshen up and the hotel staff storing our baggage, we took a walk around Venice. The wait was well worth it, because when we arrived back at the hotel and were escorted to our our 4th floor room........it was a stunner ! Also, our view of the canal below was stunning ! The staff were so friendly and made our stay so enjoyable, that when returning to Venice, we will definitely book into the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They go the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: DivingDad13
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent boutique hotel located very close to the main plaza and the grand canal. The service was excellent and the view from the well decorated room was not to be beaten. We left an iPod behind and had it returned to us once we got back to Canada. We weren't even sure where had lost it we had traveled so much until...we got their phone call. Try that in a large hotel LOL Yeah sure.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Ash-and-Neens
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is a gem. It's just lovely. My husband and I stayed for two nights in November and Antonio and the team made us feel so welcome. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Venice. It is literally across the canal from Santa Lucia station - and as Venice is small you can walk everywhere so easily from here, it's just wonderful, I wish we could have stayed longer. Just a wee tip for ALL Italian hotels though, bring earplugs with you as the walls are thin just due to all the buildings being so old... all adds to the character though! hehe... we'd love to come back to the Hotel Antiche Figure one day :o)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Harvey O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure for 4 nights. What a terrific place to stay. A great location on the Grand Canal. Our room was spacious with a great view of the Canal. The genuine friendliness and helpfulness of the staff is what makes this hotel truly fantastic. As other people have stated, excellent service, this is what hospitality means.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Ann M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Antiche Figure for two nights in November. The Hotel is very well located at the beginning of the Grand Canal .The hotel was comfortable and the room well appointed and overlooked the Canal.Tthe staff were very friendly and helpful . I coulld not have asked for better service,.on returning from my vacation I realised that I had lost my I POD and thought I had probably left it at the hotel and before I could contact them they had already contacted me to say that they had found it!! Now that is excellent service. I will always be grateful to them because replacing the information in it would not have been easy!! Wonderful and honest staff!! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CJNSalisburyUK
Reviews.Content: A 2 night stay in November was our second trip to Venice and the second time we have stayed at this hotel. It is well located being opposite the train station. The room was a good size, as was the bathroom. The decoration is "classic venetian". The hotel was quiet and comfortable. The staff are very helpful. Breakfast was satisfactory with a small choice of cereal, yoghurt, rolls, cheese and cold meats. We chose to stay here a second time based on our experience in February and were not disappointed. The location is very convenient for the airport bus, and trains, and it avoids the excessive crowds that can happen in other areas, while there is good access to the atrractions of venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: brown10_1_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Grand Canal On arrival at Venice Airport we got a water taxi direct to the hotel (what an experience) Staying at this hotel made our stay in Venice an incredible experience Charming & helpful staff - well appointed room overlooking the canal - magnificent venician bathroom - great breakfasts - we sat out side sipping a beer/wine looking at the boats / ferrys going up & down the canal Walking along the canal in any direction was relaxing & informative - passing restaraunts, shops & points of interest Although this hotel (as others are in venice) was expensive - It was certainly value for money This would have to be the best hotel (for location/experince/relaxation/friendleness) that we have stayed at in the UK/Europe

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very comfortable, brilliant location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: MiaTiger
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay in standard double room. Staff were exceptionally friendly. 10 min walk from orange line station if arriving by public boat from airport, otherwise directly opposite retro train station. The bulk of the tourists seemed to be on the other side of the island, whilst some of the best osterias were close by in the jewish district.

Reviews.Title: “lives up to it's reviews”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: Coming out of the Railway station and seeing the Hotel right across the canal is such a comforting sight. We chose is Hotel because of the reviews and it lived up to them. We were offered a larger room and we chose it, we had lots of baggage. It was howevr down a back street, in hindsght we should have opted for the Hotel. The room we had was a good size. The bathroom had more taps and shower heads than I have ever seen. The staff were so helpful, great advice for restaurants! Sitting outside in the late afternoon overlooking the Canal, after walking around all day was luxury. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: EddAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with caring, helpful staff. Very convenient location, easy to get to/from train station, airport bus and vaporetto stop. Nice breakfast buffet and beautiful rooms. No negatives--I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at great location with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Flipwigg
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a suite overlooking the Grand Canal - What a wonderful experience. The hotel is so easy to find, the rooms are spacious and clean & tidy, the breakfast buffet is huge and delicious but it is the staff that made our stay so special. They are so helpful, friendly and full of great advice and ideas for things to do. Would liked to have stayed longer especially for the three chandeliers in the bathroom. Wow.

Reviews.Title: “A very special hotel in a very special city”
Reviews.Author: MizzouTraveler75
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure in the past and it has always been a very favorable experience. This visit was the same â€“ the hotel staff always delivers friendly service and special consideration to enhance our stay in this very special city. The hotel itself is small, and perhaps near the bottom tier of what would be considered a 3-star hotel but we enjoy the personal attention. They do have a small bar adjacent to the lobby which is nice. Their breakfast room is almost cramped but provides a good opportunity to rub elbows with other guests (usually Britons or French). Of course the location cannot be beatâ€¦ on the Grand Canal right across from the train station. This hotel is pricey for its size, but itâ€™s the location you are paying for, and well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TMacDonnacha
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff were brilliant throughout, although not located in middle of touristy sites of Venice this was bonus as not busy as some other locations. Room was nice bright and had amazing views of busy canal.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok, but not great value”
Reviews.Author: PeterCbrussels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a grand canal view room on the first floor paying just over 250 per night. The reception was nice and friendly. Suggestesting things to see and twice asked if we had taken free water taxi offer to see glass factory. The room was fairly small with period style furnishings. Though on the first floor lots of noise from the conversations of those passing on the street. The bath did not drain the shower. I mentioned on first night, still not repaired for the second night. There is no wifi in the rooms, only cable connection. The double is two beds together so not comfy in the middle. The location is handy when you arrive, near plaza de Roma. But a long walk from plaza saint marco. The roster at breakfast was firstly not working due to faulty plug, them very poor. Clearly nobody had tried to use. The view is directly over the grand canal to the railway station. So not the most beautiful. But, well can see all the comings and goings. So in conclusion, a mixed story. But at the price paid, per night not good enough, least for me. Would pay a bit more for real quality, or less for better quality price balance. So unfortunately I buck the trend here and give just three points.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel with character, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jhugon
Reviews.Content: If you can stand to be staying in Venice more than 5 minutes away from Piazza San Marco, or like us if you prefer to be a bit away from the mayhem of San Marco, then Antiche Figure is a great choice. This hotel is located on the Grand Canal, close to the "new bridge", and just a short walking distance from the Piazzale Roma, but be aware that you will have to carry luggage over two short bridges to reach the hotel. Piazzale Roma is a great landing spot in Venice because: (1) a bus ride from the airport costs only 5 Euros, (2) you are walking distance from the train station, and (3) the new "People Mover" tram can take you to the cruise ship embarkation in just a few minutes. The hotel itself is charming. Our room was small, but well-appointed, and the bathroom was impeccably clean and well-equipped. Internet access is free, but WiFi is only available in the bar/foyer area (you can use a fast wired connection in your room - cable provided at the reception). We were there only one night, but found the staff wonderfully friendly and accommodating - they kept wanting to offer us a welcome drink, provided recommendations for walking directions and restaurants, etc. The hotel is about a 30-minute walk from Rialto and San Marco, far enough that you can feel you are away from the crowd, and still close enough that you can enjoy taking in all the main sights of Venice on foot, while also discovering areas of the city you may not have seen before. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars hotel that should be five stars”
Reviews.Author: tbrein
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little hotel on the Grand Canal was a perfect place to stay for two nights pre-cruise. The room we had overlooked the canal and it was spacious enough for the two of us and all our bags. The breakfast eas more than adequate and the hotel staff were friendly and went out of their way to help in anyway they could. They gave wom Nderful suggestions for restaurants where the locals eat. They are centrally located, right across from the train station and within walking distance of the Piazzale Roma. When again in Venice I will make sure I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A slight inconvenience led to an even better experience”
Reviews.Author: GWTE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Antiche Figure last year and had a really good time. Prior to arriving we received an email to say that the hotel was overbooked and would we mind staying for one night at another property close by. We would then have a free upgrade to a room with a canal view. We agreed. Our first night was spent at the Ca Dei Polo which I believe is a new hotel/residence and we were given a beautiful room on the top floor. The room was huge. On our return to the Antiche Figure we were given a canal view room on the top floor and we really liked the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
