Breakfast was a buffet and I would imagine that it has enough variety to satisfy most people. I certainly was full until my evening meal. We would definitely return to this hotel if we are in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed in, bar none”
Reviews.Author: MotherT1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful hotel after our trip on the Orient express. The friendliness and professionalism displayed here was on a par with the service that we had received on the train. We stayed in a blue room with a view of the Grand Canal and train station. The room was huge and the bathroom substantial. As it rained for the three days we were there, combined with high tide that meant every evening we were very grateful to return to our lovely warm inviting room. The recommendations the staff gave us for restaurants to eat in each evening were all wonderful and didn't break the bank. All together a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sharonburr
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel on the Grande Canal, right across from the train station. My husband and I arrived on an overnight train from Munich and it was very early in the morning. Our room was not ready, but we were allowed to leave our luggage at the hotel while we went walking around this magical city. The hotel staff are very friendly and knowledgable and most speak English very well. We found our room to be spotless and we LOVED the view of the Canal. There is a gondola stop right in front of the hotel and a water taxi stop nearby. We so enjoyed our breakfasts that were included with the room. Everything was fresh and the coffee was fantastic. There is a small bar at the hotel and it was so nice to sit outside with a glass of wine and watch the boats go back and forth. I cannot think of anything negative to say about the Hotel Antiche Figure. I highly recommend this hotel and if we are ever able to get back to Venice, this will be the place for us!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in an extremely convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the hotel for three nights just earlier this week. The hotel is very convenient to the train and bus station on the island of Venice, which is nice to drop off the bags quickly, or for a short walk to catch the bus to the airport. The staff was very friendly and willing to help, including helping us decide what musical performances to attend and providing directions. The room and bathroom were a nice size and comfortable, and everything was neat and tidy. The breakfast (included in the price of the room) was substantial. I would definitely recommend it, and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Delight”
Reviews.Author: baggagecarrier
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at this lovely hotel on the Grand Canal. What a delight to sit outside at their bar sipping a prosecco and watching the canal traffic: laundry and luggage, cabinetry and vegetables, the ambulance, fire "truck" and police, lumber and a shiny black grand piano tipped on its side all passed by: Venice on parade. The hotel is 3 star which means that you don't get plush bathrobes but it has everything else including free internet service and an ample breakfast. The staff are very kind and helpful. Our room, one of the less expensive red level, still had a view of the canal and an adjacent church. The furnishings were in good condition and the decor very Venetian as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “This is a unique experience”
Reviews.Author: Alerxander
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time last year, was lucky to get a room for a night during the busy season. I did not realize it was the beginning of the lifetime commitments. The atmorphere is unique and in my mind it is identified with you miracles of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: Masteralessio1
Reviews.Content: we were booked to stay for one night ! upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to their other hotel, which is 4 star the hotel canal grande! WOW this hotel was gorgeous. The service form the staff at this hotel was awesome they assisted us to move to canal grande STAY here if u are coming to venice fantastic!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend Antiche Figure!”
Reviews.Author: AZSteelers
Reviews.Content: if you want to be close to the train station (don't worry, no noise from it really) then this is the place for you. It is less than a 6 minute walk (beware you will have to lug you luggage up and down the stairs of a bridge but it is not that hard... I am petite and hauled my 2 suitcases totaling 70+ lbs (close to 32kg) by myself without too much hassle, there will also be people offering to help you out! Close to gondola rides as well as the water bus. The staff is very very helpful and can give you directions to anywhere you'd like and can recommend some good restaurants in the area. If you are in a front room it can be a bit noisy (not bad unless you want to keep the windows open). But overall it was a good experience and I'd recommend it as well as stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Great locations!”
Reviews.Author: jdody
Reviews.Content: Only a few minutes walk from the train station was a welcome bonus for us weary travelers. Right on the water! Charming! The rooms (we had two) had old world character and charm. The best was having Antonio and Michaele greet us and make us feel like old friends. Our two teenagers who aren't impressed by much, really liked them. They recommend restaurants and even made the reservations. On our second day, Francesca helped arrange a boat trip to the Murano Glass factory. She was pleasant and ready to help. On our last day, Alexandro checked us out with great service and a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Greg T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few nights in late September. As other reviewers have said, this hotel is easy to find. That's a big plus in a place like Venice. Our room was very comfortable and spacious by Venetian standards and we had a little balcony that looked over the Grand Canal. By mistake, I left my cellphone charger and Euro adapter behind. When I called the hotel a day or so later, they indicated that they would send it to me (of course, I had to pay for the shipping). Sure enough, they did send it! This is the kind of service that makes you want to go and stay in the same hotel again and again. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A safety net in crowded Venice!”
Reviews.Author: salsacapri
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who advised that you can enjoy Venice alone. True indeed if you are putting up at such a hospitable and friendly hotel as in Antiche Figure, where everyone is warm and kind and puts an extra effort to help you feel at home. After the crazy parties with friends in Milan, I took the Frechiabiancca Train straight to Venice and true to what was mentioned by many here, it is heaven that you only need to cross the bridge to this hotel, unlike many who have to squeezed and struggled onto water taxis to many other hotels. It was already a hazzel dragging my luggage across the bridge, let alone figuring the water routes and tickets and pushing your way into the always crowded water taxi. The standard room was warm and clean, you do not need a canal view as you'll be out everyday anyway. Antonio and everyone was extremely helpful in sights and advice, I went to Burano island instead of the touristy Murano for a change, totally colorful and out of the ordinary Venice you'll see. Good to have a break on the last day of your trip to experience a quieter and more charming part of Venice, though it's one hour by water taxi. I was there for 4 nights, totally enjoyed the chat in the lobby with free wifi every other night over a drink or two. Being alone, you don't really hang out late outside, so the hotel staff were really nice companionship as you discussed your day of getting lost. Venice was not what I expected, too crowded, too commercialized and over priced. The best view was from the Ralto Bridge where you can absorb a picturesque moment at night. I totally agreed that you can enjoy Venice alone, you're on your own agenda and especially when you can count on the hotel for any assistance and sincere concern. The only room for improvement I would suggest is the breakfast, which was a little plan and simple everyday. However, they were pretty patient as I usually finished late while going online at the same time =P BTW, ipad and Mac work better on wifi there.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Iainbr
Reviews.Content: We have just left Venice after two fantastic nights at this delightful hotel. Staff were brilliant and the rooms clean and very well appointed. But the truly great aspect about the oasis was the location. So close to the water taxis and the station (watch out for that bloody bridge. Too many steps after weeks of shopping in Rome, Florence and Milan). It was a great walk the Rialto and San Marko. But take the water taxi if you don't like steps. To the staff and management thank you for your genuine welcome and making our stay in Venice memorable

Reviews.Title: “Ditto”
Reviews.Author: IrishinDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in a three week period. Just before a 2 week cruise and just after. Stayed in the main hotel building for 2 days the end of September, 2011 and 2 days in a room in an "annex" building just down a walkway from the hotel. Either is a good choice. The bedroom in the "annex" is larger than in the hotel but the bath in the hotel seems to be a bit larger in the hotel than in the "annex". Breakfasts are great. You can order capucino from the breakfast staff and no extra charge. The location is great if using the port to catch a cruise. There is a new "People Mover" that runs from the main parking lot to the cruise port. Charge is 1 euro each. San Marco square is about a 30 minute walk through heavy traffic. Rialto is about 20 minutes. One advantage to staying at Antiche Figure rather than a hotel near San Marco is that you get to see the city as you stroll toward San Marco or the museums. From the parking lot at Pizzale Roma, the hotel is two small bridges and about 10 minutes top away. By the way, if you communicate with the hotel, you will probably receive emails from a person named Michele. No, not a female. But a very helpful guy who will give directions and advice for nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Howieboy
Reviews.Content: When traveling on a budget, you rarely stay at anything beautiful. This was not true of my trip to Venice from Rome. I booked on line a room in Venice at the Hotel Antiche Figure. I was pleasantly shocked. I got off my train and walked across the bridge and arrived at the hotel. It was breathtaking and at a great location. The desk clerk treated me as if I was a wealthy traveler. I was given advice as to how to get around and what to see. The room was beautiful and looked over the canal and the roof of a church. The bathroom was exquisite. I had a fantastic breakfast and headed out for the day. I walked easily to so many things and caught the water taxis to all spots of interest. They scheduled my visit to Morano, where I bought a beautiful piece of art. I traveled on a very tight budget and never expected to stay somewhere as nice as this. I hated to leave, but traveled on my way by train to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Bill J
Reviews.Content: 11-14 Sep 2011 Antique Figure Hotel Venice. Exceptionally good hotel close to station, air conditioning, good breakfasts, very efficient, helpful and friendly staff. Choosing the upgraded room with a view over the Grand Canal was well worth it. It was like having a front row circle seat in a theatre to watch the people, the vaporettos, the gondolas, the work boats, the water taxis. Part of a package so can not comment on cost

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche Figure is situated right on the Grand Canal directly across from the Santa Lucia Train Station. It's just a brief walk with the luggage over the bridge to the hotel. This was a great comfort to my husband and I after witnessing several people who were lost and looking for their hotel in the maze of alleys that make up Venice. Erasmo and Anka at the desk were so warm and friendly and had a wealth of information to share. Erasmo is a history major and welcomed my husband's endless questions about Venezia's past and present. There is easy access to the water taxi and vaporetto. From our window we were able to view the busy canal traffic with its interesting sights and sounds. The room was beautiful, romantic and clean. The breakfast was included and very nice. Erasmo was kind enough to have our breakfast packaged for our early train departure which was before 7:00am. We would love to return to this hotel sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Douglas N
Reviews.Content: The Antiche Figure is a wonderful hotel and a terrific spot to use as your base to visit Venice. It is conveniently located right across the Grand Canal from the train station, with water taxi and vaporetto stops immediately accessible. The staff were the best we experienced in our two weeks in Italy. They were friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and very focussed on ensuring our experience was the best it could be. Our junior suite room was modern, and very well appointed with added features that made a big difference (in-room coffee/tea, extra linen, a well stocked mini bar, good air conditioning, etc). An extensive breakfast was included with lots to choose from and excellent cappuccinos. It was clear to us the hotel staff all wanted our stay to be a memorable experience and they succeeded. The Hotel Antiche Figure exceeded our expectations in every way, and we look forward to returning to this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful intimate hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BButensky
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful intimate hotel located on the Grand Canal in Venice, Italy. The rooms are small, but very clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful The location is excellent and there are many restaurants and shops nearby. Breakkfast comes with the room and is quite adequate. If you take the water taxi from the airport, you can get off right in front of the hotel as they have a dock. The staff will help you with your luggage. However, if you take the bus from the airport, you will have to walk from the bus terminal to the hotel. While it's a short walk, you have to climb over two bridges lugging your suitcase. Best bet- it costs more, but the water taxi is more direct. I loved this hotel. It's also a great location if you are taking a cruise as you can get a water taxi in front for a ride to the cruiseships at the Maritime Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbh
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Venice. Amazing location, immaculate rooms, cheerful staff and free internet. We arrived late at night after a long flight. What a relief to find such a charming hotel. We took the shuttle bus in from the airport (easy) and simply walked about 1/2 a block, crossed the canal, and we were there. It is a quiet peaceful place to stay after battling crowds at the "tourists" spots all day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: Ex-airfaircrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfection. Location: The hotel is located across the Grand Canal from Santa Lucia Train Station making it an easy walk from the station. Having witnessed firsthand tourists dragging luggage over inumerable bridges to access their hotels, we realized how localionally perfect Antiche Figure is. Vaporetti servicing Venice and taxis are nearby affording access everywhere - another plus! Rooms: Our room was high celinged, spacious, spotless and beautifully appointed. We had three windows overlooking the canal. How perfect! Services: Breakfast is served inside in two charming rooms or outside on tables overlooking the canal. There is a lovely bar inside that also services the outside tables along the canal. A glass of wine, sundown and watching the Grand Canal - it doesn't get much better. Staff: I have to mention wonderful Francesca first. Loaded with personality and intelligence, she was for us, the face of this charming hotel. Anything within reason that you need and she can provide it - restaurant recommendations and reservations, directions, site advice. She is a wealth of knowledge about her city and her enthusiasm is evident! Every other staff member, with whom we came in contact, were courteous and most helpful. We loved this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights in Venice and Hotel Antiche Figure played a large part in our enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: brigitteMenton
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice after spending three magical days in this lovely city. This hotel was excellent and the staff forthcoming. We decided to pay a surplus for a room overlooking the canal and were not disappointed. Room 412 is on the fourth floor. It is both spacious and beautifully furnished with fantastic views and a lovely bathroom. Tea and coffee making facilities, a mini bar, comfortable chairs and a large comfy bed. The bathroom had plenty of fluffy towels. A hair dryer that worked and those important little touches such as providing a sewing kit, a disposable razor and shower gels were in plentyful supply. The location of this hotel is fantastic.It is not necessary to walk around Venice consulting a map before finally finding your hotel. The Antiche Figure is directly opposite the railway station. If arriving by car, you take the number 2 vaporetto to the station, cross the bridge and the hotel is situated a few yards away. Breakfast is self service offering cold meat, cheeses, boiled eggs, fruit and cereals, as well as a variety of cakes and croissants and can also be taken outside weather permitting. IWe will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oakville877
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our first visit to Venice. We flew into Marco Polo Airport, took the shuttle to Piazalo Roma and from there we walked which was about 5 minutes. The hotel has a great location with good access right on The Grand Canal. The room was very tastefully decorated with antiques and had high ceilings with lots of windows overlooking the canal. During the day there is a lot of activity on the Grand Canal so if you have your windows open it's noisy (generally you're out sightseeing during this period). The vaporetta water bus stop is about 100 meters away. The hotel is very traditional with antique decoration yet everything is modern, clean and very well kept. The breakfast was ok but there could have been a bit more variety, this I believe is just for lack of space as the breakfast room is small. As for the staff they all were very pleasant and helpful. They always went out of thier way to accomodate you. We had a 7 am flight out of Venice and they arranged a water taxi for 5:15 Am for us. At 5 AM the front desk called asking us to come down. When we got down stairs they insisited we sit down and have cappucino, croissants and yogurt before we left. This was a very memorable part of our trip. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully helpful”
Reviews.Author: Christlsaf
Reviews.Content: Our UK travel company forgot to confirm our hotelbooking in this beautiful hotel....and it was fully booked! Yet the hotel's management went out of their way to find us alternative rooms- in an equally superb hotel . To add to our woes, we discovered that our passports were not returned to us when we checked out at the Europa hotel in Bologna. That hotel was not very well managed , kept our passports unnecessarily overnight , was not very cooperative to solve the problem and therefore a great disappointment. But here again the hotel manager went out of his way organising an independant courrier for us for a reasonable fee- and we were not even his clients by now! Many thanks again : highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last week this was our first time to Venice. Alessandro and his staff were warm,welcoming and extremely helpful. Our room was quiet, comfortable,and well-appointed. Housekeeping was very good, and because the room was down the alley in a separate building it was as if we were just a part of the neighborhood. Breakfast was very satisfying, the coffee was great. After sightseeing In the late afternoon sit outside and have a prosecco and just enjoy. I cannot say enough about this hotel and the staff. We look forward to our next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient location, awesome staff and historic building”
Reviews.Author: Peter E
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and is right across the canal for the train station and the vaporetto (public transport boats). The staff definitely go out of their way to assist and if you tell them the number of days you are staying and your interests they will map out an itinerary for you. We dealt with a man I think named Michel and he went above and beyond with everything. Even after he had finished work and changed to leave he stopped to ask us how our day was on his way home. We had views over the canal which were spectacular, especially at night. Was very convenient to catch a train in/out and also for the vaporetto to take you to either San Marco square, Murano or Burano. The furniture is very antique looking as per the history of the hotel but will let you read about that for yourself. The bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean, just don't leave the windows open at night as there are mosquitoes about in summer. Breakfast had everything you could ask for and the breakfast staff were also very accommodating and helpful each morning. If we go back to Venice will stay here without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Canal with class”
Reviews.Author: nothankyou123
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers friendly service, excellent facilities, and quiet class. The staff speak English, and go out of their way to help you find what you want--whether it be museums, short-cuts, or small out-of-the-way restaurants. The breakfast has many options, and can be eaten outside with views of the canal. Our room was small but stately. We were able to have a cot for one night for our daughter, before she flew back home. I was impressed with the friendliness, the class, and the flexibility all around. I will stay there again, without hesitation. And, PS, the water pressure in the shower was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Girlie410
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across from the train station. If you want something in a quiet canal this is not for you. But the room was very quiet and SO EASY to get to from the train station and then to the buses when we needed to get to the airport. After watching many people drag their luggage through the streets, we were glad we had chosen this location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Their Engish is great! Room was clean and very comfortable. Had air conditioning and a hair dryer in the room. Answered all of our questions and made great suggestions for dinner. Also made suggestions of things to be careful of in the city.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: tdacquisto
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on it's location to the train station because we were coming from Rome. Three of us with 5 large suitcases and one of us was my 74 year old Mom, which meant my partner and I would be lugging her stuff for her. Upon walking out of the train station, we saw the hotel immediately... Right across the grand canal! Perfect. Up and over the bridge and we were there. Front desk clerk Antonio was great.. speaks perfect english and said, "you must be Mr. D'Acquisto" as we came in! We had 2 rooms reserved and he put us both on the first floor in rooms 111 and 116. Mom had 116 and we had 111, which had a view of the grand canal. WOW. Awesome. HUGE king-sized bed and massive bathroom with 2 sinks! Just incredible. Everything about our stay here was just perfect. Wonderful, friendly staff, beautiful little hotel in a great location. We could not have been happier!! Thank you to everyone at the Antiche Figure for making our stay so wonderful. Molto grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Our recent stay”
Reviews.Author: IanP220
Reviews.Content: Prior to boarding a cruise in Venice recently we had to spend the previous night at a suitable hotel within easy reach of the terminal . We saw that this hotel had excellent reviews on Tripadvisor-and rightly so ! Cannot find fault with it and staffed by the most helpful and charming staff . Looking forward tremendously to a return visit .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Martincm
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel from a previous review and wasn't disappointed. We arrived into Venice by train and the hotel is directly across the canal from the station. (walk over one bridge) The staff was delightful and most helpful. We then left Venice by ship . The hotel staff organized several guests in one water taxi to save on costs which then dropped us off at the Cruise Terminal. No worrying about bags. The recommendations for restaurants were also fantastic. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly & helpful staff-just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: simon s
Reviews.Content: Deciding on Venice for my partners 50th birthday, we chose this hotel due to the good reports on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed! Although we were not accomodated in the main hotel, (last minute booking & the Venice film festival was in town!) we were given a ground floor mini suite in the next door annex. It had a large double bed in the bedroom, with safe & minibar & a sofa bed & mini kitchen (complete with sink, cooker & fridge) in the adjoining lounge. Both rooms had flat screen TV's. Beautifully decorated in the Venetian style, it had a small, but clean bathroom. The only small moan was due to being located in a small street, you needed the lights on during the day as it was quite dark, despite large windows. But this mattered not, as we were there to explore Venice & only returned to the hotel to sleep! The staff were helpful & friendly, giving us a map & ideas on where to go. It was delightful to sit outside the hotel on the grand canal, whilst sipping a campari! We never made breakfast, although it was included in the price, as we were never up by the 10am deadline! Such was the comfort of the beds, along with the peace & quiet of the air-conditioned suite. The location is perfect, as you are a small distance away from the noisy, hustle & bustle of Rialto & St.Marks (30 min walk or take a water bus), yet near enough to the bus & train terminals to make travel easy. I can't rate the hotel high enough-it was a truly wonderful 4 days!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: ezy_cruising
Reviews.Content: Every staff member at the hotel were friendly, warm, helpful and courteous. Special thanks to Francesca and Alex. Francesca welcomed us and gave us an useful map of the city. She indicated all the special interesting areas to explore and informed us of tours we could take during our stay. Francesca also showed us two rooms and let us pick the one we prefer. Alex ("The Great") was always quick to answer questions or indicate directions in his friendly and humourous manner. Both Francesca & Alex always have a warm friendly smile and were extremely sincere. The hotel is nicely situated across from the train station and is only a 5 minute walk from the bus terminal (a couple of bridges with stairs). If we ever return to Venice, we would definitely go back to Hotel Antiche.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Daniel R
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel to stay at. The accomodations were excellent and the hotel staff was wonderful. They were able to answer all of our questions and provide us with excellent places to eat. Our room was very comfortable. We had one of the blue rooms that overlook the Grand Canal. The hotel is located directly across from the train station. It is a short walk from the train station, however, with heavy or too many bags can be very trying. The bridges crossing the canals in Venice are for the most part not suitcase friendly. My wife and I hired a water taxi from the airport. It is a bit expensive at about 100â‚¬ but to us, it was worth the expense. It took us to within about 10 meters of the hotel. Directly in front of the hotel are Gondola "parking spaces". The hotel staff came to the water taxi and helped us with our bags. Upon leaving, threy helped take our bags to the water taxi. The breakfast was quite plentiful with a good selection of pastries, fruits, drinks, lunch meats, cheeses, etc. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay ruined at the leaving”
Reviews.Author: Milady-Amber
Reviews.Content: I have thought a while before deciding to write this review because a bad day can occur to everyone but I have to be honest towards the other reviewers whom can read my words...Me and an mate were going to leave Venice but unfortunately we missed our late night train to Rome so we decided to ask in this hotel-due to this good reviews- if there was a room for us and luckily it was so.Nothing to complain about hotel or the room itself,even if not really clean but it was just for a night and I close a eye on it.But when the following morn we left,I heard some unpleasant words in italian addressed to me and my friend said by a member of the staff...don't know who he was and really I don't want to know more about him.Foresaid I'm originally from Italy,I've understand clearly his words and he left me speechless. A client MUST be respected from everywhere he/she may come even if sometimes a client may be boring,especially because the staff can't be so offensive and I think to the other clients whom don't know Italian...so even if I stayed there a single night,for sure this hotel left me a bad memory.

Reviews.Title: “What a relief”
Reviews.Author: chrisso53
Reviews.Content: After 8 weeks travelling through Europe and the last leg by train from Rome, were were tired and exhausted. The last part of our journey was a cruise of the Greek Islands departing from Venice so having booked the Antiche Figure we were hoping for a pleasant goodbye to the mainland. The weather was hot and dragging our overloaded suitcases from the station to the hotel was indeed exhausting, and we were early for check-in. Thank heavens for the amazing staff at our hotel. Not only did they offer to take our suicases and other travelling paraphenalia, we were offered the services of the bar (not opened at that time of the morning) and given an overview of the city to peruse at our leisure. The owner also offered to find oter cruisers to share a water taxi the following morning to take us to the cruise port. Our room was fantastic, comfortable, with wifi access and full of charm and accompanied by outstanding friendly service. The staff took time to guide us to nearby excellent restaurants and made us aware of ~ fakes~ when buying souvenirs. We were offered the service of leaving our luggage at the hotel upon our return from the cruise even though we were not staying the night, but had to wait a few hours for the train back to Rome. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We are seasoned travellers and try to book carefully using trip advisor reviews. This hotel is proud of its excellent rating and hopefully will continue to provide outstanding service and friendliness to travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: VAjanet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. I can't say enough about the friendly staff! The rooms were large by European standards and very clean. The hotel has old world charm, but a modern elevator that comfortably handled 3-4 people with luggage. We were given a complimentary upgrade and a bottle of wine with chocolates, which we can only assume were due to the fact that we stayed for 3 nights. This hotel had the friendliest staff I have ever met! They were wonderful and helped us with restaurant recommendations, directions and suggestions for maximizing our time in Venice. Breakfast consisted of pastries, meats, cheeses, boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. You could also have cappuccino for no extra charge. The breakfast rooms were bright, clean and comfortable. The hotel also has a small bar with tables out on the terrace. We were invited to bring our own wine out to the terrace, they supplied the glasses. This was not our first stay in Venice, so we went to Murano and Burano. I strongly recommend buying a 12 hour Vaporetto pass. You can take a tour of the Grand Canal, go to the F.te Nove stop where you should catch the LN line to Murano, then head to Burano for lunch. Burano was by far our favorite attraction in Venice. It is a small, picturesque village with beautifully painted houses, plenty of cafes and shopping, but the photo opportunities are worth the trip! Getting there: We travelled from the Pl.Roma, following a cruise, so we had to cross two small bridges. There are strong, young Italians who will gladly carry your luggage to the hotel.... for a tip. I think it's worth it! They quickly swept my bag over the bridge and for a 3Euro tip, saved me a lot of strain! If you chose to do it yourself, go to the bridge through the market area rather than the bridge closest to the canal. The bridge is behind the Hotel Chiara, not the one in front of it. It is longer, but lower and has long low steps making it easier to roll your suitcase over. Unfortunately, the Italian luggage carriers don't want to work early in the morning or in rain. :o/ It is a better way to get back to the Pl. Roma to catch the shuttle for the airport. The shuttle is 5E per person to the airport, you must handle your luggage on the bus and it takes about 20-25 minutes. The water taxi is 110E or the hotel can arrange a private transfer for 60E.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Maria433
Reviews.Content: The best hotel by far on our 5 week tour of Europe. The room was spacious with beautiful decor in keeping with old Venice. A real boutique hotel full of charm and great service. The staff acknowleged you everytime you entered or left the hotel. The staff were outstanding in service and friendliness. They had a great outside seating area where you can sit and have a drink and watch the world go by. But the best part was the tea and coffee making facility in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful discovery”
Reviews.Author: badger36
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a holiday and Italy and perhaps the highlight of the holiday was our stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice. The locations is ideal directly opposite the station and a very short walk to the airport bus service - a really BIG benefit when finding a hotel in Venice...unless you don't mind carrying bags on crowded boats and over dozens of bridges! The staff were extremely friendly and would do anything to help and make the stay even more memorable. We stayed in a beautiful two room suite a few meters down a narrow street directly next to the hotel. Very quiet, beautifully furnished and of very high standard. We loved it! A really nice buffet breakfast is served every morning and again the level of service is exceptional - you really feel like you are staying with family. Can't wait to return to this note - a really memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Drpeekay
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed by their courtesy and help, that I can suggest this place to ANYONE!.The loaction is beautiful...right on the grand canal... as close to the bus stops as possible. Dont think twice... please book it!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute treat”
Reviews.Author: Inthebook
Reviews.Content: Just visited Venice for the first time with a friend and we've had great weekend, thanks in no small part to this hotel. As other reviewers have reported, we were offered a two-room suite down the lane at the side of the hotel as a "present" on arrival, but we were so impressed that we decided to pay the small supplement to stay there for the two further nights of our stay, as it gave us the benefit of a room each, a small kitchen area and absolute peace and quiet. The location of the hotel is superb - really close to the airport buses, overlooking the hubbub of the Grand Canal (just sit out front with a cappuccino and watch how the various boats are used to support every day life in Venice), handy for the water-buses to and from St Marks, Murano, ... wherever you want to go, but also giving you the incentive to walk around and explore (don't forget your map!). The staff are a delight and couldn't be more helpful and friendly. An absolute treat of a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: BoAOslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice little hotel perfectly placed directly facing the quieter end of the Grande Canale. Very nice rooms and breakfast. The best, however, was the formidable service and friendliness from the staff. No matter what we asked we always received help and a big smile! Highly recommended for all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Vacationers921
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right across from the train station. Since we were travelling by train, we were delighted to be able to walk within minutes to the Hotel. The great thing about staying on this side of the canal is that its less busy than St. Mark's Square which is easily accessible by water bus. Our room was very comfortable and it was situated in a separate building in the alley next to the main hotel. Breakfast was great and what an experience to enjoy it right beside the canal in the morning. One slight downside - maybe because of the location of our room, it didn't appear to be very clean. Having said this we had a great stay at the hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say location!”
Reviews.Author: AP-WA
Reviews.Content: Can you say location! I arrived in Venice by train which made going to Hotel Antiche Figure a breeze since it is located right across the canal from the train station and there is a bridge right there. The last time I was in Venice I stayed in a hotel near St. Marks Square and found getting to and from the hotel by water taxi very expensive and trying to drag your luggage through the narrow streets is definitely not advised. When I saw the location (and reviews on Tripadvisor) of Hotel Antiche Figure I decided that this was my place to stay. I arrived in Venice before check in time but the hotel had no problems holding my bags till my room was ready. The staff was extremely helpful and bent over backwards to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel breakfast was good and the staff was always there to fulfill any needs. I would say it was better than I even expected.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and loving atmospere”
Reviews.Author: Susanne B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, at a very central location. We loved the atmosphere and the personale was very friendly and serviceminded, smiling and helpfull. The room was superb and the breakfast was excellent. Sure we will be back if we go to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home..highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Akhilesh C
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice in September...And even during the high rush season they provided special attention to even smallest of our needs...helped us in booking the best eateries around,places to visit, provided food even at 1 am in the morning etc etc....The staff is really cordial... The hotel is very clean and at a walking distance from the water bus stations, railway station etc...Specially the grand canal view from our room was magnificent!! I would really really recommend this hotel to anyone for their stay in Venice....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, heartily recommended”
Reviews.Author: sirotley
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, not really expensive if compared with similar hotels in Venice. They give good value for money. The location is convenient, although not ideal. It is quite close to the Piazzale Roma, where the bus from the airport stops, and where there is a big parking if you come by car. It is also in front of the train station. Therefore, you will not be forced to walk a long distance tugging your luggage. It is important to consider that Venice is certainly not a pedestrian friendly city if you have suitcases or child prams. The downside of its location is that, although facing the Grand Canal, it is not in one of the beatiful areas. Nevermind, because once inside, the hotel is cozy and charming. It is elegant but not overdecorated in the typical Venetian baroque style. People at the reception are friendly and helpful. The room was nice, but a little on the small side, in spite of being a suite. Not many room space for luggage. Everything was spotless, although there was a slight smell of dampness in the bathroom. Nothing outrageous, though, and I suppose that it is almost ibnevitable in a city built over the water. Breakfast is good although not spectacular. There were sufficient choices, although they were lacking some more variety of warm plates. It is definitely a good base to visit around the city, at reasonable prices, so I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed and extra night in Venice after a 12 day cruise and we chose this hotel based on the great reveiws and the proximity to the cruise ship terminal and the train station which we left from the following morning. The hotel is wonderful in everyway. The rooms were immaculate, the breakfast was awesome, the location was the best and the staff we first class. Can't say enough about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all of the rave reviews!”
Reviews.Author: LarryDG
Reviews.Content: Picked this based upon TA reviews and it was great decision! Staff could not have been friendlier and more willing to help in any manner. Wonderful location across Grand Canal from train station and only 2 bridges from connections to cruise ships and airport bus. Room was absolutely adequate. Clean and air conditioning was able to beat the 90+ heat that week. bathrooms are very nice and everything is very clean. Also enjoyed sitting at outdoor cafe. This is a wonderful hotel to experience Venice from!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suzibk
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room for 3 but were allocated a suite which was beautifully decorated in typical Venetian style, more like staying in someone's apartment, so much more than we had expected. The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay special. Located directly opposite the train station and fronts onto the Grand Canal, you can have breakfast on the terrace and watch the Gondolas go buy....wonderful!! You are a bit of a walk to Rialto Bridge, St Marco's Sq and Doges Palace but don't let that put you off, the walk is a must if you want to really see Venice. The only downside I can come up with is that Wifi is not available in the room only at the hotel reception - although there is internet connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, warm and friendly people, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Dion_Lily179
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from August 24 - 26, 2011. The hotel is located on the opposite side of the train station St. Lucia, so it is very easy to spot the hotel. As soon as we entered the hotel, Francesca welcomed us with such warmth and hospitality. We already paid our hotel, but Francesca offered us a junior suite room (which is on a different building but next to the hotel), which was beautiful, very clean and spacey. It is quite big actually considered this is in Europe. Francesca also recommended an excellent restaurant for us to have lunch, Trattoria Povoledo, great food and affordable price. And for dinner, Anka recommended Osterio Al Vezzo Pocco, the best Pizza in town and it is true. They are always busy, so it is better to booked first, and also they closed on wednesday. Breakfast was included in the room that we paid and it is very good. They have a flavoured coffee yoghourt, which is amazing, we loved it so much. If you are planning to go to Venezia in the near future, this is the only place to stay, small hotel, but very clean and they made us feel special and comfortable. You couldnt asked for any better customer service. Thank you to Francesca, Alessandro, Anka, Linda and the other lady (sorry forgot her name, who made the very best cappucinno) for great hospitality and customer service. We loved it and definitely will come back and also recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “6 weeks across Europe this was my favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoff B
Reviews.Content: An excellently located hotel on the grand canal opposite the railway station, however just off the main pedestrian routes so you can sit outside and enjoy a coffee without people tripping over your table. The hotel staff were most helpful recommending dining, places to visit and ways to get around. The room and en-suite were clean and well appointed. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelon002
Reviews.Content: Our past trips to Venice have always provided disappointing experiences with hotels, but thanks to Trip Advisor, we found Hotel Antiche Figure. Past hotels have been overpriced and mediocre or worse in quality. Antiche Figure staff welcomed us warmly and attentively and at several points during our stay offered tips on sightseeing and restaurants, and we always were pleased with their specific suggestions. They seemed genuinely happy to have our business and assuring a pleasant stay. We booked two rooms, one on the Grand Canal, and the other a junior suite in another building around the corner. Both were well appointed with period furniture and lovely linens, and our room in the suite in the other building had a cleverly designed, modern kitchenette. I loved walking out the door into the street (a Venice street, i.e., an alleyway), feeling a little like a real Venetian. Needless to say, it was very quiet, and we slept well. The room on the Grand Canal was also quiet, despite the boat traffic and the presence of the train station across the canal. We found a convenient laundomat a block or so away, and next to it a coffee bar at which to wait for the laundry, where we waitied for our laundry over croissants and espresso, along with locals who stopped in on their way to work. While Antiche Figure is convenient to the train station and vaporetto stops, sites and restaurants, its location also offered a glimpse of a real, working part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent....”
Reviews.Author: neilhadnall
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews of this hotel it seemd to be a suitable choice for our four day stay. The reality was......just excellent. From walking out of the station to see it directly across the Grand Canal we felt we had made the right choice and once inside the experience just got better. The staff were superb, being both friendly and helpful at all times. Breakfast was a treat, especially when taken outside at the canalside. Accommodation was of a good three star standard, but the staff were five star. We will be returning to Venice and we will definately be returning to this hotel. To all the staff....a big thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Purely excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Beccazab
Reviews.Content: One of the most pleasant experiences I've had with a hotel. I am sitting in their elegant dining area right now eating a more than adequate breakfast. Much more offered than other places in Europe. The staff is warm and friendly and literally ask you if you want a coffee or cappuccino everytime you sit down, which is great. You can sit outside right on the Grand Canal and have a drink while you watch the boats pass by. The rooms make you feel like you are staying in a 16th century palace.... Which is what it is. If you have a canal room it is like waking up in a fairy tale. The location is perfect if you plan on taking the public transit boats and they also will call for water taxi services for you on the spot. I really could say much more about what a great hotel this is. Five stars all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique Hotel right on the canal”
Reviews.Author: aulee92
Reviews.Content: As many have mentioned before, this hotel is located across the river from the train station. I absolutely loved this hotel and it's staff. Upon checking, I was asked if I wanted to upgrade my room, and have free breakfast added in, which I did. Can't remember the cost difference, since it was 2 years ago, but it wasn't much, and well worth it. I had a 2nd floor room directly overlooking the canal. Although the decor wasn't my thing, everything else at the hotel was what I was looking for. Great personalized service, making you feel like you're family. Wish I could remember the staff members by name, but I took the time to talk to most of them. From the lovely lady, who manned the front desk and checked me in, (she also would make me fresh espresso every morning, while I sat outside for breakfast, watching Venice wake up) to some of the guys that worked there as well. Its always nice to find out how the locals live, how far they travel to work, etc. It gives me a better understanding of the culture and city that I'm visiting. I apologize to the hotel, that this is 2 years in the coming, but hope the review is worth it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond In The Rough”
Reviews.Author: nsmooth56
Reviews.Content: In my one week stay involving Rome, Florence, and Venice, this was my favorite hotel of the three. First and foremost, it's only a 5 minute walk from the train station (just over the canal). Once we arrived, the staff were extremely courteous and friendly and this did not change throughout the stay. They suggested a great restaurant for a late dinner and the hotel had free entry passes for the nearby casino. The hotel also provided a free service to Murano to see a glass blowing factory. They also explained to us the different methods of transportation and guided us around the different sites on a map. Also, good to note is that they held our bags after checkout to explore the city even more before departing. Now to the technicalities... the rooms aren't that big (like most in Venice), but they are very clean and include a fridge and work desk. The bathrooms were clean and included a tub, toilet, sink, and bidet. Oh, almost forgot to mention... FREE INTERNET!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Little Hotel with Greatest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: MScrib
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the first week of August before we went on a cruise. Location is great! Near Bus station, water taxi's, People Mover to Cruise ship... take a water taxi to St. Marks Square..... not a problem. Rooms were very clean and nice. We had 2 rooms - 1 was a larger room with canal view and the other was a double. Both rooms were great. Continental Breakfast was great as well. The ladies that work the breakfast are so happy to please. Special Thank You to Anka and Francesca they are just fantastic!!! I would definitely reccommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Such a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: titusMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening and the lady at reception was very welcoming telling us all that was available in the locality. We had a very comfortable night in a superior double. Next morning good breakfast - above average for a hotel of this type and brilliant coffee from the kitchen - if you like it very strong!! The next morning again the reception staff could not do enough to give us all the information we needed to get to the cruise terminal. The location was extremely handy for the port - a 10 min walk to the people carrier and then 1 euro to the port. Would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nbray67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three days in Venice stopping at this small hotel. Directions on web site a little hard to follow. On arriving at the airport get tickets for the airport bus into Venice at 5 euro each way or 9 euro return. Bus located just out of arrivals door. Takes approx 25 minutes on the bus before you arrive at the bus station. Once arrived you will see a new bridge going over the grand canal. Do not cross this bridge but head for it and turn right and follow the bank crossing over two small bridges then the hotel is on right approx 5-10 mins walk from bus stop. Very easy access and no need for an expensive water taxi. Staff very welcoming and very helpful. Room was not ready on arrival as we got there at 10.30am, but not a problem. Left luggage in reception and went to explore. Sat down at a nearby restaurant and ordered one Bacardi and coke and one lemonade. Nearly fell in the canal when the cost was 17 euro!! Seems to be an average price so you will need a lot of euros if you intend to drink. Street vendors offer drinks from 1 euro for water upwards to approx 2.50 euro for cans, a bit better value. Venice is easy accessible by foot or water bus. We purchased a 12 hour ticket at 16 euros each which gave you unlimited travel on any route all day. Good value if you want to visit all areas of Venice. The water bus stop is just outside the hotel on the opposite bank. Around every corner is a picture and certainly a lovely city to visit. A gondola is a must but book it on the small canals rather than the grand canal as it can get very busy. A tip is ask a price then walk away. We were quoted over 200 euro for a 30 min ride which we got down to 120 euro , still expensive but an average price but a must do! We would recommend this hotel for cleanliness, location, friendly staff and price. Breakfast was more than adequate although at times a little cramped. You will enjoy Venice and this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1717
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 26th to the 29th July. We paid for a premium room overlooking the grand canal which was definitely worth it. The room itself was really good and the staff could not have been more helpful including recommending several restaurants, all of which were great places to eat. Eating breakfast at a table outside overlooking the canal was the perfect start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Small perfect romantic hotel & damn cheap as price..”
Reviews.Author: butch54
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend was very anxious to visit Venice may be because of movies.Venice was more unique clean few years back now its different still romance is the essence of city. Anyway the bookings were all done by my girl so I was in tension what kind of hotel it will be like that,,but when we reached from outside itself I was impressed , its renovated from old place still the old charm is their. Location is perfect which overlooks grand canal wonderful view. We stayed in suite i think its junior suite. Luxurious large nice decorated suite with beautiful bed for couple not married anyway. toilet is excellent clean with some special shower. Overall its good place to stay with nice hospitality,Francesca at reception wonderful lady .. thats venice specialty.. I would say because of location its great place & service ,,not to forget wonderful breakfast & small bar..Small wonderful hotel for perfect romantic honeymoon stuff..I think its not for old people...Have fun in Venice Italian style. San Marco is half an hour walk away I love to walk in Venice or get a vaporetti its water bus. Walk to get the view of romance. Its best cheap hotel but what you get in return is priceless..thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: manheiw
Reviews.Content: Of all the excellent reviews of this hotel I must add one personal touch: I forgot my mobile phone in the hotel and checked out for my cruise tour. A week later I went back to the hotel and asked for assistance. To my great surprise they have my phone kept in the reception desk. I couldn't say enough how important my business phone numbers and messages in my sim card and all I can say is: A VERY BIG "THANK YOU" TO THE STAFF OF THIS HOTEL. To all readers I will whole heartedly recommend this hotel. The staff, all fluent in English, which is very important for Asians as we normally speak very little other European languages. We enjoyed very much in the stay in Venice, thanks to their dinning recommendations. They even give me an free upgrade to their junior suite because I was travelling with my daughter and my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Very clean, easy to find and great location!”
Reviews.Author: bellalee04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on August 2nd and 3rd! We booked this hotel based on all of the trip advisor comments and we were NOT disappointed! This hotel is in a perfect location..as soon as you exit the train station, make a left and go over the first bridge you see. Once over the bridge, make a right and the hotel is right there! We had small luggage so the travel over the bridge was no big deal for us. If you're an older couple with larger suitcases you will probably have to take a cab to cross the canal. Francesca at the front desk was super friendly and very accommodating she showed us three different rooms. Great customer service! . We had originally booked the red room (double) at 159 Euros (through their website). The room is small but very clean and we were celebrating our anniversary so we asked for an upgrade. We went with the triple room with the balcony. Much bigger, and the bathroom had two sinks! It was an extra 40 euros a night. Breakfast was good, continental breakfast with fruit, croissants, hard boiled eggs and lunch meat. In summary, this hotel was very clean, easy to find and was in a great location. Right across from the vaporetti stop and the train station. We felt very safe at night too! P.s. The hotel recommended that we travel on foot everywhere, but you can get lost very easily plus walking every day gets tiring very fast so we bought a 24 hour vaporetti pass...we used it quite often especially when we went to St. Marco's at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with wonderful hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: habibah1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for 2 nights. From start to finish we were impressed. From the beautifully decorated rooms to the plentiful and delicious breakfast we would definitely recommend and return. The staff was hospitable and so helpful. When we arrived early our room was ready and they gave us a map showing how to get to San Marco. Though it was a 20 minute walk, what a fun walk! Lots to see and do and totally the whole point of going to Venice-- you need to just get lost! Loved that it was right across from the train station as we travel to and from Rome. Also you can't beat the value/price. There was wifi in the lobby which was a nice touch as well. As mentioned before the breakfast was wonderful. Fresh pastries, cereal, yogurt, meats, cheeses, lots to eat and very delicious! One of our best nights was taking the water taxi to San Marco. We picked up some paninis, a couple beers from the grocery store and had a picnic in San Marco at night. The ride there was gorgeous! Definitely a different Venice at night :) Very romantic and enjoyable-- also a cheap night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Koalatree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this boutique hotel for the first part of our honeymoon. It definitely did not disappoint. While we had to switch rooms a couple of times (mostly due to our mistake), they were very accommodating and even offered us an upgrade to one of their Junior Suites (which had recently been remodeled a couple years ago). The service was top notch - better than we've received in most 4 and even 5 star hotels - as they were very attentive to our needs and great to offer recommendations. This is a solid 3 star hotel well worth the money. Since we had the opportunity to stay in both the Junior Suite (which is in the back alley way) and the Canal facing room, we can say that the Canal facing room is probably not worth the extra money. You get an OK view, but you can get that same view and better by just walking anywhere along the Canal. Much better to spend the money on the Junior Suite which was nice, cozy, clean, and newer - even if there was no view. Side Note The hotel may offer you to visit the nearby Island of Murano (where the famous glass factories are) with a "free" boat ride to one of the factories. Personally speaking, it's not worth the free trip to the factory as once you're there it's just a big sales pitch the whole time (and the glass is actually not as interesting as that you'll find on the rest of the Island - it's also MUCH more expensive than what you'll find in the main part of Venice or the small shops in Murano). Once you're at the factory, the factory will keep you there and tell you that the rest of the island there's nothing to see. . .they'll push to send you back to the main island or to another nearby island just so you don't see what the rest of Murano has to offer. We were foolish enough to spend half of a day looking at a pretty lame factory and then being shipped off to Burano - a nearby island known for making Lace which is not worth the visit. Complete waste of time. Would recommend (if you have 3 or 4 days in Venice) to take the public boat over to Murano and checking out the Island on your own. There you'll see much nicer glass works and not feel the sales pressure from the Factories.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: travelfun16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011. Stayed in one of the renovated suites down the side alley. Beautiful room, good size for venice, excellent air-con and brand new bathroom. Front desk staff were incredibly helpful for everything including sites, getting around, and suggestions for restaurants. I like to eat at less touristy spots while travelling and Antonio at the front desk has excellent suggestions for great food at great prices, as well as higher end places if that's what you want. The hotel is perfectly situated at the top end of the grand canal making travel a snap. If you arrive by train, the hotel is right across the grand canal from the station and you can walk there in about 3 minutes even with a big suitcase (only 1 bridge to walk across). If you arrive by bus, the Roma terminal is only a 10 minute walk (5 minutes if you don't have a suitcase). Being so close to these stations means you don't have to wait in line and get on the Vaporetto to get to the hotel which is very convenient when arriving or departing from Venice. But don't worry, you are still far enough away from the bus and train stations that there is no noise or huge crowds near the hotel. Overall a fantastic stay and would absolutely stay here again next time i'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location and value”
Reviews.Author: KenDesa
Reviews.Content: Believe all the positive reviews and none of the negative one. The location is brilliant opposite the station on the Grand Canal. The staff are great. They recommend great eating and walking.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT !”
Reviews.Author: Savannah78
Reviews.Content: Found this great place on Tripadvisor ! First time to Venice. If you are looking for a place close to evrything, this is the place to book. Easy to reach from airport. Watertaxi cost 100 EURO !!!!! So we took the blue bus / ATVO instead. Only 5 Euro pr pax. 20 minutes bus ride, cross a bridge and there you are . We booked a Residence Suite. And that was big enough for a family. 2 adults and 2 children . ( 10 and 12 ) The room was very nice and clean. Staff is excellent ! Very good on explaning how to get around. Venice is a very charming place. Lots to see, and lots to do here We would like to come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could want”
Reviews.Author: Jessie097
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche was fantastic! We were in Europe for our honeymoon and arrived in Venice by train from Rome. Although it may not seem like something to write home about in other cities, the hotel was soooo easy to find! Unlike many in Venice which can result in the most seasoned traveller ending in tears sitting on their suitcase. Secondly they upgraded us to a bigger room as they knew it was our honeymoon for no additional cost and the service and recommendations from the staff was likewise great. We cannot wait to get back, it was the absolute highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: toolsie1
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the mainland by plane and we caught a bus to Venice which cost us 15 euros for 3 of us (water taxi is 100 euros).The bus stop is only about 5 minutes away from the hotel, you do have to carry the bags over the bridge but my husband is really strong and the bridge was only small. Check in was quick and easy and the guy at reception was great, he gave us a map and marked out routes to sights and restaurnts, he also told us about a free tour to the maurano glass factory, he said it's a great demonstration of glass blowing. The room was nice and clean but a bit small for 2 adults and one 11 year old child. The bathroom was also very clean. Breakfast was good and the breakfast room was small , but we were able to sit outside and have breakfast and enjoy the grand canal and everything going on. The staff were all very friendly, welcoming and always greeted us with a smile. After checking out we caught the train to Florence so the location was perfect as the train station is only across the canal. Our only regreat was doing the free maurano glass factory(B.F.Signoretti) tour, the taxi picked us up within 5minutes of the hotel calling. The taxi ride was great.A few minutes demonstration and they take you up to the showroom and the hard sell starts,we almost fell for it until the we were told that a one of a kind very expensive piece we were looking at which I wasn't sure about the colour can be made in another colour of my liking( alarm bells started ringing in my husbands head). My husband said no and they tried for ages to change his mind. After that leaving the maurano island to come back was a different story we were left out in the sun for over an hour while other people were taken back. When we were finally taken back with 6 other people we were all dropped of at St.Marks square to find our way to our hotels.For us this was a very bad tour. Overall the Hotel Antiche Figure is a perfect place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with a helpful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: P_Deacon
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived my son and I felt comfortable and welcomed. Francesca personally showed us our selection of rooms and made sure we were happy with our temporary home. No question was left unanswered as we looked for recommendations and ways around the city. The staff's opinions on local dining were right on and fantastic. Francesca and all the staff we encountered spoke excellent English and were amazingly helpful and friendly, which was refreshing after reading so many reviews about "Venetian attitudes." Did I mention that our room was beautifully decorated and spacious with the best bathroom of our entire trip? We enjoyed taking in the Venice atmosphere watching the canal activity from our personal balcony. Of all the cities we visited on our Italy trip, this was our absolute favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dennis_Alexander
Reviews.Content: This hotel enjoys a fantastic location, quite literally just across the canal from Santa Lucia station (though be prepared to lug your luggage across the Scalzi bridge). The hotel is small and compact, and this extends to the guest rooms and breakfast room, but this in perfectly understandable. The quality of service provided by the hotel staff is outstanding, and they seemed genuinely interested in making sure we had an enjoyable stay. The staff could not have been more helpful. When we checked out, we were able to leave our bags at the hotel before catching an afternoon train. This avoided the queues at the station left luggage office. The only negative aspect was the breakfast coffee, which was dire. We would strongly recommend this hotel, especially for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location if taking the train!”
Reviews.Author: mikeybee1975
Reviews.Content: Very warm and informative staff! Our room was just perfect. CLEAN and comfortable beds! We will stay here when we return! Also Carlo at the front desk is as professional and personable as they come! Thanks for the great conversation and Bellini's ! Buon Giorno!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel the entire trip”
Reviews.Author: BluePersuasion
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a two-week tour of Italy, beginning in Rome, traveling then to Florence, and ending up in Venice at the Hotel Antiche Figure. I have to say that this hotel was my favorite one on the whole trip, and I had stayed in four-star hotels in the other two cities. What this hotel lacks in star ratings it more than makes up for in staff. Every single person we dealt with was top notch. As you can see from previous reviews, this is the norm -- not some lucky fluke we experienced. From Francesca and Alessandro at the front desk the first day we got there, helping to acclimate us and tell us where to find things, to Antonio who typically worked from 4pm to 11pm and who always met us at the bar with a glass of ice water for my husband, to the breakfast ladies (who I wish I knew the names of to properly address them) who were always smiling and welcoming every morning -- they all made you feel SO welcome and appreciated. They take pride in servicing their clientele, and it shows -- and they have earned Trip Advisor's award with every fiber of their being. Don't let their three-star rating fool you. It's likely due to things that they can never change (hotel size, location, amenities, etc.), but our experience there was better that BOTH the other hotels in Rome and Florence combined. Besides that, their location is ideal, being right across the channel from the train station and a short five-minute walk to the bus pick-up to get you to or from the airport. Are there better hotels there? I don't know, and I don't care. If I ever end up in Venice again, I would go back there with no qualms.

Reviews.Title: “5 star everything!”
Reviews.Author: Richiedao
Reviews.Content: The hotel and every single member of the staff were wonderful. We can't remember a hotel experience that was as pleasant as the one provided by the Antiche Figure. Thank you for being such a wonderful ending to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsail
Reviews.Content: The staff was the most friendly group I have ever experienced in Italy or elsewhere. From the moment we arrived we really were treated like special friends. Restaurant and sightseeing advice were offered constantly. The room was comfortabe and well air conditioned although quite small. Breakfast was a nice selection of meats cheeses and pastries that were beautifully presented. The location was especially convenient, a 10 minute walk from the Pizalle Roma, close to transportation and the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and accomodations and would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: wetravel00
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and offered excellent suggestions regarding places to eat. Breakfast was provided and was delicious especially the capachino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: mikala37
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if youâ€™re cruising. Itâ€™s a 5-minute walk to the People Mover, which takes you to the port and is the same location as the P. Roma bus station if youâ€™re arriving from the airport. From the Santa Lucia train station you can see on the opposite side of the canal. Make sure youâ€™re able to lift your luggage up/down the steps of the bridge; or that your suitcase wheels are sturdy. I saw more than one person dragging their suitcase with broken wheels. The room we stayed in was small but good enough. The bathroom was a good size but more importantly everything was clean. We had a few mosquitoes in our room but managed to get them all before going to sleep. The room included a small buffet breakfast, wi-fi, and I think satellite TV (we couldnâ€™t get it to work but didnâ€™t say anything because we were only staying for one night), free boat ride to Murano Glass Factory and they pick you up after your tour and drop you wherever youâ€™d like. You definitely pay (We paid 150 euro) for convenience but if you factor in the cost of a water taxi or hauling your luggage around Venice, it was worth it for one night. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: skinnypez10
Reviews.Content: Staff: Perfect in every way!! Upgraded us at no charge as we had booked a package deal with a flight, but our initial flight was cancelled and we missed the first night. Was nice of them to fix us up with a larger room at no cost. Location: Very convenient to the but that transports passengers to the island from the airport. Also directly across the canal from the train station. Convenient to the water taxis, so all of Venice is easily accessible. Breakfast: Very well organized and offers the typical European-style breakfast. Do your research on what this means if you aren't sure...if you are dissapointed by what they offer, then you are expecting the wrong things.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PBPHYSIO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly placed on the grand canal opposite the main train station. Travel light as you have to carry your suitcases up the steps over the steepest bridge in Venice! If arriving from the airport the best way in is by private water taxi. It will give you a great introduction to Venice and saves the struggle with luggage from the water bus stop and will drop you right outside. The hotel is very comfortable and clean, the breakfast can be taken outside whist you watch the ''traffic'' on the canal.Enjoy a very reasonably priced bottle of Proscecco in the sunshine each evening or order the local Aperol spritz as an apperitif. Antonio on the front desk seemed to make it his whole purpose in life to ensure we had restaurant bookings, train times, places to visit, directions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coastalgardener
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful by e-mail even before we left the U.S. for Venice. They gave me options and directions for getting from the airport to the hotel. Check-in was very pleasant. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal and was lovely -- very nice bathroom too! We asked for recommendations for dinner and were given directions to a small "off the beaten path" restaurant where we ate outside and had some of the best pizza ever! The staff seemed eager to please and very interested in making sure our stay with them was memorable. You cannot beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round - you do pay for convenience though!”
Reviews.Author: rachelandgromit
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Hotel Antiche Figure. Having spent many a night reading reviews on different Venice hotels, this was the most expensive (149Euro) of the hotels we considered (I am sure you will see some of the ones I considered in the Venice forum) and I know that we could have got a canal view room in a different hotel for this price or less. If I'm honest, the one reason we picked the Antiche Figure in the end was the location. We knew we would arrive into Venice early from the overnight train to Paris and we didn't want to maul with our bags and spend time getting lost trying to find our hotel, so for this reason we went with the Antiche Figure. So easy, walk out of the train station and it is infront of you. Walk left, over the bridge, turn right and it is there on your left. Staff were amazing, letting us check in straight away and having our room ready for us. We weren't offered an upgrade and it was my partner's 30th birthday, however they were very busy. We did have an (almost) canal view if you turned your head to the right and hung out of the window slightly, but we weren't expecting a canal view as we didn't pay for this so it may have been wishful thinking! The advice of the staff was great, recommending the best way of getting around, to a nice restaurant for somewhere to eat for my partners 30th, to the best way to get a taxi to the airport, nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were clean and tidy and huge compared to our room in Paris, and the bathroom amazing, water pressure great too. Breakfast is continental, but probably the best continental I've had anywhere in Europe. Breads, pastries, juices, cereal, meat, yoghurts and coffee (either out of the machine or fresh). The two women who run the breakfast setup are amazing, very efficient. For the English man who became quite arrogant when scrambled eggs weren't included in the buffet, please do your homework!! We were embarassed to be English, read what a continental breakfast is before complaining! In summary, would I stay here again, probably, but I'd perhaps look at the cheaper options in the little backstreets of Venice too now I feel more confident navigating my way around Venice. That said, price aside, there is absolutely nothing bad to say about this little hotel, it deserves it's excellent rating from Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent team running this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edgar186
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay in Venice with my wife. Choose this hotel on the recommendation of previous reviewers. It was a fantastic stay. It is everything that others described: ideal location close to train station bus station with easy access to vaporetti that can take you anywhere in Venice and the islands around Venice, the breakfast was very good (cannot expect more from a 3satr hotel), the rooms were very clean, decent size, lovely well kept curtains, good choice of channels on TV, nice bathroom, but also some minor detail that made it even nicer, e.g. sweets left every day on the bed, light in the closet, and very good a/c. Loved having the breakfast outside watching life go by, and also in the evening. Free internet access made it easy to speak to the family on Skype. But to me, what makes this hotel a top one is the people that run it.
