From the very beginning we were welcomed by a lovely receptionist (I think her name was Anka) who gave us all the right information we needed to know to see as much of Venice as we could. An attendant took us up to the room and explained how everything worked. The girl in charge of the breakfast (she was there every day 18th, 19th, 20th July, but did not get her name) was lovely and genuine. You knew that her morning greeting and a smile were true, and took very good care of the customers, even with those who were arrogant at times. It was interesting to see how everyone pitched in to help out to ensure that everything run smoothly, including the manager. We have stayed in lots of hotels in different countries including 5 star hotels, but never experienced such a good team in one hotel. It felt like having a constant insider to the place, with very valuable advice. Would definitely stay here again, and send others. E

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly/helpful staff, and great for families”
Reviews.Author: islandermama
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Venice with my 70 year old in laws and our toddler. My father in law can't walk long distances so we chose this hotel for it's location from the train station. As you come out of the train station, it is right across the canal which was perfect for us. You do have to cross a bridge so if you can pack light it would be better. The staff was superb and offered a bigger room for us with the baby but we opted to have the room next to our parents. The water buses were easy to catch from here. The breakfast was the best compared to the 3 different hotels we stayed at in Italy. The rooms were very clean and the a/c was a great relief from the heat. It was a less crowded area which we loved. They let us check out a little later so the baby could nap and they let us leave our luggage in a storage room after we checked out without charge so we could sightsee more before catching our train. We would most definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice - Deserves High Rating”
Reviews.Author: freedom_53Ontario
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in convenient location on Grande Canal. Short walk from the train station. Also minutes from Piazza Roma which is arrival point for transportation from airport. Clean, quiet, well-equipped room with good bed, shower and bathroom. Enjoyed the breakfast - coffee, juice, cheese, sliced meats, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bread, pastries. Computer available in lobby with free internet. Very friendly and helpful staff! Nice outdoor seating area for breakfast or late night drinks. Easy access to major sights. Smallish room with no view and a little pricey, but probably average for Venice so still a strong recommendation. Might be worth it to splurge for one of their larger Deluxe rooms with balcony and canal view.

Reviews.Title: “A+, great spot and wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: Modex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 40th birthday and were very pleased. The room was excellent, and the service top class. Antonio was very helpful and a consummate pro. The level of service and consideration was to the degree that they even refilled the ice in our champagne bucket when they noticed we stepped out for 20 mins. The location is also very convenient, walking distance to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and super nice hotel in Venice for a deal!”
Reviews.Author: TheWinFin
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very Clean Super friendly and professional Great value for money AC in the rooms (which means no mosquitoes) Elevator present Super friendly bar tender Great location (not too close to the touristy hub) Cons: Only rooms facing the water have a good view

Reviews.Title: “Your Own Private Villa on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Iam3
Reviews.Content: After lugging our bags around Italy for a week, the Antiche Figure was a welcome rest. It is conveniently located across the Grand Canal from the Venice Santa Maria train station (an easy walk) and not far from the cruise terminal (a little longer walk the other way). The vaporetto to Rialto Bridge and Saint Mark's square is also just across the canal (the cheapest way to get around) and a gondola stand is right outside the hotel. Our rooms were excellent. We booked adjacent rooms overlooking the Grand Canal, each with private balconies - perfect for enjoying a peach bellini and watching the traffic float by. The staff was excellent and very attentive. They spoke multiple languages fluently and were very helpful in giving directions and booking reservations. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice when I return to Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: Rizleen
Reviews.Content: I loved how the person who greeted us at the front desk was so friendly and helpful, ~ offered us a room upgrade at a price which was worth it!!! The room we stayed in was excellent and surprisingly spacious, considering the fact that the hotel lobby and breakfast room was small. Definitely will recommend to my friends if they decide to visit Venice, and for me & my hubby, we will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful - thank you !!”
Reviews.Author: lily23Winchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our two teenage children in July 2011. The staff could not have been more helpful - the room (overlooking Grand Canal) was beautiful - bathroom (and I'm fussy about bathrooms) beautifully decorated and perfectly clean. Our stay in Venice was just made by this hotel. In fact we left it to go to Rome and we were homesick for the Antiche Figure after about an hour !

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrewnn
Reviews.Content: Thank you for your reviews prior to me booking this hotel. I concur with many of the contributions noting this is a fantastic three star hotel boxing well above its weight. We took an upgraded room which they offered on check in and found an extremely clean, spacious and well appointed room with a lovely bathroom. The bed was huge and very comfortable giving a very restful sleep. The room was canal facing and there was a little noise from the Vapporetto but it wasnt disturbing, there were also shutters that could be pulled if you needed to. Opening the windows first thing in the morning to the hustle and bustle of Grand Canal was one of the highlights of our trip. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly making us feel at home on arrival - so much so we rearranged our holiday to stay longer in this hotel. Breakfast was about average and because there were no large rooms its spread out amongst rooms as best they can. The hotel is situated close to bus station and opposite the railway station being easily found but I do concur with the comments to travel light or indeed take a water taxi if you dont want to drag your many kilos over bridges on arrival and departure. Whilst this is away from the main attraction of St. Marks Square the island is very accessible by walking - but you do a lot of that as with many cities. All in all this is a very nice hotel which has more a 4 star feel than a three.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Visit to this Hotel/Staff Tip Top”
Reviews.Author: DSHT
Reviews.Content: I shall receommend this hotel to everyone, just over the bridge from the railway, ferries right outside for access to everywhere, not loud either. Great location, you can walk Venice, lovely to see all the beautiful buildings and back streets. The rooms were excellent/clean and the staff immense, couldn't have been more helpful if they tried. I would definatley stay here again and ask you not to miss this experience, 12 out of 10 I don't like Continental Breakfast but my husband does and throughly enjoyed it but it was no trouble to have cooked at small charge, worth it. I did not find Venice dirty or smelly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be one of the best small hotels in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: RussellBen
Reviews.Content: We just spent a lovely four days in this small hotel. Conveniently located on the Grand Canal a short walk from the Piazzale Roma, where the bus arrives from the airport, the hotel is immaculate, with all marble modern bathrooms and rooms that are larger than many small hotels. The public spaces were charming, and the breakfast was excellent, fresh croissants, fruit, breads, etc., served on white tablecloths. So much for the physical qualities; what made our stay so enjoyable was the wonderful staff. Quite literally, they were the most pleasant, warm, and helpful hotel staff we have found anywhere in years of travel. We will stay here on our next trip to Venice, and we recommend it enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: magnolia387
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were leaving on a cruise so planned to arrive three days early to enjoy Venice. Antiche Figure came highly recommended. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal but also looked across at the train station. (not a problem don't look at it) The hotel staff was very helpful, friendly and accomdating. We had planned to lug our bags across the two little bridges to the people mover and on to the cruise ship. However- a very nasty thunderstorm changed those plans. The hotel staff orderd water taxis for all the cruise ship travlers so that we could share the cost. The ushered us each out while holding an umbrella and helped with lugguage. THe morning breakfast was ample and very good. Our room was a nice size by Italy standards. Beds comfy, marlble bathroom , internet jack,what else could one ask for. The big plus of the location was being away from the St Marks Square crowd-it was so peaceful and quiet in the evening. The water buses were also very close by. Buy your St Marks tickets before you leave.(go to Venice Connected) Bathrooms are hard to come by. There are two locations in the Palace and two public locations. We bought the passes as the are one euro for each visit. Also- we bought the water bus passes before we left and discovered that it appears only the tourists use the passes. Have fun trying to get lost and finding your way to your hotel. THe Hotel Antiche is almost like cheating becasue you follow the signs to the train station, but each street is different. Hagel with the gondoliers. We got the price down to 60 euro!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jansbuyingmachine
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Antiche Figure for two nights and loved it. I had booked a suite but on arrival didn't realise what had been booked was what I would call an apartment. It was also not in the main hotel but a short walk down a side street. Although it was very nice it wasn't what I was expecting. I spoke to the manager and he couldn't have been more helpfull and moved us to a room in the hotel which was very nice. He even offered to move us again to another room if we still weren't happy. The room was great! The service was the best and most friendly I've ever received. We had a great stay here and would stay here again if we are lucky enough to go back to Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....but not as I expected!”
Reviews.Author: FalcoG
Reviews.Content: The room is nice, the pillow kind of hard, the bathroom is fine. The hotel is well located if you come by train, is just passing the bridge and then walk a little and you are at the hotel. The front view of the hotel is the modern terminal. The breakfast was ok also Michele and Antonio were very nice. I think that Mr X, as mentioned in one of the previous reviews, was at the Front Desk the next day.... : ( This was the most expensive hotel of all my trip and, sorry to say, it did not meet my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: CatherineSelf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure last week, and had an amazing experience! After travelling around to a number of other cities in Italy, we arrived at Hotel Antiche Figure and were pleasantly surprised by the great service we received. Anka was the most helpful, friendly and informative person we came across while in Italy! Such a sweet girl! Also had outstanding service from Antonio who provided us with some great recommendations of restaurants in the nearby vicinity when we couldn't bear walking any further after a day of wandering the Venice streets. We would highly recommend this service-oriented hotel which is in a great location right across the canal from the train station. So easy to get to!

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey...”
Reviews.Author: MissAisling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the rooms are nice. However we found it a little expensive for what you get. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and had just a GREAT experience there”
Reviews.Author: ralphap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (and another couple) arrived at Antiche Figure after the typical 24-hour-with-little-sleep trip from the US and were exhausted. Our introduction to Italy was the staff at this hotel. They could not have been nicer. A tremendous load was lifted (literally, in the case of our luggage) as they immediately took care of everything for us - checked in, settled in our rooms, a refreshing drink, etc. The location faces the Grand Canal so that was exciting. Water taxis stop immediately in front. Across the canal is the train station (although crossing on foot involves a 100+ meter walk to and across the nearest bridge - the Scalzi Bridge). The hotel is small but had everything one needs for a short stay. It appeared to have recently had a complete renovation as the room furnishings, bathroom fixtures, small things like room door locks were all new and very modern. The AC worked great. The room was not large but was more than adequate and was spotlessly clean and very comfortable, again with a great view of the Grand Canal. It was not noisy, we slept great. It's location is away from the hustle, bustle and prices of the area around Piazza San Marcos, yet we walked there in about 45 minutes, taking our time and enjoying back streets, piazzas, shops and neighborhoods of the real Venice. It's very convenient to the Cruise port as well as the train station. They have a small but nice bar with good cocktails and wine at reasonable prices and a nice seating area for a very complete continental breakfast which was excellent. Free internet at a PC in the lobby with good reception. We found sidewalk cafes within a short distance where we had good drinks and a very nice dinner. (One word of caution - if you are carrying lots of heavy luggage, take a water taxi to and from the hotel. Public transportation stops a block or two away or on the wrong side of the canal and carrying heavy luggage over the bridges is not for old and weak backs.) In summary, Antiche Figure is a great value, great location , modern, clean and comfortable. It's not the Four Seasons but for one or two nights where convenience to the train station, airport and cruise port is important, it is perfect. Whenever we had a question or a need, the staff went out of their way to get us an answer and continually made us feel welcomed and valued. We highly recommend Hotel Antiche Figure

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: aiken_bonzi
Reviews.Content: Our family loved the hotel. The staff was very friendly and gave good advice to sightseeing. Of course the location on the Grand Canal and across from the train station can not be beat. The hotel upgraded us to a larger room which was very nice. Our daughters enjoyed talking with the desk staff and bartender late at night when they were on wi-fi. We definitely would stay there again. Nothing at all to complain about or belittle.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianaPei
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right opposite to the train station, which is very convenient for us to just walk across the bridge and reach there in three minutes. We stayed at a deluxe room, which is elegantly furnished, and has a small balcony that we can look out to the main canal and see the unique water traffic of Venice. The manager and staff are very professional and offer quality service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HKexpat46
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed here which shows how much we value the professional service of this seemingly tight knit team. The hotel manager Alessandro is clearly very talented in running this and another higher end property - he could lift the game of many a fancier hotel we stayed in. The hotel is directly opposite the train station when you arrive which means you can get off the train, check in and be off walking around Venice within 20 minutes of arrival - pretty fantastic. I guess not as picturesque a setting as some other hotels in Venice though. The hotel is near a big supermarket, park and laundry matt, so if you are parents this is a good hotel for kids. Overall for this value nothing could be improved, except perhaps the location (unless you like trains!)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Sparkster110
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night before boarding our cruise ship but really enjoyed the hotel. The location is terrific, the staff friendly and helpful, and the room was attractive and very clean. Breakfast was included and was very good. We would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Che un hotel fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: NJP1
Reviews.Content: As a single traveller I felt extremely comfortable staying at this hotel and it is in the top ten for all the reasons mentioned here by all the other travellers. I decided to upgrade and I'm glad I did as I was given an apartment with my own 'kitchen' and 'living area' and it was just like being at home. But more importantly it was so very quiet night and day which is very important to me as I am a light sleeper. I didn't really come into contact with the staff ( as the apartment was not in the hotel itself) but what little I did they were always very charming and polite. The decor of the apartment was lovely browns and creams and the shower was excellent. I was only disappointed that I could not find any English TV Channels but I didn't go to Venice to watch TV! I would love to stay at this hotel again and without hesitation I would recommend it to other travellers who want to experience the beautiful city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Kagemand
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from the helpful staff. Rooms and common areas were nice. Even though we had a room on the side of the building, we still had views of the canal. It's very easy to get to from the car parks and the train station. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RandGloveitaly
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first of 4 stops during our tour of Italy...and we loved everything about it. We stayed at this hotel for three nights and have no complaints. The staff were wonderful, the room was spacious, the breakfast food tasty and the coffee fantastic. We stayed in a suite in the alley and although there was no view of the water, the room was peaceful. Antiche is in a great location, right across from the train station and close to the square where the buses from the airport drop you off. We traveled with Rick Steves' book and along with recommendations from the hotel, used it to make choices about food, attractions, and tips on Venice in general. Our only disappointment was the trip to Murano arranged through the hotel. With a free shuttle to the island and a free tour of a glass factory, we thought it would be an easy tour to get to know the famous glass. While the boat ride was fine, the tour through the glass factory was.....uncomfortable. My husband and I could not wait to get out of there. The glass not our style, the prices outrageous and the gentle pressure to purchase something was a little too much for us. But, if you go in a group, maybe the experience is different. For just the two of us, it was unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn036
Reviews.Content: No wonder this hotel won the 2011 Tripadvisor Award. It is conveniently situated at the head of the Grand Canal for the cruise terminal.My daughter and I stayed only one night but wished we'd had longer. I chose this hotel because of the Tripadvisor review and it did not disappoint. The hotel was as comfortable as we expected and the staff were so helpful and accommodating, including an excellent recommendatiion for dinner at a nearby trattoria. We were given a room with a small balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. We'll definitely book this hotel again when we come back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the service”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: We arrived by rental car and it was an easy walk over the bridge to Hotel Antiche. They staff were excellent and considerate. We ordered a suite down the side alley. Initially I was disappointed, but it turned out well as the sheer volume of people and water traffic makes for much sound. Our room was well appointed, the bathroom rather smaller than I would have liked. The breakfast was an efficient affair and the Hotel was fully booked so it all ran smoothly considering. It was the people service that made the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Definite good choice”
Reviews.Author: Edm0nt0n_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure simply added to the lure of Venice. Upon arrival, the staff at the front desk were most welcoming and efficient. We were provided with a suite which had a kitchen/eating area and a separate bedroom. The newly completed decor reflected the style of Venice as it provided a comfortable space. The bathroom was large and featured a spa shower.The breakfast was served in an elegant room and offered a good variety of food for the guests. Cappuccinos were prepared by the breakfast staff as they welcomed you to your table. All areas of the hotel were very clean and well maintained.This hotel is located near the train station which means upon arrival in Venice, luggage can be quickly and easily gotten out of the way. By purchasing a pass for the vaporetto, all of the sights of Venice are easily reached by a boat ride down the grand canal. When we return to Venice we will most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: TaraSmith_AL
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel in busy Venice. My mom, myself, and my 4 year old daughter thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ColleenMaitland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from the train station, excellent choice. Located on the grand canal. The staff are very helpful, couldn't do enough for us. we spent 5 days here, and enjoyed our visit. We stayed in one of the small apartment attached to the hotel, best thing we did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: smk0523
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here just days ago for our honeymoon. It was the first stop of more to come in Italy and we were enchanted at the first sight of our room. It was quaint and lovely...even had a small balcony from which to overlook the grand canal. The staff couldn't have been nicer - they truly went out of their way to give us great dining recommendations and directions to different locations. The breakfast was perfect and even started at 7AM so we had time to eat before we had to catch an early train to our next stop. Being directly across from the train station couldn't have been more convenient. Would highly recommend this hotel for honeymooners or families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and a helpful location in a confusing city.”
Reviews.Author: utahskier
Reviews.Content: Usually I will avoid train station locations as they are generally very busy and not in the best areas. However, for Venice being near the station is a plus. If you take the bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma, the Figure is very easy to find. And, Venice is a city of bridges. If you pick a hotel far from a vaparetto stop, you will lug your bags up and down bridges. Definitely to be avoided. Also, Venice is a very confusing city to nagivate. When lost, look for signs that say "ferrovia" and you will always come back to the hotel. Regarding the staff, Michele, Antonio, and Francesca were excellent. The rooms are typically european (ie small) but very clean and comfortable. This is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: saraspode
Reviews.Content: a fantastic hotel, a great location with easy access to vaporetto buses and trains. The staff were very helpful and had good recommendations for places to east and how to get to the main sites. we had a canal facing room which was worth the extra, and we would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: Beth095
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel , everything was perfect .the staff were especially helpful couldn't have asked for better when you are in a place that is unlike any other. Great location for us as we were leaving by train ,station was across the canal .Our room was large and overlooked the canal , we heard no noise during our stay . Would definitely recommend this hotel to family or friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room Right on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: renosteve95
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room in this hotel, with a little balcony right on the Grand Canal. We thought it might be noisy but it really wasn't with the window closed. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The hotel is across the canal from the train station so it is very easy to access if you are traveling by train. It is away from the hustle and bustle of St. Marks Square, which is a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for 3 nights and could not fault this hotel - excellent location, friendly staff and a reasonably-sized, comfortable room. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location - excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: karensherman
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in one of the best locations overlooking the Gran Canal in Venice. We upgraded our rooms and had a huge suite for only 20e extra per night. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly and anything we asked was arranged. The only critisism is that the room although it had a wardrobe had no drawer space so a lot of our clothing had to remain in our suitcase to be used when needed. It was a very large room and there was ample space for a chest of drawers ro it seems a bit strange that one wasnt provided. Other than that we would definatelt rebook and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: threeonrtheroad
Reviews.Content: There is little I can add to the other recent reviews. This is a lovely hotel in a great location with beautifully furnished rooms with lots of amenities. It is expensive, but so is everything in Venice! We had a wonderful room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. It was a little noisy, but we didn't mind because we wanted to be immersed in the canal experience! But it's the staff that make this hotel special. My daughter woke up ill the first morning of our three-night visit. The staff went out of their way to help us get quick medical attention for her and offer whatever she needed during the day. The next morning, they expressed delight when they saw she was up for breakfast. We really felt that they cared. My only complaint relates to breakfast. Not the food, which was fine; but the lack of adequate seating in the breakfast rooms. This is a small hotel and, no matter what time we came down, it was so crowded that we had difficulty getting a table. It seemed as though people were walking in off the streets for breakfast! (They were actually coming from the hotel's annex.) Other than this, we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great breakfast, and location”
Reviews.Author: LiveForTravel1958
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Antiche Figure in Venice for 4 nights, and really enjoyed our visit. We found the hotel was clean, our room (a canopy room in the building next door, accessed by a corridor) well equipped and serviced, bed very comfortable. The hotel offered a deluxe continental breakfast which was a great start to every day, special coffees were available upon request and quickly served. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and keen on providing the best service. They were knowledgeable about Venice, things to see and do, and places to eat. The hotel also offered an on-site bar, and we observed other guests enjoying a beverage both in the bar and at tables out side the hotel entrance. The hotel was ideally situated for us, as we wanted to visit other islands as well as visit Verona inland. Coming from the airport on the shuttle bus (5Euro), we were dropped off a short walk from the hotel at the Piazzale Roma. The hotel was right across the Grand Canal from key stops (accessible via a bridge) for the vaporetta (water bus), which gave us easy access to the various parts of Venice, Murano, Burano, Lido that we wanted to visit. We purchased a 3 day pass, which was brilliant as we just needed to flash it and board any water bus to take us where we wanted to go. Also, right across from the hotel was the Ferrovia (Santa Lucia Train Station) which gave us ready access to points inland, including Verona.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS A REAL FIND AND WE CAN'T WAIT TO RETURN!”
Reviews.Author: SurreyScarlett
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read the wonderful reports on T/A and were thrilled to find that it was in such a lovely quiet area, surrounded by lovely buildings, churches and canals. There are many local restaurants nearby, most of them mainly frequented by Italians. We booked a cheaper room without a view of the canal, and our friends booked the more expensive room. Both rooms were bright, clean and nicely furnished in traditional Italian style with en suite bathrooms, our friends' bedroom was large and spacious with 2 windows looking over the canal, while ours was smaller with one window overlooking a lovely old building, and the other had a good side view of the canal. We all slept very well, as the beds were extremely comfortable. Both rooms had a television with Sky, and there is a computer in the reception.The buffet breakfast was very good, and could be taken inside or on the pavement overlooking the canal, but order fresh coffee from the waitress rather than taking it from the machine! The hotel is within walking distance of all the main areas of interest, although we found the Rialto bridge and st. Marks Square area so terribly crowded when we were there in this month (May) that we stayed well away! There were some lovely shops nearby, and we were very surprised to find beautiful leather bags of all types from only 25 lira! One morning we went into a beautiful Cathedral close to the hotel, only to discover that a wedding was about to take place, so we stayed for the whole hour and a half enjoying the wonderful music and the soloist singing Ava Maria - a great experience, and what an atmosphere! We found all the hotel staff very helpful and polite,especially reception who were extremely helpful, especially Anka who went out of her way to suggest restaurants where we could escape tourists and find the best local food. We ate most night in different restaurants fairly close to the hotel, as we found the quality of the food better, and the prices far less than any of the restaurants in the more popular areas. We arrived on the Orient Express at the railway station which is opposite the hotel and being in our 60s found lugging our suitcases up and down all the hundreds of steps of the bridge rather too much, but apparently we could have ordered a porter from the hotel beforehand, which we will definitely do next time. We returned to the airport by private water taxi which picked us up right outside the hotel at a cost of 120 euros for the four of us.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Olie079
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure Venice after disembarking from our cruise. It was a great little hotel in an ideal location as it is only one bridge away from Piazzale Roma where the shuttle bus dropped us off and another bridge away from the Station which was very convenient as we were catching the Venice Simplon the following morning. It was also easy to find your way back after exploring Venice as there are plenty of signs to Piazzale Roma. It was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful, even arranging a free shuttle to Murano Island. Breakfast was included which was a bonus and it was lovely to sit out front with a coffee and watch all the activity on the canal. There are lots of restaurants just across the canal and we felt perfectly safe walking around there at night. The decor was very "Venetian" and charming and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks All the Boxes”
Reviews.Author: Where2gonext60
Reviews.Content: Its very rare you go to a hotel and all aspects are great. This is one of those hotels. Location, cleanliness, quality and size of rooms, freindliness of ALL staff and great value. Our two rooms overlooked the grand canal. As soon as you pulled back the curtains there was no mistaking where you were. Venice is just one of those magicall places made all the more special by people who really wanted you to have a great time. Everyone without exception not only was helpful but had a smile on thier face which is so unusual in the hospitality business. Do yourself a favour.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: kroe55
Reviews.Content: We lashed out and booked a Grand Canel view room and finished up with a top floor room meeting our every expectation. The hotel is conveniently located to Piazzale Roma (400 mtrs) and opposite the railway station. The hotel staff were excellent and advised some excellent non touristy dining options that turned out to be absolutely first class. In our experience it is always worth asking the hotel staff for dining options. You almost certainly wont be disappointed. The rooms while not being huge were extremely well appointed and beautifully decorated. Evening drinks outside watching the passing parade are not to be missed. A geat experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Comfortable Rooms, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AirlineGuyFLA
Reviews.Content: As an Airline Crew member for many years I feel I can provide an accurate review based on the hundreds of hotels I have experienced over the years. This hotel was in a great location. The staff was very pleasant upon arrival and offered to show us an upgrade room as well as our original reserved room. We saw both and decided to go with the upgraded canal view since it was larger. The room had wooden shutters to close at night which provided a room free of sunlight and was totally quiet . The A/C worked very well. The marble bathroom was small but very clean and looked nice. The room itself was very comfortable and was worthy of its ratings. The staff was very cordial, polite and knowledgeable. We took a shared water taxi back to the airport upon return and it was right on time and picked us up 10 feet from the hotel, a great option back to the airport. Thanks for a great stay in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air.........”
Reviews.Author: slake137
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located, right across from the railway station and very accessible to the water taxi stations. The reception staff are EXTREMELY friendly and very helpful.......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location....great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MandLGloucester
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, especially if you arrive by train, clean, good breakfast and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Host and marvelous stay”
Reviews.Author: dearrose
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for the first time with two more couples. The hotel very close from the parking garage ,where we received a great discount through the hotel, small but with very clean and nice rooms. We ask for room with view to the canal. Spanish speaking tourists, we receive a warm welcome from his manager, Alessander, that help us spend the most memorables moments in our 21 days trip. We were suppose to stay just one night and we spend two !! Our best wishes to Alessander and his wonderful staff. We hope to go back soon !!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about "best of 2011"”
Reviews.Author: LDN
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here last week and while I agree with many of the compliments that other guests have written, I am a little surprised by the â€œbest of 2011â€� award. By all means the staff is excellent. We felt there was a little too much up-grade, book a tour, sales pressure when we checked-in, but overall we found the staff to really go out of their way to answer questions, make reservations, etc. The location is as convenient as stated by many people. What surprised me was the quality of the room. We had a king bed that was obviously two twins put together with a big lump in the middle. The quality of the bed linens is very low and the pillows are thin lumps. The only blankets on the bed are a thin sheet and the bedspread. The walls were so thin that we would listen to our neighbor using the bathroom each night as we lay in bed. (Not very romantic!) The place that we stayed in Tuscany was also a â€œbest of 2011â€� winner and there was simply no comparison between the two hotels. The rooms, service, location and beds in Tuscany were amazing. Maybe that was why I was disappointed in this place. But truly part of the vacation experience for me is sleeping in a really wonderful room. If that is a priority to you as well, Iâ€™m not sure this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DaveNKent
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here six years ago and saw that it still had good reviews on Tripadvisor so we booked again, this time we were with two friends. As before it provided the perfect base from which to explore Venice. Located 5 minutes from the bus station (â‚¬3 from the airport) and opposite the railway station it is easy to get to however you arrive in Venice. The reception staff are exceptionally helpful and all speak excellent English. Within an hour of checking-in they had booked the restaurants we wanted for all four nights of our stay. We had two beautiful rooms in the annex which were well furnished and very quite. The breakfast had all you could want from a cold buffet. Previously we had a room overlooking the Grand Canal which was lovely too. Being opposite one of the largest Vaporetto stops on the Grand Canal it was easy to get around and the walk back from the Rialto through the back streets give you a chance to explore parts of Venice not on the regular tourist route. All this and â‚¬20 for a bottle of Prosecco, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: bperutz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, incredible location. Very clean!!! The bedroom was very beautiful. I like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location opposite the railway station on the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie34
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with impeccable service. We stayed in a double, superior room at the side of the hotel and had a fantastic night's sleep. Most railway locations are a bit grim, but this was magical. Calm, serene and a lovely backdrop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lovevenice30
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all our expectations!! The hotel is beautiful, the staff incredible. Upon check-in the staff greeted us and explained the entire city and what we needed to see while there. The staff went above and beyond as far as customer service. All services in this hotel were impecable. We upgraded to a room with a view of the Grand Canal. The room was and bathroom were large. It did get a bit noisy due to the canal traffic but was worth the view. The location was great, close to the train station and within walking distance to everything. Breakfast was good, cappucino superb and they have a few tables outside to sit and have a drink. Amazing city, amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: mttinsf
Reviews.Content: We travelled with my partner's elderly parents. This hotel location could not have been more perfect (unless it was attached to the train station). From the station to the hotel - 50 metres, a bridge, and another 50 metres. To the taxi/bus for the airport - two small bridges and ~100 metres. Having taken the vaporetto with tourists hauling heavy bags, made me appreciate this hotel all the more. We had rooms without any view, but we only used the room to sleep. The hotel itself was quiet, and had a warm feel to it. The rooms were expensive at ~$330 a night, but then again, all of Venice is expensive! Having read the negative reviews of this hotel, what I appreciate is that the hotel tried to respond to these reviews. That is service!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rob091
Reviews.Content: We had four nights at this busy hotel. It is right opposite the train station on the other side of the Grand Canal. The location is great and we had no issues at all with noise from the boats on the canal. The room was wonderful, large and well appointed with lovely views of the Grand Canal. The staff were always friendly and helpful; always happy to provide advice whenever asked. They provide free Internet and a buffet breakfast is available on the ground floor. There is a bar downstairs and tables outside where you can relax and watch Venice go by. Our favourite restaurants where Osteria ae Cravate (great food and fabulous service) and La Rosa Dei Venti (try the Zuppa Pesce!) - both a short walk from the hotel in Santa Croce

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ss_1234q
Reviews.Content: All other reviews about this hotel are correct - it is hard to fault. It is 'only' a 3 star hotel but staff are friendly, rooms are clean, roomy, have a charm about them and location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Tatania77
Reviews.Content: Staying in Venice is expensive and this hotel is not cheap but it offers a lot for the price and we were really pleased with it. The location was excellent for many reasons. Firstly, it's easy to get to - we arrived by bus number 5 from the airport to the nearby Piazalle Roma, which is the cheapest way to arrive in Venice and surprisingly hassle-free, too. The train station is right across the hotel and if you are staying for a few days, like we did, you can travel to Treviso, Padua, Vicenza or Verona. Vaporetto 'Ferrovia' is opposite the hotel and if you take vaporetto 1 or 2 to San Marco or back you'll see the whole Grand Canal - just make sure you get to the front of the ship for a good view. Also, being close to Ferrovia ( the train station), makes navigating back to the hotel quite easy - there are yellow signs "per Ferrovia" all over Venice and you can just follow those. Finally, the area ( Santa Croce) is lovely - it's not as crowded as San Marco but has lots of picturesque little streets, campi and bridges and some excellent sights ( like the magnificent Frari) as well. A good place to start exploring Venice before plunging into the crowds and tat of Rialto-San Marco. Not all went swimmingly, though. When we arrived, it turned out that they had overbooked through a mistake, but they were extremely apologetic about this and offered us to spend the first night in a nearby 4-star hotel and then to upgrade to a better room in the annex for the remaining 5 nights. All at not extra cost for us, of course. We accepted that quite happily and it all went quite well ( apart from having to tip the porter in the four-star hotel who conveniently didn't have change) Then on our fifth day we found out that our flight had been cancelled so we needed to stay at least one more night and, fortunately, the staff offered us the same room at a reduced rate. The room we had in the annex was good. The annex is in a very narrow, quiet street to the right of the hotel. There isn't much of a view at all but on the other hand you don't get any noise from the street. The walls between the rooms are not very soundproof but it wasn't a big problem - you can hear flushing water but not conversation. The bathroom was nice, with a nice big shower and lots of fixtures. There was a good bed, a kettle, a TV and free internet. The room was cleaned to an excellent standard and it was cosy and warm, too. The only bit I didn't like was that it had a very light cover on the bed and a very thick warm blanket in the wardrobe, nothing in between. But you can adjust the room temperature. We booked the room with breakfast included and that was a wise decision. They serve continental breakfast (so no bacon and scrambled eggs) but there's a decent choice of cold meats, cheese, cereal, fruit and an especially nice choice of pastries. The staff make excellent cappuccino or espresso as well and bring it to your table. The staff in the hotel are all really lovely and friendly - they speak excellent English and they are extremely helpful - they were eager to recommend places to visit and restaurants to eat in. Generally, the restaurants in the area are cheaper than in San Marco so we tended to eat nearby. The ones we liked most was Al Vecio Pozzo (excellent pizza, good value) and Le Bacco Felice ( lovely pizza and pasta, but don't order fish). The one we didn't particlularly care for was Ca Leon - it didn't have house wine and other alcohol was really expensive and it was pricier than the other two. We had complimentary spritz from the bar on our first night and enjoyed it so went on to have a drink on a couple other nights, sitting outside, looking at the Grand Canal... It was very pleasant. Overall, this trip didn't come cheap but we were really happy with this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love Venice, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: GLANNEY
Reviews.Content: Right across from train station, BUT steep bridge to cross, so be prepared if you have luggage - backpack would be best. Front desk was very pleasant. Only stayed one night and had a large, clean room overlooking the Grand Canal, what's not to like!! Nice breakfast, best cappuccino we had in Italy. They held our luggage til 4:30, when our train was ready to leave. Definitely pricey, but we didn't have to cart luggage on a tragetto, which was nice. Heard no noise at all overnight, inside or out; the morning "rush" on the canal was fun to watch. Definitely a "once in a life time" treat being on the grand canal.

Reviews.Title: “It Was as Good as Everyone Said!”
Reviews.Author: KathyMills
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect but found out very quickly that the Francesca and Carlo and the rest of the staff were fantastic. They bent over backwards to ensure we were comfortable. The rooms were roomy, they let us check out a couple of rooms to see which we would prefer. Unheard of usually. We walked to the hotel just over the bridge from the train, a pleasant surprise and enjoyed the area very much. Nicely appointed with antiques and comfortable beds, great breakfast in the morning with excellent service. We really enjoyed ourselves in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Rolleri
Reviews.Content: A really nice stay in Venice. Me and my friend stayed in this hotel for three nights and we enjoyed it, really. Excellent staff, safe place and best location. Will certainly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm comfortable ambience: gloriously Venetian!”
Reviews.Author: Gilnockie
Reviews.Content: We booked the canal view blue rooms on the second floor: sumptuous decor, from the gold candelabra sprouting from the en-suite mirror to the splendidly rococo furnishings in the bedroom. Be aware though that the Grand Canal is a working thoroughfare, you do get the engine noise of the boat traffic in the morning, but isn't that part of being in Venice? Service we found to be attentive, thoughtful and intelligent: samples being front desk staff's considerate handling of my invalid credit card, suggestions for local dining, and, arranging recital bookings. Breakfast was, and no doubt still is, in the continental style, pastries, cakes and small goods. Not really to this Australian's taste, but it was plentiful and varied. Our only complaint was of our own making: we didn't stay long enough! Definitely nothing to feel blue about this boutique gem!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, ideally situated for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelincomfort01
Reviews.Content: Directly opposite the rail station and a vaporetto (water bus) stop, this hotel is ideally located. From Marco Polo airport, a 25 min bus ride (Route 5) costing 3 Euros takes you to the bus station at Piazzale Roma, 7 minutes walk from the hotel. The staff are welcoming and speak excellent English. The room was very small. We had booked a double + 1 room for ourselves and our adult daughter, and there was barely room to move between the beds. There was a good size hanging area, but little other storage. That said, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and there was no nigh time noise - we all slept well. There is an internet connection in the room, but wireless is only available on the ground floor, which was a bit disappointing. Breakfast buffet was very good, and times very flexible. There is a nice bar area, ideal for a cappucino and a nightcap. The staff couldn't have been nicer, and were full of information and advice. All in all a real success. Only giving it 4 not 5 because of cramped space and lack of wireless in the room. Finally, people had said Vdenice was quiet at night - it really is! Even St Mark's Sq wasn't lit up at night, and was virtually deserted by 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HIltonMagic
Reviews.Content: We were recently in Venice for two nights and booked the Hotel Antiche Figure based upon its location and the reviews posted here on TA. We were very pleased with our decision. Since we didn't have a ton of time and we were renting a car when we left, we wanted a centrally located hotel and this one couldn't have been any better. Located right across the Grand Canal from the train station, we had a 2 minute walk to get there. The person at the front desk was very helpful upon check-in providing us maps and information. The room was quite large and very clean. The bathroom was spotless and large. We had a room overlooking the canal (upon our request) and to be honest, I am not sure I would do that the next time as it was a little noisy at night due to the people walking by. The hotel does offer breakfast for an additional charge, but we did not try it as there are quite a few places nearby in the morning to grab a cornetto and cappuccino. Directly across the canal from the hotel (in front of the train station) there is a stop for the water taxi, so that was very convenient for getting around town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, very quaint and the service was impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: Zazu79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right across from the train station! The hotel staff were so informative and helpful. Out all our hotel from Venice to Rome, Hotel Antiche Figure was my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “You must go here”
Reviews.Author: DAZ531
Reviews.Content: From marco polo airport your options are, 1. Water taxi direct to hotel right outside. 100 euros. 30mins. 2. Bus. 3 euros each. 20mins then walk over 2 small bridges along grand canal for 5mins. 3. Train. Sorry dont know as didnt bother. Once arrived at the hotel you are greeted with a warm welcome and within a minute you are in your room. We booked room 311 which is the blue coloured room in most of the photos and doesnt dissappoint. It was lovely and overlooked the grand canal. The staff are so polite and friendly and help you with requests easily and quickly. Whilst in venice i proposed to my girlfriend and asked the staff if they could order me a red rose for the room and to have champagne on ice ready for our return that day. Everything was sorted without any problems and we celebrated being engaged outside the hotel drinking champagne watching the world go by. Fantastic. Breakfast was continental style and had plenty of choice. The coffee kept on coming. It will take approx 20mins walk through the side streets and bridges to get to st marks square. Overall the hotel is a great place to stay and i wish i was still there. Yuo wont be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, loved Venice”
Reviews.Author: mandycandler
Reviews.Content: Thank you Antiche Figure, Venice. Breakfast was great, hotel is located perfectly (Venice is a maze, so knowing that the hotel is situated directly across the canal from the Train Station helped us), impeccable service from the front desk crew. Room was spacious and perfect for our party of three, opening the window to the Grand Canal and watching the action was a plus. The trip to Murano is interesting, but a bit high-pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Kellycorr
Reviews.Content: When we were researching for a hotel in Venice, Hotel Antiche Figure had very good reviews and when we got there, it truly lived up to that reputation! For our first night, they immediately upgraded us to their sister hotel, the Hotel Canal Grande which was likewise spectacular! It had a great view, perfect location, superb service and it was very clean. The bathroom was huge and elegant. For our next day, we stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure, and was booked in one of the best rooms that had a spectacular view of the Grand Canal. The room was very cozy, romantic and beautiful. Service was likewise excellent! Best of all, the room rates were not too expensive! I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends. They truly made our honeymoon unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: aparkerw
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good pick since we had to get to Rome for our departing flight. Being right across from the train station was great for making a quick departure. The room we had wes quite good and spacious. And the direct water taxi ride out to Murano for a glass factory tour was very convenient. The location, while convenient to the train station, was very far away from places like St. Marks and the Rialto. We found ourselves doing a large amount of walking. Not terrible since getting lost in venice is half the fun. The breakfast service was very good and this hotel was a very convenient pick.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: japhoto
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor reading reviews from other travelers and i just got a good vibe. When we arrived in Venice by train, we could see the hotel across the canal....amazing location after a long train trip. Also, very close to the bus which takes you to the airport. The staff at the front desk offered to give us a free upgrade on the room into a suite just a short distance off the main property....I was a little skeptical at first but the guy behind the desk kept saying, "Its a gift"...so I accepted. He whisked down an ancient venetian alley just to the right of the hotel and into a separate entrance. Up a fight of stairs and into our beautiful room with a four poster bed, flat screen tv, the most amazing bathroom (i could've spent the whole time in this huge shower). It was the end of our long trip throughout italy and the comfort was off the charts. I'm definitely coming back. If you have time, they also offer a complimentary boat trip to murano for a tour of venetian glass. Unbelievable stay....go here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, excellent staff, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Wheres_the_plane
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the Antiche Figure. Located on the Grand Canal, so easy access for Water Taxi. Good comunication before stay by email and telephone all reception staff speak English, they were able to put our two rooms together as requested which was much appreciated. Very friendly welcome, keen to explain how to get around, find actual location of places and best routes. We had the Deluxe rooms overlooking the canal, 5 Star quality, large bathroom, large bed, chandeliers, tea and coffee making facitities, fridge. There is some noise caused by the Vapparetos but you soon get used to this and stop noticing it. Good continental breakfast, very nice staff on hand to offer a morning cappuccino. We had a few problems with transportation which the hotel were able to help with. We also had a few occasions to book or change restaurant bookings which the reception staff cheerfully did for us. As a first time visitor to Venice, I felt I needed more assistance than I have in any other city, and was so glad to be staying here. The best local restaurant we went to was La Zucca - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A fab hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: jacquelyn_andrews
Reviews.Content: Easy access from train/ bus stations. Not too busy an area, water bus stages very close by. I would go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowds, and such great service.”
Reviews.Author: travellerCA
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the Dolomites, surrounded by majestic scenery and plenty of space. Then we headed for Venice, just in time for the last weekend of Carnevale, and the crush of people felt like an assault. We stowed away on a high-speed train from Mestre, since we couldn't begin to board the normal trains. We came out of the front door of the train station, looked over the Grand Canal, and saw that our hotel, the Antiche Figure, was literally across the river. One bridgeâ€”a big bridge, but just one of themâ€”to cross, and the crowds thinned significantly. We were greeted enthusiastically ("Ben arrivati!") and our luggage was taken upstairs to our double-superior with extra bed on the 4th (top) floor. For a European hotel, particularly one in a historic district, it was a very large room (slightly cramped by the extra bed, but not too bad). There were two closets, a very large bathroom with a great shower and (mercifully) instant hot water. The windows were open, which admitted the noise of the throngs, but the windows are thick and insulating, and as soon as we closed them we couldn't hear anything anymore, including the chiming of the church bells (Venice is a city of churches and all of them, it seems, chime the hour.) And, happily (and unlike much of Europe in the winter), the room was not overheatedâ€”it had its own controls near the light control (as in nearly all European hotel rooms, you must put your room key into a slot to operate the lights). There is a bar downstairs that is the normal price for a barâ€”you don't need to go out searching for a place to have your beer or coffeeâ€”and very pleasant service. The front desk is wonderful. They asked if we needed lunch or dinner recommendations, and their dinner recommendation (Ca' Leon, just around the corner) was great Venetian seafood and not the least bit touristy. They asked if we needed costumes for Carnevale. They doted on our little daughter. There is Internet (cable only) in the rooms; there is free Wi-Fi in the lobby and there is a computer for use near the front desk. Ask at the front desk for an access code. Breakfast was wonderful. A little heavy on the sweetsâ€”it was Carnevale, after all, so there were pies and fritelleâ€”but good cornetti and bread rolls with hams and salamis and cheeses, plenty of good fruit, and good fresh orange juice. When I went to go get a cappuccino from the machine, the lady overseeing the operation stopped me and offered to go get a cappuccino from the bar for me, a real one. It was, of course, excellent (what IS it about coffee in Italy that we can't seem to master in the US?) and she was, like all the other staff, wonderful. Due to the crowds, it was about 20-30 minutes' walk to Rialto and closer to 45 to Piazza San Marco. There are huge gold signs with arrows everywhere in Venice; while you won't know exactly where you're going, the signs will point you to the right spot. Antiche Figure is also 5-10 minutes' walk to the Jewish Ghetto and about 20-25 minutes' walk to Fondamenta Nuova, from whence you can pick up ferries to Murano, Burano, San Michele and Lido di Venezia. On the way back, you don't have to worry about getting lost because you just follow signs for "Ferrovia" (railway station), which will put you right back at the hotel. There is a huge vaporetto stop right across from the hotel (go back over the Ponte degli Scalzi that you crossed to get to the hotel from the train station), which will take you nearly anywhere in Venice, including San Marco, Dorsoduro and the Zattere. (The vaporetto is not cheap, incidentally, compared to a bus.) It was easy to get away, too. There are two small bridges required to get to the bus stops at Piazzale Roma. Turn left out of the front door, go over the first bridge, then turn left. Turn right at the next bridge and you will find yourself in Piazzale Roma at the bus station. The coach buses to Marco Polo Airport (VCE) and Treviso Airport (TSF) leave from post D2, clearly marked on the left. Go to the ATVO office (in the building facing you, with the caffÃ¨ and the sign for the people mover) and buy your tickets: 3â‚¬ to Marco Polo and 5â‚¬ to Treviso, luggage included (though you will have to stow it yourself in the bins underneath the coach bus). I think if we'd had to stay in a hotel back in the calli and rami, we'd have lost our minds with all the luggage. Having the hotel so close by, with such wonderful service, was a real win and we would happily stay next time we're in Venice (perhaps when it's less crowded).

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you're arriving in Venice by train”
Reviews.Author: CatPacker
Reviews.Content: Every travel guide I looked at mentioned how disorienting it can be to try to find your hotel moments after arriving in this labyrinthine city. (I think "labyrinthine" is a word, right?) So it was a relief to step out the front door of the Santa Lucia train station and see our hotel directly across the canal! One bridge to haul our gear over, and then we were safe at home. Couldn't have been easier. And the welcome couldn't have been nicer either. The staff here are extremely pleasant and very used to helping overwhelmed Americans, from dinner suggestions to walking routes that let you hit the highlights while still allowing room for exploration. We had a "deluxe" room, right on the canal, with a cute little balcony (granted, it was February, so the balcony didn't get much use). And I think we paid 150 euro per night, breakfast included (again, it was February... but still that's really cheap for what we got). I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel with extremely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Misha-np
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Antiche figure is ideal. It's on the Grand Canal, within walking distance of both the bus and train stations and oposite a water bus stop (easily accessed by crossing a nearby bridge). IHowever would suggest that Venice is best experienced on foot and Antiche Figure is well situated for that being about 15 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge and 20 minutes from St. Mark's Square. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, giving us the local weather forcast plus tips on where to eat and what to see and helping arrange a trip to the Islands. A great hotel, which enhanced the Venice experience. I will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Top Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SJH21
Reviews.Content: Can not think of anything negative to say. Staff are all friendly and helpful. Room was excellent, comfortable and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Aini_1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. The twin room is ok or but the triple room is quite small. The service is good and a special thanks to Francesca. Will return in our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel with friendly helpful staff made our visit to Venice just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: j_simpson48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location,near the bus and train station but giving all the atmosphere of the Grande Canal with its waterfront setting. The hotel staff ensured we had just the type and price range of restaurants we wanted, they advised on transport to the islands and served drinks as we returned from walking the island. Our room was comfortable and well furnished and the bathroom felt venitian and luxurious. We will definately return and hope that Michel is still there to greet us!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jenndoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. We were given the opportunity to upgrade to an apartment. in the building next store The apt had a nice foyer with stairs leading up to the living areas. There was a large room with a small kitchen and living room and a separate bedroom. There was also a decent size balcony. They said they hope to put some outdoor furniture out there soon. The staff was amazing. Very professional and friendly. They take personal pride in making sure you are taken care of. We got a great restaurant recommendation from Carlo. The breakfast lady has so much energy. She was constantly making sure if you wanted cappachino or expresso, making sure food available, and cleaning up. The only issue we had was the mosquitos when we were sleeping. When we were going to sleep we heard a mosquito buzzing around. We thought we killed it but woke up with bites all over. When we told the staff when checking out, we found out that there was something in the room to plug in to keep them away. They were going to make sure in the future to tell guests beforehand. We did see mosquitos in other places while in Venice so this was not an issue with a hotel. It's typical of Venice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SherwinTelfer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very clean, friendly staff and great location. Will go back and stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “OMW! Best Choice Ever! NO regrets!”
Reviews.Author: Kissgurami
Reviews.Content: To be honest, i was skeptical about the hotel since the photos on it's website didn't come off as "nice" No offence to Antiche :) When we arrived on 16th Feb, it was raining! And you have no idea how glad we were when Antiche was only mins away from P.Roma. We were greeted with warmth & the reception (forgot his name :( ) felt that we had to come in the rain and was assuring us, it would get better. We were shown to our room (RM411) and OMW! The room was way more than i expected!! The arts on the wall were cupid, the room was in a really good condition & it wasn't a tiny hole :p Sweets on our pillows, i always love such sweet touches :) Next, Bathroom since that is always the least kept and alas, the bathroom had his & hers sinks accompanied with a bathtub. Coffee/Tea maker - Check mark, bathtub - check mark , selection of tea - check mark again :) , toiletries - check mark ! Spacious - Check mark! Quality + Price = Awesome! We had 3 windows facing the Grand Canal & throughout my stay, I sat at the window which has the Gondola right beneath. Lovely! The buzz starts around 8am and on our 3rd Day, the sun came out and just enhanced the lovely view. We were told how to navigate around Venice and walking would be best for us to see the streets. And that's how we started walking our way through, there is a short cut from a street to San Marco/Rialto. Took us around 15 min of walk which was really decent. If you wanted a water bus, it is right opposite the hotel. Gondola? Right at the door step and don't worry, they don't harass you :) I didn't find it noisy at all, ( i kept one of the windows opened by at the at times during my evening). We had a reservation at MET and our water taxi was taken care of :) Breakfast? There is a lovely Italian lady who cheers me up with her smile and her infamous "Would you like to have a cup of Italian cappuccino?" Of coz I did each time :p It is a cosy breakfast room and a decent spread of cold cuts, pastries,juice, yogurt and soft boil eggs. The location is excellent since we came on Ryanair and we had around 7 hours to spare after we checked out. Our bags were with Antiche while we went around and came back to grab them before heading to P.Roma (2 mins walk :p) . The reception even asked if we need to use the restroom to freshen up before we head off. Such hospitality :) Thanks Antiche, Venice was my pre-birthday treat and everything was so beautiful & complete experience! :) Word of recommendation - update the photos on your website:-p

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: biglunchbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel would get my vote just on service alone however when you combine the location, it was as near to perfect as one could get. As commented before by many the hotel is located just over the bridge from the station. This means a LOT in Venice as with 400 plus bridges, the thought of lugging our suitcases over them to get to our hotel did not appeal - of course a water taxi is an alternative but is another expense and hassle after arriving. Having said that the bridge across the Grand canal is a big one so start pumping the hand weights now. We had a canal view room on the top floor which was perfect. I've heard the rooms at the back of the hotel are a bit bigger but without the view. It was amazing to wake up and look out the three windows and watch the Venetians go about their morning routines on the canal.. There is a lot of traffic on the grand canal but the windows are double glazed so the noise of boats (which to some might be annoying) was minimal. Free internet was available in the lobby but not in the rooms which seems to be the norm in Italy. It can also be quite slow. Everything was very clean, breakfast a real treat every morning. We also discovered a coin laundry at the back of the hotel which came in handy. If we visit Venice again, we will definitely stay here. It has everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Very friendly, Clean and confortable”
Reviews.Author: moanygit
Reviews.Content: A short walk from the bus station and perfectly placed to jump on a boat to see Venice. (no. 1 or 2 leave just opposite at Ferrevio or from Piazza de la Roma. 45min walk to San Marco, 25 Min to rialto. We arrived late at night so was good not to have to walk far to our hotel. It was the perfect location really, as on the last day we left our bags at reception, went for a walk and just picked them up on our way back to catch the bus. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was plentiful and pleasant (I recommend getting down there before 9am though, it can be a little busy) Room was clean and comfortable and beautifully decorated. a little pricier than some other hotels but worth it for the location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyKent64
Reviews.Content: From the very start the staff at the Antiche were helpful in a genuine and non corperate way. Our main contact was 'Carlo', and he provided excellent advice and tips to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. Hotel is clean and tidy and our canal view room was perfect. Location is great, and being opposite the railway station you cannot get to lost as an abundance of signs will send you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Fault It!”
Reviews.Author: runtlander
Reviews.Content: The service was polite, cheerful and very helpful. The front desk staff helpfully changed the time of a dinner reservation for us and on leaving an item of clothing in our room the after care service was brilliant reuniting my jumper and I quickly and efficiently. We upgraded to a front bedroom as we were there mid week and in January and the hotel was quiet. The room was light and spacious overlooking the canal. The bathroom was modern and in good order. The location was excellent once we found it! in close proximity (though not at all noisy) to the bus and train terminal. It was close to all the amenities we needed, including a bridge over the canal and a water taxi stop and ticket machines. The hotel was recommended by a friend and we have no hesitation endorsing her recommendation to others

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kkillamb
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. Very close to Piazzale Roma, and right across the canal from the train station. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The rooms were small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: drnan
Reviews.Content: The location allows for leisurely walk to Rialto & San Marco, yet accessible to water taxi, if needed. The shared water-taxi from the airport dropped us at the hotel next door. The staff were nice and friendly. Breakfast was good. -Travelers from Malaysia-

Reviews.Title: “It was just great”
Reviews.Author: SA-to-wherever
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor suggested the hotel and it was everything promised. The hotel is perfectly located to arrive and depart Venice, whether that be by rail, air or bus. As it is right opposite the railway station on the other side of the Grand Canal it is easily found. From Piazzale Roma, where all the buses arrive, it is an easy drag of your suitcase, on the same side of the Grand Canal to the hotel. From being "scolded" at arrival for the shortness of our stay in Venice to the hearty Ciao when we left the staff were genuinely friendly and helpful. We stayed 3 people in the room and with the extra bed the room was a bit too full but still manageable. The rooms and furnishings were well appointed but not muted. The 2 Chandelier lamp fittings in the bathroom perhaps the most startling. The breakfast was well presented and varied. Even though there was an automatic coffee / hot chocolate machine in the breakfast room the the staff still offered to go and make us extra nice espressos and cappuccinos in the Coffee Shop at no extra cost. There is free cabled internet in the rooms with wi-fi only in the foyer. There is no question that we will stay here again when Venice is on the itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: paulam29
Reviews.Content: Well, after perusing laterooms.com and trip advisor, I think it is fair to say I was almost cross eyed due to the sheer number of hotels and conflicting reviews. I booked this hotel purely because of the reviews and I was not disappointed. Location: fantastic, right on the Grand Canal, opposite the station. If you get lost whilst out and about look for the signs saying 'P.Roma' and you cant go wrong. I left the bus station via the rear entrance not the front so managed to get lost but it really is less than 5 minutes from the bus station. Hotel: We booked a superior room in the main hotel but upgraded to a suite which was in an annex. The room was beautiful, very tastefully decorated and lots of space. Dont be deterred by the fact the suites are separate from the main hotel - this is common in Venice. Staff: Well what can we say? Carlo deserves a special mention as he was so friendly and helpful, he recommended a fabulous restaurant and even ensured we had reservations. Carol, if you want a job in England you could teach my staff a thing or two! All the hotel staff were very helpful and nothing seemed too much trouble, even when I arrived with a grumpy other half in tow (due to me getting us lost and him being so hungry) they offered to make toast to see him through despite the kitchen being closed. Breakfast: It is a continental breakfast so any brits expecting a fry up-think again. Plenty of food to choose from and again staff very helpful - no waiting to catch their eye to get an espresso. We will definitely return again and maybe even stay in their sister hotel the grand canal

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: mdeblasi
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night but wish I stayed longer. The staff were awesome and the hotel amazing. I have no idea why it is a three star. I am staying in a four star in Rome right now and it sucks compared to the Antiche Figure. I would recommend it to anyone. For 25 euros I upgraded to a view on the canal, so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: macnbactravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled Italy for a little over a week and this was our last hotel stop and it was definitely a fanastic choice, especially when we were starting to get exhausted by all the siteseeing and walking. The hotel is close to the train station and the bus stop, but it is across the Grand Canal from both, so it is quite. The hotel was reasonably priced and the staff was beyong helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and updated with Venetian charm.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Joseatoro
Reviews.Content: I booked a two-night stay at the AF because the good reviews on Tripadvisor and they are all true. We reserved a room on a small venetian alley that is slighty cheaper (95â‚¬) than the premises on the main building. The room was very nice, with a great bead, flat TV, and bathroom. It included coffee and tea. It was warm and cozy. The alley was very quiet so we could have a very good sleep at night. The breakfast was continental with good coffee and a nice selection of ham, salami, and bread. The staff was very kind and always ready to help. The location for us was very good it is located in the Santa Croce sestieri in front of the railway station and th vaporeto stop, besides it is just a five-minute walk to the bus station, so it was pretty easy to arrive there and later to go to the airport. On the line 2 of the vaporeto it is about 20 minutes to St Mark's Square, and walking it is about 30 - 40 minutes depending on how many times you stop. In summary it is a very good hotel to go to Venice. A comfortable location, nice premises and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and co-operative staff”
Reviews.Author: BJSMumbai
Reviews.Content: The location as described is bang opposite the railway station. In Venice you need to walk or take a water taxi. This location is convenient for both. The reception staff is very co-operative and helped us in getting across by providing us with a map and describing the places of interest. The bus stand is also pretty close. The rooms are very small and we decided to upgrade our room by paying extra for the large room which had a Canal view. The overall stay was comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Staff made our short stay in Venice the very best!”
Reviews.Author: RAPJJP
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 6:30 am train and very helpful staff let us check in immediately even though we were only staying one night! Room was very nice in "Venetian style". Spa style bath. Helped us with restaurant reservations and sightseeing advice. Scrumptious breakfast included. Easy water bus access. Can see from train station so no getting lost first thing with luggage in tow (Caution: 45 bridge steps up to get over the bridge to get to hotel). Free Wi-Fi in our room!
