All of this for our lowest cost room in Italy - on the Grand Canal in Venice. Exceptional hotel at exceptional value!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Hcutt2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before leaving for a cruise from this port. I had been to the city before and paid over double the price for an equal quality hotel. I loved walking the city streets to the touristy parts of town and back again. It was nice to have a hotel with the feel of the city without being surrounded by a crowd. If you love to walk around a city this is the place for you!! Get away from San Marco square, but still feel as though your in a hotel that is on the Grand Canal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: malagnou
Reviews.Content: We spent a very pleasant 6 nights at this hotel with our 14-year old daughter. We were in Venice for New Years Eve. Our room was a decent size and, with an extra portable bed, fit the three of us comfortably. The room and bathroom were cleaned meticulously, every day. The hotel is very close to the vaporettos & therefore easy to get anywhere you want. Because it is not in the San Marcos area, it is relatively quiet. In our room, we heard no outside noises nor did we hear noise from other rooms. We slept very well. The windows are well-insulated for sound. The breakfast is varied--Italian stye plus ham, wÃ¼rst of some sort, cheese...) and enabled us to skip lunch. (No hot egg dishes but twice I saw the staff bring out omelettes and scrambled eggs that they made in response to a special request from one table with children. What service!) The staff is extremely helpful, very pleasant, cordial, extremely knowledgeable about Venice & the sites to see, very helpful with maps and itineraries, warm and welcoming. If there is anything you need, ask them. They will help. They are fluent in many languages. In addition, this hotel is closely situated to a historic part of Venice that is less well-known to tourists and well-worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING staff!”
Reviews.Author: aduf
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice via a bus from the airport (the all arrive to Piazzale Roma). It can be quite confusing arriving in Venice at nighttime. I knew that the hotel was across from the train station but after asking 4 locals for directions and getting blank stares, I just decided to go with my gut instinct and cross the main bridge (modern design). After dragging our suitcase up and down the stairs of the bridge and walking for about a minute, we came across 3 police officers to ask for directions. Even with the name and the address of the hotel, they could only vaguely guide us after seeing the map provided from my booking. Luckily, I happened to look across the grand canal and see the hotel directly across from us. I would later discover that it is really quite easy to get to the Piazzale Roma (just have to cross 2 small bridges and you are there)! We arrived to the hotel after 11pm on the night before New Years Eve and were warmly welcomed. The receptionist helped us with our bags up to our room. The room is a step back in time....very Venetian in style. The hotel room was extremely warm, which was a great relief from the bitter chill outside. We had a side view of the Grand Canal and the area is really quite at night. The breakfast buffet did not have a lot to offer but was adequate. The hotel is really conveniently located (a lot easier to find your way in the daylight!). Across the Grand Canal is a vaporetto (water bus) stop and makes it really easy to get to St Marks. We took the vaporetto once and it was an enjoyable trip and you really get to see the Grand Canal. Venice is a wonderful city to walk in but make sure to get a very detailed map, even with one you will probably get lost. On the morning of New Years Eve, we asked the front desk to for recommendations for a restaurant to ring in the New Year. They were so accommodating- they had a lot of menus to select from and even translated them for us. While we were out sightseeing, they made the reservation. The restaurant they recommended was really nice (www.anticabesseta.it/), not at all touristy feeling and reasonably priced at 60 euro for the prix fix menu, considering some restaurants were charging over 250 euro per person. When we got back to the hotel that night, we were invited to toast in the New Year with a glass of prosecco (a really nice touch). Even though the hotel is not the chicest, it is quintessentially Venice and the absolutely fantastic staff made the stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Niland
Reviews.Content: I booked this the day we flew out, trusted tripadvisor's ratings and selected the highest hotel in the budget level I wanted to be at, and that was it. Location, fantastic, room, nice and big, very clean. Quiet place, Venice in general, after 10 at night. Arriving into the city when it was basically empty and the short walk to the hotel made the 12 hour journey to get there pale into insignificance, it was just stunningly beautiful. Then it rained for three days almost non stop, but you can't have everything! Despite the rain, a great trip... And really good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a short break - great spot, clean , warm rooms & friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: traveller616275
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location ,very close to the train & bus station, so easy to find when you arrive in a strange city. It also means you don't have many bridges to carry your luggage over - handy in Venice. Despite being close to the stations it in in a quiet spot and close to many good places to eat. Yes, it is a 20-25 minute stroll to St Mark's Square but that is a plus - you get to see so much more of Venice, it's a lovely walk and you are away from the over priced areas.We went in December - lovely bright days but very cold, so it was lovely to come back to such a warm , cosy room. The staff were helpful and friendly , the buffet breakfast was tasty and there was plenty of choice . Entrance fees can be pricey but if you eat outside the main centre Venice needn't be as expensive as you expect e.g pizza in a restaurant 9 euros. It's easy to use the waterbus to travel around - we went out to the islands on it - and Venice is relatively small so you can easily walk to the areas you want to see. Venice was a great choice for a city break and the Antiche Figure was the perfect hotel for it - we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, service, breakfast,room, and location”
Reviews.Author: Franell
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for his birthday and we were absolutely thrilled that I had used tripadvisor and decided to book on the reviews that we had read. We upgraded to a canal view room no-one believes we were overlooking the busy fabulous Grand Canal. It was fabulous huge bed for two small people like us the best views and a 7 minute walk from the bus station and even though we didn't need it the train station was over the bridge. Location, location, location!! 20 mins walk to Rialto. We absolutely loved our stay despite the really cold weather because our room was lovely & warm & welcoming after our big adventure days!!! Including going to Murano(recommeded to us by the friendly helpful reception staff) and Burano. We cannot wait to go back when its warmer. We checked out at noon but didn'y fly till at night so there was a facility for left luggage and the facilities were still on offer to us. Breakfast waitress very efficient and friendly. Love it all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have found a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WillandLilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed all of our expectations. We were hesitant about the location initally but once we arrived we found that it is the perfect location for those that want to walk around and actually explore the island and not just see Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. Francesca on the front desk offered us an upgrade to the suite which we fell in love with once we saw it. I recommend it as it really is a beautiful room deocorated in a style that suits the area. It is a very short walk from the main hotel but a beautiful room with a nice living area and kitchen. Teh staff were always exceptionally friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good quality. Linda was very helpful and makes a good coffee ! The day trip that they organise to Mazzuccato glass factory on Murano is well worth it and Roberto was very helpful in helping us select our pieces. I am usually very picky with hotels because we stayed in some shockers but I honestly cant wait to go back to Venice and when I do I will be staying there again. Full credit to the hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Convenient Location.”
Reviews.Author: kikamei
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Hotel Antiche Figure based on the previous reviews it received on this site and its convenient location to Piazzale Roma and Santa Lucia Train Station. After our one week stay, we were not disappointed with our choice. Not only is the hotel in a good location, the quality of service far exceeded our expectations. The staff are very accommodating and make it a point to ensure that your stay is as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. When we first arrived, the staff provided us with a map of Venice and gave us some helpful tips on the area and attractions. My husband even forgot his key for his luggage lock and they helped us pry it open. They also set up free tours to Murano. Other than that, the hotel rooms are very clean and spacious, the bathrooms are modern, and the breakfast buffet is delicious and filling. The only downside is that the room walls are quite thin, so you will need ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Overall, Hotel Antiche Figure is a great hotel and I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a Venetian Getaway! Very Convenient and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Salty74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Venice in mid-September 2010 during a 16 day European trip that included stops in Rome, Munich and Paris. We used Marriott points at most of our locations but chose to stay in a authentic style hotel during our one night stay in Venice. We chose Hotel Antiche Figure based off of reviews on Trip Advisor and were not dissappointed...our stay was excellent. Location: For the purpose of our trip the location of the hotel was excellent. The hotel overlooks the Grand Canal and is a five minute walk from the Santa Lucia train station on what would be the north end of the "island." We were only staying for one night but spent most of two full days in Venice. We caught an overnight train to Munich so the location near the train station was extremely convenient. We quickly got from the station and through check in so that we could begin enjoying the wonderul sights and experiences that were waiting for us. After check in we lazily walked from the hotel to St. Marks square which was an excellent experience shopping, eating, sight seeing and getting lost which was an adventure. Check In/Service: The staff greeted us with smiles and quickly got through all the paperwork. After making some suggestions on some sights to see and a few "tour" options the hostess escorted us to our room which was unexpected and an excellent touch. We were offered a room upgrade but did not accept since we were only there for one night. The staff working at the bar was excellent, made some great local drinks and provided some light snacks. Upon checkout the hotel staff graciously offered to look after our suit cases since our train was not leaving until late. Room: Our room was labeled a "Superior Red Room" with a queen sized bed. The room had all the necessary essentials and some nice touches with the fabric walls etc. The room was very clean. The bathroom had very nice features, marble tiling, etc. I will say that the shower stall was pretty small but has made for some nice conversation pieces about our trip. The AC worked well which was nice as it was unseasonably hot/humid outside. For my taste the bed was slightly hard but didn't matter much b/c we were pretty tired by the end of our sightseeing adventure. Our room was on the 2nd floor and did not overlook the canal but was very quiet. Breakfast: The breakfast was very good and consisted of Italian meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, juices and coffee. Everything tasted fresh and was very traditional. Cost: I beleive we paid somewhere in the ball park of $200. While researching other hotels this was a pretty good value and we were very happy with the cost for the service and experience we received. Overall we had an excellent experience and would definitely stay here again. We did not feel that we lost any part of our Venetian experience by staying on the outskirts of the city and it fit perfectly into our travel plans. The staff was amazing and definitely helped make the experience top notch. Being a traveller who generally will pay for a nice hotel when travelling and I can't imagine having a better experience anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service and nice experience”
Reviews.Author: anindyachakraborty
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Venice and my parents are with me so i want a nice hotel . i booked a three bedroom and when they saw us , they instantly offered a canal view suite , they even reduced the daily rate. Awesome staff , they are very helpful and they are accommodative. we checked out a little late and they allowed that. its one of the nice experience i had with any hotel . People should consider this hotel even if they have to pay a bit more. Actually they deserve the TripAdvisor award.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Introduction to Venice”
Reviews.Author: roncrundl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and the hotel was recommended by a friend. Location was excellent, as was the room overlooking the Grand Canal. Staff could not possibly have been any more helpful. They offered assistance to every request and helped make our stay so very enjoyable. This hotel is a "must stay" for us.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay, not sure why so highly rated”
Reviews.Author: maryvale
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel through Hotwire and got a decent priced and were excited about all the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor -- but I'm not sure the No. 4 rating is really accurate. What the hotel does well: Service: The front desk staff are very helpful -- one even borrowed a computer cord we were missing from a friend of his. We got a few very good restaurant recommendations, and they were always willing to call to check if places were open or make reservations for us. Breakfast: A huge spread every morning, with delicious cappucinos and fresh pastries, as well as cold cuts, hardboiled eggs, and cereal. What the hotel does not do well: Rooms: We had one in the main building, and all the sounds carried, including hearing someone throwing up next door one night (ew). Bring earplugs. The rooms are clean but a bit worn and small, and the bed we had had broken springs throughout. The bathrooms are nice. Internet: There is only wi-fi in the lobby, and the rooms are ethernet LAN lines. Just be aware of this -- we weren't. Take it or leave it: Location: The location is arguably good because it's right by the train station, but it's also pretty far from St. Mark's and a bit of a hike to some of the better restaurants. So this is a plus or minus, depending on how you see it. Amenities: The laundry service the hotel offers is absurdly expensive -- 10 euro to clean a woman's shirt, 3 euro to clean a pair of socks. But the staff directed us to a laundromat just around the corner, and I recommend it -- much cheaper, and only takes an hour. Overall, it seems to have pretty good value, but you might be able to get nicer digs for not much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Small flaws don't detract from an excellent overall experience”
Reviews.Author: oxfordgary
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the highlight of this hotel is the very friendly and helpful service. After our three night stay we headed to Verona by train before returning to Venice for a few hours before our flight home. The hotel management were happy for us to return and leave our bags for a few hours on our return to Venice, despite that we had checked out a day earlier. Our room overlooking the Grand Canal was comfortable and well-equipped. Our one complaint - a shower curtain that had seen better days - was rectified the morning after we mentioned it. If your idea of a room overlooking the Grand Canal conjures up visions of ancient palazzi, remember that the hotel is directly opposite the modern railway station: whilst the reality doesn't quite live up to the romantic vision, it is still fascinating to observe the comings and goings on the water. The location is perfect for travellers, perhaps less so for families who may wish to be closer to the Rialto or beyond, especially given the expense of the water buses (E6.50 one way, E16 for 12 hours). Breakfast is fine (excellent coffee from the waitresses, undrinkable from the machine), bar prices very Venetian (E15 for a G&T and an orange juice). Overall, though, we would definitely recommend and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good room, beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: INNALOO
Reviews.Content: Arrived quite late from Florence, the hotel also have a few service apartment at the side lane next to the hotel. Given a room with a 1 bedroom suite. The room was comfy with microwave oven and hotplate. Free ADSL internet. Breakfast was served in the hotel's restaurant. Superb spread of breakfast with both hot and cold dish. The location is superb like most writer said.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Umheracane
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Venice, and not only was the staff -francheska & Michael excellent (gave us directions everywhere & with suggestions to restaurants). the hotel is extremely close to both the train station and bus station. don't get discouraged about having to roll ur luggage over 2 small bridges - it's typical in Venice-- and the hotel & service well worth it. I enjoyed my stay soo much I am planning my next visit this upcoming new year and def staying at hotel antiche. thank u francheska & michael for ur service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: stlimkh
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week long trip in Italy and spent one night in this hotel. The location made it very convenient in Venice, located directly across the river from the train station. And since we had one day in Venice only, able to drop the bag off and get going was great! The staff (knowing we had only a day), recommended a tour route for us to take to optimize our time and visit the most important sites/visits.. If I visit Venice again, I will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotell in a special city”
Reviews.Author: morbjorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week. Nice hotel, near railway and bus station and a central location in relation to the vaporetto. It is approx. 20 minutes walk to Marco's Square (if you do not get lost). We stayed in room 212 with their own (small) balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. Nice little hotel where the staff is uniquely concerned that guests will enjoy. Good breakfast served by a smiling lady who always offers a variety of coffee. Respsjonistene stood ready to serve you with good personal advice on everything from restaurants to tours of the city and the lagoon. Upon arrival we were given cable internet connection in the room, there is wireless network in the reception area. We had a great time. Some tips: Avoid restaurants right in the tourist trail (between the railway station / bus station to the Rialto and on to St. Mark), try for example the area near the ghetto or the area south of the road between the bus station and the Accademia. Better prices, better food and nicer staff. We bought a transport card for the entire period and had the great pleasure of this, both for sightseeing and transportation. The card also covers tours of the lagoon, a visit to San Michelle (cemetery) and the island of Burano is especially recommended. Museum card was hardly used, only in the Doge's Palace, except that there was little interesting to use it for. There is no need to buy toilet card, there is always a pleasant bar serving coffee, wine or some food. All these places have toilets.

Reviews.Title: “Arrive by train? Drop your bags in 5 mintues and experience Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Alanfb
Reviews.Content: Across the Canal from the train station... 3 - 5 minute walk. But the location isn't even the best part! Get a Canal view room for little extra. Spacious rooms. VERY competent staff and great breakfast make this hotel perfect. Free wifi also. Although we spend little time in our hotel, we were always welcomed back by name and everyone seemed genuinely interested in seeing that we had a wonderful time while back in Venice! Highly recommending this one!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-cruise hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetogo999
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The location was perfect. We took the bus from the Airport and it was just over 2 bridges to the hotel. The hotel staff was great - always willing to help with directions and advice. They even arranged a water taxi for those of us going to the Ruby Princess which was very easy and convenient. Our room was directly on the canal - do book a canal view room, it is worth it! The room was large and beautifully decorated - the last time I stayed in Venice, my room was much smaller. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo!”
Reviews.Author: PaulRehob
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in Venice, Italy for 4 days as part of a longer cruise/trip and stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure - suite with balcony overlooking the Grand Canal - it was truly belissimo! Room was spacious, beautifully decorated, and with bidet. The staff & service were excellent and very helpful with recommendations on dining etc. Also, European breakfast served daily. Conveniently located to bridge crossings/ferries/ gondolas etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MMT67
Reviews.Content: We took the advice of other travellers and booked this hotel from Trip Advisor. We have received the best service and value for money in Venice which is normally very expensive. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice at any time of the year. Special mention to Carlos on reception who has provided invaluable assistance during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience”
Reviews.Author: janefromtexas
Reviews.Content: Once again, Antiche Figure was an excellent choice for a pre-cruise stay. This time we took the bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma where we paid 10euros to store our 2 large suitcases overnight. We were then able to easily manage our carry-ons over the 2 small bridges from PR to the hotel. The following day we reversed the process to PR and used a land taxi to the pier. We had an excellent recommendation from the hotel for a wineshop frequented by locals, located behind the hotel. We enjoyed our evening meal at a restaurant, also recommended by the hotel, in the same vicinity. The service and facilities were all terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: ManxMaid
Reviews.Content: We booked the Antiche Figure on the strength of previous reviews and were not disappointed. All the staff are really friendly, helpful and efficient and this is a great hotel in, what was for us, an excellent location - very easy to find from P. Roma (and the station). It is about a 30-40 minute walk from San Marco, and we enjoyed the challenge of finding different routes there and back. Just follow the yellow San Marco or P. Roma signs (you will see them everywhere) and you will eventually get to where you want to go. The hotel looks at though it has recently been refurbished to a high standard and our first floor room was very comfortable, quiet and spotlessly clean. Internet access in our room was free. We were offered the option of upgrading to one of the hotel's separate apartments - which was very new and modern, but we felt that our original room suited us fine. The apartments would be handy for anyone with a family or for a party travelling together. Breakfast was very good and plentiful with the usual continental choices. On a particularly wet morning the hotel arranged a private boat taxi from right outside the hotel to a Murano Glass Gallery and although we didn't buy anything we were brought back to the Venice Vaporetto stop for Murono and Burano. On our second evening, we dined at Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo which is an easy five minute walk from the hotel and had a great steak - not particularly Venetian I know, but they also did a great range of home made Pizzas and pasta dishes. All in all we had a wonderful time and thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay and would return to the Antiche if we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: snugsta
Reviews.Content: location could not be better - very easy to find from the train station, people mover or parking garages (and doesn't require taking a water taxi), yet in a quiet neighborhood with a local feel that feels removed from the tourist trade. easy walk to rialto (approx. 20 min), walk to san marco was a bit longer (approx 45 min), but couldn't be a nicer walk. staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. rooms were good and bathrooms were modern.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough!”
Reviews.Author: rula1960
Reviews.Content: Everything is true. My husband and I had a rental car. We returned it and had a short walk over 2 small bridges and we were there. The staff was wonderful. The gentleman at the front desk must have spent 15-20 min going over the map with us and advising us of what to see. He was fantastic. I suppose the only thing which could pose a problem for some guest would be our room. Although beautiful and clean it was up 2 1/2 flights of stairs. We didn't mind and we were helped with our bags, but I'm sure if it were a problem they would have accomodated us. They were sooooo helpful. They recommended a little restaurant around the corner and the meal was delicious. Had a wonderful time and can't wait to do it all again without changing a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pia_traveler519
Reviews.Content: As others have said this hotel is in a great location for arriving with baggage right across the Grand Canal from the train station. The staff are very friendly and will make recommendations for dinner, nightlife, etc. They were helpful in explaining how to go about getting a gondola ride. The breakfast is good though mostly cold items, breads, fruit, cold meat. And they offer cappuccinos from the bar as well. Our room was small but very nice and clean with a partial view of the grand canal from the window. We took the free transportation to the Murano glass factory but would not recommend it. It was basically a ruse by the glass factory people (more like a Murano art gallery) to get you to think you are getting a tour of an actual Murano glass factory. When in reality they show you some guys working with glass for a few minutes and then make you go through several glass galleries trying to sell you stuff. It was pretty much a waste of time for us as everything would be way out our price range anyway. Then when you don't buy anything they are a bit rude and you are on your own to get back to the main Venice island. That wasn't a big deal for us because we bought the 3-day public water-bus passes (highly recommended!) which include access to all the islands. We exited the gallery property through a back gate someone there was nice enough to show us and then walked around the island of Murano and had lunch there before going to Burano. We would highly recommend going to the island of Burano though using the public water buses. Again, get the multi-day water-bus passes, they're well worth it. Even for just riding up and down the Grand Canal looking at the beautiful city. We would stay here again when we return to Venice mainly for the location, friendly staff, and room cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattiecattie154976
Reviews.Content: Five friends and myself stayed at the Antiche Figure in Venice Italy. This was a wonderful hotel for many reasons. First and foremost, all the staff were so friendly and helpful. An extra bed was placed in our room without hesitation as the sleeping accomodations needed to be changed ( our request not a mistake of the hotels). The desk staff were impeccably dressed , gracious and helpful, always willing to assist with any of our questions or needs. The hotel was very clean and well kept. The breakfasts were lovely and the waitresses were also so friendly and kind. I would recommend this hotel to anyone !! I would definitely go back there on my next visit. Bravo -- Well done Antiche Figure !!! Bonnie Beed

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks”
Reviews.Author: spongeass
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Easy to get to from either bus station or Train Station. Water bus stop opposite. Staff very helpful and friendly. Good free wi fi access in hotel. Breakfasts very good and typical with the usual nice selection of cakes if you are into that. Good selection of restaurants nearby. Our best find after 5 days was the ' Brek' self service restaurant a short walk over the bridge opposite the hotel. You select the meal / drinks you want from the counter and pay at the till. Even does small carafe of wine ( 2 glasses) for 1.75 euro. Great prices for Venice if, like us, you get fed up of paying for over priced meals with table cover charges, service charges and over priced drinks on top. Vaporetta 2-3 day tickets are worth getting to see all the nearby islands and all the canal network. High tides in Venice can cause problems for getting about on foot especially around the popular St Marks square which was flooded when we visited and raised walkways are used to gain access to the flooded areas. This however is only temporary. We also caught a train to Verona 80 mins away and spent the day there. Return Tickets cost 36 euro each. But plenty to see and an impressive Roman amphitheatre and of course the Romeo & Julliet house. Cheaper to buy the daily Verona City leisure pass when you get there, gets you into most of the major attractions and includes free bus travel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic reccomend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: swansea68
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect if arriving by bus or train, easy to find a great starting point. Staff very willing to help and advise. Breakfast what you woud expect from continental but plenty of choice and always plenty there.Numerous restaurants nearby, waterbus stops nearby, all the sites walkable. staff will give you directions to the sites but they are all easy to find. We were there for 4 nights and couldn't fault it. Stewart & Heather Swansea, UK

Reviews.Title: “Home sweet home, as good as it gets to being in your own home.....”
Reviews.Author: tewmom
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I was traveling with my daughter and her boyfriend. Upon our arrival we were greeted by the nicest woman who spoke fluent English. We were offered an upgrade to a suite which I was happy to take. The suite was awesome, large master bedroom with a beautiful large bathroom. The shower had an oversized head and then six additional heads on the wall, my daughter said it was like being in a car wash, lol. The staff was so friendly and helpful really made us feel at home. I found this hotel based on comments here on trip advisor and just want to second everything you read about this hotel. The location is PERFECT, close to the train station so not a problem dragging your luggage to the hotel. The woman at the front desk mapped out all the directions to the most visited sites. Highly recommend, 10 stars, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again"”
Reviews.Author: youaremycat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located right across from the train station, but that is only good for the day you arrive and the day you leave. Otherwise this area is not the most desirable. San Marco is on the other side of the city, which even though is not big, it's big enough to make getting there annoying. It's an hour walk down the main street, or a half hour if you take some short cuts. It's very touristy over there but there are lots of hotels throughout the city that I would have preferred. Our room was nice and there were some very nice people who worked there but ultimately we were sent to a restaurant that I'm sure they had some sort of deal with. The restaurant ignored us for about 20 minutes and we ended up leaving. When we told the man at the desk that we left he was visibly angry and didn't speak to us the rest of our stay. It was very strange. Ultimately the hotel is not bad at all but it's just in the worst area of an incredible city. I would opt for something in between this and San Marco - which is over-run by tourists and a bit overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely break for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: TwinmaAF
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at one of the apartments, belonging to the hotel, for four nights, at the end of October. It was spotlessly clean, and very comfortable. It had a v.small kitchenette, behind two glass doors, so you could do a bit of self catering, if you wanted. We didn't. The staff were very pleasant, and very helpful. They also arranged a complimentary trip to Murano, via water taxi, for us. If I'd one criticism, it would be the lack of clothes storage space - one wardrobe, and NO drawers. Other than that, it was really really enjoyable, and we'd go back, anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, excellent by all means”
Reviews.Author: edocawy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel by all means. Located just across the train station in a very lively area with many shops and restaurants near by. The public transportaion is very close, they also offer a free ride to Murano Island. The staff are great very helpful especially the guy with long hair at night shift

Reviews.Title: “...”
Reviews.Author: travel_addict_92
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel! in the past two years they have expanded and now have more staff helping. everyone went out of their way to accomodate guests at the hotel! The staff there are very knowledgable and willing to give excellant advice to us!! The rooms were decent size, venetian style (in my opinion i find venetian style gaudy..... lol but most people wont!) Its right accros from the train station. there are also plenty of restaurants in the area too. only bad thing is it isnt close to st marks square or many toher attractions, however half the fun is finding all these places! you cant say you've been to venice and havent gotten lost!! would deffinitely be back to the hotel and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable, nice hotel (but not quite perfect)”
Reviews.Author: tobyis
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in one room in the main building which was a good-average room (smallish, but quiet), and in another room in the new annex (separate building) which was new and very nice! It was much bigger (although slightly noisier) and had a nice romantic double bed! Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, but be CAREFUL if following their recommendations - we went to two restaurants and an opera recital they highly recommended, and all three turned out to be rather deceiving and disappointing! Breakfasts were very nice. Location is average. It's rather close to the train station and bus terminal (helpful if travelling by train or bus), but not noisy, although it's quite far from Piazza San Marco (a long walk). Liked: New room in new annex. Good breakfasts. Staff were very friendly. Disliked: Location (a bit far from P. San Marco), deceiving and disappointing recommendations from hotel staff. Like many hotels, some rooms have two single beds pushed together as doubles.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay - we strongly recomend Antiche Figure Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jean_luc_s
Reviews.Content: Very nice location if you arrive by train or car: you arrive quickly to the hotel and youÂ´re ready to explore Venice quicker than almost any other further location. Wonderful room (411 with a very nice view of the grand canal). ItÂ´s a large blue room, designed and furnished in old venice style, marble bathroom, big comfy bed, soudproof windows, safe, desk, chairs, small table and a mini-bar. Very clean and very venice. The best room of our trip. Very nice people at the reception, to show the room and at the breakfast room providing with good information, good tips and explained everything on maps they provided. I must say that the level of service has improved a lot in the last 20 years. People in venice are now really friendly. The only improvement that could be made is offering more salty options for breakfast. The buffet is more (as almost always in Italy) on the seet side. WeÂ´ll be back next time if we can have the same 411 room on top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay again?”
Reviews.Author: GWTE
Reviews.Content: The answer is definitely. Stayed for five nights at the end of October in the annex just around the corner from the hotel and the room was really nice and had a four poster bed. It's right on the Grand Canal opposite the railway station and a great location to begin a vaporreto ride down the canal. Found the staff to be very friandly and helpful. My wife was bitten by mosquitoes whilst we were there resulting in two bad eye infections. The hotel arranged for her to see a doctor at the local pharmacy and when we went there she was treated and we were not charged. The hotel also ensured that the room had mosqutio killers in them so that we did not have any further problems. Overall a very good hotel in a beautiful city and we would both love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming and excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: NorcalTami
Reviews.Content: Actually we stayed here in March 2009 but never got a review up. We had an excellent stay for 3 nights in Venice at this beautiful hotel. We were offered an upgrade to the new wing suites for a very small fee and took it! It was huge and luxurious. The bathroom had some superb finishes and it had a separate sitting area with a bar area which had hot water with coffee/tea, sink, fridge, stovetop and dishes. The breakfast was superb and make sure you take advanage of the free cappucinos! Don't use that machine ask the waitress. The concierge was wonderful and definitely ask him where to eat....don't eat at the tourist traps along the canal they aren't very good. He also set us up for a free trip to see Murano glass factory and other siteseeing tips. They are very conveniently located just over the big bridge across from the train station. When you get off the bridge turn right not left or you will be wandering around like we were! They had a computer in the lobby where you could check your emails that was nice since I hadn't seen my computer in 2 weeks so I got caught up. We also enjoyed having a couple drinks in front of the hotel at the little tables in front of the canal and people watched! Fun! If you get a suite you get a fridge so there is a coop on the other side of the train station you can get fruit and veggies there. We didn't have a whole lot of these our entire trip so that was a treat. They weren't very patient there so just be sure to try to have change and small bills!!! You also need to weigh your fruit/veggies before you get to the register. Great stay...loved it....want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: YatesandVines
Reviews.Content: Oct.2010 We have just returned from the Hotel Antiche Figure which was excellent in every way. The location was perfect too for arrival by bus from the airport and for getting around the many amazing sights of Venice. The staff on Reception were so good, giving us helpful advice on local restaurants and special places to visit. The rooms were beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean . At the end of our four day visit we were sad to leave. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again !”
Reviews.Author: travellocks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently established and was very well appointed. The employees is what makes this hotel completely exceptional. They were moderately hot, knowing and an unconditional great pleasure and I gaze ahead to residing at this hotel again. I not ever hassle to compose these things but this Hotel is a genuine find

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward to Going Back”
Reviews.Author: BlueSwan99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights before our cruise trip. Last year we only spent one night so last summer year we planned this trip in order to visit Venice again and stay this particular hotel for a longer time. Surprisedly, Francesca who works in the front desk still remembers us; and she has a lot of energies and caring heart to help everyone. Then Carlo tried very hard to make the arrangement of our transportation for the cruise terminal. We had the room with Canal view on the top floor; we like to keep windows open during days and nights to hear the pleasant noise, music and activity from street and Grand Canal. And my husband enjoyed sitting in the front of the hotel drinking cappuccino or wine to experience the life in Venice; at same time, I was curiously wandering around the shops and landmarks. Anyway, for sure we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SusieFromMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September and enjoyed it immensely. The room itself was average and the bed was not the most comfortable. However, the location, the view and the staff made up for it. The staff was more than helpful in identifying locations for dinner, providing directions and answering any and all questions. I usually don't pay for a view as we spend so little time in the room but to see all the action on the Grand Canal and fall asleep with the window open listening to the water was incredible. Also, it was so nice to be able to just jump on the vaporetto right across from the hotel which allowed us to come and go more than we usually would on vacation. Being right across from the train station was also great as we were able to just pop in and buy our train tickets in advance and not have to deal with buying them when we had all our luggage with us. This was a great hotel and I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: larmaro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to find and convenient right across from the train station. The only problem is you have to take your luggage across a large bridge to get to the other side. The staff were very helpful and the hotel has been redone beautifully and still has kept the old venetian character. We would definetly stay there again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel overlooking Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Campbell
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in we were offered a choice of rooms and chose to stay in a corner bedroom on the top floor overlooking the Grand Canal which was awesome. The room was spacious clean and tidy with coffee/tea making facilities. The staff were extremely helpful and upon arrival gave us a map with ideas of places to visits and the best routes to take to the various sites. An excellent buffet breakfast was included. The hotel is situated opposite the Railway station with just one bridge to walk across with our luggage which was ideal. Would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great spot on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: ncman21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated on the Grand Canal, across from the train station, near the bus terminal, and across from a large water taxi stop. The staff was very helpful and our room, overlooking the Canal, was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: jcbBoston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay in Italy where we traveled with friends to Venice for a three-day stay. No time wasted trying to find the hotel suitcases in tow. As Trip Advisor had noted, it was right across the Grand Canal when we arrived by train and only a few steps from the Piazza di Roma, the main vaparetto stop. The staff could not have been more helpful with dinner suggestions and reservations, wonderful walking suggestions; they even provided cappuccino and croissants one morning when we missed breakfast. Both rooms were quiet, comfortable and replete with Venetian glass chandeliers. A complimentary trip by water taxi to Murano was included. Their tiny bar provided an essential coffee or evening aperitif when needed. Special thanks to Carlo who gave us great advice. In spite of the crowds of tourists in Venice, the Antiche Figure felt like home. Mille grazie

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sunnski
Reviews.Content: Right across the canal from the train station and on the grand canal. But not too noisy. Great service by the staff. They answered all our questoins. Gave excellent restaurant suggestions. Nice bar service at night. Good drinks, resonable prices. Rooms-small but that is to be expected in Venice. The rooms were clean, well apointed and everything worked. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, particularly for pre-cruise stays”
Reviews.Author: dmc63
Reviews.Content: We chose the Antiche Figure because of its proximity to the Piazzale Roma, which is where we would eventually be catching a shuttle to the cruise terminal, but it turned out to be a great location for accessing everything we wanted to see and do in Venice. Our room was small and slightly worn but the bathroom was spacious and nicely decorated. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, if somewhat pedestrian, and could have benefited from the inclusion of more fresh fruit. The made-to-order espresso drinks were a nice touch. The service was mostly fabulous, with a few minor exceptions. On our first night at around 9 pm, I asked the woman at the front desk where I could purchase bottled water, but she explained that all stores were closed at that hour. Fortunately, another guest overheard us and pointed me in the direction of a still-open gourmet/convenience store less than three minutes away. And while the staff that checked us in was warm and welcoming, the gentleman that checked us out was competent but less than friendly. Given its convenient location, service and amenities, the Antiche Figure is very reasonably priced compared to other Venice hotels. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: crewsin76
Reviews.Content: Located across the canal from the train station. The hotel is very accessible and located so that many of the sights in Venice are walking distance. There is a gondola station just outside the door. . the beds are comfortable and the showers are good. We all had a very pleasant 3 night stay. We were able to sit outside and drink the wine we'd purchased on our winery visit. The staff was very friendly, helpful and took great care and pride in their jobs. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcathy
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Antiche Figure. We picked it because it was really close to the train station, so we didn't have to carry our luggage too far. It's also close to the train station. It's a hike by foot to St. Mark's, but that can be a real plus as well. The room was great with a view of the Grand Canal, but the most impressive thing was the staff was EXTREMELY helpful and knowledeable about Venice and spoke great English, which considering my poor Italian was a real big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Rome, Florence, Venice, & Paris; the best hotel of the trip.”
Reviews.Author: norpatk
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations greatly. First the location is perfect, walking(which you do a lot of in Venice), boat riding or just plain beautiful view( overlooking the Grand Canal. Our room was perfect ( a Junior Suite with a small balcony). Breakfast worked for us( mostly cold meats and cereals, breads and great coffee). Finally the staff was beyond great, from the moment we walked in the door, Micheal at the front desk treat us like royalty. We stayed three nights and it just got better. The connection to internet was flawlesss. The resturaunt recommendation "Ca Leon" right up the street and around the corner was so good we went twice. When we arrived we walked from the train station over a bridge and into the hotel right down the street. When we left we walked right down the street to the bus station to the express bus to the airport. how easy is that. All in all a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again if lucky enough to visit Venice again!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGs
Reviews.Content: First great thing is that it is easy to find, you walk out of the train station and you can see it the other side of the canal. A short walk to a bridge cross the canal and walk back to Hotel and you are ready to check in. During our stay we saw so many people lugging suitcases up and down stairs and all around the tiny walkways, getting lost and looking hot and bothered. yet the Hotel is very quiet, we heard no noise at night and slept very well. Carlos was on duty when we arrived and he was brilliant, he spoke very good English and took pride in ensuring you had a good stay. He recommended restaurants he thought would suit you and always followed up to check it was a good choice. He booked all our restaurants for us and drew us maps of how to get there and back and also booked an unforgettable evening at the 'Musica a Palazzo' - a must if you have any musical appreciation. Each scene is held in a different room in a very old building lit by candlelight and accompanied by a quartet. We saw La Traviata, I will never forget it. All in all a wonderful experience, thank you to Carlos and all the staff from the cleaner to the manager who were so friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Service was exceptional!!”
Reviews.Author: PDXtraveler99
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel based on all the great reviews on TA and was not disappointed. It's location is beyond convenient for a city where you will be walking a lot. Everything said below in reviews is spot on. Staff and service was some of the best I have received in Europe especially for the price. We were offered up grade to one of the new suites that is not in the main building but just down the ally way. It was very comfortable and big(!!) and very quiet. I will be recommending this to all my friends. Opera Lovers, http://www.musicapalazzo.com We saw La Traviata and It was amazing seeing it at this location. The Hotel can book for you

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandra_and_Scott
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September in a blue room with a view of the start of the Grand Canal out of a side window and across from the train station on the fourth floor. We were in a nice qauint and comfortable room. Although across from the train station with the windows closed there was little noise and we had no trouble sleeping. All the employees were very kind to us with a special thanks to Micheal(spelling?) who was extremely helpful to us in providing maps and suggested itineraries and suggesting nice restaurants. This location made finding the hotel easy with only two shorter bridges to drag the luggage over. Being right on the Grand Canal was a special treat. Everything is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but it's the Staff that make it special”
Reviews.Author: LucyRichmond
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the deluxe rooms overlooking the canal and higher up in case of noise. Both requests were fulfilled. The room and bathroom were excellent, tastefully decorated and with quality furnishings. Tea/Coffee making facilities in the room.The location is just across the Grand Canal from the station so we had no problem getting to it. Also it is at the beginning of Route 1 on the water bus so you can grab a front row seat as you make your way to St Mark's Square. We bought a three day pass the cost of which we had recovered by the middle of the second day. Breakfast was the usual spread though it wasn't until the third day that we finally worked out exactly what to ask for in order to get strong Italian coffee with a hot milk (Cappucino with double expresso and no Cocoa). The main Breakfast room can get a bit crowded so we ate either in the Bar area or outside where additional tables were laid. However, what really stood out for me during my stay was how friendly and helpful the (English speaking) staff were. Nothing was too much trouble with lots of useful advice as to how to make the most of our stay. I had a problem with my Computer lead which was sorted quickly thanks to a type of adapter I haven't seen before! I can highly recommend a nearby restaurant - 'La Rosa Dei Venti' - frequented by as many locals as Tourists though be warned...the Fish Soup is amazingly good but it's a main course, not an Appetizer as shown on the Menu... We would definitely stay here again on a return visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “YOU MUST STAY HERE IN VENICE”
Reviews.Author: CarlBunting
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must if you are staying in Venice. It is a lovely little hotel on the banks of the Grand Canal within easy walking distance to the bus /waterbus stops for getting to/from the airport. the hotel is very clean and inexpensive by Venetian standards, but the main reason to stay are the staff. They are the most helpful, friendly staff of any hotel I have stayed in (only Cheeca Lodge in the Florida Keys comes close). Nothing is too much trouble and they are always on hand to give advice regarding your stay, whether recommending places to visit, restaraunts or general advice on how to get around the city. The service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, elegant, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Tarzan_Jane029
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was right before a cruise departure. The hotel is very close to the Piazzale Roma and across from the Santa Lucia train station, and of course the water taxis & Vaporettos. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfeast very nice and included in the hotel stay. I would recommend staying at this hotle either before a cruise or for a longer stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yuletidexxx
Reviews.Content: As everyone else has already said - the location is perfect, especially if you are the type who actually enjoys walking and exploring rather than just "being at the doorstep" of the touristy spots. Even if you'd rather not walk everywhere, the waterbus stop is literally across from the hotel. I know Rick Steves and other travel guides often advise not staying near the train station, but this is one very notable exception. No noise, no shady characters, and a beautiful area. We were so happy with the service here. When we arrived, we found out from the manager at the desk that our credit card company had put a block on our card (because I had forgotten to inform them I'd be overseas). Although they were under no obligation to hold the room for us, they thankfully did and were very accommodating about the entire process. They even went out of their way to call ahead to our next hotel in Lucca to inform them of our situation (and to make sure they held our room there) while we sorted things out with our credit card company. I can't tell you how nice it was to have that kind of assistance and support at the desk. They were always very accommodating and eager to make sure we were satisfied with our stay there. A++++ Overall, I highly recommend this hotel if you are planning a stay in Venice. A real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A+ All the way, thank you all.”
Reviews.Author: dyefamilyDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (self, wife & young son (7) late august for 3 days, ABSOLUTLY no complaints at all. Well 1 little 1 mentioned later ï�Š the staff were the best I have ever encounted in both my leisure and business travels across Europe. Location is A1 from bus, water boat and train station (6oo mts) each and we would definitely contact them 1st when we return to this beautiful city, which we will. The daily staff, Francesca and the other girls made us so welcome from the moment we set foot in the door. Nothing was too much trouble and they always found the time and provide great local information when we asked. Breakfast was much better than we expected given other reviews and was quite ample for our needs. The hotel, including all public areas and room where clean, tidy and a pleasure to spend the odd bits of time in that we managed while exploring this wonderful city. We will return to Venice and to this hotel again and hopefully they will have learnt how to make a hot cappuccino. Thank you all including Alexandro (manager) who handled our booking but we never actually met or needed due to the service mentioned above. See you in 2011 Chris, Marie and â€œbigâ€� Jack

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: maxfelger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in July 2007 and again for three days in August 2010. It was great both times. The first time we stayed in a room down the lane in a building that is separate from the main hotel, which was quiet and newly renovated. This time, we stayed in room 411 overlooking the Grande Canal. It was very special to be able to overlook the canal and all its activities, from the early morning (when Venice is just waking up and you see the delivery boats, gondoliers cleaning their gondolas, garbage pickup boats, boats delivering hotel laundry, construction boats on their way to work, etc. -- there's a boat for every purpose here!) until late at night. Both times, our rooms were beautiful and clean and both times the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The hotel also offers an excellent breakfast. Hotel Antiche Figure is close to the train station -- an easy walk, even with suitcases. It's in a great location for accessing everything and it's perfect for watching all of the action on the Grande Canal. The exceptional staff make sure everything you need is taken care of. Thank you to them all. (Also, the room overlooking the Canal was quiet, even though there's so much going on outside on the Canal.) We wouldn't choose stay anywhere else in Venice and can't wait for a third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Nicely Appointed Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JJD2
Reviews.Content: Antiche Figure is conveniently located right on the Grand Canal, directly across from Train Station, and is close to bus shuttles to the port, which is very convenient if you are beginning or ending a cruise in Venice. Check in was a breeze, as was check out. The room was nicely furnished with beautiful Murano glass and antiques, and a nice view of the Canal. The staff took care of our restaurant reservations well in advance of our stay, which helped us tremendously. The breakfast was standard fare, but was a convenient way to start the day. It was especially nice to grab a table outside to enjoy the canal and people-watching, while having breakfast or cocktails from the bar. It is usually very expensive to stay in Venice, but rates at Antiche Figure are fairly reasonable. A special â€˜thank youâ€™ goes out to Michele at the front desk. He did an exceptional job of welcoming us and helping us to get oriented in Venice. We would definitely stay at Hotel Antiche Figure again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: may74london
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at The Antiche Figure for 4 nights through expedia last year in August of 2009, but unfortunately we could not make it due to illness. The hotel was very sorry that we could not make it and because it was booked as a package through expedia, they could not offer us a refund, which is completely understandable. The hotel promised that if we were to come back in the future that they would take care of us, and that is exactly what they did when we booked with them for this August. From the moment we arrived Francesca remembered our reservation and no show from last year and welcomed us very warmly. She then offered us a few options in order to make up for our loss last year and very kindly Carlo showed us several rooms at the Antiche and at their sister hotel The Grand Canal (which is a four star , more expensive hotel). . We then chose to stay at their sister only because we loved the room so much and it was a free upgrade, but we went back and visited Francesca and Carlo because they were so nice. The Antiche Figure is a small hotel in an excellent location, you only need to cross 2 bridges if you are walking from the bus station. Hotel rooms in general are small in Venice, but the Antiche had good sized rooms, which are very clean and nicely decorated. It is a hotel run by wonderful people that will make your trip memorable. There is a reason that it is rated so highly amongst hundreds of hotels in Venice, book there and you will not be dissapointed, you will receive 5 star service!

Reviews.Title: “Location is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: chooknhally
Reviews.Content: As everyone has stated....located right across from the train station (saves you heaps on water taxi bill). Hotel is lovely as is the staff...service/breakfast/cleanliness all excellent. Nice to sit outside and enjoy a drink overlooking grand canal late in the afternoon. Much nicer to stay here than close to the busier and more expensive Marco area. Another handy hint is that there is a laundromat located just one block from hotel. Good suggestion from staff on where to eat......really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect way to start our trip”
Reviews.Author: johnlitch
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived this hotel experience was wonderful. We were offered one of the new suites at the same price as out triple room and were thrilled with the American style design and roominess. A true luxury bathroom complete with bidet, and a small kitchen area and living room made it a great place to flop after a busy day of sightseeing. The entire staff, especially Francesca at the front desk, were exceptionally helpful, multilingual, and truly caring about our comfort. The breakfast was continental and a fine way to start our days. The entire hotel is elegant and placed right on the grand canal across from the train station. While it is on the west end of town it was very easy to get on the number one waterbus across the canal for a ride to any of the other areas of Venice. Make sure to grab a cappuccino across the bridge, and to have dinner at the Ca Leone restaurant 5 minutes from the hotel. (The seafood lasagna was phenomenal).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: 39globetrotter
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in Santa Croce, the quieter/less touristy but equally beautiful area of Venice. As soon as we arrived the staff made us feel very welcome and were extremely helpful (providing maps, etc). The room was clean, comfy and still had character. Breakfast was limited (would have liked more fresh fruit) but the recommendations for evening meals were excellent. We really appreciated the brilliant service, escpecially as it was my dad's birthday, and would definitely recommmend :) loved the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: martimarti
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel not just because of previous reviews but also being opposite the station, we came from Como, and close to the Airport Bus Stop for getting to Marco Polo airport. On arrival, we were warmly greeted and offered an upfgrade to their 4star sister hotel - the Canal Grande - because we were staying 4 nights and not just the one. But we were shown our allocated room before being taken the five minute stroll to t he Grande. It was a "no brainer"; we accepted the upgrade and were in no way disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / Great location ...”
Reviews.Author: artnak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antiche Figure for 2 nights July 24 & 25 before a cruise. The location could not be better. A quick bus (ATVO - 3 euro each) from the airport to Piazzale Roma and a short walk with 2 small bridges to the hotel, very easy. We had 2 carry-ons and 2 large suit cases which fit easily in the luggage compartment of the bus. This hotel is right on the Grand Canal, but so much quieter than the areas near San Marco. Small pedestrian streets behind the hotel with good restaurants. We especially enjoyed restaurant Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo. We ate there both nights. Continental breakfast at the hotel was very good, as was the cappucino coffee. We ate both mornings outside overlooking the canal and people watching. This hotel is very clean and has a great staff who are willing to help you in any way. We found the price a very good value considering what rooms in Venice can cost. Our room was not large but more than sufficient for our needs. There is an elevator/lift which makes it a lot easier for bringing your luggage upstairs. Great location to get to the cruise port if you are taking a cruise. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Cavloacher
Reviews.Content: Superb interactive staff that created a welcoming family and helpful atmosphere,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lmg317
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at this hotel. We were stranded at 12pm at another hotel that was paid for and then cancelled by the travel agent, and no room for us! the lovely staff at Antiche Figure took us in with open arms!!! I am glad that we had this twist of fate! The hotel is beautiful, clean, and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and very welcome the next morning. The central location made it very easy for arriving in Venice from the airport and were able to see all the sights! We will be sure to stay there again when in Venice and can not say enough about the staff and the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful room, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: KarenJ22
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 2 teenaged boys. This was the last stop of a wonderful trip. The hotel is in a great location, easy to get to, we walked everywhere. Great breakfast with lots of choices. The weather was wonderful during our stay and we ate breakfast outside. Lovely room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Excellent rooms - Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Allikevang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four days. It is very well situated, only one bridge away and walking distance from the central station. The rooms were big, good beds, luxury bathrooms, everything very clean, very well functionning aircondition and good breakfast. The most outstanding was the very serviceminded and caring personell - knowledgeble and always prepared with good recommendations for restaurants, trips, leisure. Definitely an excellent choise if you haven't been to Venice before, or just want to be spoiled

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Kelhayes
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in the lovely Hotel Antiche Figure. (stayed here 2 years ago). The staff was wonderful. We met our teenage daughter in Venice and she arrived a day before us. The hotel did not have a room available on the night that she arrived and was kind enough to book her a room around the corner and walk her to the room. This is a very cosy and relaxing hotel. Breakfast was great!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely start to a cruise from Venice”
Reviews.Author: AnnieNorthernEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after reading the reviews and we were deiighted that we did, Three of us - husband and daughter aged 13 and myself destined for a cruise holiday but we wanted to show our daughter the sights of Venice before joining the cruise. We had only one night arriving about 8.00. We asked on arrival for an informal pizza type restaurant and the hotel rang immediately for a table at a local restaurant that they said was very good but very busy.- (it was excellent) Dinner and directions to the restaurant taken care of and we were shown to our room. This was in the residence, back from the Grand Canal down a side alley that they assured us was safe at all times. Access to the room is via a bell and camera which allows them to release the lock from the hotel so it felt very safe. We were delighted with our room, a sitting room with sofa bed made up for my daughter, our room very nicely decorated and the rooms and bathrooms immaculately clean. Small but very well appointed and comfortable - no complaints at all. The breakfast was good, the staff at breakfast very helpful and the staff stored our luggage, gave us good directions on boat routes etc. A very enjoyable stay, my only regret is that we did not have another evening. For anyone needing to be close to the port this is and excellent choice - two bridges to carry your luggage over but only small ones! we saw some poor people dragging cases a very long way to hotels more in the centre. This hotel is literally a 10 minute stroll from the bus terminal and very easy to find - a major consideration in a city that is so easy to get lost in. From the bus terminal buses are run by the cruise companies usually free for guests. The water taxi Â£90 is a terrible expense for a very short journey.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this is a must hotel to stay in, all the reviews are completely true”
Reviews.Author: Dreamchasers76
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in the perfect location. Our room overlooked the Grande Canal and was fabulously clean, very, very comfortable and cannot be faulted. The service from every single member of staff was exemplary, nothing was too much trouble and the recommendations for restaurants, bars, sights etc was spot on. Breakfast was continental and plenty of it, all the food was constantly refreshed and a variety of fresh coffee was served. All in all we could not fault this hotel and we are fussy, the bed was amazingly comfortable, access to the City was perfect, when we go back to Venice we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff at Hotel Antiche Figure is Perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: Will022
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at Hotel Canal Grande but when we arrived, Alessandro offered us a room at Antiche Figure which is the sister Hotel nearby. If your lucky enough for this to happen.....TAKE IT! We were given a beautiful canal view room right across from the train station. It was amazing! The staff was friendly and so helpful. Carlos is a "Rockstar"!!! It rained one night we were there, but it didn't matter because Carlos would sing and we could sit in the cafe area and drink wine and espresso and watch the boats go by. Everyone who worked the front desk was wonderful and thanks again Alessandro for making our trip to Venice unforgettable. William and Christine

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Gilbertohio
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Antiche Figure on Tripadvisor and trusted the opinions we read. They were all true. We had a great time. We got a room with a view to the canal. The staff is very friendly and helful. We enjoyed the nice breakfast and if you are coming or leaving Venice by train, you can't beat this Hotel's location. If I am ever back in Venice would stay at Antiche Figure again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveller08
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Antiche Figure around noon, and only had to wait for a couple of minutes before being taken to our suite. While waiting, we used the free internet provided at a computer by the front desk. The suite (number 514) was on the third floor in a little street right off the canal and very quiet. After climbing to the third floor, we were surprised to find that the suite was beautifully decorated and made you feel like you were somewhere in a castle. The suite was very large by European standards. The beds were very firm, like everywhere in Italy. The modern amenities - shower, coffee maker, air conditioning were top notch. We could control the temperature in the room, which was really important at the end of June, when the weather gets really hot. At the end of each day, we arrived to a clean suite, nice and cool, and little candies on the pillows. What a nice touch! We chose this hotel based on its super location, right across the bridge from the train station. The only difficulty was in getting our luggage across the bridge with many steps, but that is something you face everywhere in Venice. At least we did not have to look for a water taxi to transport our luggage. It was that close! Getting around was easy - on foot mostly, and the water but was really close. Just a half a block away is a laundromat, which is really convenient if you want to pack light. The breakfast, which was included in our room rate, was very nice. There were different pastries, some cheese, cold cuts, boiled eggs, fruit, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. The breakfast attendant was very pleasant, making sure your needs are taken care of. The best part of staying at Antiche Figure is definitely its staff. Everybody at the hotel is friendly and eager to assist the guest to the absolutely best of their ability. The hotel manager, Alessandro, was amazing. He met us with a smile every morning, and after breakfast mapped out our day's itinerary. He is the best guide we had during our trip to Italy. He knows and loves Venice, and as a true Venitian, guides you to the best restaurants, the nicest islands, the quaintest picture spots and the best shops. One day, we'll come back - and definitely stay at Antiche Figure again.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this is the one you want!”
Reviews.Author: Charleston_SCSukey
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel with a great location and most accommodating staff! They truly made our stay very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly convenient location with exceptional staff!”
Reviews.Author: Vivaldis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always look for good value "boutique" hotels when we travel, realizing we are going to spend little time in the room, but still not wanting the chain hotel feel. In Venice, that is not difficult to do and we had several choices. We selected the hotel Antiche Figure for convenience, based on its location right across from the train station. We were given a well-appointed corner room overlooking the grand canal (see photos). The room had everything we needed. Venice was only our second stop in Italy, so although we didn't realize it at first, this turned out to be a reasonably sized room by European standards. My original concern that it would be noisy due to its location did not materialize. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The continental breakfast was definitely better than average, with a good selection of the usual pastries, apreads, cold cuts, cappucinos, etc. all of high quality and with attentive service. Although it is not located close to most of the Venice sights, we did not find that to be a problem. We walked through the maze of alleys to a few locations, and took the vaporettos to others. Both of those were great for experiencing Venice, in our opinion. The clincher for our opinion that this is a great place to stay was how we were helped by the front desk. I mistakenly left the voucher for a prepaid tour of the Doges' Palace in the room and didn't find out until I got to the entrance 25 minutes before the tour start time, so going back to get it was out of the question. As a last resort, I called the front desk, gave them permission to enter our room and described where they would find the voucher. I asked them to fax it to the ticket office. Ten minutes later, we were joining the tour, thanks to the staff's willingness to help. Overall, a strongly recommended place to stay in Venice. If you have the same experience as we did (minus the forgotten voucher, I hope), you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: SpitzieAussie
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the 'Antiche Figure' for two nights was fantastic. The hotel was beautiful and the service was fantastic. We had the deluxe room that has a small balcony and over looks the grand canal, which was great. We actually drove to Venice after initially going to get the train and found that the hotel is within easy walking distance for both. The only possible downside for some people is therefore that you are on the opposite side to the main area around 'San Marco' square. This to us was actually a good thing as it was nice to be away from that whole area at night and around a 30min walk through the streets. You probably see a lot more anyway and may take a lot longer if you are traveling with your wife like me as the shops are never ending. Breakfast was included in our stay at the hotel and was lovely to eat outside as you watched Venice life walk and float by. All amenities mentioned in the brochures for the hotel are there and most importantly work well. Overall, the hotel itself is fantastic and the staff can't do enough for you. You usually don't even have to ask for something as they are always asking you if there is anything you need or if they can help in any way. The hotel has good management and are a credit to them and the hotel. We had a fantastic stay and can't recommend the 'Antiche Figure' enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: bseo-pero
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming. The price is reasonable, and the ammenities are worthwhile. While there's no internet connections in the hotel rooms, there is free internet in the lobby. Our room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast is included with the price, and by European standards, the breakfast is elaborate. On our last day, there were torrential rain, and the hotel offered us the use of an umbrella. We've never had that kind of courtesy in the past. Even though it's considered a 3 star hotel, it was much better than the 4 star hotel where we stayed the previous week. When we return to Venice, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Ktwofish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antiche Figure for 1 night after a Mediterranean cruise. We were a family group of 16, and arranging for 6 rooms (3 triples and 3 doubles) was easily accomplished by email. Our room was a triple--a king size (I think...maybe queen) bed and they brought in a twin. A little small for 3 adults (my husband, 23 yr. old son, and me), but would have been fine for 2 people. It was very charming and the decor was quaint. The front desk was very nice and helpful--we were 16 people pulling luggage after a 12 day cruise, and we arrived around 10 am.
