They stored our luggage in one room, and the rest of the rooms were ready in a couple hours. The location was extremely convenient from the cruise port. I arranged a transfer to Piazzale Roma through Princess Cruise Lines, and from there we walked (over 2 small bridges) to the hotel. Their website directions were perfect. In hindsight, I would not pay Princess Cruise Lines for the transfer to the Piazzale Rome, which was $24 US per person...a bus ride 3/4 of a mile. I could have arranged 2 water taxis for all 16 of us cheaper...and we would have been taken right to the hotel, since is is on the Grand Canal. Breakfast was OK (no eggs or bacon to the disappointment of my "boys"), and the staff was very nice. The front desk gave us the sales pitch to visit the Murano factory for "free", but we didn't "bite". They also explained how to find your way in Venice. There were signs pointing to The Rialto Bridge or San Marco Square, and then there were signs pointing to Piazzale Rome and Ferrovia (train station) on the return. It was very easy to get to St. Mark's and then get back to our hotel, which was right across from the train station on the Grand Canal. I made the trek twice--once when we arrived (too hot and crowded) and once in the early evening (perfect). We found a great little restaurant between the hotel and San Marco (St. Mark's) that looked like it was frequented by locals. Buy your drinks and souvenirs before you get to San Marco because the price jumps at the Square! I wish we had stayed another day or two in Venice. One day was definitely not enough time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle091
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful little hotel! Stayed with my husband and two daughters for 2 nights and loved every minute of it. The girls had a very pretty room on the side with no view and my husband and I were offered an upgrade for half price to a lovely room overlooking the Grand Canal. Both had great bathrooms worthy of a 5 star rating, Everything was spotless and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Great continental breakfast which you can have in there cute little dining room or outside overlooking Grand Canal. Great location close to the bus and train station with many shops and restaurants close by. Decent walk to St Marks but plenty of water transport at your door to get you there. Would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Italylover1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for an expensive city- only 3 stars but I found the breakfast good, the room was nicely decorated ( we stayed in a suite and it accommodated the 5 of us in our family) - The staff were very nice and extremely helpful. the location is excellent across from the train station and right on the Grand Canal. I would highly recommend this hotel for a venice stay

Reviews.Title: “hate to beat a dead horse but this place really is great!!!”
Reviews.Author: trarader
Reviews.Content: I know all of the reviews are saying how great this place is, and I wanted to tell you they are correct. My bride and I stayed there on our honeymoon and enjoyed every bit of the hotel. The location couldn't be more perfect in that it is right across from the train station, and right at the fron of the city (didn't have to take the luggage far). The staff really did make the experience better as they were extremely helpful and attentive. The rooms were amazing. We sat and watched the sunset and gongolas pass by from the patio in front of the hotel while drinking a bottle of wine. Absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “hated to leave.....”
Reviews.Author: Louistraveler1024
Reviews.Content: Great little gem right on the grand canal. the rooms were cozy, well decorated venetian style, with very nice bathroom. the staff here was the best!!!! they were always asking you what they could do for you, or of you needed help with anything, even directions. they made you fresh coffee of cappuccino at breakfast. the breakfast here was very good. fresh cakes, fruit and pastries with the normal assortment of eggs, yogurt and cereals. great location, right across the grand canal from the train station. they even had tables outside for you to eat your breakfast or have a drink on the grand canal!! very romantic at night, with plenty of places to eat and see. our family loved it here, and we really did not want to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: CT-ref
Reviews.Content: I agree with the earlier reviewers--a great place to stay! We needed to be close to the train station and the cruise lines and the Antiche Figure fit the requirement, but couple the location with a friendly helpful staff and a walkable location to San Marco and you get a perfect choice. We never had to take the vaporetto (at 6.5 Euros PP per trip, a bit much). We were only a block from a local con operated laundry so we could do our own clothes before getting on the ship for the second week of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best service”
Reviews.Author: JoJoMa55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure for two nights in June. After settling in on our first evening, I casually asked Carlo for a restaurant where we could get a simple meal. He directed us to a place just around the corner that suited us perfectly and within the few minutes it took for us to arrive, he had called ahead and secured a reserved table for us. The staff at the restaurant had a glass of prosecco waiting for us. The following night was my birthday and Carlo arranged for a reservation at a charming osteria for us. The staff at the hotel also happily stored our luggage for us for our last day there due to a late night train trip. Carlo and staff, bravo! THIS is why you have earned a high rating and it is well-deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshleyCVA
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! First, the location was great. We took a bus from the airport and were able to walk to the hotel. It was also right across the canal from the train station, which was very convenient. Second, the staff was extremely welcoming and answered any questions we had. The room was clean...the bed could've been more comfortable, but it was fine. It was overall just a really great experience in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Venice trip enhanced by stay at Hotel Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: tammyNsteve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Italy for the first time in June and spent 3 days of our vacation in Venice. I read through numerous TripAdvisor hotel listings and reviews and finally settled on Hotel Antiche Figure based on the reviews. We were so impressed with our stay at Hotel Antiche Figure! Its proximity to the train station (just a short walk over the bridge) made hauling luggage a very simple task. We were greeted by Carlo and Francesca who were such gracious hosts during our stay. Francesca offered to make restaurant suggestions and reservations and was so helpful in helping us to navigate the water taxis and getting to Murano. They upgraded us to a suite which included a small kitchen and eating area. The suite was beautiful and quiet and very restful. Such a joy to come back to after walking all day. We were greeted every morning with a smile, a hot cappucino and a wonderful breakfast buffet that we at outside overlooking the Grand Canal. We hope to make a return visit to Venice and will certainly be staying at Hotel Antiche Figure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful place and staff”
Reviews.Author: Cobyslady
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the Antiche Figure, and enjoyed each and every one of them. The staff is as friendly and helpful as they can be. We had a red room reserved, and when we checked in they offered us the suite, which is down the small street next to the hotel. It was beautiful, and had a second room with a kitchenette, sofa, table and two chairs. Breakfast was a nice bonus, and the wait staff was always happy to get us cappuccinos from the bar. The desk staff was outstanding right from the beginning, they reccomended great restaurants for us, and were always available for advice on where to go and how to get there. If we're every lucky enough to go back to the beautiful city of Venice, we wouldn't even consider staying anywhere but the Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “superb position,staff and accomodation.fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: martin080251
Reviews.Content: We , a group of 3 couples from england chose Antiche Figure from the reviews on tripadvisor and skoosh (the company we booked through as i had a small discount voucher from a previous review made). We were not dissapointed, everything incl. cleanliness,quality of furniture/fittings, staff assistance, hotel situation, etc...etc... was superb. After several days of online searching through the many,many hotels on venice island we chose the best combination of situation/reviews/affordability ........it is a minefield, but we chose the right one! it is positioned on the southern bank of the grand canal looking over the canal towards the art deco style railway station , set back so absolutely no noise or smell, ( the station is only single story , so unlike many hotels in central venice the antiche figure has a large expanse of sky on view). and very interesting to watch the world go by whilst sipping your procecco/beer from table/chairs outside hotel by canal either with breakfast in morn, or early/late drinks evening. we found various restaurants behind the hotel ...by smaller canals for evening meals at sensible prices........we didnt go recommended just looked out for the busier ones. I have also posted a review on the skoosh website, but i understand now that the best deals could be achieved by booking with the hotel direct. martin smith

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: KLibs7
Reviews.Content: The staff here was amazing. They gave us an upgraded room at no extra cost and helped us with anything that we needed. They were SO kind to us. Our room was clean and comfortable. VERY NICE bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Splurge for the waterfront view.”
Reviews.Author: darkludus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and had a great time in Venice. We booked a waterfront view, some friends of ours traveling with us did not. Their room was very small and their window faced a wall. Granted, our room was more expensive, but the view of the grand canal was well worth it. Despite being right across from the train station, the hotel is very quiet - good soundproofing. Our first night was not great, because the room had a damp moldy smell, and the carpet was wet beneath the Air Conditioner. When we told the front desk the next day, they immediately moved our things to a larger room also facing the water - no hassle at all. They seemed sincerely embarressed and I believed them when they said they did not know about the leaky AC. The hotel is located right across from the vaporetti line by the train station, but don't use that one on your outbound trips. Instead, walk left and board at the first stop on the line. You'll get a better seat and it's only a block away. Exit at the train station on your return trips. The breakfast is just OK. You get a discount on it if you book through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel: highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: rads53
Reviews.Content: My wife, two teenagers, and I spent one night at the Antiche Figure last week. Our only regret is that we couldn't stay longer. * Location: We arrived and departed by train, so the location opposite the station was ideal. Climbing the stairs to cross the bridge over the Grand Canal was a bit of a challenge, but unavoidable. * Rooms: We had two identical rooms on the first and second floors. They were very comfortable, nicely appointed, and quite spacious by European standards. * Staff: I can't say enough about how welcoming and helpful the staff were. * Other amenities: Breakfast on the morning of our departure was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazmWorcester
Reviews.Content: We do not think we can add to the excellent reviews on this hotel. Excellent position, and very easy to get to the main attractions. Do buy the vaparetto tickets (if from England, works the same as the Oyster Card). We went everywhere on them as my husband has problems with his knees and struggles walking too far. The hotel itself was lovely, very clean and the staff - well they were all so friendly and extremely helpful. I forgot my plug adapter (no problem) also ethernet lead to laptop (needed it to keep checking vulcanic ash!, again no problem) in fact I think the hotel have thought of all the "little" things people leave behind. Breakfast room(s) lovely, we even sat in the small bar for breakfast one morning. You won't get a "full English" but you certainly will not go hungry with the spread they provide. Our room was divine, right on the grand canal with 2 windows and 1 balcony (albeit small) but it was great watching the World pass by. Oh and the beds were so comfortable, I want one.... Yes a little noise from the vaparettos but who sleeps well the first night! If you are light-sleepers take some earplugs, if you forget, guess what, the hotel will get some for you. All they want to do is please you and make sure you have no problems. You won't regret staying there. Deserves 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: wendyhazelnut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the bus station so getting there from the airport was really easy. A bus from the airport taking 20 minutes costing 3 euro drops you off at Piazza Roma and the hotel is easy to find and isnt far. This is a real bonus in Venice, you really dont want to have to walk far with your luggage across all those little bridges or have to take a taxi (extortionate prices). The hotel is located right on the Grand canal, also very handy for the ferry as there is a stop directly outside the hotel. Its quite noisy though if you have one of the rooms at the front as we did but its a hive of activity so is quite interesting! the train station is also right opposite the hotel so we took a day trip to florence, well worth it, about 80 quid round trip on the fast train. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and professional, we really enjoyed our stay here. Lovely bathrooms and nice rooms. We paid to upgrade our room but we didnt need to really in hindsight as hotels in Venice arent the cheapest to begin with!

Reviews.Title: “LA SERINISSIMA”
Reviews.Author: PrimaDonnaMaryland
Reviews.Content: The most compentent and caring staff ever encountered and that includes 5 starr upscale hotels around the world! they were able to secure a wheelchair for me, the senior of the group, with very short notice. It was delivered and returned by one of the hotel staff . Our rooms overlooked the Grand Canal and were opposite the train station, vaporetto stop and close to Piazzle Roma which provided easy access to transport from cruise and to airport.. Elegant rooms, bathroom and cheerful breakfast staff completes the picuure as wll as the lapping of the Canal water as you rest /sleep. Local, charming location in the Santa Croce region away from the tourist crowd, but easily acceible to St. Mark's, Doge's Palace, Rialto etc.Bravo to the Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BBBaby
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room but upon arrival, because we were staying for more than 3 days, we were offered a suite in a building located around the corner from the hotel. We basically had a fully equiped, attractive apartment for the price of a standard room. The staff was fantasic, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served in two lovely rooms in the hotel. There is a bar and the hotel is on the Grand Canal and has tables out front where one can enjoy the sights and sounds of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “If you travel to Venice, this is definetely the best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fingerprint2010
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a fantastic experience in this hotel in our honey moon. We stayed in a great room, very comfortable, clean and silent, even though hotel is located by VeniceÂ´s main channel. The breakfast was amazing, with a great variety of breads, cakes, cereals, cheeses, hams... even cappuccinos!!! The hotel is only 300 meters from the main train station, and letÂ´s face it: it is very handy when you have a heavy luggage to drag through Venice. And the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful with every of our requirements. We were very pleased! Thanks to all!!! Trust me, you cannot get a better 3 star hotel than this one in Venice or anywhere else, for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - best in Venice ?”
Reviews.Author: AshleyandChris
Reviews.Content: From our unexpectedly early arrival to our late afternoon departure , the staff could not have been more helpful. We were lucky enough to have a view over the Grand Canal and the room slept 4 in comfort which few other Venetian hotels seem to be able to do, and as we have a 9 year old and 19 year old helped avoid the cost of 2 rooms. Ideally situated opposite train station and close to Piazzale Roma for buses and airport coach transfer avoided too much lugging of bags over bridges ! Also easy to find if you get lost as you just follow signs to the train station - really useful! Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel does not deserve 3 stars, it deserves 5!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WaresofDuluth
Reviews.Content: This is a marvelous property with an exceptional staff. The location is ideal: across from the train station and two vaparetto stops. For first time vistors, getting there is no problem: by train its just across the bridge. By bus it is 50 meters from the bus terminal. By the waterbus line, again 50 meters. We absolutely loved the hotel but the staff made the difference. Carlos is an exceptional person who will go out of his way to make your stay enjoyable. The breakfast is large and tasty. But most of all, staying here you get a real sense of Venice. You are near the Jewish Ghetto and only a 20-30 minute walk to St. Marks and the walk itself is a great adventure. Stay here. Don't be fooled by the high priced, over-hyped properties. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is perfect. The place is the best. We will be back many times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dmanalo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally across the street from the train station, which was a plus because you only had to cross one bridge to get there (this being my first trip to Italy I made the mistake of bringing a very large suitcase). We got a canal view with a balcony - amazing!! Alesandro at the front desk was super gracious, plus he was a younger and more handsome version of Richard Gere =) His English was great and we received excellent recommendations for sightseeing and restaurants. More pluses: double sink and bathtub, breakfast, free internet

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler1818
Reviews.Content: The best hotel staff in all of Europe! Super friendly and helpful. Large rooms/ bathrooms for Europe. Directly across the river from the train station and a boat stop. Awesome experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kitalki
Reviews.Content: What a gem!!! I found this hotel from HIGH reviews on TripAdvisor and I"m telling you this hotel is BETTER THAN ANY OTHER. The staff is WONDERFULLY ACCOMMODATING, KNOWLEDGEABLE and HELPFUL in EVERY WAY. My parents and I visited Venice prior to a cruise and we stayed in this hotel for 2 days before and 2 days after the cruise. They have a lovely trip to Murano for free, sent me to a beautiful jazz club, made the BEST BREAKFAST BUFFET ever, and had the most adorable rooms!!! Everything EXCEEDED my expectations!! I have told everyone about this hotel and I will definitely return to stay there again one day. GOD BLESS TO ALL THE STAFF!! And we love you!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kanuIreland
Reviews.Content: When my sister and myself arrived in this charming hotel, we were met by a gentleman and a lady - who where most helpful and charming. There was no upsell. We found them to be very helpful and we were given a lovely room. The photos on the website are not realistic, much better in real life. The rooms are not large, but they had everything you could ask for. Breakfast was delightful, especially watching everyone else go to work! The walk to Rialto Bridge is very pleasant but returning can be bit of a walk if you get lost and if you dont like maps! I would get the boat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Boginia1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during our trip to Italy. Having arrived to Venice by train fairly late in the evening, it was very helpful that the hotel was right across the street from the train station - no need for a water taxi or dragging your suitcases across cobblestone streets (though we still had to climb up and down a lot of stairs to get across the Grand Canal). The hotel is nice - has a lovely charm to it, but the person helping us (let's call him Mr. X)left something to be desired. From the moment we stepped into the hotel Mr. X tried to upsell us - room upgrades, a glass of water (5 Euros?), a tour, a restaurant, everything about Mr. X exuded disgust with us, I don't know if it was because we kept saying "No, thank you" or some other snobby reason. In fact, as soon as someone else walked into the lobby Mr. X immediately ran off to help them leaving us stranded (luckily there was another staff member that was actually off duty, but the girl was really nice and finished checking us in). Overall, the hotel was nice - the rooms are well furnished. though a bit small, but it's Venice. The location is as far away from St. Mark's as possible, but we liked it - we enjoyed the walks through the city, which is all in all 1 mile away; plus the location is superb for getting in and out of Venice - right next to the train station and the bus terminal. I'd stay here again, hoping and praying not to be helped by Mr. X.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: HolidaysYay
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in the Hotel Antiche Figure at the end of April whilst recovering from a long-haul flight from Australia. I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. Despite being on my own in lovely Venice I felt so comfortable at the hotel - it cannot be faulted. The rooms are spotless, beautifully decorated, contain all the facilities you need, breakfast lovely and the location is so convenient - the day I left it was a 5 minute walk to the train station. I feel that the staff of the hotel have a focus on satisfying the needs of their guests - at every opportunity I was asked if I was enjoying my stay and whether they can do anything to improve my experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy their stay in this most beautiful of all cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - easy to find location”
Reviews.Author: roxsheeba
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great value in a very expensive city. The location was also a plus, it was in the historical Venice but being right on the Grand Canal was easy to get back to, anyone who has been to Venice will know the value in that! The staff were very professional and always ready to help. As we were travelling by train on our next leg being directly across the canal from the train station was also of huge benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: serenity133
Reviews.Content: Superior room overlooking Grand Canal was clean and elegant, all the staff were friendly, very polite and helpful. A very good choice was available for breakfast. Very close to Piazzale Roma which has buses direct to and from Airport. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: patried
Reviews.Content: If you're searching for hotel accommodations in Venice, Italy - look no further! The Antiche Figure, located on the Grand Canal,is within walking distance of the Piazzale Roma, many restaurants and cafes, and shopping ! The room, which was our for two nights, directly faced the Grand Canal ( opposite the train station ) was charming, the complimentary breakfast was more than adequate and we can only describe the staff (Francesca, Carlo, Alessandro and Anka ) as delightful , helpful, and , simply, WONDERFUL. We highly recommend the Antiche Figure and will certainly plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: OXOlady
Reviews.Content: We have had a lovely weekend in Venice. We booked this hotel via Expedia after reading the reviews on TP. We had a standard double which was absolutely fine, spotlessly clean and extremely quiet. The location is perfect for touring the city. We travelled in from Marco Polo airport on the 3 euro bus and the hotel was so easy to find about a 5 minute walk from the bus stop along the Grand Canal. The vaperetto stops are opposite and walking along any street in any direction brings you to a huge choice of restaurants, cafes and bars. We found a bar about 5 minutes away that served glasses of beer or wine for less than 1 euro and it was crowded with locals of all ages. All the staff in the hotel are exceptionally smiley and friendly. I would definately return to this hotel and recommend this hotel to my friends. It was just perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable , clean, understated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cat555
Reviews.Content: I found my way to this hotel when my flight was cancelled due to the volcanic ash and the hotel I was staying in luckily had no vacancies It was a great find. The staff were businesslike but very helpfull. The room was clean, fresh, quiet and adequately spacious. Wifi was free and I could access it on my iPhone in my first floor room. Breakfast was good and the bar service just lovely. When I had to change my travel plans at a moments notice, the staff at reception were very accommadating. I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: brickm
Reviews.Content: We found the Staff to be extremely friendly and helpful, giving us great advice not only for our time in Venice but also for our next destination. The room was very spacious and clean, it was well equipped with tea and coffee making facilities, fridge and toiletries. For us the location was excellent as we were travelling by train so we were able to drop our bags of in our room and be out exploring within 10 minutes of arriving in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EFTMan
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a long weekend in Venice, it was our first time and I had booked it as a surprise for my Partner's birthday. I had booked the Hotel Antiche Figure because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and I must say that I made the right choice! Firstly, on arrival we were made to feel really at home and were offered an upgrade to a larger room overlooking the Grand Canal for a reasonable price and we took it and weren't disappointed. Although the view also took in the train station (as it is opposite) just being able to open the window and watch the hustle and bustle of tourists and the gondolers and water taxi's going by was an experience in itself! The room itself was beautiful and we could not have expected anymore and although we were opposite the train station, it was very quiet, so sleeping was fine. The service was impeccable and both Carlo and the Lady on reception went out of their way to find time to draw maps and advise us of the best places to go, something that I find rare these days. The breakfast which was included in the price was great, it was just a continental breakfast which we both like and there was plenty of choice for all! The location of the hotel was spot on, it was 5 minutes walk from the Piazalle Roma (the main bus station), and this was a start/end point for most main water bus routes to and from the main areas of interest. The water taxi from the airport stopped right outside which was a real bonus! Also, having visited the more touristy area, the Hotel was just far enough away to be fairly quiet but was within walking distance of St Marks, Rialto bridge etc... (about 20 to 30 mins). Overall, due to the weather (26 degrees and sunny most of the time) and the quality of the hotel, we were both very disappointed to leave Venice and the Hotel and have no doubts that when we visit Venice again we will definately stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure and would recommend hotel to anyone who wants a romantic weekend in a great value 5 star service Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with incredibly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: disraeli23
Reviews.Content: As independent travellers, we read the reviews in Trip Advisor about how great the staff were and thought that that was not especially important to us as we like to do our own thing. However, then came the Icelandic volcano and the staff could not have been more helpful. They kept the room rates at pre-volcano levels - unlike most other hotels we heard of, they phoned the airport and train station for the latest travel information and even re-charged our mobile phone for us ! Despite it's small size, the bar was a really friendly place for a post meal evening drink. So well done to manager Alessandro for assembling such a great team of staff. The rooms themselves are variable. We were initially put on the top floor in a very small room with a noisy radiator but were then moved to a much better room on the 1st floor. The hotel is a short walk from both the main bus terminus and the railway station - this was very handy as we made several trips to the airport. Rialto and St Mark's square are a 30 minute walk - it is best to cross the bridge outside the hotel and walk through the shopping area. There are plenty of trattorias and pizzerias nearby but we found the food in Venice inferior to other Italian cities. In conclusion, a unique city, ideal for a 3 night break at the Hotel Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneSPolmont
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights (12/13 April) as part of our honeymoon ( middle-aged-second time round-ers) and had a wonderful time here. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and as we were leaving by train, it was very convenient for the station - just a short walk over the bridge. Our only complaint was - we didn't stay long enough! We will be back someday and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel right on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: mugsy58
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The location was great - right on the Grand Canal, and right across from the train station. The staff was helpful and attentive. The room was small but nicely decorated and appointed. The bathroom was great. We enjoyed being a bit away from the many cruise boat tourists who are on the island during the day. Breakfast was good and the wait staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “One night not enough?”
Reviews.Author: Birdie2boy
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night (Sat) at the Antiche Figure after a seven night cruise. Our room 412 was at the top of the hotel. A very nice comfortable room. Check in was quick and easy at 9am we just dropped our cases off and on our return late afternoon they had been taken up to our room. The welcome was excellent from both Francessca and Carlo we were provided with a very good map and they offered to help us with restaurant suggestions. Our stay was only until the Sunday afternoon. Had we stayed longer I am am sure that the staff would have planned some itineries.The room was a good size with a queen bed, two night tables, a small vanity and two chairs. There was a nice flat screen TV and BBC news and CNN were in English. The small bathroom was fully equipped and the bath was excellent. There was also wired Internet available. Best of all for me, was the kettle with coffee and tea making supplies. Umbrellas were also provided for rainy days. The room was cleaned spotless and it was very quiet. The bed was comfortable when we asked for two extra pillows they promptly arrived. We slept very well. The breakfast had ample selections of meat, cheeses, pastries, cereals, juice, fruit, just about anything you could want. The breakfast staff also were quick to offer cappacino and were extremely pleasant and cheerful. It was a great start to the day. I felt the location of the hotel was perfect. We took the bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma and the hotel was a short walk (maybe 5 minutes) away right on the grand canal. Right across the bridge was a Vaparetto stop and the train station. There were many restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk. (However the food in Venice is not very good and VERY expensive - thank goodness for that good breakfast!) Having said that we were recommended a very good restaurant by the hotel and although 101 euros that was reasonable for Venice. The food was excellent. I have absolutely no complaints about the Antiche Figure. The staff was wonderful, the breakfast was great, the room was clean and comfortable, and you can't beat the location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting quality with very personal and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “We felt so welcome, the location is great and room was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ian_PearceBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: Right on the busy waterfront of the Grand Canal I loved this small, historic and beautiful hotel. The room was lovely - clean and ornate, location great - just across the Grand Canal from the railway station and the price was reasonable (for Venice paying in pounds sterling) but the staff made our holiday so wonderful. We wre greeted on arrival at midnight by a very wide awake young man who was extremely welcoming and friendly despite the late hour. I travelled with my two teenage kids and the manager spotted their height and asked if we needed a bigger third bed which duly arrived. All the desk staff were very helpful and personable and made such a difference to our stay. If you are tired of disininterested service in hotels I suggest you try this one. Breakfast is a bit cramped as dining space is short but the food is fine and very good value by Venetian standards. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: CTProfessional
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel as a result of the outstanding reviews on TripAdvisor. It did not disappoint. I read some of the negative reviews about the view of the train station...and while it's true that it's in plain view of the hotel, it's not at all unsightly and will not take away from your experience. If anything, the hotel's proximity to the train station makes it all the more convenient for your travels to/from other cities. The hotel is clean and quaint. It has a bar and free internet access. The front desk staff is incredibly friendly and helpful--the best of all five hotels we stayed at during our two weeks in Italy. Other than a bit of hustle and bustle surrounding the train station during the day, the location is the best possible as it gives you a chance to meander through the less crowded/beautiful residential areas on your way to and from the tourist attractions. We had an extremely pleasant and well-rounded experience in the city as a result, and would definitely return to the Hotel Antiche Figure. Our only (minor) "complaint "was the breakfast, which wasn't very impressive compared to other hotels. They seemed short-staffed in the breakfast room each morning.

Reviews.Title: “10/10! Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: FlipFlopHeaven
Reviews.Content: Just back from a mini break in Venice staying at the Hotel Antiche Figure - I searched Trip Advisor before making my booking and am pleased to say that all the positive reviews do this hotel justice. We arrived too early to check in but we were able to leave our luggage without any hassle, we were given a map, some advise and off we went. The hotel staff were helpful, friendly and every question we asked was answered with accurate helpful answers. The room was spotless and perfect in everyway - I specifically booked a room with views over the Grand Canal and was not disappointed. We had a room on the 4th floor with 3 windows giving 3 different aspects (have attached some pictures). The bathroom was spotless and the bed extremley comfortable. 10 out of 10. Breakfast was also very good, and for the money I would recommend it. There was something for everyone (unless you were looking for a fry up!!) pastries, cereals, cold meats etc a perfectly adequate continental breakfast to start the day with. Even when we checked out we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel for the day as our flight was in the evening - the staff were brilliant and the hotel excellent! Even the location of this hotel gets 10 out of 10 - a short walk from the main bus station and literally opposite the train station, with 'water bus' stops and gondola's right outside. Would definately recommend this hotel to others - would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff were amazing, Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: Cian_Peyton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights recently with my girlfriend and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the perfect time in Venice. Not only is the location perfect, The staff are unbelievably friendly and helpful. They couldn't do enough for us... The rooms were lovely with a great view of the canal, also every evening when we would come in from sight seeing the room would be spotless and we had little chocolates on our pillows. The breakfast in the morning was great value for money and the quality of food was superb. I will be recommending this hotel to anyone I know thinking of going to Venice. Cant wait to go back again next year...

Reviews.Title: “Everyone in the world has to stay here at least once”
Reviews.Author: AlessandraBuffy
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time in Venice and it was the most wonderful stay,thanks to the wonderful staff at Antiche Figure - the personal attention they showed us was incredible, all the staff are so friendly and helpful and the extra special touches really make you want to stay forever. Breakfast wasn't included in the price of our room but for â‚¬7 each, it was fantastic value and was a delicious start to the day. The lovely staff offered to upgrade our room, offered to call restaurants for reservations for us, offered my boyfriend tea as he had the flu, recommended things to do, the list is endless. The location is fab, it was quiet to sleep at night, bathroom toiletries are included and I love the chocolates on the pillow. I love Italy and especially Venice, even more after an unforgettable 3 nights in this hotel. Grazie mille to all the staff, especially Francesca - we will be back x

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jaffacakes5
Reviews.Content: Brilliant helpful friendly staff, lovely rooms (we upgraded to get a view of the Grand Canal and a much larger room), good breakfast. The rooms were nice and quiet despite overlooking the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: cverduchi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was where we stayed the night before our cruise set sail from Venice. Though not near the harbor, definitely well worth it. The service was amazing, they really care about their customers. The decor of the room was not my taste and the rooms were not huge. However, I would stay again due to the wonderful service and the proximity for sightseeing. The staff will recommend great restaurants too- we took a suggestion for a small out of the way place which wound up being phenomenal and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cicignon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Antiche Figure for 4 nights. Very convenient location only a few hundred meters from bus station (P.le Roma) and right across the canal from the train station. Reception open 24H, nice breakfast, and a very comfortable room that was clean, spacious, nicely decorated, with a comfy bed (for Italy) and that had a great view of the canal. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Antiche Figure and when we arrived we were upgraded to a "Suite" which was down the street from the main hotel. While maybe not for everyone, I liked that the room was private and quite. Check in was quick and easy and the staff provided a very good map and they offered to help us in any way to develop an itinerary for the day and with restaurant suggestions. While we already had our days planned, I truly believe the staff would accommodate and help us any way that they could. I saw them helping many other guests. I also had a problem figuring out how to turn on the heater and they immediately came to the room to help. They were all terrific! I can't say enough about how helpful and nice all of the staff was. The room was average in size with a queen bed, two night tables, a small vanity and two chairs. There was a nice flat screen TV and BBC news and CNN were in English. The small bathroom was fully equipped and the shower had multiple heads. Slippers were provided and candies were left on the bed each night. There was also wired Internet available. Best of all for me, was the kettle with coffee and tea making supplies. Umbrellas were also provided for rainy days. The room was cleaned spotless and it was very quiet. The bed was comfortable and it was no problem getting another blanket or pillow from the front desk. We slept very well. The breakfast had ample selections of meat, cheeses, pastries, cereals, juice, fruit, just about anything you could want. The breakfast staff also were quick to offer cappacino and were extremely pleasant and cheerful. It was a great start to the day. I felt the location of the hotel was perfect. We took the bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma and the hotel was a short walk (maybe 5 minutes) away right on the grand canal. Right across the bridge was a Vaparetto stop and the train station which was very convenient for us when we left on a train to Rome. Venice is not that big and we were able to walk to all the sites, or if we got tired, it was easy to catch a Vaparetto right back to the front of the hotel (well across a bridge from the hotel). We bought the Venice Connected Card for the Vaparetto and easily surpassed the 22 Euros I paid for it. The area around the hotel was busy in the morning and at night, but quaint and quiet during the day. There were many restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk. (However the food in Venice is not very good and VERY expensive - thank goodness for that good breakfast!) It was also fun to watch all the activity on the Grand Canal and at the trian station. I have absolutely no complaints about the Antiche Figure. The staff was wonderful, the breakfast was great, the room was clean and comfortable, and you can't beat the location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: fionaross22
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The location is excellent - just the other side of the Grand Canal from the railway station, with an excellent view and within easy walking distance of all the main attractions. The staff spoke fluent English and provided excellent suggestions for restaurants and were extremely helpful throughout our stay. We stayed in a deluxe room which had an excellent view and a very generously sized bed and bathroom. We would happily stay there again should we return to Venice and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, central location!”
Reviews.Author: Shredder8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (3/13 and 3/14) for our honeymoon, and Antiche Figure was the perfect start to our trip. Chose the hotel primarily for its great location, (directly across from the train station and close to the buses) and the glowing reviews it received from everyone. It didn't disappoint. Like most guests, we were offered a room upgrade (for more money), but we politely declined and it wasn't much of an issue after that. The staff was really wonderful and accommodating, and spent time helping us plan our 2 day itinerary. And they even put us in a larger room when they heard it was our honeymoon. Sweet! Room was nicely furnished, and the bathroom was beautifully decorated, although our shower could have been bigger. Free internet was a nice bonus. Didn't realize that breakfast was not included in our booking, but there are plenty of places around to eat. If you have a train or plane to catch in the early morning, this is the perfect place to stay for the close proximity to both. The hotel feels more like a 5 star than 3.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel I have stayed in all my trips to Europe!”
Reviews.Author: VegasTravelqueen
Reviews.Content: This little gem is in a great location across from the train terminal. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean The breakfast is nice, I have had better, but it definately is very adequate. I am sorry that I just found this hotel on my 4th trip to Venice, but as a travel agent, I will definately send my clients and family back to the Hotel Antiche Figure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer4444
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay in Venice staying at this great little hotel. We were given a free room upgrade on the first night and offered the same room (which was much better than the one booked) for a very good price including breakfast for the remaining 3 nights. Nice sized room and stunning bathroom, bed was fine but not outstanding, great view out onto the Grand Canal, even better that we awoke to the filming of Johnny Depp and Angelina Jolie's new film "The Tourist" on our first morning and got some great photo's but getting back to the hotel, the staff were superb, very, very helpful and friendly and always eager to assist us and the breakfast we had on the following three mornings was very good for continental. Great location opposite the train station and away from the really touristy areas but close enough to walk to all the main sites and get to by vaporetto (stop directly opposite the hotel). Loved Venice and the hotel helped make it a great epxerience oh and seeing two of hollywoods biggest stars helped too!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ssmak
Reviews.Content: Located directly across from the train station makes Antiche Figure a great place to stay. We arrived quite early on our check-in day, but after getting a room upgrade, we were able to check in almost immediately. Our room had a wonderful view over the Grand Canal (though was a bit noisy when all the boats started transit), HUGE bathroom and a comfortable bed. The staff is what really made Antiche Figure fantastic. They were more then helpful with our check-in, things to see and do (and how to get there) and when we returned at night, they serviced the in-house bar for us, explaining the beers we tested. I only wish we could have stayed longer as Antiche Figure felt like a luxury.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel Antiche Figure never fails to impress.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaJonesLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th visit to the hotel, the location is both attractive and convenient, and the staff are unfailingly helpful. A true home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: bphSolna_Sweden
Reviews.Content: Very accessible, 5 min walk from P.le Roma and Ferrovia. Beautiful, quiet rooms with excellent beds. Everything in perfect working condition. Most accomodating and kind service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, People and Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jdhi
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. The people were lovely and helped in anyway they could. The location was great. It was straight across from the train station so there was virtually no dragging the luggage and no expense. The room we stayed in had a lovely view of the water. It had comfy beds and well equipped bathroom. Very venetion style - really enjoyed our stay here. The price was good considering how much it is to stay in Venice. It says it is a three star but I truly believe the friendly staff make it is five star. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rpspp
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? The entire staff deserves ten stars -- they're courteous, professional, friendly, patient and extremely helpful. The hotel is conveniently located for exploring the city on foot or using public transport. An upgrade was offered; the room was well-appointed, very clean, extremely comfortable, not on the canal but well-lit. There is no charge for internet access on the computer in the hotel lobby; breakfast offers a satisfactorily broad, continental-style buffet (and proper "espresso" coffee). What's left? The staff again: they're eager that you enjoy your stay in their city. An excellent value all around; highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel in every sense”
Reviews.Author: AndyWLancashire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay to celebrate our wedding annniversary & having read many reviews found them to be perfectly justified. From the convenient location we enjoyed a superior double room on the 4th floor which was both roomy and with a lovely natural light. Excellent bathroom with fresh towels daily & extremely clean. Perfectly adequate breakfast with attentive staff through to the several different but extremely helpful reception staff. We would say that this was probably one of the best hotels we have stayed in over the years which met & exceeded our needs & expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: actorgolferhoneymoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because my mother and aunt recommended it. Great location, friendly staff (Alessandro is so friendly and informative!), and charming rooms. It's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Are there any better 3* hotels than this - anywhere?”
Reviews.Author: JandApe
Reviews.Content: Trust the good reviews â€“ they are the accurate ones. Anyone who has been to Venice and was unfortunate enough to pick a hotel deep in the city will appreciate the ease with which this hotel can be reached from both the train and bus stations. Using the water bus from the airport will be a little trickier, but unless this is your first trip and you want to arrive by sea, the ATVO bus at â‚¬3 is cheaper and quicker. Excellent though its location is, the best thing about the hotel, are the people who run it. Astonishingly friendly, helpful, smiling and exhibiting a desire to assist, that borders on fanatical. We are relatively seasoned visitors to Venice, so didnâ€™t really need any help and this really did seem to put the reception staff out. On each encounter we were asked was everything OK and could they be of any assistance? As with some other reviewers, we were offered a room upgrade. As we had booked a basic four night package with Last Minute, we decided to go for the very reasonably priced upgrade to one of the suites. WOW! The reasonable outlay was the best money I have ever spent in a hotel. The four night suite upgrade, including breakfast, was cheaper than the one-way upgrade for my wife and I on the British Airways flight; now that IS a mistake! Back to the hotel, the suite consisted of two rooms plus shower room, all immaculately decorated and finished. If you are a fan of the bath, then beware. If you like a shower, then the suites have the Rolls-Royce of showers! With a massive shower head and wall jets that pummel you from the side. The rest of the bathroom fixtures are also top quality (see photo). The bedroom was simply marvellous, with a large comfy bed, with some rather fancy drapes above the headboard (see photo). The rooms had very expensive fabric wall coverings, that made one feel like minor royalty. The living room area had a table sofa and an area behind glass that contained a full size fridge, sink, along with tea and coffee making facilities (see rather dark photo). The room also had two wonderful flat screen TVâ€™s, a mini-bar and a safe. Truly excellent. I wonâ€™t comment on the restaurants close by, itâ€™s not the fault of the hotel if an establishment isnâ€™t to your taste, or you have a poor experience. They do deserve thanks for at least offering some recommendations. Finally, a word about the scourge of Venice, mosquitoes! On the first night, we opened the windows wide; thinking that as this was February, our biting â€˜friendsâ€™ would be at least hibernatingâ€¦but no. During the night, I was awoken by the shrill buzz of one in my ear and sure enough, in the morning, my wife and I had both been bitten, in quite a few places. Now this isnâ€™t rare in Venice, come the heat of summer and you can loose so much blood to the things, one can almost feel faint! Only in the morning did I discover a mosquito repelling device, plugged in a wall socket. It was one of the devices that is supposed to emit a sound that the insects find unpleasant. A bit like humans do when they listen to Des Oâ€™Connor. Naturally, it didnâ€™t work, none of the â€˜greenâ€™ chemical free devices do (in my experience) but at least the hotel had made an effort to try and keep them away. Iâ€™ve been to five star establishments where suggestions about what to do regarding biting insects have been met simply with an indifferent shrug of the shoulders. The device in the room may have only served to make the little blighters more angry/hungry but at least they tried. How I wish I could give Antiche Figure more than five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel, convenient location, clean, attractive rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Passepartout26
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days in this excellent hotel on the Grand Canal. The reception staff were consistently friendly and approachable and went out of their way to be helpful. Our room and bathroom were very large, clean and comfortable with a view of the Grand Canal, the station and the vaporetto stops (there was some noise from these but not enough to disturb us). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, lovely staff- we Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: silvertigress
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel at the start of January it was no.4 out of all the hotels in venice on trip advisor and i see it has now gone down to seventh!! travesty!! what a little gem of a place!! we arrived via Piazzale roma bus station from treviso airport. just a short walk across the bridge and along the street and cross over the big white bridge and you are there!! when we checked in the staff at the front desk were lovley and everyone spoke great english- handy as i only know v. basic italian. I booked this hotel with Thomas cook and thought it included breakfast but it didnt. So as reported by other reviewers, we too were offered an upgrade and breakfast, but in a 'your choice' kind of way-no pressure. We were given the key to both rooms and told to just ring down and let him know what we had decided. after seeing the rooms we just has to go for the upgrade. we were on the 4th floor in room 411 with a lovely view of the bridge and the canal. It was a bit noisy with boats and so on going past at all hours, but it didnt bother us one bit, and is part and parcel of venice life. nicest room I think I have stayed at! When I asked the front desk staff reccommended a few restaurants for us and it was really nice, just a short walk from the hotel, like two streets on the same side of the bridge. Osteria Vecio Pozio, it was a lovely place ! Cozy and welcoming and busy!!! staff were friendly and the portions were huge, unless you are starving dont order a starter!!! great range of pizza and pasta and seafood. pizza looked amazing. great value compared to what we saw in the rest of venice!! please do tell the staff in the hotel your budget follow the staff reccommendations because on the first night we had a terrible dinner in a side street restaurant, slightly off the beaten track heading to the rialto. it looked lovely outside, but they had the cheek to charge 49 euro's for a slice of lasagne, pasta with what seemed to be tinned vegetables, a beer and a lemonade, and bread that we didnt even want! TIp- if like us you have never been to italy before, send the bread away or tell them when you are ordering that you dont want any!! and Dont eat ANYWHERE that has a menu turistico!!! most of the time we ate in a wee place on the opposite side of the bridge called BQ or BM or something. the staff there spoke like ten languages and we just had slices of pizza for one ot two euro's. italian ice cream is also amazing!!! one thing I did notice about venice was that there werent very many places to sit. Please dont bother with cheesy Gondola trips,( if you must wait till your last day- so you can see why im saying that) before I went I thought it would be so romantic, but when I saw them full of tourists who didnt know one another mindlessly taking pictures and nearly getting run over with the vaparetto I changed my mind. Instead get the vaperetto 1 down the grand canal to piazza san marco, its just as good! and get the no.2 back up again. definaltey get the vaperetto pass if you arent into walking about its much easier and less tiring on the feet to get to the main things you want to visit. please bring ID with you if you want to get an audio guide at the Doges palace etc. we didnt and they wouldnt give us one. Didnt have a very good impression of the staff at the any of the museums or places we visited they were more interested in chatting to one another or texting on their mobiles than doing their job. mostly they just looked bored and like Tourists were some sort or imposition rather than how they make their money!!! friendly and helpful they werent!! Hotel staff can help you with the trip to murano/burano or anywhere else that you want to visit. I thought the breakfast was just ok because I like something warm to eat in the morning, but my partner thought the breakfast was decent and filing. after you check in go out and just wonder about, get lost ( though you cant really just follow the signs for rialto/san marco or back the way towards the hotel to p. roma or alla ferrovia the train station) and ABOVE all wear comfortable shoes and enjoy :) I loved venice and I will definatley go back and I would love to stay at the antiche figure room 411 again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: oggiebedworth
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Carnival and the hotel was an oasis of calm. Located opposite the main railway station, and about 200 metres (and one bridge) from the vaporetto point, and about 400 metres, albeit across 2 bridges (this is Venice!) to the bus station, and on the Grand Canal - it presses most buttons. We were given a choice of room, a warm and frienbdly welcome that was sustained throughout the 4 day stay. I can't recopmmend this highly enough, and around the back, say 200 metres away is an excellent and good value (for Venice) pizza house.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaskid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right on the Grand Canal. It's a short walk from the bus station and just across the canal from the railway station. We booked through Expedia and booked a standard room but when we arrived the hotel offered us a special half price room upgrade to a front canal view room which was well worth it as it also included a good buffet style continental breakfast. The hotel has a lot of shops and restaurants nearby and it's a short walk to most of the main sights. All staff were exceptionally friendly and I would highly recommend this hotel. In the lobby there is a computer with free internet access. The room was a good size with a nice bathroom, inroom safe, flatscreen TV but the exceptional thing was the view. We had 3 windows worth (2 front and 1 side) of the Grand Canal. Truly amazing and would love to go back there someday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully helpful staff, Attrative,Clean rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JackK
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel on the reviews from Trip Advisor, and were not disappointed in the least. The staff was pleasant, and made you feel like nothing you needed would be a problem for them. They offered help in arranging whatever excursion we were interested in, and offered advice on what restaurant, or show they thought we would like. They arranged free transport from the hotel to Murano for a tour of a glass blowing shop, and near he end of our stay, when my partner was feeling poorly, they called the doctor for a house call so she could be treated in the room late at night. The rooms were very nice, with beautiful trimmings, and very clean. The size of the room was also very comfortable, and the hotel breakfast was traditional. The hotel is conveniently located across the Grand Canal from the train and bus station, so its a short walk over the bridge to the other side of the canal that is busy with places to grab a quick bite to eat. Although the maps of Venice are sometimes hard to follow, most of where you would want to see, or nice places to eat, are within 30 minutes walking distance from the hotel. If you wanted to get there quicker, the water taxis come right to the hotel. We were happy about the ease of getting to and from the airport by boat, and it could have been even easier and cheaper if we had taken the bus. Being on the Grand Canal was great for getting your bearings, but the room we had did not look out over it. It would have been even more romantic, had we been in one of those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure was pleasant in every way.”
Reviews.Author: noeflyzone
Reviews.Content: There were three of us, myself, my husband and 21 yr. old daughter in the room. The room was a double and they added a twin bed to accommodate our daughter. We arrived early (11am.) fully intending to just drop our bags and check-in later. They only had us wait approx. 15 minutes and let us check-in early and the room was perfect! The room was very large compared to most European rooms and our bathroom was beautiful - we especially enjoyed the heated towel rack since we were there in January. The location was great because of the short walk from the bus stop and we liked being right on the Grand Canal to watch the traffic of Venice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and great service!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieandMrP
Reviews.Content: We thought the location and service was great! The hotel is situated close to the bus terminal, yet you merely have to cross a bridge to reach the central parts of Venice. We received great advice regarding restaurants off the tourist track as well as a lovely opera (Musica a Palazzo). Be sure to pick a room with a view of the grand canal!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Toddlerfun
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our toddler in tow. They upgraded our room to a suite so that we could fit our porta-cot in the room. The heating in the room was great, continental breakfast each morning was generous, with made to order coffee. The staff were fantastic, always helpful with were to eat locally, which boat to catch, which tour was good. The hotel was perfect in its location, as we hopped off the train, walked across the bridge and were there. Cathcing boats into the central part of Venice was easy, however it was great to ust walk arouhd. Near the hotel there are some great local restuarants, (one mentioned by the hotel) the other one we found just by walking five minutes from out room (Indian restaurant and it was fantastic!). We finished out stay with a free trip to Murano and bought way too much, but oh well, it was amazing! Overall the stay was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto!!!”
Reviews.Author: BON0
Reviews.Content: This is the first time in my life I write a review while still at the hotel. I am writing this 30 minutes before check-out. This hotel is SUPERB with every meaning of the word. First, it is located right across the Ferruvia Train Station. You only need to cross the bridge to get there. It overlooks the Grand Canal, so you can't ask for more. From the moment you step in they will make you feel at home, and I really mean HOME. They will tell you everything you need to know, from sightseeing places you shouldn't miss, to places where you should eat, to Gondola places and fares, just EVERYTHING. The room was VERY clean, the bathroom is VERY elegant. I LOVE THIS PLACE AND WOULD LOVE TO COME BACK HERE ONE DAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff... nothing too much trouble... great rooms & location”
Reviews.Author: shelkar
Reviews.Content: we (two adults & three chidren aged 16, 13 & 10) recently stayed here. The rooms were clean with excellent bathrooms( one room had a bath). Location was terrific - seconds from the grand canal & a thirty minute walk to the square. What really made this hotel stand out was the warmth & service of the hotel staff. Nothing was too much trouble & everything was done with a smile. We ended up being stranded in Venice due to flight cancellations & the staff were extremely caring. All in all a great value hotel very reasonably priced & one we would heartily reccommend

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, absolutely stunned by fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: harry_wet
Reviews.Content: I ran across from the train station after just getting off the train in seriously heavy winter rain and walked into thankfully the first hotel I saw, the woman behind the counter was possibly the most friendly person I've ever come across in hospitality. For 80 euros a night is out of my budget but place is definately worth it considering that hostels around here are 40 euros and apparently terrible, I managed to get a double bed in the most amazing room. It is clean and boutique beautiful. Don't get me started on the bathroom, everything about this hotel absolutely amazing. Breakfast is really good too, with a bit of variety. But I cannot speak more highly of the staff, also considering most Venetians are pretty rude and bad tempered. They were interested in where I had been, how my day was and where and how I was going to go next, then they would give you tips on how to go about it.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its tripadvisor rank if it is compared to other 3 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: trav_lr007
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel this place is fantastic. Super attentive staff who clearly have a goal to please you. I was told when I checked out that if that had been a problem I should have complained and they would have fixed it (including making the beds softer or harder - yes, I was explicitly told this). So, if you stay here and are unhappy with any issue, they clearly want to know. We don't feel comfortable niggling in such a way so it is good to know they want to fix every issue and won't spit in your cappuccino for complaining. Breakfast was a normal continental affair. Stayed in additional suites. The beds and pillows are extra firm. Shower was phenomenal; no bathtub; no dishes to cook on provided stove; away from the canal which is nice and quiet and preferable. Some staff spoke fluent english and I am sure I heard french too. Overall, if you get a good deal it is worth it. But I am not sure I would pay more for this place than a 4-star with decent ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: UTinEurope
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at Antiche Figure. Loved this hotel and this city. Venice was gorgeous and just stepping out of the hotel to see the Grand Canal is breathtaking. Location is awesome, it is honestly DIRECTLY across from the train station so just take one of the bridges over and youre there. If you cross over the bridge back to the side where the station is and go the right you hit a winding street with tooooons of shops, stores, and great restaurants. We spent most of our time just walking up this street- which takes you to Rialto and S. Marco. We were also offered a room with a "grand canal" view. For more than 50 dollars more a night it wasnt much, two twin beds pushed together in an attic like room with windows that looked at the station that were smaller then 2 x 2. We opted to stay in our original 110 dollar a night room that we booked on Expedia, which we thought was much nicer. The room was spacious with a large closet, safe, comfy bed, and beautiful bathroom. Breakfast is offered at 7 EUR a day per person and seeing that it was mostly light foods (breads, cereal, no hot items, etc) we opted out. Overall, great time at Antiche Figure, how could you not enjoy a hotel that is 5 steps away from the Grand Canal??

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: nette15
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal being close to the bus connections to the airport, the cruise connections, the railroad station, and the vaporetti. The rooms were beautiful, the breakfast was very good, and the location was nice and quiet at night. The concierge was extremely helpful, going above and beyond what was necessary to make our first stay in Venice perfect. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked this place”
Reviews.Author: Nogbad
Reviews.Content: The Antiche Figure is on the Grand Canal, and we upgraded for the canal view rooms which look over the gondola station and into the railway station (which may not be the most romantic building in Venice, but it is one of the few built in the 20th century) A main bonus of the hotel is its proximity to the station and to the bus station at Piazzale Roma, which makes finding it easy. For first time visitors to Venice like we were, finding stuff is hard, if not impossible. We quickly learnt to relax and just walk - you cant go to far off course, mainly because of all the water. Venice is just amazing - not a bustling thriving city, more like a very upmarket theme park, but I loved it. The hotel worked for us without making us think that the hotel was the best part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location, Great Staff !”
Reviews.Author: SergioBuchJr
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in this Hotel, and the experience couldn't be better. All staff were great, with tips about the city, restaurants, etc. When we arrived, the guy at the front desk asked us if we would like to take a look at a room with a small balcony and view to the channel. We were tired from the trip and the price diference was small,so we decided to take it even without see it. Great choice ! Beyond the nice view to the channel, the room is large (from europe standards) great bathroom and very clean. Breakfast is very good and you have free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “WoW !!”
Reviews.Author: AngusSeattle
Reviews.Content: WE tried to stay here on our first night in Venice before our cruise but here was no availablity. Although we enjoyed our stay in Padua for the first night we would have REALLY felt like we were in Italy had we been able to stay here. We were fortunate to stay on our last night at a great rate of $126. The staff were the best I have ever seen. They went above and beyond to make things easy for us including an great room with a side canal view and a tub we were desparately desiring. And the rooms were outstanding! Such charm and so plush!! The real Venice style with the tall windows , flowing curtains,flowered wall paper ect.We were in France and Italy for 4 weeks and this was the nicest hotel we stayed at. We feel fortuante to have found it available. We would definatly stay again and encourage any considering this hotel to book if you can.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gorgeous Place -Can't wait to return to Venice to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Staff0rdDave
Reviews.Content: Unusually the Hotel was exactly as the Brochure -clean ,well appointed ,beautifully decorated & furnished ,staffed with friendly staff who were all ,with one exception, helpfull. The one exception was the night manager who recommended the "Ristorante Poveleda" to us -a truly dreadfull place,with poor service that should never have been recommended to anyone!Maybe there were 'kickbacks' involved! That criticism apart everything else about the Hotel was perfect; the breakfast was comprehensive &sumptious( by European standards) & at E7 a head a bargain compared to local cafes;the location is unbeatable 250M from Piazza Romana.We were delighted by the recommendation of the lady manager to visit "Osteria al Vecio Pozzo " an absolute treasure of a place -we went twice !!We will return to both Hotel & Ostaria

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: danovich
Reviews.Content: The staff here were absolutely fantastic - very helpful, explained all the sights to see and how to get there, provided maps, spoke perfect english, etc. The hotel is very nice and is in an excellent location less than 5 minutes walk from the main train station. Breakfast is a typical European breakfast, so don't expect too much. Also had free internet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: MizzouTraveler75
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure lives up to its reputation and favorable reviews - a great location on the Grand Canal, easy access from the train station, elegant rooms with a awesome balcony view, and a very friendly & attentive staff. The bar is small and the breakfast room can get a little crowded, but that adds to the ambiance. The only unappealing aspect of this fantastic family-run hotel is its price, but then what ISN'T expensive in Venice?

Reviews.Title: “A couple of tips”
Reviews.Author: Iloveyork
Reviews.Content: This is rightly a well regarded hotel with friendly staff and a grand canal location that is the shortest of walks from the Railway Station / P Roma. Booking direct seems to get you the breakfast thrown in that is often excluded with on line bookings. Also ask for a coffee at the bar -the breakfast room is 'blessed' with a make your own instant machine!

Reviews.Title: “great find near the station”
Reviews.Author: StamfordRaffles
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, but with no pretensions, three-star hotel in oldish building in Venice (where hotels are cramped and the rooms a quarter of the size of anywhere else). It has a basic and very small bar downstairs off the lobby and breakfast is a buffet in a ground floor room at the back. Its biggest advantage it that it is v near both the bus station and the railway station and at the Northern edge of the Grand Canal. That means it's easy to get to on arrival but within 15-20 minutes walking distance of Rialto Bridge. Head south and you can lose yourself (easily!) in winding backsteets that finish is dead ends or tiny bridges over canals before finally reaching San Marco via the Accademia bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff; Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: JacintaTheHague_NL
Reviews.Content: It was so easy to get from Treviso; take the bus, then an easy ten minute walk to the hotel. A friendly welcome and being greeted 'by name' was a great way to begin our 3 day getaway to Venice. Location was perfect, if only we could have controlled the weather! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Antiche Figure is where it's at!”
Reviews.Author: faotraveler
Reviews.Content: I can't be more enthustiastic about the Antiche Figure's location! For those arriving into Venice late at night, I can't think of a better place to stay! No wandering around lost in the dark searching alleyways for your hotel when all you want to do is get to sleep! We arrived around 11pm onto Piazza Roma (where the buses from the airport drop you off) and walked the short 5 minutes to the hotel. When we arrived, we were offered an upgraded room that included a view of the Grand Canal! Breakfast was adequate - not spectacular - but be sure to order your cappuccino from the waitstaff instead of getting it from the machine in the breakfast area - far superior! Great access to the Vaparetto, restaurants, and of course, the train station. Some might complain about the distance from Saint Mark's square, but we enjoyed the opportunity to jump on the Vaparetto or wander through the alleyways checking out all of the stores and restaurants along the way. The room itself was great; modern conveniences, roomy, and with a healthy minibar - free wireless internet was available, but only in the bathroom. Otherwise there was free access from the computer in the lobby. Would definitely recommend for a romantic getaway...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with excellent location and great service at reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: keithmervyn
Reviews.Content: When you arrive or depart Venice you really do need a hotel which is local to "the end of the road", i.e Piazalle Roma, or the main train station, where the water starts and you will be walking, with suitcases trundelling behind you, up and down many steps over the canal bridges. The Antiche Figure, just 300 metres from Piazalle Roma, is already well reviewed and for our 3 nights stay it could not be faulted. Well appointed, very clean, staff extremely helpful, good continental breakfast, etc. Importantly the price charged (150 Euros B & B, early November) is considerably lower than that being quoted by other contending hotels - remember Venice is EXPENSIVE. If you don't like that, then don't go there. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Clean. Friendly & Helpful. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lastylo
Reviews.Content: Sitting on the Grande Canal directly across from Stazione Centrale, the location could not have been more convenient nor the hotel staff more welcoming. Upon check-in, we were escorted to our room to ensure "we were pleased with the space," then our bags were delivered. Beautiful marble bathrooms appointed, of course, with Murano chandeliers. Great recommendations on sights and excursions. HIGHLY recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Read the fine print!”
Reviews.Author: Shar1805
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May and except for their misleading restaurant recommendations (don't every let anyone talk you into the fish of the day unless they tell you how much it will cost) and the "breakfast not included" condition we enjoyed it. The staff is very nice and the rooms are lovely. We went back in October with another couple. There was no room at Antiche so they stayed at the more luxurious 4 star hotel almost next door (Carlton). Their cost, including breakfast, was the same as ours! My opinion now is that Antiche Figure is rated too high on Trip Advisor's list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: deniuh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel before taking the train to Roma. The Hotel is centrally located by the train station, S.
