Lucia, Vaporetto stop, Gondola ride etc etc. Francesca and the rest of the staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make your stay fantastic. We were upgraded to a suite around the corner - the annex - at first we were skeptical but it was worth the extra Euros 40. The suite was recently renovated. Bathroom was lovely and the Canopy bed was simply beautiful. The location of this hotel is fantastic. We walked everywhere and it gave us a great opportunity to stroll the Venetian neighborhoods. We will definitely return to Hotel Antiche Figure next time we return to Venice. Thanks Tripadvisor for a great recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Oxypete
Reviews.Content: Everyone who works at this hotel is friendly and very helpful. The staff knows Venice and will help you enjoy this wonderful city. Their restaurant recommendations were excellent. The breakfast was simple and adequate. The hotel is an easy walk from the train station or Piazzale Roma where the airport bus will drop you off if you do not have lots of bags as there are bridges to cross. Do not attempt to walk to the cruise ship terminal - have the staff arrange a water taxi. We will be back again - this is an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: MrThompson
Reviews.Content: A first timer to Venice we were so impressed by the helpful and and friendly staff at the Antiche Figure which is so ideally located for everything - train,vaporetto,walking,croosing the canal and good food. We had a canal view deluxe on the top floor - views to die for and immaculately presented. We will be back to Antiche Figure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff and Room!”
Reviews.Author: dupk333
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews from TripAdvisor...it was everything as promised...The staff was wonderful, especially Carlos, who went out of his way to make sure my wife and I enjoyed our stay...Location is great, right across the Grand Canal from the train station...so when I saw the long lines for arriving travelers waiting for water taxis to their hotels, I knew I had made the right decision booking the Antiche Figure...Our room had a view overlooking the Grand Canal...which as I said is directly across from the train station...but none the less, it was nice to look out the window and see all of the activity in the area...Room was large with nice size bathroom...We would stay here again if we ever go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: hondo15
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've been to Venice; the first time was for a three-day stay in a rather expensive hotel at athe beginning of a two-week trip to Italy. This time we were going on a cruise out of Venice. The hotel in a great location -- near to the cruise pier and across the canal from the railway station. We discovered a whole new area of Venice to explore. Best of all was the staff. Gianni gave us great options for our room, arranged for us to travel to the pier with other guests at the hotel (so we were able to split the 100 euro cost) and made us feel like we were staying in someone's home instead of a hotel. Breakfast is included and is great. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in an excellent position”
Reviews.Author: JRGGRl
Reviews.Content: Booked this to celebrate 40th wedding anniversary following reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel performed to the high standard expected from previous reviews. One point to emphasise is the hotel's good location. It is possible to travel to and from Marco Polo airport by waterbus either directly or by changing at St Mark's. Many waterbuses stop opposite. It is also just around the corner from the bus station and opposite the railway station. It is well positioned to explore the less popular parts of Venice on foot and get away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Robert07
Reviews.Content: Arriving on a late flight and witnessing the despair of travellers trying to arrange transfers to hotels in out of the way parts of town we were thankful we had booked the Antiche Figure. A 20 minute â‚¬2.50 trip on the Number 5 bus brought us to Piazzale Roma from where it was a 5 minute walk along the Grand Canal to the hotel. No water taxi, no vaporetto, dead easy. The hotel offered excellent service without the pretentiousness of some of the larger establishments. Rooms were fine, we had a side room on the first floor. The hotel is opposite the main Ferrovia vaporetto stop so there is quite a bit of noise, noticable even with the windows closed. Personally I wouldn't pay extra for the front canal view rooms as the noise would be an issue for me. Breakfast was not included but the â‚¬7 charge was good value. We had our own restaurant recommendations from friends but the front desk man offered his own (uninvited) which we declined as we felt, rightly or wrongly, we were being pushed to his friend's places. There are a few outside tables and an evening drink on the Grand Canal watching the world go by was a delight. There are far more expensive and luxurious hotels than this, but as a comfortable and convenient mid-market hotel it is amongst the best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: jgthmc
Reviews.Content: Our family had two rooms in this hotel prior to starting our cruise out of Venice. On our return after the cruise we stayed in a neighboring hotel, Canal Grande, that is affiliated with this hotel. The hotel is located directly across from the train station and a short walk from Piazza Roma. We had stayed in hotels closer the Piazza San Marco during our two previous trips to Venice but chose this location because of the transportation options available at the Piazza Roma. Both Hotels were a perfect choice. The Antiche Figure was full on our return leg but they offered us a Suite for four people t the Canal Grande at a very reasonable price. The rooms were elegantly furnished with upholstered walls, marble baths and comfortable beds. The Canal Grande had only been open for two weeks and it is a little nicer. The Canal Grande hotel even had flat screen TV's hidden behind gilded mirrors. The personnel at both hotels were very helpful and arranged for water taxis and a trip to Murano island. To get to the hotels we took bus Number 5 from the airport to Piazza Roma at a cost of about 3 euros a person and it was about a 100 yard walk to the hotels. You have to cross a stepped bridge but we managed even though we had two suitcases that weighed close to 50 pounds each. It is about a forty minute walk to San Marco from the hotel but you would want to tour this area any way. We found the area near the hotels on the street, Strada Nova, to be our favorite part of Venice. It has many restaurants, grocery stores and shops. We found two wonderful restaurants and the prices are much less than those near the piazza San Marco. We will stay one of these two hotels on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JDouglasinVA
Reviews.Content: From the time we entered this hotel until the time we left, we felt as if we were at home or at least in a Bed and Breakfast Boutique. The staff were welcoming, courteous and went out of their way to ensure that we were comfortable, had directions on where to go and how to get there and coordinated an amazing tour of Murano and Burano for us. We were traveling with 7 folks including a 3-year old. They were able to put us in 3 rooms on the same floor, without us even having to request it. I thought about commending one of the individuals at the front desk, but they all deserve commendation. In a country far from home, they made our stay in Venice a memorable one. We didnâ€™t have to worry about bothering the staff or getting attitude when trying to figure out where/what to do because they were always available. This hotel is convenient to the train station and the bus lot. It is on the canal, but out of the hustle and bustle of Piazzo San Marco, but convenient to restaurants, stores, water metro and reaching San Marco gives you the opportunity to enjoy the stroll through the streets of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Italy - most friendly and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Miami_Jessica
Reviews.Content: From the moment my friends and I walked in to Antiche Figure, we were immediately greeted with a smile and offered advice on restaurants and places to go. This hotel has the best of all; convenient location, awesome staff, comfortable rooms, great breakfast with endless capuccini, and the best service you can get. This was the best stay among four hotels across four different cities we stayed in Italy. Special thanks to Carlo, Erasmo, Silvio, Francesca, Jessica, and Alessandro for making our stay a wonderful and memorable one! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure -- Very friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: austintoanywhere
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was wonderfully helpful. The location was excellent -- right across from the train station and the ferry stops. Loved Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: potter2984
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were greeted with a smile and upgraded to a suite. The room was beautiful. Staff was extremely helpful with lost luggage and advice on restaurants and transportation. Would go back and highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Venice. The location is perfect for walking or taking a valparetto.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough accolades for the staff and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 1956Lover
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Antiche Figure for our one pre-cruise night basically due to the close location of Plazza Roma (thanks to other pre-cruiser comments). When we arrived, the hotel staff offered us to stay at their new hotel, Canal Grande, that had just opened the day before, just a few blocks down from Hotel Figure. We were offered a room on the grand canal for the same price. This room was absolutely gorgeous - beautifully decorated with a four poster bed in gold brocade fabric. The staff could not have been nicer, even taking our luggage from the Hotel Figure to the Canal Grande. In the evening, we were offered a free drink of our choice, and while the hotel yet has table and chairs outside (the request has been made to the city) we sat on the small balcony and watched the boats go up and down the canel. The location is a plus if taking a cruise, or the train. Do take the bus from the airport to Plazza Roma, and the hotel is just down the street - within walking distanct. We were able to go St. Mark square and other sites with little effort (but the crowd was unbearable, we could not stay in that area). I would recommend this hotel in a heart beat......you will not find a nicer place to stay, or a more friendly staff. The staff was bending over backwards to make our stay as pleasant as possible - and they suceeded. Thank you Hotel Antiche Figure and Canal Grande for making our trip a memorable one. Wally and Alice Bell, Acworth, Georgia (October 2, 2009)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNell
Reviews.Content: Venice was the second stop on our honeymoon and this hotel was perfect. We got the bus from the airport to the station, and the hotel is just across from the station. Arriving late at night meant that we wanted little fuss and didn't want to get lost trying to find the hotel. The hotel is in a brilliant location, close to good shops and restaurants and of coruse the train station. It is about a 30min walk to St Marks and Rialto, but it's Venice, so you enjoy the stroll past all the shops as you get to those destinations. The room was very nice, tidy and quiet and the breakfast was very good too. The staff were fantastic and very helpful. We would stay here again that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Bitafun2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice, it's location on the Grand Canal was exciting, the rooms were above our expectations, with an excellent hotel staff, especially Ms. Francesca Zambotto. She gave us good advice about using local transportation around the city, recommended some fine dining areas, answered all our questions, made sure we were comfortable and without a doubt, helped us have a wonderful time in Venice. Bravo .... We will return !! Jim & Chris Carlsbad, CA. USA

Reviews.Title: “Get location!”
Reviews.Author: dlnicholl
Reviews.Content: It can't get much easier to arrive at this hotel! After an inexpensive (3 euros) and quick bus trip (20 minutes) from the airport, we had an easy 10 minute walk to this hotel on the Grand Canal. We got there at 10 AM and expected to just ask if we could leave our bags until check-in time but to our surprise we were able to check in as our room was ready. The hotel staff was very helpful with directions. We appreciated the free internet access in the lobby. The breakfast which was included was delicious and they provided a free water taxi ride and tour of the glass factory on Murano Island. Hotels in Venice aren't cheap, but I'd consider this hotel a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and genuinely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ks10583
Reviews.Content: spent a delightful 4 nights at the Antiche. Stayed in the suites annexed to the main hotel. The room was sweetly decorated (four poster bed) and very clean and fresh smelling. Updated bathroom with more than enough fresh towels. Breakfast was 'thrown in'...and was pretty good. Coffee made to order...we requested a double cappuchino that was the very best!!! Even when we missed the breakfast deadline we were invited to help our selves since breakfast had not been cleared away. Carla even made us coffee as we liked it that morning. As previous reviewers have noted the Antiche is truly a find. Will no doubt stay there again when we visit Venice next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality and location”
Reviews.Author: CSN
Reviews.Content: My mum and I were upgraded to a suite, which only had one bed but was ok. Our room was down an alley to the right of the main hotel. You may think this is a bit dodgy but really it is fine, there are loads of alley ways in Venice. It also meant it was quieter. Not really sure why it was a suite and we could not compare to a normal room, however it was very clean and had two armchairs to sit on (and another desk chair). BBC Worldwide on the TV. Powerful shower, no bath, canopy bed. Breakfast was not included in our rate but we paid 7 euros each per day to have breakfast in the main part of the hotel which was worth it. We have cereal, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, cold meats and cheese. The coffee was not very good from the machine however the waitress will make you one if you ask and not charge you any more which is better. Five euros for a diet coke and another five for a glass of wine in the hotel, this is the norm for anything on the grand canal - get used to it. We took up their offer of pasta on our first night, as we arrived at 10pm. It was costly and not that great but filled a hole. Directions for the hotel: If you have never been to Venice before remember there are loads of canals. The Grand Canal only has four bridges across it. If you arrive at Piazzale Roma, which is likely if you fly in then catch a bus/shuttle, you could come out of it any which way. Make sure you head for the "new bridge" - it looks new. However DO NOT go over it, stand at the bottom of the new bridge with the bridge on your left. Then turn with your back to it and walk forwards you will have to go over at least one, possibly two bridges over smaller canals. You will come to the hotel on your right. Please see pictures. It is right opposite the train station which is a slightly modern art deco long low building. Points of note for venice in general: Always take your map out with you (Time out is a great guide book) Check opening times and most importantly days of restaurants you like the look of so you are not disappointed when you go back and they are shut. Expect a cover charge - to include poptentially bread and sometimes service. This could be from one euro to five euros per person. Murano is worth a visit as is Lido. We got a 12 hour boat travel card for 16 euros which we made the most of.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RuthyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Venice several times, in wonderful places like La Calcina, and Hotel American, so our experience has always been excellent. This hotel, however, exceeded our expectations. It is beautiful, immaculate, and it has the friendliest staff we have encountered in Venice. They were so nice that I asked the two front desk people for their names: Alessandro E, and Carlo L. They were always ready with suggestions and ready to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The hotel is located across the train station, so it is extremely convenient. If we go back to Venice we will definitely go back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: beachNmargarita
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche Figure did not disappoint us in a way! Conveniently located within walking distance of Piazza Roma and across the Canal from the train station it was a perfect choice for us pre and post cruise. From the moment we arrived the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome showing us several rooms to choose from. Our room facing the Canal was a great choice. Large, clean and comfortable with a lovely bath it more than met our expectations. The English speaking staff was friendly and helpful allowing us to check in early, giving us helpful directions and information. Breakfast had many selections and was served either inside or outside adjacent to the lobby bar. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: malibu1London
Reviews.Content: When we first booked this hotel we were very concerned about its location. We were wanting to stay near San Marco..because that is all we knew of Venice, but after reading these reviews decided to book here anyway. We could not have been more happy with our decision. The location is excellent! You will not fully appreaciate how easy it is to get to and from this hotel from the Airport until you have spent time wandering Venice, which is truly like one big labrynth. Also we took in a day trip to Rome and this was very easy as we just had to walk across the bridge to the train station. Carlos and Franchesca were there to greet us upon arrival. We had arrived from Canada earlier than expected and they acted quickly to facilitate us with a room as we were both very tired from the flight. During our eight day stay the rooms were maintained emaculately and had every emenity that I could have expected. I suspect the only reason this hotel is rated a three star is because it doesn't have a restaruant but that was fine by us. We didn't travel half way across the world to eat at the hotel. As I would learn Carlos was a native of Venice and had some excellent suggestions as to where to eat. One restaurant in particular "Al Ponte dei Tolentini", was by far the best dinning experience we had in Venice. Also staff made arrangement for us to attend an Opera where they were showing "La Treviata", the opera house was not as grande as "La Fenice" but it was a nice experience and the staff arranged for a water taxi to pick us at the hotel and bring us there. These little things made a big difference in our stay as we would not have been able to arrange them on our own as neither of us spoke any Italian. We spent our days wondering the foot paths and exploring Venice. We got to see alot more of it than I think we would have if we had have booked in San Marco. San Marco is wonderful and we eventualy ended up there every day, but the journey there was half the fun. If I had to offer one critism, it would be the bar tender Silvio.....but that might be because I don't like anyone younger and better looking than me who diverts my girlfreinds attention;) Actually he was great, and we enjoyed some laughs together out on the patio. He even chilled our vine that we bought at a nearby store which we drank by the canal. Overall a fantastic location and hope to be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: fatnipples
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her from 9/4-9/7. We were there for the film festival and the Regatta. The hotel really is in a perfect location. Right across the bridge from the train station. Don't worry you can't here the trains. After spending three days in Venice I really began to understand just how important this location was. We saw so many tourists dragging there bags through crowded narrow coble stone streets looking for their hotels. It just looked like a nightmare. Taking the water bus also looked like a nightmare since it was super packet and water taxis are outrageous. We had the canal vie double room. The room was great. right on the water and a window in the shower which is nice. The staff is all very friendly and helpful. There are several tables outside to sit and have a drink or coffee. We spent a few hours each day just hanging out watching the gondola guys argue with people over the price. Here's a tip. It's going to cost you 80EUR so dont bother trying to hagle.in Three days i saw one couple get it for 70EUR. Its not worth the trouble. I also recommend not getting the water bus mustiples day pay or even taking the water bus. It is not worth it. you can walk to most of the places in the same time it takes for the water bus. It is much more romantic and interesting just to walk. Its very confusing to walk but you figure it out. I didnt take once water bus and i couldnt be happier. Back to the hotel's location. Its unbeatable. The main area near St. Marks is so crowded its just plain nuts and there are always cruise ships in. I dont know if i would go back to Venice as its more of a place you only need to see once but i would recommend this hotel to anyone. Its a little pricey but so is every other decent hotel. Great hotel and staff. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: ChrisEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the recommendation of friends and the reports on Tripadvisor. Every aspect of our stay was perfect. From the prompt friendly email response, the location, the lovely pristine bedroom, the friendly staff who couldn't do enough to help everything was as we had hoped. Well done, you just get it right!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, well-designed rooms, lovely outdoor bar.”
Reviews.Author: pandjBerkshireUk
Reviews.Content: We would support other travellers' reviews of this small hotel in Venice. The staff are amazingly helpful and friendly, excellent (small) rooms and bathrooms and we enjoyed breakfast, afternoon and late night drinks outside overlooking the Grand Canal. Although it's a vaporetto ride to St Mark's Square the area behind the hotel is quieter and very atmospheric with many interesting buildings, bars and retaurants. A highlight was walking to the Scuola Giovanni Evangelista (only 5 minutes away) for a small scale production of Tosca - unforgettable. For a bird's eye view of Venice get the No 2 vaporetto to San Giorgio Maggiore and go up to the top of the Campanile. Much quieter than the tower in Piazza San Marco. We wish the proprietor well with his new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location right on Grand Canal with helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBmsydney
Reviews.Content: what a great find this hotel was thanks to trip advisor, would definitely stay here again. Our room was spacious and clean, breakfast was wonderful and the staff could not be more helpful

Reviews.Title: “what a treasure-wonderful location and staff so friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: BandJWestSussexUk
Reviews.Content: we were thrilled with the hotel and the staff were so welcoming. Room (Room 312) a spotlessly clean double luxury one with very comfortable huge bed and plenty of room, occasional chairs and well stocked mini-bar, at the front overlooking station. So much going on and fascinating to watch from. Ideal location for water buses (vaporetto). Could be a little noisy with the windows open but no problem at all with them closed as they they are double-glazed. Not far to cart suitcases from the bus station which is real plus point in Venice. Very good breakfast- nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Would we go there again? You bet!!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: OnlineLounge
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is just over the bridge from the train station, so it's very easy to get to and from. But that just makes it even more appealing. The rooms were great (big bathrooms, comfort all around), but the best of all was the staff. I've stayed in hundreds, if not thousands of hotels around the world, and I had the best service of my life at the Antiche Figure. For example: I'd booked two rooms, but some friends joined us so we needed three. They were sold out. The staff called some of their friends at other hotels and found a room at a 4-star hotel about 5 minutes away at a ridiculously good "friend" rate. When I asked if he could show us where it was on a map, he (Carlos) said: "No, I'll take you there." And walked us 5 minutes over to the other hotel to make sure we didn't get lost. That was the first of many "This would never happen in the States." moments from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...great service...highly reccomended...”
Reviews.Author: Rpk071
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small boutique hotel right on the grand canal. An excellent base to explore Venice by walking- water taxis are not worth it! It's also right opposite the railway station and the water bus stand. But what's most appealing about this hotel is the service. They had in fact botched up our rooms because of a double booking but they made up for it by putting us up in the best room at their fancy sister hotel so that we could watch the regatta and then charging us much less than they had quoted initially to make up for it - all on their own! Carlos is brilliant and very sweet! ask him for eating options because a lot of the tourist cafe's are rip off's. All in all an excellent experience. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt would return to Hotel Antiche the second time around.”
Reviews.Author: lsleeper1019
Reviews.Content: great Hotel, great staff & service. Staff spoke engish fairly well and were eager to help answer questions.Rooms were very clean, breakfast good.We loved the location, right across from the train station so that was great when we were checking out. Only advice I would give is have the hotel staff get porters to take your luggage over the bridge for you. We were 4 women traveling and we had 4 large suitcases so it was well worth the 10 euros each to have them hold on to the luggage and get it on the train for us when we were ready to board. The waterbus transport is great, you can pay like 16 euros and ride the waterbus everywhere for 24-48hrs. I can't say anything negative about our stay at Hotel Antiche it was perfect for our stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler02
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a more convenient and attentive hotel. The staff were extremely helpful, and our room was gorgeous! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice for business or pleasure. It's located directly across the grand Canal from the train station, so that makes easy reference for finding your way back while exploring this maze of a city. We got lost several times, but that made it even better because we got to see parts of Venice that we otherwise would have missed. The people were friendly, and the food and shopping were first rate. We will definitely be returning to Venice, and when we do, we will stay at Antique Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location-easy to find; Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AusBrit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the Grand Canal straight opposite St Lucia rail terminus. Our room was at the back so no view but we didnt plan to be inside often! We struck Venice on their hottest week-over 30 most days so were ecstatic with the air-conditioner! The staff were friendly and very helpful-spoke good English. We took up the offer of 7euro breakfast as everything is pricey (ie a coffee was 3.00). We sat outside on the plaza, overlooking the canal each morning though they did have a breakfast room inside. They provided juices, hot drinks, 3 cereals, choice of pastries, bread, jam , fruit and yoghurt-plenty to keep us going all morning. Food in Venice is expensive. There are a couple of supermarkets. There are also plenty of restaurants but we found they all had pretty well the same offerings-set price 3 courses from 12-20eu ea: pasta, pizza or chicken or fish-both the latter ones with little imagination or taste. You get an entree, main and the 3rd course is salad or potatoes with the main! We found a place we went back to frequently for its value. Cant remember the name but if you continue past the rail terminus towards San Marco, its a few hundred metres down on the left. The staff all wear black & orange-bright orange caps! and they have an ice cream servery facing the street - best value ice creams on Venice! They give huge scoops so for 1.20 for one scoop its more than enough. On the other side of the shop is the pizza bar. You can choose from their menu or have made to order. We found the small size (12") adequate to share and at 6eu great value. We bought some cheap but nice italian wine at the supermarket and sat on a jetty/pier ea night watching life go by. Theres lots to do. The vaporetto (water buses-ferries) are the best way to get around-buy day passes and go everywhere. In peak hour theyre busy so youll have to stand. Our hotel organised a 'free' water taxi transfer to Murano island, where all the fantstic glassware factories are. Be aware: they take you to the large galleries and its hard not to feel pressured to buy, but resist and treat it as an art gallery-fantastic! As we didnt buy we also didnt get a return trip back and were directed to the ferry, but we walked around the entire isalnd (its not huge)and found lots of family crafts/shops selling glass jewellery, ornaments, home wares, art etc at considerably cheaper prices but all authentic Murano. 8 eu for a trip up the tower lift in San Marco square is well worth the panoramic view from the top, and youll find loads of market stalls to barter at, as well as all the designer shops. Theres also a number of concerts held in the ancient churches in the evenings, worth going to. Friends of ours were lucky enough to 'happen upon' an Andre Boccelli full final rehearsal in San Marco one afternoon-for no cost!!! We didnt do the gondolas-most want 80eu and whilst its economical if the boat is shared (some took 6), its not as romantic, and too expensive for us. We took the airport bus from Treviso airport at about 7eu return. Take note: on return you are allocated a bus by your departure flight. We like to be at airports well ahead of time (learnt the hard way!) but were told we had to wait for another hour. I guess they need to give priority to passengers on earlier flights, and we did arrive the 2 hrs ahead as recommended, on our allocated bus. Our hotel was happy to hold our luggage after checkout, & even to use their lobby bathroom to freshen up before we left. Another note: there are lots of public loos in Venice, all serviced and all charging 1.50eu to use!! (the rail stationis slighly better at .80cents!) I was aware that many hotels are difficult to find as its so easy to get lost in the maze of Venetian streets; I did a google map of ours before we arrived-I chose the 'walk to' option and had no problems locating ours. The hotel decor was 'olde worldd' Venice, but wtih all the mod cons and it looked recently refurbished. The bed (queen) was great and we didnt feel sqeezed in. We had a large marble bathroom (shower over bath) and small fridge with tea/coffee making facilities. All in all a perfect location at a perfect price.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem in this jewel of a city”
Reviews.Author: Pinkcatsmum
Reviews.Content: To get straight to the point, the Hotel Antiche Figure is perfect for your stay in Venice. It's in a fantastic location, right on the Grand Canal and very convenient for the public transport system both in Venice itself and to and from the airport. The staff couldn't be more pleasant and helpful and our bedroom was just lovely. It didn't matter that the hotel lacks certain facilities - let's face it, all you need in Venice is a comfortable room in a great location with staff who'll do their best to please. The rest of your time should be spent just soaking up the atmosphere, history and vibrancy of this most beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: EvcaK
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Venice with my boyfriend and his family in this hotel and thought it was absolutely brilliant. The rooms were very nicely decorated and vere spotlessly clean. The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. It was really easy to get around. It only took a couple of minutes to get to the bus station, the train station is just across the canal and so is the waterbus.. Breakfast was very nice, breadrolls, cheese, ham, fruit, yoghurts, cakes, pastries.... I'm really glad we chose this hotel for our stay in Venice, we all had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: worldatmyfingerops
Reviews.Content: Great location. Small but superb rooms and bathrooms, Excellent touches abound. Good breakfast with all the amenities. Above all, superb staff, friendly, helpful, always available. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: VandykeWoburnSands
Reviews.Content: A very warm welcome from the helpful staff. Rooms kept spotless. Excellent breakfast buffet really sets you up for the day. Ideal location for access to all parts of Venice. Will stay at the Antiche Figure on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant time”
Reviews.Author: Royals84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for our 25th wedding Anniversary. Couldn't of had a better place to stay. Picked this hotel after reading all the good reviews and really glad we did.The staff were friendly and were happy to help if you needed anything. We had the red rooms which are down the side but still had a small view out of the side window. Room was not that large but had everything you needed and a lovely bathroom. Venice is a magical place and easy to get around. Breakfast was good, did a range of cold meats, yoghurt etc. Location was excellent on the Grand Canal as the starting point for the vaporettos was just 5 mins walk away where you could get to most places from. At first we were worried we would experience too much noise, but it was fine. Hotel about 5 mins walk from the coach drop off point from airport and only about 2 bridges to cross, which is a good thing with cases. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a beutiful place, however...”
Reviews.Author: Miguel_Resende
Reviews.Content: It is a bit expensive and in the smaller rooms you don't get a tub, but you will feel confortable and rested there, besides, it is in front of the railway station and at a small distance walk to the buses to the airports.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Hotel - best ever value even after many Venis stays”
Reviews.Author: Heidelbergredwoods
Reviews.Content: This is a jewel of a hotel. Don't let the location "across from the train station" put you off. It is an ideal location on the grand canal. We chose this hotel because of the reviews and its location - very suitable for someone who has trouble walking as you can get there by crossing only one bridge from the train station. We stayed in the new depandance - just 1 minute walk from the hotel. Rooms were extremely nice and roomy (FOR VENICE ! ). Service was fantastic, breakfast a treat. We can highly recommend this hotel and we will DEFINATELY stay again as the service and hotel feal were at least one star higher than it is officially rated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: DollyNyc
Reviews.Content: Cute would be a great word for this hotel very conviniently across the railway station. It definitely was'nt tough to find it. Location could not have been better. This is a cute little hotel with venetian charm. I loved the venetian furnishings. Hotel was ideal for its price. Breakfast was glorius. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location to arrive to - rather out of the way if here for 3days”
Reviews.Author: ehorner
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very far away from St Marco Square. If you want to spend a lot of time in this area this is not the hotel you want to stay at. We arrived from the train which made commuting to this hotel very easy! Simply walk across the bridge and you are there. Very nice. getting to the airport was rather easy to as it's a short walk to Piazza Roma for the Bus/taxi. I would have preffered a nicer bed (common critisism that i personally have) but we upgraded to a canopy room for an extra 30EUR a night (+ breakfast) which made the room rather nice.

Reviews.Title: “Romance all the way”
Reviews.Author: Carol5LL
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly helpful staff - romantic views of the canal. Can't fault this hotel, and want to go back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “They really make you feel special here”
Reviews.Author: Piglethead
Reviews.Content: My man and I stayed here in late July 2009. There was a slight hiccup with our booking, however, it was dealt with very professionally and we left the Antiche Figure very satisfied with the room which was a gorgeous suite, and the staff who made us feel really special. The location was brilliant, the breakfasts very tasty, the whole place was very clean and quiet and our favourite thing was to sit outside the hotel in the evenings with a coffee and watch all the goings on along the Grand Canal. After travelling the world for 7 weeks we have to say that of all the hotels we stayed at, the Antiche Figure was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FABULOUS! GOLD STARS+++ Hotel Antique Figure in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: AkayToronto
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had the good fortune to board a cruise to Greece from the Port of Venice. We selected the Hotel Antiche Figure because it was situated on the Grand Canal, full of historic Venetian charm and it's proximity to the cruise port. Great location! Simply Gorgeous! Spacious air conditioned deluxe room complete with sitting area. We stayed in room 412 with a canal view. Superb silk tapestries, gold leaf trims, quality carpeting. Large bathrooms (bath and shower) elegantly finished with marble and murano glass. Management and front desk staff Alessandro (the Manager), Francesca and Gianni were extremely polite and very accommodating. GREAT LOCATIONâ€¦just opposite the Railway Station and Vaporetto (water taxi) stop and a short walk from the Airport Bus Terminal in Piazzale Roma. We hired a private water taxi (Mauro +39 3409232186) right from the airport terminal desk. He was just learning English and was absolutely charming . Our broken dictionary Italian and his broken English was delightful. He shuttled us back and forth between the airport, cruise ship terminal and provided a tour of the area. Wonderful way to see Venice. We wished our stay was longer than planned. Very safe and comfortable and we would definitely go backâ€¦The Hotel Antiche Figure is a definite must when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “absolutly perfect, romantic and beautifull outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: rehbergs
Reviews.Content: we got a suite and it was big and sooo beautifull, fabric on the walls, a huge 2 person shower with like 6 shower heads and a rain maker showerhead. i loved the decor. the bar guy is super cute, lol and really nice as is all the staff. the hotel manager is remarkable. the service is A1. the only thing this hotel didnt have was a restraunt attached for room service, but there was so many restraunts within walking distance it didnt matter! the breakfast was the best we experianced on our vaction. we were on a mmonth long vacation in rome, venice, london and paris and this was the favorite place for sure. THE SERVICE COULD NOT BE BEAT. the real FRIENDLY and accomidateing employees were a treat. i am sorry i took so long to post this review! you can walk with your bags from the train station, just cross the bridge. lots of shopping close. great food close.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto...”
Reviews.Author: tvland224
Reviews.Content: What an amazingly wonderful surprise! We were in Venice only two nights, but were happy with everything about the hotel, including ease of getting to/from, proximity to everywhere we wanted to see, the food, but in particular, the service was unbelievably accommodating, and we went away with not only priceless memories, but new friends (the hotel staff) who went way beyond the call of duty to make our stay comfortable and easy. Carlo, in particular, was a most gracious host. We asked if he was an owner, after checking in, and was surprised to learn he was staff, he had taken an owner's kind of interest in making sure even special requests (wine appeared on our gondola ride. which Carlo also arranged) were managed with ease and willingness. And the price... we didn't find a better value anywhere. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Small and beautifully formed.un”
Reviews.Author: JayeLondon
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, was attending a conference in Venice and staff were helpful and friendly from the moment I rang with a query. Stayed in a standard room which, like the rest of the hotel ,was immaculately clean. It was also nicely furnished and very comfortable; the bathroom had a marble floor and chandalier wall lights. The toiletries smelled of fresh grapefruit and there were lots of lovely clean white towels. The hotel is easy to find being very close to both the train and bus station. If you arrive at the airport don't bother with a taxi, it drops you in the same place as the express bus which only cost 3 euros Breakfast at the hotel was a very fresh cold buffet of lovely pastries, bread, fruit, yoghurt etc and was all the more enjoyable for being eaten on the terrace overlooking the grand canal. There were lots of great eateries and shops locally and the area feels a bit more authentic than staying near San Marco or Rialto. Had one of the best meals of my life in a local restaurant. Don't know where they find their staff or how they train them, but if they could bottle it they'd make a fortune. Everyone, without exception, was wonderfully friendly, helpful and courteous, but not in a horrible sycophantic way. I stayed at Antiche Figure with three colleagues all of whom loved the hotel too. Because I was in Venice to attend a conference, I didn't have very much time to look around and so want to return fairly soon - staying at the Antiche Figure of course!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: garyPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice this month. The hotel is about 200 yards from the Piazzale Roma along the Grand Canal. Drag your bags over two bridges. Our accommodations were very comfortable, with good air conditioning a must in July! Breakfasts were OK. The staff happily made us all capuccinos each morning. We enjoyed sitting outside the hotel having a drink looking out at all the acitivties on and around the Grand Canal. The best feature of the hotel was the staff, especially Alessandro Fornasier (the general manager) and Francesca Zambotto (the assistant manager). We got confused, and tried to leave a day early. Francesca gently pointed out our mistake; we had a laugh together, and had our bags taken back to the room. We then went on a 12-day cruise. We realized we had lost my sterling silver money clip with some cash. When we returned to the hotel, Alessandro told us the clip had been found, and produced it for us! Great people! Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was amazing”
Reviews.Author: DebbieOwingsMillMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure two days prior a cruise departure and one day after the cruise. We came in before the normal check in time and they gave us a room with little or no wait both times. We are extremely thankful because the first day we had jet lag and were very tired. Throughout our stay they were so very helpful. The young lady called a museum for us to see if our tickets were good from our previous stay, another gentleman gave internet assistance for printing our boarding passes, they gave us countless directions, bus times, and just went out of their way to be a good host during our stay. The hotel is at a great location for the train, bus, or going to the marina for a cruise. I loved the walk to St. Mark's, it was an adventure going through the maze of streets to get there. The rooms are small, but very clean and charming. We enjoyed sitting outside in the evening having a glass of wine and watching all the people. We were thankful that they had free internet to be in contact with our family back home. To save lots of money do not take the water taxi to the airport, take the public transportation. It's a little bit a hassle, but you can save a lot. You only have to go over two small bridges and you're at the bus terminal. If you have lots of luggage, it may be a good idea to take the taxi. The staff is deserving of the wonderful rating. Thank you Hotel Antiche Figure helping us to have a wonderful experience in Venice. Max and Debbie

Reviews.Title: “Great, hotel with a super convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: vacations-r-thebest
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our European holiday and had a nice 2 days in Venice thanks to Hotel Antiche Figure. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and the staff was very accommodating. Beware that the wall are extremely thin and you can hear your neighbors. The AC worked really well, and we used it often due to the incredible heat and humidity. The location was great, right across the canal from the train station, which is where we arrived from. Rather than wait for one of the crowded boats to take us across, we dragged our bags across the bridge. It was hard, but well worth the time and money we would have wasted on a hot, packed boat. When you stay be sure to sit outdoors and have a drink from their bar, they're a bit pricey, but it's worth it! I loved that it offered free wireless internet, since we had a laptop. I'm not sure I'd return to Venice again, especially in the summer. There were WAY too many tourists and everything was super crowded. However if I decide to re-visit Venice off season, I would definitely stay at this great hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Carlo is a rock star”
Reviews.Author: maxi531
Reviews.Content: I can't review the hotel because they booked my reservation for August instead of July but they ended up putting me in the Sofitel hotel around the block (a little farther walk but a very nice hotel). Carlo was extremely nice and apologetic and walked me over to the hotel. I would have liked to have stayed at the Antiche (being #4 on trip advisor instead of #175 which is what the sofitel is) but i had no complaints about the alternate accomodations. Verify your reservations before you go1

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: ambicion6
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend stay at the Hotel Antiche. The hotel is charming and the rooms are very nicely decorated. The location is excellent! its about 5-7 min walk to the Santa Lucia Train station. Avoid taking a water taxi from the airport to the hotel. Its crazy expensive. Just take the ATVO bus. the ticket machines are located right where the bag claim area is and its only 3Euro/ticket for a one-way trip. The hotel is also located right in front of water bus stop (the vaporettos) so you can take the water bus to San Marco plaza or just walk there. its about a 25 min walk which is not bad at all because you see so many cool things along the way. We had the breakfast (7 euro/person) and it was quite nice. they have the usual - yogurts, cereals, boiled eggs, ham, cheese, croissants, other sweet breads, fruit and juice as well as coffee and tea. I think its worth it to get the breakfast because Venice is rather expensive and at least this way you can eat alot before making your way out to see the sights. If you want to visit Murano, the hotel will call a taxi for you. Its free, the only kicker is that you have to go to a 20 min tour of the factory and listen to a sales pitch. but you dont have to buy anything. if youre not into sales pitches, you can take a water bus to Murano and the other islands from the stop across the hotel. And, if you're coming from the US, and you pre-paid your hotel already, but did not get the breakfast, and decided to add it on, dont let them charge you in dollars when you check out (they told us we would get a better rate - so not true). Have them charge you the breakfast in euros. you'll get a better exchange rate from your credit card company. Also, when you check out, do not take a water taxi to the hotel (its about 60 euro). just walk to the santa lucia train station and take the ATVO bus (its 3 euros/person and takes 15-20mins to get to the airport and its air conditioned!)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller1001
Reviews.Content: Robert and I travel extensively for business and can compare this hotel to many five star luxury hotels . This is my favourite hotel in five years . The staff are so very friendly and helpful .Arriving at 7 .15 am they let us drop our bags and check into the rooms when they became available . The grand canal rooms have lovely views and the windows are double glazed there are shutters and well lined curtains, The noise for the canal was very muffled and did not bother anyone in our party . The rooms away from the canal are supposed to me even more luxurious.Our bed was enormous and we had a lovely bathroom with endless hot water.The staff answered my endless queries with charm and humour .We left our bags there until we left Venice much later that evening . The staff are a huge attribute to this very well run hotel but the facilities are also excellent .Being very close tot he station there are many ice cream stalls and food stalls available apart from many restaurants and a pharmacy . The vaporettos from the station are frrequent and we always hopped on effortlessly even in rush hour .We hope to return soon !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: qetisa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon in Venice where we stayed at the Antiche Figure hotel. The hotel is only 5minutes walk from Piazzale Roma, which is where all the buses stop (including the direct bus from Treviso airport). The hotel is also opposite the Santa Lucia train station and the traghetto stop. This makes the location of this hotel ideal for a stay in Venice. The hotel is small but the rooms are nicely decorated and very clean, with a view of the canal. All members of staff are extremely nice and helpful and have made our stay at this hotel even nicer. Will surely return to this hotel on our next trip to Venice and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Marcolasvegas
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas, where we have fantastic hotels, with great customer service, but I have never experienced the kind of customer service that you will experience in this hotel, even thou it's in Italy :) (I'm originally from there). While everybody is great - i seriously thought that they were all co-owners the first day, seeing how professional they all were - Carlo definetely stands out for his genuine passion for what he does and his willingness to please you at all times. When I saw a negative review about him I had to step in with this review, I can only think of a personal attack or revenge of some kind, Carlo gave us the best experience ever. This hotel is highly recomend it by me and my wife

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, very, very hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: MGSteve
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the best hotels in Venice. It may not be the most luxurious, it may not be the biggest, it may not be next to St Marks' square. It is however, just about perfect in every other regard! The rooms are comfy, the staff go out of their way to accommodate you. They'll look after your bags if you arrive early or need to catch a late train or bus on your way out. For any brits flying Ryan Air, this is a very easy hotel to get to. The bus drops you off at the bus station, follow the signs for the train station, cross over the big bridge onto the pavement on the other side of the canal to the station, turn right and its about a hundred yards up the canal side! We had a canal view room when my wife and I went back to Venice this summer (we stayed at the same hotel on our first visit). It was only a short break (a long weekend), but we loved it. The water bus stop is just the other side of the bridge and from there you can get pretty much anywhere in Venice within 30 mins. So as far as location goes, yes it may not be next to the square, but equally, you don't have to walk through Venice with all your luggage when you arrive and depart! The only downside (really with Venice as a whole) is cost. To stay a week is eye-wateringly expensive and to be honest, once you've done the normal touristy things you'd be bored. We'll only go back for long weekends now, to sit on the water boats and watch Venice go by, have a good meal out and have a wonder down the narrow roads. Venice is lovely, but whatever you do, don't go for more than a week at absolute tops. You'll be bored out of your mind. Oh, and penny-less as well! But as far as this hotel goes, for us its the pick of Venice. Facilities wise, they have internet access in the form of a shared computer - so don't expect Wifi or anything. But its free and reasonably quick.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel excellat staff and location”
Reviews.Author: cbm22
Reviews.Content: Very nice hoel clean rooms and good location for travelers. The staff was extremly helpfull except for one staff member who said his name is Carlos, on our last night he told us, and other guests, that their was a planed bus strike for our departure day. Carlos stated he could provide us with a taxie in the morning if we agreed to book it that night. We made a check with a near by hotel and the staff told us the strike was not true. The next day there was no strike and we continued our trip. I woould also recommend they do away with the coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “My Very Honest Opinion”
Reviews.Author: MBOROFC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break and thought I would take the time to give my views on the Hotel Antiche Figure. A lot has already been said and I would concur with all the previous positive comments about location, decoration of rooms, cleanliness etc. Where I think the Hotel excels is the exceptional customer service skills, attention to detail and the willingness to go that extra mile to make our stay as pleasant and as stress free as possible. From the moment we booked, till the moment we left nothing was too much trouble from the housekeepers, bar staff, breakfast staff and front of house. It really would not be fair to single an individual but Carlo did go the extra mile to answer any queies we had. I honestly believe that if you leave this Hotel feeling dissatisfied then you have not raised your concerns to the appropriate people while you were there giving them the opportunity to resolve the issues. Once again, thank you all for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I could have asked for in Venice”
Reviews.Author: fin3222001
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to find out that the train station was right across the bridge from the hotel and no more than a 15-20 min taxi drive from the airport. The hotel is quite a walk from San Marco, but you will be walking to other places anyway. The service in the hotel was exemplary, and they accomodate you very well. Only complaint was that our room had no access to the internet. Additionally, we requested tickets to the opera and the front desk accomodated us VERY well and quickly. Plenty of restaurants to choose from near the hotel. The rooms were quite nice and clean. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and when I come back to Venice, I will definitely seek out a room there first!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location!”
Reviews.Author: uklkb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor comments. I always have to laugh when people's biggest complaint about hotels in Europe is the size of the hotel room. It's Europe, people! You aren't going to get a huge hotel room, but the room at Hotel Antiche Figure is a great size. The front desk staff is extremely friendly and they've got a great bar with outdoor seating. We loved sitting out there with a glass of wine after a long day of sightseeing. The location is right across from the train station so the hardest part is lugging your bags over a bridge. If you stay down in St. Mark's Square, it's going to cost a fortune to take a water taxi. It's a slight way to the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square, but there's a vaporetto stop right across the way if you don't want to walk. They also have wi-fi, but you have to ask for the code. The breakfast is NOT included, so we didn't try it. It was rather pricey and we preferred to get a small pastry on the way. All in all, this hotel was extremely clean and the service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorskPearl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure as many others before us have! It really was a perfect place to stay because of the convenience of getting to the train station and the bus station. Being on the grand canal wasn't half bad either! The staff was very accommodating. We noticed it the most when a demanding guest insisted they MUST have skim milk (not 1%). The next day for breakfast they went out and specifically bought skim milk just for this one guest. The Murano tour that they give for free is really great, but they try very hard to sell you their extremely expensive glass at the factory so stay strong if you don't want any :) The cafe was great and we loved sitting out at the tables and ordering a cafe latte. The rooms were on the small side and it seems that they only recommend the same 2 restaurants over and over to people because we ended up at one with guests from 3 other tables from the Hotel Antiche Figure as well. However, over all, it was a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent................again!”
Reviews.Author: Fredbear
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Antiche Figure. We stayed last year and praised it to the roof tops, we returned this year, and no it wasn't a fluke! The location was still excellent, who wants to haul their cases on the packed vaporetto to their hotel?, nope not us. Quite literally a five minute walk from Piazza Roma and you are there. We booked direct with the hotel this time, and on arrival were offered one of the suites (down the alley) at the same rate we had booked the room at. The same room as last year, and still as good. ALL the staff are wonderful, I don't know where Allessandro and Francesca find them, but they are obviously excellent judges of character. I've said it before and I'll say it again, and again, and again this is a wonderful hotel They tell us they are opening a second hotel over the Scalzi Bridge, a 4* establishment. I'm sure it will be excellent, but when we return I'm pretty certain it will be to the Antiche Figure. I think we would miss sitting outside at the tables right next to the canal, watching the world go by. I only hope some of the excellent staff stick by the Antiche Figure and don't defect to the new place, they are a huge part of the overall perfection of the place. I'm sure the new one as I say will be perfect, if anyone can do it, Allessandro and his staff can, but we would miss the Antiche. Keep up the good work, we'll be back to check :o)

Reviews.Title: “Deserves all the praise it gets”
Reviews.Author: Balix
Reviews.Content: I can only add to what others have said about this hotel, it is wonderful. We booked through Expedia who offered a good flight/hotel deal. Venice hotels are not cheap and the Antiche Figure does not buck the trend but in comparison with others in the city it was averagely priced. Despite being at the other end of the Grand Canal from San Marco, it could not be more conveniently placed for visitors arriving in Venice. It lies opposite the train station just one bridge away and is just three minutes and two bridges away from Piazzale Roma where the Airport bus drops you off. The Water Bus stop is over the bridge by the station which enables you to reach any part of the city easily enough and most places are easily reached on foot through the labyrinth of alleyways and canal banks that make this city unique. Outside the front door is a Gondola pier for that must have, if expensive, trip on the traditional Venetian boat. Having got there you will be welcomed by the most pleasant, friendly and helpful staff you can imagine. We had booked a triple room which meant we would occupy a suite. This, along with a number of others, was not situated in the main hotel building but in the apartment block next door. Access was up the alley to the right of the main building and entry was remotely controlled by the hotel staff who utilised CCTV to ensure only guests would get access. This arrangement might put some people off but please donâ€™t let it â€“ it worked well and gave the impression of occupying an actual Venetian apartment. The suite itself could not have been nicer. There was a living area, a bedroom and a shower room. The third bed was made up in the living area which also had a small kitchen behind glass doors. The bedroom was not overly big but perfectly acceptable and nicely decorated. The shower was really impressive with water jets attacking you from all angles, though the taps had a mind of their own sometimes. The apartment is air conditioned which was a godsend on a hot, humid summerâ€™s day. We were only there two nights prior to a cruise but it would have been a perfect base for a week or even longer. Back in the main building there was a small bar next to the reception. There were tables outside, ideal to watch the world float by. The breakfast area was behind and served a typical continental style breakfast buffet for 7 Euros per head. I was delighted to find that good quality internet access was free and not used as a source of revenue by the hotel. A cable is supplied for your laptop for use in the room and a PC, along with wireless access for you laptop, is available in the lobby area. Iâ€™m not surprised that this hotel rates #4 in Trip Advisorâ€™s list of nearly five hundred Venice hotels. What is surprising is that three other hotels rate higher. When we return to Venice this will be the hotel we stay in, without a shadow of doubt. Alessandro and his staff can be rightly proud of all the positive reviews they have received.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Alottosee
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, friendly and helpful staff, very clean room and wonderful location. All around, a wonderful experience and would most definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Makes Venice Easy to Navigate”
Reviews.Author: curves
Reviews.Content: Sorry it took so long I have been swamped at work I only stayed one night at the hotel Antiche Figure BUT it was great. We were greeted warmly and asked if we wanted to upgrade to a jr suite(people there left early) but after a journey and a half I just wanted a shower and to eat(the room wasnt ready yet) We had an adorable room for 3.One double bed and one twin. The A/C was awesome and it was hot outside. The bathroomis very spacious and very bright. The shower floor is flat with the rest of the bathroom floor so you need to navigate the water stream but how long is a shower ?!. (the kids joked that if dad was there, the shower might have been a bit tricky, just keep the water streaming downward not outward) They have the cutest little bar and room off to the side of the hotel spilling onto a small outside sitting terrace On our first nite I sat outside and had a wonderful summer drink I think its called Prosseco? It was refreshing and lovely sitting by the canal at sunset The next morning we had breakfast at the outside terrace that was great . I had picked this hotel because it was close to the train station so after breakfast we crossed the bridge in front of the hotel to the train station, real convenient. Hotel also convenient to the gondola rides(right in front of hotel) across the bridge for vaporettos, and a lovely walk to St Marks square thru all the narrow and wide street full of shops places to eat. really fun. If you stayed farther in you might not do that walk. Prices are comparable to most in Venice. I payed 259e for a triple with breakfast as I had shopped this was a good price for a hotel that fit all my needs. I would certainly stay there again , Michel and his staff were very gracious and helpful. Zully Castro (curves Curves

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Can't say enogh good things.”
Reviews.Author: mckayvo
Reviews.Content: If you're arriving, departing (or both) by train. This place will allow you to just cross a bridge with your luggage - instead of trying to drag it through all of the winding, narrow walk-ways in Venice (or lugging it on a boat). The room we had was beautiful and big with a large bathroom and a Grand Canal view. The staff was unbelievable. Greated us at the door with towels one night (at 3AM) after walking home in the rain. Extemely friendly and helpful....much more than I expected. Not the closest to St. Mark's, but it has to be one of the best deals in Venice...ask and you will receive.

Reviews.Title: “Grand on the Canal”
Reviews.Author: Mariefla
Reviews.Content: The reviews were right about this wonderful place. Location is perfect from the train station, and the view of the Grand Canal is worth everything. We had a corner room that faced the canal and enjoyed watching the boats go by. Carlo and the staff there are so helpful and the hotel is beautifully decorated and comfortable. Large bathroom is a plus. I would return again. Soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “A great Little spot!”
Reviews.Author: troutss
Reviews.Content: We arrived after our cruise this little hotel is a gem and in great location. They were very helpful and it is very new inside and the rooms are small but lovely. We had three rooms and they were all very nice. We would stay again.Loved Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: D_Puppet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure the final four nights of a two-week trip to Italy. We loved being able to cross one bridge from the train station and be at the hotel. The person checking us in spent a lot of time trying to get us to take a suite in the "new annex down the street for just 30 more euro a night rather than the usual 120"; we wanted to see our room in the main hotel but it wasn't ready. When we came back to the hotel after some sightseeing we got the hard sell again; when we finally were shown our room in the main hotel, we were thrilled and didn't bother going to see the annex. With that out of the way, the rest of the stay was near perfect. The room was small (rooms in Italy are always small) but very clean and comfortable (it was the only double bed we slept on in Italy which wasn't just two singles pushed together), the marble bathroom was small but luxurious, and being around the side of the building gave us just the right amount of light and noise from the Grand Canal (people staying in the front of the hotel should know that the Canal gets busy with boats and barges after 730 am; still, it's away from the tourist hordes around Saint Mark's). From the hotel it's easy to get around Venice, whether walking or taking a vaporetto to the train station stop. Once we got past the check-in unpleasantness, the staff could not have been more helpful. They made reservations at a small restaurant for our final night (and even called us in the room to ask the times we wanted) and drew a map. There was free and fast wifi in the lobby. One other thing, though--we reserved through Expedia, and the hotel made a big deal that we would have to pay 7 euro a person for breakfast "through a special deal with Expedia", where if we'd reserved through the hotel's website we would have gotten it for free. We know other people have complained on TA about this policy, and we have to agree. They should offer breakfast to everyone, or not. That said, there's a great cheap place nearby, Brek, where a roll and espresso won't bankrupt you. (You can get food from a market and keep it in the minibar if you want to save money on food, also.) We would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: givanildobs
Reviews.Content: Great location, traveled by train, easy to find, within walking distance of the train station, gentile staff, safe hotel. This hotel was very nice, great breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: 1freqtraveler
Reviews.Content: can't say enough positive things. our stay was fantastic. traveling with 2 teenagers and we all loved it. the staff is amazing and helpful -- they spent 15 minutes with us when we first checked in going over what to do and see without us evening asking, plus much more. we had a beautiful suite in the annex. one of the best showers we've ever had in a hotel. close to the rail station, five minute walk from the bus station, close to water bus. it's not cheap but would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: bento2744
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel right on the Grand Canal and across the bridge from Venice Central Train station. I read on the Venice forum that there was a free shuttle to Piazza Rome, but our ship ( Wind Surf) docked right on the main channel, instead of main terminal occupied by mega ships. So, no shuttle and the only way to get to the hotel was by water taxi(especially with many luggage). Do not try to walk to any hotel in Venice! It is difficult to do with uneven surface and unbelievable number of bridges you must cross. There were 8 of us with 13 bags and the taxi was worth every penny at 170 euros. It delivered us right infront of hotel's dock and bellman was there to help. There is also public taxi for 7 euros which makes many stops, but you nedd to know where your hotel is and get off at nearest dock. I would not try it with many bags. Just remember, knowing where your hotel is located and minimizing distance to walk will eliminate a big frustration. Saving few euros can cost you much headach and taint your first impression of this beautiful city. The staff at the hotel was simply amazing, they could not have done enough for us. Johnny at the front desk will make you feel so welcome, it will make your day! Nice breakfast in the morning, we didn't include in our booking, but at 7 euro pp, it was fine. Rooms are not big, like most European properties, but clean and well appointed , nice bar in the lobby and mini bar in the room. Free internet. We booked a Grand Canal View deluxe room, splurge a little, how often will you be back in Venice? Our friend had a non canal view room and it was a bigger room? If you plan to use the train, when you depart, be aware that porter will charge you $13 per bag to carry them across the big bridge and to the train terminal. Wheeling bags up those steps is not easy. We happened to see an elderly couple with 6 big bags lost in a maze of canals and bridges, trying to find their hotel, I felt terrible for them. Be well informed before you attempt to handle your own bags in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay in a different hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: go-daddy-o
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. For those of you new to Venice - don't underestimate the value of being close to the train station. I can't tell you how many frustrated, lost people we saw, lugging suitcase across bridge after bridge trying to get their stay in Venice started. You will get lost and it will take you literally hours to find your hotel. We got off the train, walked across the bridge and started enjoying our trip immediately. The rooms are beautiful - and the staff is amazing. Venice can be overwhelming - and the staff are great and making reservations, recommending itineraries tailored to your trip. Really - can't say enough great things. It may look far from everything on the map - don't be fooled. It is not. This hotel is well worth it. can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: texasm0mma
Reviews.Content: My 33 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We upgraded to a suite which was new and very spacious especially for Venice. Breakfast was very good, and sitting outside having drinks was most pleasurable. The staff was great, and very helpful. It is located across the canal from the train station so it was convenient to get to. Great walk to St. Mark's and also easy access to water taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyblues
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is FIRST CLASS! We arrived with a mix up in reservations, and they put us up in the Hotel Sofitel (sister chain) for the first night located around the corner. The room was great, breakfast buffet included. The location of Hotel Antiche Figure is so convenient from the train station. For the inconvenience, the remaining days of our stay, they gave us suite accommodations. The french cottage-y chic suite was very grand! The massaging shower was luxury at its best! The breakfast buffet was good here, too. Have I mentioned, the service is great!!! The staff was so very helpful and sympathetic to helping us research rebooking options when our connection flight was cancelled. Very attentive to your needs. They even helped some other guests with laundry detergent for a clean load! Very, very nice. Room rates were very reasonable!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: phillygal2
Reviews.Content: After a 12 day mediterrean cruise, we decided to spend one extra night in Venice and based on the reviews here booked the Hotel Antiche Figure. We weren't disappointed! What a wonderful place to stay...we only wish we could have stayed longer! We disembarked our ship around 9 am and got a water taxi from the pier to the hotel. It was expensive but we had 4 large suitcases as well as carry ons so it was really the only way to go. We were able to dock right at the hotel and the staff helped us with the luggage and told us our room was ready early! We were able to check in at 10 AM! What a treat since we were hot and tired from our long cruise. We were escourted up to our room and it was on the corner facing the canal. The room was spotless with a large chandelier and beautiful amenities. The bathroom was huge by European standards with the most elegant accomodations. It was so nice to be able to relax a bit before going out into Venice. Our friends had warned us that it was better to stay in St. Mark's Square but that is so not true!!! It is so crowded and touristy there. The Hotel Antiche Figure is in the perfect location! You are near transportation but not a part of the teeming crowds in the square. The staff was extremely helpful when it came to directions and it was easy to find the Hotel because you just need to look for signs for the train station. It was great coming "home" and relaxing away from the crowds at the outdoor bar right in front of the hotel and on the canal. AWESOME! All I can say is keep up the good work and we will definitely stay here again if we ever get the chance to go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel - Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: AxFamily
Reviews.Content: We have been in Venice for 4 nights last month (April 2009). We have booked this hotel depending on Trip Advisorâ€™s reviews and recommendations. At the end of our trip this choice proved perfect!! The hotel is in perfect place; just 5 minutes walk from the bus station, 2 minutes walk from the rail station, on an excellent position just 2 meters from the Grand canal (!) Very comfortable room, excellent service, very clean hotel, rich breakfast, the staff is very friendly and helpful -- they will do whatever is necessary to make your stay enjoyable. Fantastic view from our room (it worth the extra), amazing walks on narrow paths and canals, all day time (even late evenings), terrific pizza at every corner, hundreds of excellent restaurants everywhere, cafÃ© on St Marks Square at â€œFlorianâ€� (it worthâ€™s the extra 12 â‚¬ for live music) or sitting by the sea, shopping on Jewish area, having a gondola ride on narrow canals as centuries ago Venetians did so, thousands of masks and â€œmuranoâ€� glasses, etc, etc, â€¦ We are looking forward being in Venice again !!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has the perfect location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Eryngium
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and absolutely loved it. The location is just perfect. You come back in the evening and have a nightcap sitting outside at one of the table 20 yards from the gondolas in Grand Canal. Also, when you arrive in Venice at the station, as we did, its great to look across the canal and see your hotel 2 minutes away ! Its also less than 5 mins from the bus station. That may make the area sound a bit seedy but its not at all. Its a lovely area and we felt completely safe wandering around at all times. Being across the canal has another great bonus. If you are walking around Venice the streets are really very confusing. However, there are signs to the station everywhere so you just follow them and end up back at the hotel ! If you are staying for a couple of days the best deal in Venice is to get a 24/48 or 72 hour vaperetto ticket and just hop-off on on when travelling around the city. Another benefit of the hotel is that it is just along from Piazalle Roma which is the first vaparetto stop. Embark there rather than at the station and its easy to get a seat right up front for the best sightseeing. Take the No. 1 all the way from there to Lido , it takes about an hour and its just superb. There are a few really nice restaurants in the area. Try Il Refolo for pizzaria and Vittorias for the best pasta ! The best restaurant we found was also nearby - Osteria La Zucca - you may have to book but its absolutely lovely. All in all we loved both Venice and Antiche Figure and will definately be back to both.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Easy to Find Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeBruin
