Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure for two nights in May 2009 on our way to Florence from Monte Carlo. Overall, we liked the hotel and would stay there again and would recommend it, as others have here, but in the interest of full disclosure, here are both the positives and potential drawbacks: Positives: - DIRECTLY across the train station. You walk outside, you see it across the canal. Walk across the nearby bridge and you are "home" - Staff is very friendly and helpful -- they will do whatever is necessary to make your stay enjoyable - The room is clean and the bathrooms are nice. We didn't pay for a canal view room, but that was fine since we were never in the room to enjoy it. - Free internet access in your room through a LAN cable, by wi fi in the lobby, or on the hotel's computer in the lobby. - More of a "residential" part of the city, which is good, because the restaurants nearby are where the "locals" eat, the food is very good, and the prices are much lower than what you would pay for similar meals near the Rialto bridge or St. Mark's square. Walk the area, find a local place, and you'll eat a great meal most of the time. We stumbled across "Muro" our first night as we got lost in the maze of streets nearby and had a fabulous meal with very inexpensive and good wine (the hotel recommended a tourist place in St. Mark's square; we didn't eat there but the places around it were much more overpriced and charged higher service fees and a "cover charge" the local places often did not). Negatives: - Area can seem a little seedy at night especially since there are no real tourist attractions nearby and there are guys selling counterfeit bags on the nearby bridge. Take the canal "bus" rather than walking through the maze if you want to get to St. Mark's or the Rialto bridge area. It costs about 6 euro, and gets you to St. Mark's within 30 minutes and you get a nice canal cruise to boot. - The hotel nickel and dimes you when it comes to the "free" breakfast. If you book through the hotel, the breakfast is free. Even though we paid the same price for our room as the hotel wanted to book with them directly, we were told that breakfast would cost us 7 Euros ("half" of the normal paid price) because we booked through Expedia and the hotel had to pay them commission. I think that is simply the cost of doing business and I shouldn't have to pay for breakfast if the guy sitting next to me, paying the same price for a room, gets to eat for free. Either way, we walked to the local cafe every morning and had a coffee and pastry for 6 euros for two instead of paying 7 euros each to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: shukimom
Reviews.Content: Such a relief to walk across the bridge and get to this hotel. Venice can be very confusing so it was nice to drop off luggage right away and get started exploring. The staff here are very gracious and professional. They offered to upgrade me to an annex room down the alley but I chose to stay in the hotel, which I'm glad I did, because there is definitely the charm that the annex didn't provide. Although the annex might have been more quiet. There was an upgrade charge. My room was very clean and cozy, a king size bed that took up much of the space. I loved loved loved the bathroom, marble, with a nice large tub and lots of counter space. I had a view of the canal from a side room. One might need to know that if you face the canal, when the large boats hit the curb there is a grinding sound. The train station is just across the canal, so this is a major hub of boats and traffic, and one can hear the grinding until late at night and early in the morning. Also, for a hotel this nice, they really should serve cappucino that does not come out of a machine. The coffee was awful and sort of a cheap way to cut costs. If one wanted tea or coffee from the bar there was a hefty cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: perthy_88
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went travelling around the world and I was most excited to stay in Venice. This hotel is AMAZING! Great location, the train station is across the canal and great friendly staff. When we arrived they offered us an upgrade to a suit which was stunning and had glorious views of the canals and gondoliers. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel offers 21st century comfort”
Reviews.Author: C&AHarpendenEngland
Reviews.Content: Our interest in Venice stems from a love of the paintings of Canaletto (1697-1768) but our first visit to this beautiful city has had to wait for a long time until we wanted to arrange something really special to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. Because of our appreciation of Canalettoâ€™s work, we brought with us printouts of his paintings and had much pleasure in discovering where he had stood when sketching or painting the pictures we love so much. Previous correspondents have not exaggerated the charm of this hotel. The building is full of history and appears in some of Canalettoâ€™s paintings but it has been tastefully modernised and offers every comfort. The location may not be in the centre but we found this to be a bonus as it is so convenient for arrivals and departures, being close to the bus and railway stations and with 2 bridges crossing the Grand Canal nearby. Gondolas may be hired right outside the hotel and the vaporetto stop is just on the other side of the canal. All the staff were charming, friendly and most attentive and their combined efforts made our 5-nights stay a very happy one. We thoroughly recommend this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: Par4Life
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find anything to add to the many great review written about Hotel Antiche Figure. We chose this hotel based on the wonderful comments we read here on Trip Advisor. There was no exageration. The hotel, location and staff are absolutely great. This was our first trip to Venice and the location close to the train station seemed like a good idea. When we arrived it was lightly raining and knowing it was a very short walk to our hotel was a relief. We literally could see the hotel when we exited the train station. As luck would have it, however, the sun came out within minutes. We were graciously greated and brought to our room by Michael. Our fourth floor, corner room overlooked the grand canal. It was a wonderful view and was mezmorizing to watch the coming and going of the various boats on the canal. The room was nicely appointed and very clean. Venice itself was fascinating. A maze of narrow alleys and canals. So much fun to get lost in. Forget the maps - it's impossible to figure out where you are. My husband kept saying... "Oh, I think we've been HERE before, when trying to find out way back to a location... only to find out we were in an entirely different area than we thought!" Just keep wandering, you'll get to where you're going eventually. Food is extremely expensive in Venice! Two cookies and two small coffees in a lovely little cafe cost more that 20 Euro! They WERE good, but we only did that once. Take the free shuttle to Murano Glass factory. It was fantastic to see the craftsmanship and beauty they produce there. We did not find them at all pushy, but more than willing to spend time showing you every detail of any piece you showed any interest in. In closing, we were so glad we chose this hotel. It was just what we were looking for and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: operabuffLondon
Reviews.Content: Just a short note to add to the praise for this hotel. It's so comfortable and friendly. We had a residence suite - no canal view, but so lovely to make your own coffee (provided) and relax in the sitting area. They recommended a good value restaurant - Al Vecio Pozzo - in the much less touristy area just behind the hotel. We benefited from, and agreed with, all the previous comments about location and transport. When we return to Venice, we shall certainly stay at the Antiche Figure again. We have already recommended it to several friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GuybrushTripwould
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and location was very close to the train station and bus interchange to airport. It is not that spectacular compared with hotels in other countries. But it was a good hotel compared with what u get in rome and venice. Free ADSL internet, which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond excellent...beyond fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CherylMenezes
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Antiche Figure was absolutely fabulous. The staff were exceptional, all smiles and always willing to go that extra mile. Especially the wonderful Carlo at Reception. What an asset he is to the hotel. Carlo was always so helpful and suggested some terrific restaurants in Venice that served fab food. Too bad we didnt get a chance to say goodbye. He was away from the reception desk when we returned to the hotel, and off duty when we checked out the next day. Many thanks Carlo for all your help. Thanks to you our stay in Venice was extra special. Our room had a view of the grand canal and was elegantly furnished in true Venietian style complete with murano chandeliers in the bath. Spanking clean and spacious. Both my husband and I enjoy travelling and are quite fussy when it comes to hotels and this gem definitely deserves two thumbs up . This was the second time I used trip advisor to plan a holiday and I have to say it is one of the best tools available for holiday goers. The information and ratings on hotels etc is spot on and extremely accurate.

Reviews.Title: “It's true what they say”
Reviews.Author: Marlarkey
Reviews.Content: About this hotel. Yes, the friendliness of the staff is quite amazing, you feel that you have come to visit old friends. You only had to ask for something and it was done straightaway. The location of the hotel is perfect - our room overlooked the Grand Canal and there was such a great atmosphere when you stood on the balcony and watched the world go by. One reviewer commented that there was a lot of noise from the water buses on the Canal, however we found the double glazing extremely effective in excluding the noise and were not at all affected by it. The staff were also so helpful in advising where to visit, the best way to get there, when to go and went to great pains to point you in the right direction. Apart from the excellent hotel, we absolutely loved Venice, the sights, the sounds, the atmosphere - all were so thoroughly enjoyable and so uniquely Venice! Do make sure you wear good walking shoes though, as we were told the best way to see Venice is to get lost there! You can see so much more if you wander down all the little back streets. But take a map! Also there is just nowhere to sit down unless you sit at one of the many cafes but you have to order something, you can't just rest for 10 minutes. One thing to bear in mind - Venice is very expensive! We were expecting this and as we live in London thought we should be used to that but were quite shocked when we visited the renowned Cafe Florian and the bill came to 60 euros for two coffees, one diet coke and one chocolate cake!!! Plus you are charged extra (6 euros per person) for the benefit of listening to the music being played outside! Still you have to do these things once in a lifetime at least. We also did the gondola ride, 80 euros, but again if you go to Venice you just HAVE to do it. Do visit as many of the churches as you can fit in, they are all so awe inspiring. We were only there for 2 days and felt that we should have stayed at least another day, hopefully we will return at some point in the future and make sure that we add an extra day. For all those intending to visit Venice - do stay at this hotel and enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel with Wonderfully Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TCKFallsChurch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Venice to spend a few quiet days reconnecting after nearly a year of separation during my assignment in Iraq. I cannot imagine a nicer place than the Antiche Figure. We took a junior suite in a separate building a few steps down the calle away from the noise and bustle of the Grand Canal. The bedroom was bright and airy with a small separate sitting room and tiny kitchenette built into the wall. Perfect. Carlos, Jani, and Michel took care of every request, serving us a Spritz Venezio in the early evening in front of the hotel where we could watch the boats ply the canal as the sun set, and then suggesting a restaurant for the evening meal. Make sure you get directions and be prepared to wander and ask for help, but don't give up, these guys know their restaurants and clientele. We had the gnocchi and crab sauce at "Giorgione" on their recommendation, with a bottle of Paladin Salbonello. Wonderful! The next night was a bottle of Valpolicella Brigaldera at "Fontego dei Piscatore", where the owner, Mr. Lolo, insisted we try the cuttlefish pasta. Wow! Breakfasts were a quiet simple delight. Make sure you go to the first stop to get vaporetto #1 for your Grand Canal cruise; you'll be sure to get a bow seat in the open. (Francesca advised us to do this.) The trip to Murano for a glass factory tour is worth it just for the private water taxi ride out to the island. The sales pitch after the tour is relentless, but the glass is astoundingly beautiful. The Anitche's location is the best in Venice, just steps from the train station and a nice walk to everywhere in the city. We took the vaporetto along the canal to a starting point each day and walked from there. Many thanks to all the great people at the Antiche Figure for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 40th birthday”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: We turned up with two children under 5 and were quickly offered to trade in our canal view room for a backstreet apartment much cheaper which was perfect for us and kept the noise away from the honeymoorners! Location was great and service very good.

Reviews.Title: “bellissima”
Reviews.Author: daze9
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in an apartment on the grand canal when we visit Venice, but as this was unavailable thought we'd try the Antiche Figure. We needn't have been apprehensive - the hotel and staff were excellent. We felt that our room at the side of the hotel was rather dark, but we weren't in Venice for the room! Next time we'll book a room overlooking the canal. The outstanding thing for us was the service.... friendly staff who aim to please can be something of a rarity, but everyone who works at this hotel wants their guests to feel comfortable and to get the most out of their visit to Venice. Great value breakfasts at only 7 euros get you off to a great start to your sightseeing day - well worth the money. This hotel deserves its high placing on the best hotels list.

Reviews.Title: “We'll never stay anywhere else in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Steph V
Reviews.Content: I don't know what else I can say about Antiche Figure that hasn't already been said! The location is great. It's a 20 minute walk to St. Mark's but honestly, that isn't where a visitor to Venice should spend much time. Instead, wander the side streets and canals and get as lost as possible! For this experience, Antiche Figure is perfect - it's location across from the Ferrovia makes it easy to find your way home no matter where you are since there are signs all over Venice for "alla Ferrovia". Plus, the hotel's location on the Grand Canal makes it easy to access the vaporetto, train, water taxi and gondola. You don't have to worry about dragging your luggage all over the city when entering and leaving Venice. The hotel itself is beautiful - we stayed in two different rooms during our 7-night stay and both exceeded our expectations. The first room was in the main building and was decorated in traditional Venetian style with Murano fixtures and a lovely marble bath. However, the room was small for three people so we moved after three nights to a suite in the adjacent building. What a gem! These rooms are more modern but very luxurious from the floors to the linens and even the ceilings. There are some minor drawback to staying in this building: is there is no elevator and if you're on the top level expect to climb two flights of stairs. Also, the bedroom of the suite was dark...additional lighting would be welcomed. We found the beds to be harder in the newer rooms but the front desk can provide a soft pad that solves the problem - be sure to ask for it if you're not accustomed to a very firm mattress. The marble bathroom with modern fixtures was fantastic - we enjoyed the shower and it had very good water pressure. Lastly, I can't say enough good things about all the staff at Antiche Figure, specifically Carlo. They are all so warm and friendly and speak excellent English. Carlo became our new best friend in Venice and never failed to be there with helpful advice on sightseeing, restaurants, and everything in general. Staying at Antiche Figure was a huge part of our wonderfully perfect Venice experience and we are eternally grateful to the staff for their role in making our trip so memorable. If you want to experience Venice in a personal way don't stay at any other hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It's all been said before - excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dragon33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Altiche Figure for along weekend at the end of March. The hotel continues to maintain the high standard that numerous reviewers have previously mentioned. We upgraded to a junior suite on arrival. The suites are located in a separate building at the rear of the hotel which means there are no views of the canal but you have the advantage of not having the general noise of the canal traffic. The standard of the rooms are extreemly high with a separate sitting area and cleverly designed small kitchen hidden behind smoked glass doors - not that we used it, but it was there if we had wanted to! The staff contine to be extreemly friendly and helpful and go out of their way to ensure you have a good stay. At breakfast you are offered a cup of 'proper' coffee rather than that from the instant coffee machine in the breakfast room. The selection at breakfast was more than adequate for all but those guest who think if it's not what they have at home then it's not good! The location of the hotel is ideal, being only a couple of hundred meters from the bus station with its direct transfers to and from the airport (â‚¬3 each way). Getting about on the water bus is easy but I would recommend walking, as even the small back streets have signs directing you to Rialto or St Marks (or Ferovia to get you back to the hotel). The range of shops you can find in these small streets are amazing and you seem to find a different route and different things to see each day. We were told that the Altiche Figure will soon be opening a new 4* hotel on the Grand Canal. If they maintain their current standards - and service seems to come naturally to them - then the new hotel should be something to look forward to for a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: facemask
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure. The staff graciously held our bags for us as we checked in early. They even had them bags waiting for us in our room when we got back which was nice. The room itself was great with a nice view of the canal. The bathroom was quite large compared to other hotels in Italy. They offered computer access down in the reception area for free. All of the hotels in Venice seem to be expensive so while this was one was also high in my opinion, the value was still good. But the location was great in terms of easy access to the train station. Really can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “room small”
Reviews.Author: maddiemitt
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very easy to find esp. for first time visitors to Venezia. Excellent service. Disappointingly small room at side of hotel which was a little dark .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Impressionistic
Reviews.Content: Located virtually opposite the train station, separated by the grand canal. Only problem was that we had to cross a bridge to get to the hotel, which was a bit more tiring with an infant, stroller and 2 heavy suitcases. Hotel staff are excellent and as mentioned on another review, can make excellent suggestions for restaurants. We payed a little extra for an upgraded room at the suggestion of staff given our infant. This was located in a new separate part of the hotel down the side alley. This room was more spacious than their regular rooms and also had a small kitchenette, which we appreciated given our infant. The kitchenette looked like it was rarely used and lacked kitchen utensils, but the staff did provide items at our request. Overall, very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Right Across from the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: thegirlandfig
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the guy at the front desk was the friendliest person I have ever met. He had some great suggestions for restaurants, knows the ins and outs for tourists. The hotel itself is a bit removed from St. Marco's Square, but you could bus it or walk it even. The great thing is that it is right across the canal from the train station. I have such fond memories of my trip to Venice and I think it was made extra special because of my stay at this hotel. If you don't have friends in Venice that will take you out to all the local places, this is your next best bet. The rooms are also very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “10th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Gingy11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our 10th anniversary 3/14-3/17. Upon arrival we were told that they had overbooked the hotel that night by accident and booked us a room at the "Sofitel" which is a very beautiful hotel and we were perfectly fine with accomadations. Carlo even walked us down to the Sofitel and made sure that we were okay. When we arrived back to the Hotel Antiche Figure the next day they gave us a very beautiful and romantic room and included breakfast for our troubles. It was no trouble though. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were great. This was our 2nd time back to Venice and we walked to places that we didn't see on the 1st visit. We had a great time and loved this hotel. Great location! If we come back this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyMc
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful to see our hotel from the steps of the train station as we walked to the bridge. Venice is a confusing city and we were able to find this great hotel easily, get rid of our bags, and be on our way to see the sights. Our room was wonderfully comfortable and spotless. We were given a great map at the hotel and there are signs posted to help us find our way to the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. We got to see lots of wonderful sights along the way. You want to get lost in Venice anyway, so this gave us lots of opportunities to see everything in between. I loved the computer in the lobby, and when it was time to go, we left our bags with them because we had a late train to Vienna. The breakfast was phenomenal -meat, eggs, croissants, cheese, yogurt, juice, coffee of all sorts, much more and all yummy! The staff was warm, welcoming, and spoke English perfectly. We were given lots of good advice about riding the vaporetto and where to find good food. Carlo was especially helpful when I needed to get in touch with family the evening we left. We loved our stay at Hotel Antiche Figure and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel in an incredible city”
Reviews.Author: LuvztoTravel
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed here for a night while he was visiting me. I was looking for a convenient location as well as cleanliness and separate beds. We got all those and great service as well. They even called our next hotel in Florence and got us a major discount! wow- that is incredible service. They are located right across from the train station so easy drop off of your bags. It is about a half hours walk to St. Marks square, but a nice stroll. The room was a bit small, but then again, that's standard in Venice. Make sure to check if you make your reservation is through expedia or hotels.com- there is probably no breakfast (colezione) included.

Reviews.Title: “Service was top notch.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexasMom
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at this hotel. We booked it because of its proximity to the train station since we were taking the Eurostar from Rome. Unfortunately, while the hotel is right across the Grand Canal from the station -- you have to cross a huge bridge to get there -- and there are no ramps - only steps. So this is not a hotel for people who are not traveling light. That said, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was not overly large but we had a view of the canal which was nice. The furnishings were fine but not exceptional -- though the mattress was something of a disaster. For the money - it was a good value. But take the warning about the bridge seriously because it is a pretty horrific task to carry a large bag across!

Reviews.Title: “Yes - all the good words are absolutely true!”
Reviews.Author: martico
Reviews.Content: The way we were welcomed and treated from start to finish was worthy of the best hotels anywhere. We opted to upgrade to canal-view rooms and it was well worth it. We went with some very good friends and they described our whole trip as 'magical' (the great weather helped, but still). The vaporetto is so convenient; you can walk easily with bags from Piazzale Roma (from airport bus). Don't think about staying anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Paul68
Reviews.Content: 600+ reviews can't be wrong I thought before booking and they were correct. Just the perfect hotel for your trip to Venice. Mind you, the staff knows that they have this extremly high ranking at Tripadvisor and they will go all the to keep it that way! Soon they will be opening another hotel across the canal. I wish them all the luck and hope it will be as great as the current hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure deserves to be very highly rated in all categories”
Reviews.Author: bella057
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights earlier this month and were very impressed with the service we received.All staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, going out of their way to help sort out a baggage mix up on arrival and subsequently any queries were addressed in a very positive way . The room was very clean and well appointed, breakfasts were good and plentiful.We were offered a room upgrade but decided the smaller room fulfilled our needs. This was a first visit to Venice and our experience in this hotel means it won't be our last! We bought vaporetto cards online via Veniceconnected paying 37euros as opposed to 50 euros on site. This allowed us 'free' use of the public transport system for a week . The hotel is well situated to travel about the city and lagoon yet is away from the crowds. Altogether a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, Staff so friendly.Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinaf
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 lovely days in Venice and were blessed with weather. Location of hotel is excellent so easy to find it, we fly into Marco Polo Airport got the bus to Plazza Roma and we walked approx 10 from there to our hotel no problem finding it. Rooms lovely and spotless clean, and there was always 2 love heart sweets on our pillow each evening on our return. We did not have a view of canal but that was not a problem for us. Breakfast was good for continental. Standards in hotel were very high + free internet use in reception..Staff Gianni + Michele so nice and friendly. I would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: KenLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: A really enjoyable stay. Staff were very very helpful, room was excellent, position was good, breakfast adequate. What else could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “I will ONLY stay at this hotel when I return to Venice.”
Reviews.Author: woodzicus
Reviews.Content: All the good things you have read about this hotel are true. In most cases the comments donâ€™t say enough. We stayed two nights at this hotel and can only praise its excellent location, service, comfort and OUTSTANDING customer service. Our room was very well kept and extremely comfortable. The view on the Grand Canal is perfect. The hotel is close to the train station, bus station and main vaporetto stations, which made it ideal for the visit of this enchanting city. I would like to personally thank Francesca, Carlo and Michielli for their friendly welcoming attitude. They all went out of their way to ensure us a great stay. I have rarely encountered such competent customer oriented staff. I have slept in many hotels around the world and this is one of my best experiences ever. In closing I can say that on any future trip to Venice I will only stay at the Antiche Figure. C. Woods Belgium

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: leybornepark
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on the strength of all the good comments and wasn't disappointed. Our room was a good size for a European city, newly renovated, immaculately clean, lovely bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful with good restaurant recommendations. I feel our first experience of Venice was enhanced by the fact that we went during a low season (if such a thing exists in Venice). The weather was mild and tourists were plentiful but not overwhelming, making the city pleasant to get around on foot or vaporetto. We skipped the gondolas feeling they were a rip-off (95 euros for a half hour, no thanks). Went to Harry's bar, which was most definitely a rip off (15 euros for a smallish Bellini and nowhere to sit) - stay well away. Went to Locanda Montin a very authentic, delicious restaurant with nice a garden in back and Antica Besseta, for wonderful fish and pasta. In all, this is a beautiful, boutique-style hotel in a glorious city. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in a unique and beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: scottjohndavies
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews we had read on Tripadvisor. We travelled to Venice on 16th February for a 2 night stay. The trip was a 60th birthday present for my fiancee's mother who was also on the trip. We had requested 2 rooms with views over the Grand Canal. Both rooms were very clean and furnished to a very high standard. High ceilings, and thick cream carpet. My only minor disapointment was the fact that the LCD television was not picking up any channels in our room. This was not important to us as we had no intention to spend any time in our room watching the tv when one of the most interesting cities in the world lay outside our hotel. We didnt bother to report it to hotel staff. However, I am sure had we done so, the matter would have been resolved immediately. The staff in the hotel were second to none. They could not have been more helpful or friendly. We were given great recomendations in terms of restaurants, sightseeing locations and airport transfers. I cannot speak highly enough of the staff at this hotel. The manager, the concierge, the cleaner were all very approachable and made you feel very welcome. The hotel is located in the north of the city near to Ferrovia, the train station. A Waterbus terminal was literally a stones throw from the hotel. We tended to catch the water bus back to the hotel at the end of a busy days walking. Part of the fun of Venice is walking through and over the narrow side streets and bridges. Plenty of hidden gems lie in wait in the form of churches, shops and world class photo backdrops. This city is truly unique and a must visit to any true traveller. A stay at The Hotel Antiche Figure only adds to the magic experience of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value in Romantic Venice”
Reviews.Author: jkeats149
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure between 13 February and 17 February, coming to Venice for the Carnivale 2009 festivities. We stayed in room 312, overlooking the Grand Canal. What was best is that the room had apparently just been recently renovated, as the room smelled of freshly laid carpet (and yes, you could tell it was definitely new carpet). First and foremost, the room was incredible: greenish marble backroom, with antique-style fixtures; the bedroom was presented in very relaxing colors, beige, blue, gold, and yellow, with a lovely chandelier and sitting area; windows looked out onto the Grand Canal (see photos). The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, greeting us every morning with a "Buongiorno," and ending every night with a welcoming phrase (thanks to the night manager, I think named Enrico ?). The hotel was well positioned up near Piazalle Roma and the train station, with easy links to the mainland. There were also plenty of gondolas and water taxis around as well, and the hotel was happy to arrange. I think the best thing about this hotel was that you had excellent access to "off the beaten path" Venice. So, easy access to the historical Jewish Ghetto in Cannaregio, wonderful shops around the Grand Canal right across the Ponte degli Scalzi, short walk to the famous Casino de Venezia (wear a suit or sportscoat, guys), and more, and more, and more. I'll be honest: crossing the Scalzi bridge and walking along the canal, you are talking a 30-40 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge, then a further 10 minutes to the Piazza San Marco. However, we found the areas in the more touristy neighborhoods to be overrun with people, busy, and loud. It was a welcome change, after a long day of photos, sightseeing, walking tours, boat rides, and cappuccinos, to come back and find a nice, lovely, quiet hotel waiting to welcome us with a much needed night of recharging sleep. And the walk to and fro the hotel alone was worth it, making your way through side streets, past the many hidden churches towering in the dark and through the labyrinthine passages that make Venice such a special city (and often at night, when the ghosts of the past really come alive). If this sounds appealing, then Antiche Figure is the hotel for you. So, here is my advice. Read all the reviews, listen to all the opinions, check out all the photos. But the fact is, put aside the hype and rating, and the fact remains: this is an excellent hotel, with excellent value, in an excellent location, and for what it's worth, for us, there was no better place to be in Venice. Full stop. And if you are looking for a lovely venue as well, take a moment and at least consider this lovely little hotel. You will not be the least bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “New years eve in Venice”
Reviews.Author: david04
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for those travelling to Venice for the first time. It is opposite the railway station which makes it easy to find initially and to get around, whether you are walking or taking the water buses. There are plenty of good restuarants nearby and it is easy to get to the main attractions. The staff at the hotel were the most helpul of the three hotels we stayed at in Italy and were genuinely interested in the guests. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfasts were good value and the coffees excellent. Although not an attraction a nearby bonus is the laudramat around the corner since laundry for a family of 6 costs way too much.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Juanking
Reviews.Content: There's no point in echoing what everyone else has said so will keep it simple. If you want a superb quality hotel with excellent staff, is easy to get to & from and which won't break the bank (unlike EVERYTHING else in Venice!), you will not find a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - they really helped us”
Reviews.Author: andcommentary
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for the first time in pretty awful weather - cold, rainy and snowy, The welcome from the Hotel was really excellent - they upgraded our room at a cost of 25 euro per night, which was a bargain as we had a great view of the Grand Canal for the duration of our 4 nights. The staff were really eager to help and recommended the best ways to get around - the Vaporreto, which are terrific - you see all of life and a fabuloous slow trip into the heart of Venice, or a tour of the lagoons. Don't go to Venice with disablilities - the place is not really equipped for it! The Hotel is not in the prettiest part of Venice - it is quite a way from the centre but travelling by water bus into the centre is a great trip on its own. Yous see all the fabulous old palaces and just get off when you see someting you fancy. The hotel rooms are well fitted, immaculately clean and the linen and towels of first rate quality, although the rooms are perhaps a little on the small side. Although it was an old palace the whole place is fitted to a great spec. The public rooms are too small - the lounge area and the breakfast area are actually quite small, however, wherever we went in Venice the intenal areas are not large. This is not a capital city like London, Paris, but anybody who is a romantic at heart will adore the place - it epitomises charm. Venice for Brits is eye-wateringly expensive particularly with a devalued pound so be prepared! The trip to the Murano glass factory is a must - you are under strong pressure to buy so if you don't want to buy DO NOT GO. However the trip by water taxi is great - as is the return trip. Restaurants recommeded by marco were great - there is a lovely pizzeria at the back of the hotel worth eating at - just ask the staff - they could not be more helpful. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: Tournz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and arrived by train. The hotel was extremely easy to find as it's just opposite the train station - getting bags over the bridge wasn't a problem as we only had one bag each on wheels. Our room (we were told it was their best room) was on the top floor and had dual aspect windows overlooking the Grand Canal. We had an enormous bed and the room was decorated beaufully in fairly typical Venetian opulent style. It wasn't the cheapest hotel we stayed on our travels around Italy but it was the best in terms of size, decoration and location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and smiles from Franchesca”
Reviews.Author: IM_sl
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience staying at the hotel. Francesca was accomodating and always greeted us with a smile. She was also patient and explained the various sightseeing locations. She even went out of her way to check the train schedules on the internet so that we could decide which timing to leave Venice. Although we wished the other staff could be more like her. The location was spot-on. Directly opposite the train station; it is also an easy ten min stroll from the bus interchange. We were glad that the hotel is located along the main canal rather than the smaller lanes inside; it was much easier to spot. It also helped that the water taxis stop just opposite the hotel. Francesca suggested we pay a little surcharge to get the top floor in a room with a great view of the canal. It was fantastic. We had 3 windows to look out from and were enthralled with the views both day and night. Plenty of natural light and both the room and bathroom were generously sized. So if given the chance, please upgrade to the canal view rooms! There were just some minor unexplained occurences in the room which were more irritating than anything else but that's a different story altogether!

Reviews.Title: “A great, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: meiravit
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling in Venice during 15-17 of January (last week), and wanted to write my good impression from this hotel. As we first got off the train we were happy to find out that the Antiche Figure is only a 2 minutes walk from the station, just crossing the bridge in front of it. Then we entered the hotel and were greeted very warmly by the owners of rhe place -Francesca and her hausband (sorry,can't remember his name). Francesca took the time to show me several available rooms untill I was satisfied. The room itself was spacious and comfortable, decorated beautifully Venician style, with a roomy bathroom and good towels. We would be happy to see the canal from the window but had to pay 70 Euro more on the one which was available which was also a smoking one (which we didn't want) so we passed. On teh first morning we had the hotel breakfast (7 Euro each), which was not included, and was pretty good but rather a continental one, so we skipped it the other day. As for the service, again, we realy felt at home, got good explanations and were advised on nice restaurants in the area. Another nice service is the free internet use which helped us a lot ! One thing which could create a problem: not enough non-smoking rooms (in most of the hotel rooms you could smoke), which leaves a small variety of rooms to be offered. Other fron that- we loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: EibhlinDublin
Reviews.Content: I checked trip advisor before we booked our holiday to get advice on hotel accommodation. Hotel Antiche Figure came highly recommended by other travellers and based on this information I chose it as our place of residence during our stay. This proved to be a very wise move -we were not disappointed. It was conveniently close to Piazzale Roma - literally 5 minutes walk. All of the hotel staff were consistently very friendly, pleasant, polite and helpful. Our room was very comfortable, overlooked the grand canal and had a lovely big bathroom. We had such a lovely few days in Venice and staying at this hotel certainly added to our comfort and enjoyment. I hope to be there again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, convenient location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mlsmn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying for 2 nights at the Antiche Figure in Venice last month. Upon arriving we were offered to move to suites (we had 2 rooms booked) at the 'annex' location down the small street next to the hotel. The rooms were well decorated with many amenities. The suites did appear to be quite a bit larger than the double and triple rooms we were shown in the main hotel. The suites did not have views of the Canal, but that was not a priority for us as we spent most of our time exploring the lovely city of Venice. The location of the hotel is very convenient for arrival and departure from Venice. We were able to walk from the Piazzale Roma after arriving by air, then leave Venice via the train station directly across the canal. The bridge across the canal is somewhat difficult with large luggage to reach the train station. Venice is easy to walk in, we walked to and from St. Mark's square, although the water bus was also available. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. They were kind to give us restaurant recommendations and show us the nearest church to attend Christmas Eve services. The breakfast room was large, the buffet was nice with meats, cheese, eggs, fresh fruit and a large variety of breads and cereals each day. We would be pleased to stay at this hotel if we are able to return to Venice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: fromdenile
Reviews.Content: I had read all the great reviews for Antiche Figure before booking with them through Expedia, so it's hard to say something that hasn't already been said. However, I have travelled all over the world and have rarely encountered the degree of friendliness and service that this small hotel provides. The personnel were truly outstanding. FYI....the Antiche Figure will be opening a Boutique Hotel down the street from their current location later this year. They said that any previous guests or persons who say they received a recommendation from a previous guest will be able to stay at the new hotel during it's first year of operation at the same rates as the original hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Francesca_Vincenti
Reviews.Content: Small but perfect in many ways. Nothing beats a 3-Star Hotel with a 5-Star service and accommodation offer! The staff ensure constant personalised & friendly assistance. Your stay here is guaranteed to be comfortable, pleasant and hassle free. Conveniently located within a 5 minute walk from the central bus terminus at Piazzale Roma (the final stop for all vehicles before Venice) and situated directly opposite (across the Grand Canal) the Train Station, you are perfectly set within reach of all major attractions. The Vaporetto (public water bus service) from close to the Train Station here is only â‚¬6.50 to Piazza San Marco. The hotel staff will surprise you with their unsurpassed knowledge of current events in the city, cultural or historical exhibtions and more. The rooms are incredibly decorated in the style reminiscent of pure Venetian romance. They are kept constantly preened and spotless by their 'attention to detail' housekeepers. I loved walking in to find a Baci chocolate on my pillow every night and I would let it slowly melt in my mouth while I smiled like the princess I imagined myself to be while gazing out of my window onto the Canale Grande. The breakfast was always fresh with a wide choice of healthy food items to choose from or for those who want to indulge & spoil themselves during their stay, there is always a delectable spread of tarts, fresh crossants and other mouth-watering goodies! I highly recommend the place. It's the best value for money anyone can get around venice....and believe me, the staff's genuine friendly attitude is priceless. I am definitely returning for a personal vacation with my partner and shall mark this hotel as my top choice! Francesca Vincenti Malta

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Megfy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche Figure is the ideal place to stay in Venice. It is in a superbly convenient location, close to the coach station (shuttle from airport), the train station and the waterbus stops. It is very quiet and the service is exceptional. The staff are friendly and very helpful - nothing is too much trouble. the rooms are a good size and nicely decorated, with plenty of wardrobe space and shelves. there is a free safe in the room. The bathroom is particularly well appointed with everything you might need. There is an excellent breakfast buffet and free internet access. We would recommend it to anyone at all visiting Venice, and already have!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, loved the service--fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: LauraSSpringfield_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice right before the most recent flooding . . .the location from the main bus terminal Piazelle Roma made it really convenient and CHEAP to get to and from the airport on the airport buses. When you land and go to the main baggage area, look for a little window (Information) off to one end of the airport and you can buy the bus passes for the airport bus and waterbuses for however many days you'll be using it. The water buses were very short walk from the hotel, as people have mentioned, --even a gondelier station right outside the hotel door! Pay attention to the directions from the buses, because you want to go over the little green metal bridge (about 40 steps) to walk to the hotel. You'll come right to it then. I booked after looking at the hotel website and checking everything out on Trip Advisor---which was so helpful for planning our trip there and to Vienna. The front desk was very good about emailing all info and confirmations. I even wrote a few days before since I booked the room months in advance; they always replied promptly etc. They genuinely wanted us to have a good stay. The front desk staff was very accommodating---gave us names of places to try for eating, gave us an early morning cappucino and continental breakfast at 5:00a.m. the day we left for an early flight. They offered us a room upgrade for a nominal amount, which was really worth it to be facing the Grand Canale. We were there when it was cold, so the tourists were not there enmasse, loud etc. It was great room . .. great coffeemaker in the room fully stocked with teas and coffee, and fantastic amenities like shampoos, toothbrushes with paste etc. So nice since it's such a pain with the airline restrictions now. Flat screen TV. The hotel has recently been remodeled; it's clean and lots of marble in the bathrooms, nice decor. Even the inside room we looked at was nice, but a good deal cozier (small) than the one we ended up with. Either way, they have nice rooms. The staff couldn't have been kinder and more helpful! (They will make you a nice cappucino in the bar and bring it to the breakfast area if you ask, and then will just charge it to your room. It's lovely, better than the coffee machine, which isn't terrible either) The bar also has some little sweet treats to buy and maybe even some sandwiches; I didn't check. No full restaurant service tho, but a cute little nook in the lobby across from the bar, if you want to enjoy something downstairs, which people did I noticed. The breakfast I thought was very good---quite a big spread of all kinds of baked items, boiled eggs, fruit, cereals, yogurt and so forth. A lovely big breakfast room--enough to handle all the clientele. The staff weren't pushy, either, about getting you out of the breakfast, which was nice since you're on vacation! They arranged the FREE water taxi to Murano (you can take a water bus home) which was really nice, although the taxi takes you to a small, artist gallery glass factory which is pretty pricey--the cheapest thing we saw was 60 Euro, but we did enjoy the little demonstration and looking in the showroom. NO obligation to buy; the hotel staff even mentioned that, but you do have to steel yourself for the sales pitch. The last demonstrations were around 3 or 4:00 in the afternoon, so watch the timing. It's a short walk from there up the hill to the main street and canal where there are plenty of other shops and restaurants. You catch the water bus from there. One thing to watch in the restaurants--especially near San Marks Square. There are two menu prices in many---one for take away items, drinks etc. and another price for sitting down, which can make it considerably more expensive. We were there without the big crowds, which was sooo nice. We enjoyed touring the Basilica and the Doges' Palace--esp. the prisons (very foreboding), but we enjoyed wandering around the streets just as much! Got a lot in because there was no waiting time, but it was chilly and probably felt even colder because you're on the water, so we were glad we had heavy coats and cashmere! Our stay was definitely enhanced because of the Hotel Antiche Figure; I'm so glad we found it online. We did book early and I'd advise that because I'm sure it fills up fast because of the price and the good reviews. We would love to find another hotel like this one if we visit another romantic spot in Italy again. sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge”
Reviews.Author: inxs69
Reviews.Content: i travel a lot on business and have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world. this time i was traveling as a tourist. I chose this hotel based on the reviews on hotels.com. I was very pleased, its a short walk from the blue airport bus stop, away from the crowded area of san marco. there is a water bus stop right across, and in front of the santa lucia train station, a very convenient location. on top of the convenience, i was most impressed by the staff, mikele, carlo, and francesca and the rest of the antiche figure employees made my stay very comfortable and unforgettable. they were conscientious and overtly accommodating, much better service than in any of the big hotel chains i have stayed at. most people think of venice in the late spring or summer, but people in the know will tell you nothing is quite like venice in the winter. thanks again to the antiche figure staff!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Moreholiday
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. We had a lovely room on the top floor with windows on 2 sides over looking the canal. The staff go out of their way to help you. They booked us a lovely restuarant and a show which we wanted to go to. The rooms are clean and big. The bed is big enough to swim in! The boat stop is on the otherside of the bridge and most numbers stop there, so bery easy to get around and back. We walking to the Rialto bridge in 25 mins at a slow pace. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Noramlly I would give good and bad points to the hotel but this one really has none. There is no restuarant in the hotel, but your in venice and there are resturants everywhere. If you stay here I hope you have as good as time as we did. I will be going back here soon.

Reviews.Title: “delightful and easy to find!”
Reviews.Author: jobeard
Reviews.Content: Across from the train station, we only needed to cross one bridge and walk 100m (100yds) to the hotel. Staff was cordial and very helpful. Our room was very nice and in the fall-off-season, reasonably priced. With the vaporetto stops at the train station, access to Venice was also a snap. (recommend you try both directions and going West, ie to the right when @ the station, is the short trip to St. Marks :) ) Going left is the scenic view leading to the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to return”
Reviews.Author: GirlTraveler70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel pre and post cruise and loved it! We were moved to the hotel down the street (alley?) from the main hotel, which was fine with us. The rooms were larger than we booked and it was very quiet! I felt like we were staying in an apartment rather than a hotel. The location for us was great. Near the train station and Piazza Roma. It was a bit challenging at first to find the proper bridges to cross, but I did it alone with no map. Once I got the hang of navigating Venice, it was not bad. Close to vappereto stops too. Took the free shuttle to Murano, although I did not buy anything at the recommended store as it was lovely but expensive. We did purchase items at other locations. The staff was very accomodating and even carried our VERY HEAVY bags up to the third floor! We were able to check e-mail in the lobby for free as well. The kitchenette had decent coffee for beiing instant. The shower had so many knobs and jets it took a while to figure it all out. I would love to have that many options at home. I would absolutely stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: msmith
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of previous reviews on trip advisor, and it sure did meet the reviews. What a lovely place to stay in Venice. We stayed, with 2 other couples for 2 pre cruise nights. The owner was always available to help with directions and service. Our rooms were ready when we arrived, and check in was very easy, as we arrived by water taxi and we had additional help with our luggage. The breakfast, which was included had a nice variety of danish, cereals and fruit and the atmosphere was very pleasant. There were several breakfast areas. Internet is also included, which is great as I traveled with my lap top! We loved the bar area, drinks were reasonably priced, and we met other travelers, and had lots of laughs well into the evening. The owner made arrangements for a water taxi, also helped with the luggage, and made it easy for us to get to our cruise ship. Our rooms were very clean and furnished with some elegant features, including beautiful lighting in the bathrooms! What a great introduction to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jds98235
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night in the Antiche Figure and booked the Grand Canal overlook room. It was very charming, quiet, and the staff were extremely friendly. We loved the views from the windows in our room. Also, the bed was exceptionally soft and comfortable, something you dont find much in Europe. Price was comparable to everything else in Venice: very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: homeseller
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews here and on its location across from the train and vaporetto station. So glad we did. When we arrived we had no trouble crossing the bridge and finding our hotel which was right there on the Grand Canal. (Still perplexed at how one would drag luggage on the vaporetto or worse, walk through the winding streets of Venice, if one's hotel was some distance from the train station.) The staff was amazingly helpful, knowledgeable and patient and all spoke very good English. The room was very clean, though on the small side, quite luxurious and had a wonderful view of the canal. We could walk everywhere though it was quite a long walk to St Mark's. Highly recommended, though if you are looking for a very quiet location, this may be a little busy for you but we loved the convenience of the vaporetto station just across the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Greay Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ksuchy
Reviews.Content: We also stayed in this hotel as the start to our honeymoon before leaving for a mediterranean cruise. The staff could not be more helpful and polite. The hotel recently renovated an extension building (down a side alley/street) to the hotel with several suites, which we were offered to stay in for an extra 20 euros a night. We went for it and the rooms were great! Much larger than the rooms in the main hotel (which were also very nice, just much smaller). It is a short walk from Piazzale Roma where any land transfers take place. If you are looking for a hotel close to San Marco, this is not the one to stay in, but we found it very convenient and a nice walk. (You could also take the vaporetto from the stop right across the canal from the hotel - very convenient) The city is beautiful! I definitely recommend Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Place and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GraciePittsburgh
Reviews.Content: After returning from our cruise in the Greek islands, we had just a few nights to see Venice. Hotel Antique Figure was the perfect location. We walked from the ship to the hotel and when we left to return to the states we walked to the station to catch the bus to Marco Polo airport. The hotel was lovely. The room was beautiful over looking the Grande Canal with a large spacious marble bathroom. But better than the accomodations and breakfast was the personal service we were given. Everyone was kind and helpful with plenty of advice and suggestions for where to go, and how to get there, from restaurants to tourist attractions. We had a wonderful experience and would recommend this hotel to all our friends! Max and Cynthia Pennsylvania, USA

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cat15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure 2 nights before our cruise. I chose it because of the excellant reviews on Trip Advisor. The reviews were correct. The Hotel staff is extremely helpful and welcoming. After an overnight flight we arrived around 10:00 AM. We were extremely tired and since our room was ready we were allowed to check in early. We stayed in a blue room with a view of the Canal. It was worth the extra money to us. I was concerned it would be noisy, but once the shutters are closed, we never heard a sound. The breakfast was excellant and it was a good way to start our day. The location of the Hotel is perfect, as you can easily assess the tourist spots, but the area near the hotel is quieter and less crowded. I would recommend the Hotel Antiche Figure without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Back in Venice at the Hotel Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: Airplastic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just after it was opened in 2003,the first time,and loved the location, staff and aminities. We booked a cruise that began in Venice last Novemeber and took the opportunity to stay at the Antiche Figure again. Once again we had a wonderful stay. It is an easy walk to the cruise ship buses or taxi stand from the hotel. If we ever have the opportunity to return to Venice this will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Hotel Antique Figure”
Reviews.Author: larbac67
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by train from Lucca. It was a fairly long trip and we had our big luggage with us. Once arriving at Santa Lucia Train Station in Venice we could see the hotel across the canal. We took one look at the large bridge we would have to cross with the bags and decided to make it easy on ourselves and hired a water taxi right away. They quickly hauled our bags and us across the canal right in front of the hotel. We were met by Johnny who took care of us for our 3 day stay. Johnny recommended that we upgrade to room 511 which is what we did and what a great suite it was. We liked the sitting room with the sofa and extra desk, the bathroom was very spacious and the shower had some extra devices on it which made it more than just a shower. Antique Figure has a very well thought out breakfast each morning - all I can say is it was one of the best breakfast's we had during our entire 12 days in Italy. The hotel is in a perfect location and right near two vappereto stops. We got a 36 hour pass and used it for most of the time we were there. Riding the vappereto's around Venice is really a great way to see lots of Venice - they can get a little crowded at times - try and get seats at the bow or stern for better viewing. Of course we took the mandatory gondola ride and found one available right in front of the hotel. It was a 40 minute trip around the main and side canals - worth every bit of the 80 Euro charge, so good we added a nice tip as well... Learned quite a bit about Venice on that ride. There are lots of places to eat near by the Figure Hotel so you have that covered. By all means choose this hotel when you visit Venice. Since it is small be sure to book way ahead of your arrival date. When we visit Venice again of course we will stay at the Antique Figure again. Ron Cabral Concord, California

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Tim79Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights back in May. We chose this hotel due to the previous reviews and it more than lived up to its fabulous expectations. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly especially when I put in more than a few requests for 'the best local restaurants' and flowers to be delivered on the Friday morning for my partners 30th birthday. They arrived within 15 mins - perfect service. The room and location were excellent and we had the perfect 3 days with my partner saying yes to my marriage proposal. Don't stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for the Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: johnny1129
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. Our room was not large but was well appointed. The hotel is conveniently located directly across the Grand Canal from the rail station and a water bus stop. They serve a nice breakfast in the morning (for an extra charge), and the staff was wonderful - friendly, professional, and very helpful. I can recommend this hotel to anyone who does not feel they have to be in the expensive St. Mark's square area.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosiesmum_8
Reviews.Content: I do not normally write reviews about the hotels we stay in but the Hotel Antiche Figure was so good I just had to let everyone know. We arrived at the end of extended European holiday to spend our last night in Venice at the Antiche Figure. After 6 weeks of hotels we thought this would just be the same as the rest. Fortunately we soon found out this was not the case. The staff were absolutely wonderful, their service was excellent and most importantly they made you feel as if we were at home. Our room was a deluxe room overlooking the grand canal, it was a blue room and was beautifully furnished. We loved some of the little things that our room had, such as the coffee and tea facilities in the room, something very rare in Italian hotel rooms. The bathroom was a generous size with more than usual amenities and of course it was fitted with beautiful marble and murano glass lighting. Everything about the hotel was perfect. Next time we go to Venice the Hotel Antiches Figure is definitely the place for us to stay. By the way our room number was 311.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay at the Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SabreSailor
Reviews.Content: We booked the Antiche Figure as a result of the reviews in TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed! We were in Venice for a few days before leaving on a cruise on the Zuiderdam. We arrived on September 27 after flying from NY through Madrid, taking the 3 Euro "blue bus" from the airport to Piazzale Roma (the only place in Venice that vehicles are allowed). The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Piazzale Roma (it would have been five minutes as they suggest, but we were each pulling two large wheeled suitcases up and over the two bridges which were a bit challenging). When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by the manager, who offered us a choice of two rooms - and insisted that we go up and choose. The rooms are beautiful (even though we had one the lower cost "red" rooms) and the bath was marble with a wonderful shower. Once up and the room chosen, our bags arrived in about two minutes. We then went down (it was 2:30pm) and asked the manager if there was anywhere in the area to grab a quick lunch. He directed us down an alley next to the hotel to a series of small shops including a bakery and pizzeria. Having eaten, we returned and asked if there was a short walk we could take before we started thinking about dinner. He pulled out a map, told us how to get Vaporetto (water bus) tickets (a 3-day pass), and mapped out a route for us to San Marcos via water and then a walk back. It seemed aggeressive, but it was perfect! By the way, you can pretty much throw your map away in Venice. Despite what you read, you are never really lost. You see yellow signs everywhere for San Marcos, Rialto, Piazzala Roma, and Ferrovia (train station). Since the Antiche Figure is near both the train station and Piazzala Roma, just follow the signs until you get to the Grand Canal! The staff sent us to Osteria al Veccio Pozzo for dinner, a simple restaurant where we got the simple light meal we needed before crashing. The next morning, we went to the Antiche Figure's breakfast room where we found just about anything you'd want - from delightful pastries to cereal to juice, to meats and cheeses, boiled eggs, etc. The hostess was consistent with the rest of the staff - going overboard to be helpful - everyone was even asked whether they wanted cappuccino! Back for more advice from the staff, and then a day's run around the city. Their recommendation for dinner was Trattoria Antica Bessetta, where we eventually resorted to a map - it's not easy to find! But was it worth the effort! We met the owner, who told us about a trip that morning to the Venice Pescheria (open air fish market near the Rialto) where he found the perfect turbot, which we ordered. He brought it to the table in the foil in which is was baked, and then worked like an artist to prepare the perfect presentation on our plates. This place is well worth a visit, but make reservations. It was fully booked when we left.... Another restful night at the Antiche Figure, followed by check out and detailed directions on how to find the free shuttle bus that runs between the Piazzale Roma and the pier (we had previously contacted Holland America Line and they told us that there was no such bus) which was right where the staff told us it would be. Visiting the Antiche Figure is like going home, even though it may be your first visit. The staff makes you feel like family, and they have practiced their art well. We spoke to others who had stayed at other hotels - even one in famous Bauer for more than twice the money - and none could rave about the hotel, its staff and service, as we could. If you're going to Venice, do yourself a favor. Stay at the Antiche Figure - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: tusculum1
Reviews.Content: I booked the Deluxe room at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice by going through their web site. The web site itself was well done, but I couldn't have been more pleased than I was when I actually checked in. Our room was right on the Grand Canal with beautiful views in both directions. The hotel staff was awesome! We felt at home here and I really wished I had booked more time to stay in Venice. It was so easy to get around and our hotel hosts, Francesca and Allejandro (sorry if I misspelled your names) were extremely helpful with tips about what to do. You can bet we'll come back here and I'll ask to stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travel-supermum
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Venice and stayed in the Antiche Figure. It was excellent. It is ideally placed as it is opposite the railway station with a water bus stop close by. The room was delightful, beautifully furnished and welcoming and the bathroom was wonderful - complete with candelabra! The staff were so good - giving us a map and directions to the best places to see and how to get there. They even stored our bags for nothing when we had a late train journey out - a great change when everyone charges you for everything! It was so quiet and peaceful, yet everything to see with the water on your doorstep. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: BillyElliot1
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel for our pre cruise stay on 27th Sept. I had chosen it for the reviews it had recieved and its location. My Husband had emailed them direct a few days before to tell them it was our 30th anniversary, and to ask for a nice room. they emailed stright back to say they would do there best. We arrived at about 5pm, and were greeted by a young man. The owner then came along and told us they had put us in a suite down the side of the main entrance. The young man insisted on taking our bags for us. The room was beautiful with a four poster bed! After changing we went back to reception, and they were very helpful, telling us how to get to places. When we arrived back we had a drink in the bar, before going to our room. Breakfast is served in the hotel in 2 small rooms. You help yourself to the buffet, which is nice. We checked out about 9.30 and have them save our bags for later. The hotel sits at the begining of the grand canal, a short walk from the bus and train station and main water bus. Its in an ideal location for the cruise teminal. We walked to St Marks through the narrow walk ways getting lost, which is a must! Its beautiful. The hotel is very clean, and they are so very helpful. When we got on our cruise I realised I had lost one of my flip flops, so a week later on the way back we called in and they had saved it! We would recomend this hotel to everyone.We will be going back on our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great location”
Reviews.Author: ScreenName021
Reviews.Content: Really lovely little hotel opposite the station on the Grand Canal. Our room didn't really have a view (an alley way) but it was clean, extremely comfortable and very Venetian - marble and murano glass. We checked in very late due to flight problems so maybe if we'd been there earlier in the day we might have had more of a view. But can't complain. It was a really nice room. And it sounds like a odd thing to commend a hotel on, but the air conditioning was great - quiet and efficient. A night's sleep in a what would otherwise be a good hotel is so often ruined by the whirring and whining of bad air con. And good double glazing too - Venice is a noisy place. We slept so well there. Well done to the maintenance staff. The staff are what made the stay. All of them are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is continental buffet and plenty of choice. You can have breakfast in the dining room or outside the hotel by the canal. And a night cap from the bar sitting at the tables outside the hotel watching the vaporettos and gondolas go by is an extremely pleasant way to end the day. The hotel is very handy for transport too. We really enjoyed our stay there and will definitely go back next time we're in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TigluvsItaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 9/13-16 with 2 girlfriends. We reserved 2 rooms. When we arrived on a cold, rainy day, we found that they had only one room for us and had not seen the 2nd request for a room. However, they accomodated us by giving us a large triple room with a view of the Grande Canal. The staff was right up there to set up the room. The next day, they gave my friend her room one floor up and they let me and my other friend stay in the triple for a great price (remember the room had an awesome view!) They were very apologetic about the whole mistake. The managers were very helpful and if you called down to request help ie) with bags, they would be up in 60 seconds flat. No joke!! The breakfast was adequate. The room and bathroom was spacious and beautifully decorated. I liked standing on the small balcony and watching boat traffic on the canal. It was a little far from San Marco but there is a vaporetto nearby. I preferred walking so this wasn't a big deal to me. It is right across the canal from the train station. On a side note, ladies, some of the male staff here are VERY easy on the eyes ; ) Overall, the experience here at this hotel and the city in general was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Brude
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely smaller hotel situated in a great location. Access from Marco Polo Airport is around 3 euro per person by direct bus to Piazzale Roma just a few hundred metres away while the hotel itself is directly opposite the train station. Position is on the Grand Canal with most of the sites a pleasant walk away or of course a water boat ride. Lots of restaurants in the area so you have a great choice but of course Venice is not somewhere you come for the variety and quality of its cuisine, pizza is its staple dish. On arrival at the hotel we were welcomed by the most pleasant and enthusiastic staff I have ever encountered. We were offered an update to their newly opened suites for surcharge but no pressure to take the deal. We visited our pre booked room which was lovely but the suites were really special and suited our needs better so we took the offer. The suites have a lounge with kitchen area, double bedroom and top quality bathroom, well worth the extra. Our time in Venice was terrific, Venice is a lovely quiet and safe city due to the total lack of motor vehicles, you really discover what we have lost when you can walk around smelling the air not fumes, hearing the sounds of peoples not Lorries and can turn a corner without fear of being flattened. Breakfast at the hotel was a good quality continental and again the staff were wonderful, full of smiles and welcomes. This is a wonderfully convenient hotel which is maintained in excellent condition and is staffed by highly trained and pleasant people, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: AlanfromLancashire
Reviews.Content: The Antiche Figure has a lovely setting overlooking the Grand Canal and extremely close to Ferrovia waterbus stop. Continental Breakfast choices are fine and the accompanying Cappucino's finish it off nicely. All the staff go out of there way to assist and are really helpful with directions and advice. Nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are clean and well furnished. The free water taxi to and from the Casino, with free entry tickets from the hotel including a free drink, provided an exciting evening's entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkKwok
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly. There is a computer to use with internet access of course. The hotel is conveniently located on the opposite side of the train station, across the bridge. Mind you though that there are 40 steps up the bridge and another 40 steps down, which means you want to travel light as you have to carry your luggage across the bridge. The room has been renovated and the bathroom is very clean and tidy. The fresh cappucino at breakfast is a nice touch. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rogermorgan
Reviews.Content: What can we say about this hotel. We stayed a full week in room 412 top floor with three windows overlooking the Grand Canal. This is a small hotel with a great family atmosphere.Nothing is to much trouble. The hotel offer a free trip to a Glass factory via water taxi on Murano, wonderful experience.We spent a long time looking at TA to find the hotel in vencie for our first visit, Hotel Antiche Fugure will not dissappoint you.The hotel is on the Grand Canal, 5 minutes walk from the bus terminal and the train station.Gandola trips go from outside the front door as do water taxis.The Hotel organised a gondola trip for us at night, it was fantastic. If you go to Venice book this Hotel. On a general note ,when you arrive go and buy a 1,2 or 3 day pass from ATVC to travel around on the public transport system including the vaporetto boats. Linda and Roger, West Midlands UK

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJLandof10000lakes
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel and very helpful staff. Very enjoyable to sip a glass of wine on the outside patio with the Grand Canal in front of you. We booked a room on the low end of the hotel's price scale. It was very adequate (as I said it was very clean, and that's really important to me, esp. in a foreign country!). The room was probably a bit larger than the std. European room size, but small by American standards. Overall, the room was decent enough but nothing to 'write home about'. Given the high prices in Venice, the rooms are competitively priced, but compared to elsewhere are a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mmunson5
Reviews.Content: My bride and I were honeymooning through Italy and finished in Venice. We followed the recommendations on trip advisor for Hotel Antiche Figure. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport by bus as you only have to hop over two bridges. We were upgraded to a newly renovated room that was not on the water, but the room was newly refurbished and updated. It made for a perfect stay in Venice. The staff is amazing. They offered incredible service to all of our wants and needs. They directed us around Venice like real pros. The rooms were freshly updated with renovated bathroom.
