The room was clean, cool and refreshing. Despite being off the water, I would highly recommend these rooms to anyone staying here. A great hotel with tremendous service and location. We will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “family like atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: montreal54
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the beginnig of august for four nights.All the personnel of this hotel that i met during my stay were friendly and get out of their way to make my stay like if i was a family member. They were always smiling. The location of the hotel is convenient.It is near the train station(right on the other side of the grand canal) and near the bus terminus (5 minutes walk with luggages on the same side of the canal as the hotel).It is lively but not crowdy. The room i had was cleanand comfortable.It was not a tiny room.Their was space to move around.Naturally it was not the equivalent of the north american standard as floor space goes but it beat largely a New york city standard hotel room. The breakfast room was inviting and the breakfast good. I loved to sit outside facing the Grand canal in the early morning as the city started to unfold a new day. I felt welcome and i would likely stay there again if im back in Venice one day

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: BiniTravels
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel on other side of grand canal from train station. Follow signs to Ferrovia to get back to the hotel from other parts of Venice. Hotel is located in less touristy area but in close proximity to all sights and transportation. Great service by staff (checking in/breakfast/maid). We upgraded room to Residence Suite which was a newly renovated building with the entrance in the alley next to the hotel. Room was beautiful! It was large and bathroom had massage shower. It felt like our own apartment in Venice. Breakfast buffet was in main hotel, with tables inside and outside overlooking grand canal. Different rolls, cheese, meats, cereal and fruit, but no American breakfast. Complimentary boatride and factory tour of murano glass at Murano Island. Definitely worth going.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BillandSam
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with really friendly staff. Great location for Venice - not too close to tourist swamped San Marco but easy to reach all locations in Venice. On Grand Canal with main bus depot nearby, main railway station opposite, waterbus opposite and 5 minute walk from airport waterbus drop off point (as there are no roads, you always have to walk to your hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel with Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Arunda01
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Antiche Figure based on others' reviews on Trip Advisor. After a long flight from the US, we took a bus to the Piazzale Roma (main bus stop) and were so relieved to find the hotel just a 5-minute walk away on the canal. The hotel clerk (Johnny, if I recall) was so courteous. He not only accommodated our request for no ground-level rooms, he also upgraded us to a gorgeous suite! The room did not disappoint - beautiful hardwood floors, classic decorations, and the bathroom appeared newly renovated. This hotel really helped make our first trip to Venice an enjoyable, relaxing trip. My one and only "opportunity area" for this hotel would be its breakfast offering. The breakfast room is quite tight and nothing looked/tasted very appetizing - the cereal was a little stale and the fruit looked bruised.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: jama2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming, we will go back again. The service is excellent and our room was splendid. We stayed here for 5 days next time it will be more!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back in a flash”
Reviews.Author: Neanne
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel tucked into a busy area of Venice, the Antiche Figure is directly across the Grand Canal from the train station. To get there from the station, simply gross the bridge, turn to the right and itâ€™s about the equivalent of a city block at most. The bus station to the airport is a short walk beyond the hotel and across a couple of bridges and you can travel to either Marco Polo or Treviso for very little money. With the trains, gondolas, heavy foot traffic and constant coming and going of the vaporetti, you might at first wince at the prospect of a room fronting the canal, however, we spent two nights there and slept like babies. Rooms are smallish but comfortable, with a worn-around-the edges sort of elegance with plenty of closet space, in room safe and fridge, TV, phone, antiqued furniture and silk drapes, and the spacious and elegant baths which seemed to be the standard during our stay in Italy. Personnel is crisply efficient and consistently available. There is an elevator, an ample Continental breakfast of fruits, yogurt, cereal, and pastries or croissants. There is a machine for American coffee and staff will quickly offer you freshly made cappuccino if they spot you in front of the apparatus. Granted the Antiche Figure is a long walk to Piazza San Marco (which can be obviated by traveling via vaporetto) and perhaps itâ€™s not the most glamorous spot in Venice, but the view is still lovely. Frankly, after the hordes of tourists in Piazza San Marco, I found the area rather an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Grand Canal, but without the Canal crowds”
Reviews.Author: wdw151024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure for 4 days in July, 2008. We had a wonderful time in Venice, and a terrific stay at the Antiche Figure. It is very convenient to the airport buses (how we arrived there) and the train station (how we went to Florence, our next destination). Great breakfast, great location away from the crowds (you won't regret the 20 minute walk each night to walk off all the gelato you eat) and a very hospitable staff. Our room was adorable; the 5-head shower alone was worth the price, and we slept very well. Alessandro and Francesca were wonderful with restaurant recommendations, telling us what sights to see (although definitely plan on getting a little lost in Venice) - Alessandro even gave us a restaurant recommendation for Florence when he found out we were heading there next. Read the bad reviews in context - it's a city, of course there's graffiti. That has nothing to do with the hotel, or how nice and modern the buildings are inside. Part of the fun of traveling to Europe is that it is very different in a lot of ways than other places. Just enjoy it. NOTES: In terms of food, there are a lot of very touristy places. Seek out the smaller looking ones, where locals are eating. There is really good pizza (served on wax paper, by the slice) on the left hand side of the narrow street that leads you into the square right before the Accademia. The best gelato we found was La Boutique del Gelato. We took the hotel's free taxi to Murano. Be prepared to stand firm because the prices in Murano are outrageous, but the private water taxi over there on a beautiful day in Venice was worth the price of whatever we bought. Very romantic. *** All in all, we had an amazing time in Venice and Hotel Antiche Figure was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Garysbogie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure just prior to embarking on a cruise from Venice. The hotel is quaint and beautifully maintained. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal. The only detraction was the smaller windows. We were on the top floor and it appears those below have larger windows and hence, a better view. Regardless, we were thoroughly satisfied with the room. The bed was soft, the bathroom exquisite! They furnish robes, slippers, the whole nine yards! A nice buffet breakfast is furnished. A small bar off the lobby provides alcoholic libations as well as cappucinos and cafe Americano. The location is convenient, being right across the canal from the train station and a short walk from the bus terminal. Water taxis are available at the train station and private taxis are also available. It's about a half hour walk to St. Mark's, but it's pleasant with numerous shops to browse around in or small cafes to grab a cappucino. There are a lot of cafes nearby, so going hungry won't be a problem. Overall, I couldn't give a higher recommendation to a hotel. Beware that everything in Venice has to be offloaded and transferred to a boat before delivery, so extra expenses are involved. With the dollar not holding up to the Euro, everything in Venice is expensive. Regardless, it's a city you shouldn't miss and the Hotel Antiche Figure will make it even more rewarding. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the family!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahANDchristian
Reviews.Content: Rarely do you encounter customer service like this. The hotel is so intimate that even though you may only stay there for a couple of nights as we did, the staff know who you are and remember the last conversation they had with you. Not in an overbearing way... just in a way that says they are interested in you, in your stay and in your enjoyment of their city. Of which they are abundantly proud. Our room was beautiful. By way of congratulations for our marrige, we were lucky enough to be given one of the two rooms which home a little C15th balcony, giving us fabulous views of the Grand canal. The rooms are decorated in a typically venetian palatial style... fabric wall coverings, chandeliers etc. Spacious beds which were very comfortable, and so very quiet. Location wise this place was great.. Gondolas outside the hotel doors, Train station on the other side of the Canal, great for onward transfers to Rome or Florence. Water taxi over thebridge. St Mark's square 20 mins walk away. The hotel offers a free water taxi service to Murano island, home of the famous glass, where you can enjoy a free tour of the factory and witness glass blowing etc. well worth visiting. The main bonus was the liitle terrace where you can sit and enjoy breakfast and watch the world go by. brilliant! Lovely family feel, helpful staff, Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gem of a Hotel- Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: thereseNdave
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, we had planned a week sailing on the French Riviera, followed by a few nights in Venice. We picked this hotel, based on the great reviews we had read, and we were completly satisfied! Everyone, from the front desk staff to the cleaning service to the dining room and bar staff, was exceptional. From the moment we arrived, they took great efforts to make our trip a great experience. They helped us with suggestions of things to do and places to eat, as well as what to avoid. We had a Grand Canal View room and just loved it. The only thing I would change next time is the lack of a balcony. Our room, while nice, didn't have a balcony and I didn't realize that some rooms had balconies and some didn't. For a honeymoon trip, I would have much preferred having the balcony. Overall, this hotel provides a very good value- it is so close to the train station and the bus stations (both water bus and auto bus). Easy to get anywhere from here- and yet it is a bit out of the most hectic, crowded areas. Very professional and friendly staff. Very helpful! I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I returned to Venice. Thank you very much for a very memorable time in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: MyersLondon
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Antiche Figure was absolutely fabulous, the rooms were comfortable and clean as well as the hotel generally. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, always with a smile. The Hotel is situated centrally, so you have easy access to all places, and it is decorated to a high standard. We felt comfortable and at home. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of taking a holiday in Venice and would definitely return here again. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargeYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the Saturday night after we left the cruise ship Splendour of the Seas. The hotel was just perfect for us and we had a beautiful room at the side of the hotel. It did not matter that we did not have a view as we were only staying the one night and had to leave early the next morning for the airport. We thought the hotel was one of the nicest we had stayed in and the breakfast was fine the next morning. All the staff were very pleasant, helpful and most obliging. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and if we visit Venice again we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaSteu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche Figure was perfect. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was darling. Great location. We are a family of four and were only staying for 1 night after our cruise. They had a room that had plenty of room for 4. Could not have been a better location. Close to everything yet away from the more congested areas. We are used to staying at 4 to 5 star hotels - we thought the cleanliness, accommodations and breakfast was right up there with the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ryans5
Reviews.Content: We used TripAdvisor with some trepidation to help us find a good hotel for our two night stay in Venice prior to a cruise. We were thrilled beyond words to find that everything we had read about the Antiche Figure hotel in this forum was accurate. The rooms (we traveled with another couple) were very nice, one was larger than the other, but the smaller one was still very functional. The decor was lovely, bathrooms especially. The rooms were very quiet, as well. The breakfast was quite good and could be eaten in either the breakfast room or outside right by the canal. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Definitely trust their restaurant recommendations, they were excellent. The hotel is a short walk (ten minutes max) from the Piazzelle Roma but it does require going over two bridges to get there, so pack accordingly! The hotel staff were able to direct us exactly to where the free bus was in Piazzelle Roma to take us to the cruise port. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to everyone, it has a wonderful charm about it and it's location, away from the busier parts of Venice and near the major port, make it ideal for cruisers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug037
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 10am thinking that we would have to drop our bags off and check in later in the day, but our room was ready and they allowed us to check in straight away. Our room was superb - overlooking the grand canal. It was huge and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and gave us lots of info on getting around, and even arranged a trip to Murano to see glass blowing, free of charge! We have stayed in many hotels in Europe and this has been the best so far, I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Stay”
Reviews.Author: LissyRose
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay in this hotel. It is situated on the Grand Canal, very convenient to vaporetto stops and the railway station, and a great base to explore Venice. The staff were professional, charming and very Venetian (especially Alessandro....mmm...). The facilities were excellent: classy room, comfortable bed, a roomy bathroom with drying facilities (it rains alot in Venice...), free internet, good breakfast (the best soft-boiled eggs), and competent airconditioning. I enjoyed every minute at this hotel, and I found myself looking forward to getting away from the crowds to relax in my room. When I needed help with tours, again the staff were very helpful. I plan to return here, it is good value for money and I thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Thombtc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Mediterranean cruise and stayed at Antiche Figure for 2 nights before the departure of the Emerald Princess from Venice. Once flying into Venice we took the ACTO bus to Piazza Roma. The bus is right outside the exit of the baggage area of the airport so it was very convenient. Look for a yellow ticket machine. Once you put your 3 euros in ( it gives change), validate it in another machine near it before the bus comes. When you arrive at Piazza Roma (very busy area) you have a decision to make before going to the hotel. How will you get there. We are in our 60's and pulling our luggage over 2 stepped bridges nearly killed us. If you are young, you could walk to the hotel. If not,. take a water taxi at the Piazza. ( Even young people were struggling with their luggage) The hotel was fantastic and the room 411 overlooking the canal was so much fun. When you take a shower, you can open the bathroom window and look at the beautiful green dome right next to you. There are two windows that you can open over the canal and see and hear all of the action, but once you close the windows, we couldn't hear anything. Amazing! We could see the Railway Station right across the canal. The breakfast in the morning was typical European and we loved the little cappicino machine. Take your breakfast out to the tables in front of or the side of the hotel to eat. Don't miss the action. We couldn't understand why people would eat in the breakfast room. The staff was outstanding and very pleasant. They answered any question you could think of and drew maps for anywhere. We can't say enough about the hotel and you won't be disappointed. My husband and I have traveled to Europe 5 times and would definitely stay at this hotel again. We paid about 300 euros a night for the room ( directly booked, but don't forget, you are on the canal and nothing is cheap in Venice). Going to the cruise ship, we shared a taxi with another couple we met a the hotel and then it was cheaper. Ask the desk if someone would need to also go to the ship. We paid 40 euros instead of 80 and it was well worth it. It is farther than you think to the cruise terminal if you have 2 suitcases a piece and dragging them over many steps on bridges. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel away from the madness”
Reviews.Author: travel JR
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel right on the Grand Hotel. Located away from the madness of the tousit areas...yet diretly across the canal from the train station and a few blocks walk to the bus station...the 2 ways into and out of Venice. The front desk people are great...reallyu care about their guests...and very helpful in finding neighborhood restaurants. One of the great bargains of Italy is the 24-hour pass on the water buses...take your own tour of Venice by day and night and go see the islands (Burano and Murano). Tip: BUy the ticket in early evening, go for a tour that evening..and then use it for the next day to see the islands. We found food in Vencie to be expensive and not great...but try to find the true neighborhood restaurants for an interesting evening and good food. We were careful regarding pickpockets but did have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel - go there!”
Reviews.Author: DCM.Dart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2008 and all the rave reviews were right on! The hotel is beautiful and the staff are all uniformly pleasant and go out of their way to be helpful and welcoming. This location is excellent because it's away from the main tourist areas of San Marco Square but is located near water bus stops and you can get anywhere you want easily and quickly. Only 1 warning - This is not a hotel for people who are frail, with bad backs or with disabilities. If you arrive from the airport by bus, this hotel requires you to traverse 2 bridges from the Piazzale Roma each with at least 10 steps up and back down. Or if you arrive at the train station which is literally across the canal from the hotel, you must climb a bridge with 50 steps up and the same number down...easy with no luggage but quite a workout if you are carrying 50 lb. bags with you. Be forewarned. Make sure you get restaurant recommendations from the front desk staff. All were very good and we were never disappointed. All in all, an excellent hotel experience and I would unhesitatingly recommend it to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: nateCanada
Reviews.Content: After seeing the many reviews here, I booked this hotel pre-cruise. I tried through travelocity and then, finally got this off an european website. This is a fabulous hotel. We were extremely impressed by the location, friendliness of the staff, quality of the room, and the breakfast as well. It felt like a small intimate boutique hotel. It is located near the station. Only had to carry our luggage over 2 bridges! We arrived late and the staff had everything ready for us. The room was elegant and large. The washroom clean and tidy. In room safe. Breakfast was great as well. Free internet in the lobby. Wish we could have stayed longer. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel. Highly highly recommended. Worth any reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy”
Reviews.Author: aswillia1
Reviews.Content: On the last day of our honeymoon we were confirmed to stay with the Hotel Antiche Figure. We arrived and they told us that we were a no show. There was a disconnect between the hotel and travel agent. They accomodated us by putting us in a private apartment. It was down at the end of an alley. Spray painted wall. Once inside we had no hot water, no phone, no alarm clock, and a bug zapper. As I read in bed I had bugs on my shirt. I'd think twice about this place. Management was not very friendly, but since we pre-paid they knew they must accomodate.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: DownUnderPerth
Reviews.Content: We are 2 seniors from Australia who just spent 4 weeks travelling by train through southern Germany, Austria, Slovenia and northern Italy. All of our accommodation was booked online, but our 3 night stay at Hotel Antiche Figure was the best. First of all the hotel was easy to find since it is located directly across the Grand Canal from the main train station. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and told our room was ready, but a newly-renovated suite nearby was offered for the same price. We opted for the beautifully decorated suite with a living area, kitchenette, large bedroom with canopy bed and complete bathroom with all mod-cons. Breakfast was served each morning in the main hotel. The manager and his staff spoke perfect English. Nearby restaurants, patronized by the locals, were recommended. Advice on the ferries and sightseeing hints were given. Even a water taxi ride and guided tour through one of the glass factories on Murano Island were arranged for us with 15 minutes notice. We could not have wished for a more pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: lad2709
Reviews.Content: II guess all the preceding reviews some up this little gem of a hotel in Venice. We booked one of the suites which are in a separate building about 30 meters away from the hotel. The standard of furnishing and comfort are excellent and they are quiet being off the Grand Canal, views from these rooms are limited. The suites are well equipped, with kitchen and seating area and bedroom and bathroom. They are small, but not unusual for a city and OK for a few days which is the usual case. So if you are after a view of the Grand Canal book in to the main hotel. The breakfast is served in the main hotel and reasonably good. The staff are all helpful and will provide any information or assistance you require. The location is ideal if you are arriving or leaving by road or rail and convenient for the Vapporato. This is good value, and quality accommodation for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. WILL return”
Reviews.Author: dramaticrunner
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel upon seeing its reasonable price and high rating, and my expectation were all exceeded. The staff was extremely helpful, and made sure we had everything we needed. There was free internet and free breakfast. After arriving in Venice, I was so thankful that the hotel was located where it was. It would have been so stressful to have to search through the alleys immediately upon arriving in a foreign city. This was for our honeymoon. We stayed for 3 nights in a standard room, went to rome for 1 night (and stayed in a 4star that pales in comparison to AF) then came back and spend a night in a deluxe with a view. Their bathrooms are amazing. Things you should know an expect. 1. Building in venice are close together, if you don't pay for a view, don't expect one, and don't complain when you look out your window and see the side of a building. 2. The grand canal is Venice major street, boats are loud, it will not be silent. I am getting ALL nostolgic just writing this.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as everyone says!”
Reviews.Author: jayhawkinden
Reviews.Content: We booked a double deluxe canal view room for 2 nights for the beginning of our honeymoon. Our check in was smooth and the front desk personnel were wonderful. LOCATION: Superb! We came into Venice by train and the hotel is located directly across the canal from the train station. The most difficult portion is dragging two 50 lb luggage bag over the bridge. There are only steps, no smooth part to pull them! The other benefit of this location is that is located next to a vaperetto stop (water bus) that takes you wherever you want to go. If you desire to walk (which we did), it takes only about 20 minutes to walk to St. Marks Square and about 10 minutes to Rialto Bridge. Frankly you have so much fun walking you don't even notice the length! ROOM: Our room was very spacious for a European room. Beds were firm as to be expected, but fine. The view is really nice, but a little noisy in the morning with all of the water traffic. I really didn't care. The bathroom was great with a deep tub, double sinks, robes, and tons of hot water! FOOD: We didn't eat at the hotel. We ate in the town. SERVICE: The front desk personnel are amazing! They wil help you find anything, explain how to get there in detail, and put it on a map. All of this will a pleasant, friendly attitude! I didn't post any pictures, because mine are all the same as everyone else's.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: mmctrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel in this beautiful city for three nights (May 22 - 25) and I wish had booked a longer stay. I would like to keep the hotel a secret but that would not be fair! They deserve the business. The staff made my stay very special. By far this was the best hotel that I stayed at in Italy. I would recommend you choose this property for your stay for the following reasons: The staff - From the minute I arrived I was treated with the utmost courtesy and professionalism. All of the staff (I apologize I do not know all of their names) were wonderful. Each guest is treated like a valued customer. The lovely lady at the front desk was so pleasant when I arrived. She took the time to explain all of the main sites and options for accessing Venice. Linda (the very nice lady in the breakfast room) makes you a great cappuccino in the morning and is very pleasant. It is a nice way to start your day. The breakfast selection was great (meats, cheeses, cereals, pastries and juice). The location - it is right across the canal from the train station. You exit the train station to the left, cross the bridge and turn right and you are at the hotel. You do not have to drag your luggage on boats and canals. It is very convenient. In addition, the vaporetto stop (Ferrovia) is across the canal so you can easily access all of the sites. Tip:you can buy a 48 hour ACTV pass for 26.00 Euros or a 72 hour pass for 31 Euros. Walking is also possible with the signs that point you to San Marco and Rialto. I recommend a walk at night in particular. The room - I was upgraded to a beautiful suite which was located beside the hotel. It was spotlessly clean with excellent housekeeping service. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large with a shower/tub combination. The suite had a full kitchen and two TVs. The toiletries were very nice and replaced daily. The hotel also has a very nice bar and at night you can sit at your table and enjoy a glass of wine while overlooking the canal. TIP: I enjoyed a lovely meal at Trattoria al Ponte Tel: [-] Address: Ponte del Megio (Calle Larga), Santa Croce 1666 The sea bass was excellent! I cannot wait to return to Venice and to this hotel. Thanks again to all of the staff at the Hotel Antiche Figure for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: jbkToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We researched Venice hotels for 6 months before choosing Hotel Antiche Figure for our 6 nights stay. We took the negative comment (which are view) with a grain of salt. People FIND THINGS to complain about. Our stay was excellent from the moment we arrived. Check in was fast and efficient . We were upgraded to the other building which had ample space and beautiful decor. Breakfast and service was above European standards. Thanks Linda! The location is perfect, close to the train station and vaperrato. It was nice to walk the 20 minutes and enjoy Venice's beauty. The entire staff deserves a pat on the back. Keep up the good work. Our next Venice vacation will be Antiche Figure without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: janefromtexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Antiche Figure the night prior to our cruise, based on recommendations from these boards. Because we had visited Venice previously, we were happy to stay away from the crowds in San Marco and enjoy the beauty and tranquility of San Polo and Santo Croce. The hotel's position across from the Ferrovia made it easy to always find our way back. We opted for a pricey water taxi at the airport, but felt that our jet lag, our luggage, and the distance made it worthwhile. We were able to share the water taxi cost to the pier the next day with a couple we met in the lobby. The graciousness of the staff and intimate size of the hotel made it easy to make this connection. The hotel is beautifully maintained and we would want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: StandingRoomOnly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure for 3 nights in a 1st floor (aka 2nd floor) room overlooking the canal. I save "5 star" ratings for very few places, but I am giving this hotel a 5 because the service was excellent. Feel free to ask the staff or owners any questions about recommendations in the area or things you might be in need of--they are a very good resource and friendly. The furnishings were very well put together, bathroom was beautiful, bed was firm but still reasonably comfortable, and the windows over the canal provided a welcome breeze. Breakfast included different breads, meats and cheeses, pastries, fruits, yogurt, juice, and cappuccino. All were very good and worth the extra cost. Location was great as most here already mentioned. You are right across from the train station (no noise from the trains can be heard though). It was wonderful to just go over one bridge and the hotel is right there. You will appreciate not having to walk far with your luggage. Noise from the outside was minimal, and any noise we did hear from those talking outside or from those passing by at night was rather comforting and lulled us to sleep. Honest negatives if there are to be any... no iron in the room but they will provide one if you ask, we had a couple spotty cleaning days (first time in the room--garbage in the bathroom wasn't taken out although we overlooked this) and then our room garbage wasn't taken out on another day we were there--but promptly removed after mentioning this to the front desk. It may have just been an "off" day for the cleaning staff, and may be a one-time thing. Only other negative would be having a direct view of the train station and canal, and not the canal and other Venetian buildings, but that is not a fault of the hotel, more so just a preference for some. Overall the service was excellent (deserves a 5) and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Gem on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: DickSuzanne
Reviews.Content: Very easy access from either the train station at Santa Lucia (on island of Venice) or Marco Polo airport via ACTV bus to Pizzale Roma. Located right on Grand Canal directly across from the Ferrovia (main train station). A most pleasant surprise with "old Europe" grace and ambience at competitive prices. Hotel manager, Allessandro, and front desk manager Michale are personable, knowledgeable and helpful. Superior-level rooms are newly redone, beautifully furnished with excellent bathrooms and exceedingly quiet if a bit small by US standards. Deluxe rooms are similarly refurbished, spacious, quiet but with stunning views of the Grand Canal (ours had three large windows opening directly onto the Grand Canal from a third story). Staff recommendations for dining were "insider' tips and were also excellent. If your room includes breakfast (optional) it is of a very adequate European style. The obsessive attention to detail at this hotel shows and makes your stay one you will not forget.

Reviews.Title: “DO believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Cazzers
Reviews.Content: My husband brought me to Venice for my birthday this year, a city I've always wanted to visit. He was looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel but because of the fabulous reviews on TripAdvisor he chose the Antiche Figure. We had a wonderful stay here. The staff are fantastic! Thank you, Francesca, for all your help and advice and also for booking a beautiful trattoria for my birthday dinner. It was just perfect. The staff at the trattoria even sang "Happy Birthday" to me and brought out my pudding complete with birthday candle. I knew that my husband would never have thought of doing this and the waiter told me that Francesca had let him know at the time of booking that it was a special birthday treat. We had a wonderful evening in the most beautiful and romantic of cities. This is a gorgeous hotel. I loved the Murano glass chandeliers in the bedroom (and in the bathroom!!). We upgraded to a room overlooking the Grand Canal and can't recommend it highly enough. The breakfasts, location and, of course the genuinely friendly and helpful staff made the trip so memorable, I'd go back in a heartbeat. Don't waste any time - book it, go and ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: MacAdam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel end of March/beginning of April this year for 5 days for the occasion of our 20th anniversary. We upgraded to a junior suite on arrival which was magnificent with the windows facing onto the Grand Canal. The suite was immaculate and each day when we returned to the hotel there was a Baci chocolate laid out on a serviette on each pillow. The en suite bathroom was large and also extremely clean. All the staff were lovely, especially at Reception and if you required any advice on travelling about Venice, where to eat etc. they were extremely helpful. Whenever we return to Venice we would definitely stay here again and would have no hesitation in recommendng it to anyone. The hotel is also very well located across from the railway station and it was very easy to get around from this point.

Reviews.Title: “It's Really As Good As All of the Reviews Say It Is!”
Reviews.Author: BostonNolefan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Venice from May 8-12 and we spent two nights at the Hotel Antiche Figure before boarding our cruise ship. We read these reviews before booking the room and trust me (a complete stranger) staying there was one of the BEST decisions that we ever made. The hotel is on the northern portion of the grand canal adjacent to the Scalzi bridge. We hadn't been to Venice before, so we didn't know what this location meant. It's within a very short walk from the bus stop from the airport (Piazza le Roma) and across from both the train station and a vaporetto stop. This means that you can actually take the bus from the airport (~3 Euros/person), be dropped off at Piazza le Roma, and reasonably walk to the hotel with a small suitcase. (In full disclosure you still have to cross two bridges, though). We're young and found no problem making the walk. We can't imagine having to lug our suitcases around to the hotels further down the canal. Our room was on the top floor (deluxe blue decor, check out the website) overlooking the canal. It was really beautiful and they have an elevator which made the trip up easy. The room was very nice. Nice furniture, well lit, spotless, and it appeared newly renovated (not sure if it was, or if it has just been well taken care of). It was larger than the hotels we stayed at elsewhere in Europe. The bathroom was top notch, large, beautiful with marble and Murano glass fixtures It also had two sinks. Everyone at the front desk was friendly and helped us navigate through this beautiful city. They spoke excellent English (we started to feel guilty because we don't speak Italian) and took great care to make sure that we were happy with our stay. I wish we could have stayed longer, but alas the boat had to set sail. That brings up another point. While the cruise ship port is relatively close, it is too far to trek on foot. You can either take a water taxi (they are literally parked directly in front of the building, or you can walk to Piazza le Roma and take a bus provided by the port authority (our bus was free). Less than 5 minutes drive to the cruise terminal. Breakfast consisted of breakfast meats, cheeses, coffees, and breads. It was very good. We made use of the free computer in the lobby with internet access. I think that there is wifi access in the rooms (but don't quote me on that). We were pressed for space so we didn't pack a computer. We will definitely be staying here again when we return to Venice. The cleanliness, size of the room, the view, the location, breakfast and staff made it special. If you choose to stay here you'll be happy with your decision!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location, and facility”
Reviews.Author: justdadNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as last of trip from Rome, Florence and Venice. Location across canal from train station and minutes to airport direct shuttle was ideal. Staff on all shifts went out of there way to offer assistance and spoke excellent english. Room was high end of 3 star and price very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience - worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mginabq
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice, April 28 and 29, 2008. I selected this property based on the TripAdvisor reviews because the trip to Italy was a surprise for my husband's 60th birthday, and I wanted things to be as close to perfect as they could be. I made the right choice, so many thanks to all of you who stayed there before us and wrote reviews. The hotel sits on the Grand Canal immediately across from the train station, which is very convenient. We lucked out as we were crossing the bridge and a young many offered to carry all our bags for 10 euros. It was a bargain! (Note: If you're coming from Piazzale Roma, there is a porter service via boat that will take you and your luggage for 35 euro - also a great bargain given the number of bridges you have to cross.) I splurged on the deluxe canal view room and was glad I did. While it is true that straight across you see the train station, that is definitely outweighed by the opportunity to watch the passing traffic in the Canal. The rooms are generously-sized, exactly as pictured on the hotel's website, immaculately clean, AND the bathrooms are huge, particularly by European standards. Every staff member with whom we interacted was professional, pleasant and helpful both before we arrived, by making restaurant recommendations and reservations, and after we got there, by answering our numerous questions and arranging a water taxi to get us to the airport when we departed. Francesa and Michele were lovely and tried to anticipate our needs. There is a computer for guests' use in the lobby, or if you travel with your own notebook, as we did, you can request a network cable at the desk to use in your room. The breakfast was excellent. We laughed when an American family came into the breakfast room, inspected the food, turned up their noses and promptly announced there was "nothing to eat." I don't know what they expected because both days there were hard-boiled eggs, several kinds of meat and cheese, three types of cereal, abundant pastries, croissants and breads, juices and freshly-made cappuccinos and espressos. Both evenings we were there, we sat out in the little "cafe" area they have facing the Canal and had grappa while we watched the passersby. All in all, it was a lovely ending to our three-week trip. We will certainly return to Venice - it's a fabulous city where walking everywhere is safe and doable - and when we do, we will stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure. One last note: if you're going to Italy, learn some Italian. I did, and it was most rewarding to see how appreciative the people were. No one ever laughed at the numerous errors I'm sure I made and instead I heard again and again, "Brava!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lbarlow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the ending point on a 12 day cruise and it was great! The location was about 15 mins from where the cruise ship docked and there was a free shuttle to the Piazzale Roma. we walked with our luggage to the hotel in about 10 mins. The location is great you can walk anywhere in about 20 mins. There are gondolas right outside and there is plenty of food places around the corner. The train statiion is across the Grand Canal and not to noisy either. Free internet and Breakfast was a nice addition. All in all we enjpyed our stay and would reccomend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Book with confidence!”
Reviews.Author: Nickleics
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via TripAdvisor. It is very easy to find in Venice; we arrived by train and it's directly opposite the station entrance, across the bridge over the canal. The hotel's location is an easy, and interesting, 15-20 minutes walk from the famous Rialto bridge and San Marco square. The hotel staff are friendly, offering speedy check-in as well lots of helpful advice about the most important places to visit during our short stay (2 nights). Inside the hotel was smart and clean. Our room, a large room at the front of the fourth floor overlooking the canal, was immaculately clean and of a good size. The bathroom was smart, with twin wash basins, although the bath and shower were quite small. A modest breakfast room downstairs is very efficiently staffed and has a good selection. At the time of writing, the Antiche Figure is no. 2 on TripAdvisor, and with good reason. A combination of excellent location, friendly staff and nice, clean rooms make it an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpweant
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. very clean rooms. big shower. upgraded to a bigger room located off the main street, very quiet. good breakfast. very helpful staff. walking distance from the bus stop and train station. highly recommend if staying in venice before a cruise. easy walking from the hotel to the cruise ship terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: jdawg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure last week of March for our first visit to Venice. The hotel is perfectly situated right by the water near the airport shuttle depot and the Ferrovia (train station). This is a big factor if you plan to take the train to other parts of Italy and have a luggage or two, or if you will take the train to Venice. Hotel is across from sestiere of Cannaregio, which has a lot of gelato places and restaurants. We upgraded to a deluxe room for 30 euros a night including breakfast. Not bad at all. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom quite roomy. We had 3 windows that overlooked the water and the street. Our room was on the second floor and contrary to what most people said they experienced at hotels in Venice and Italy as a whole, it was quiet at night and even early morning. We kind of expected it would be noisy, but we're surprised in a very good way that it wasn't. Traditional Italian breakfast had quite a bit of options and cappuccino was better made by one of the servers than from the machine. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. It's romantic yet not cheesy. The concierge was very helpful and nice, too. I'd stay here again if I come back to Venice. Another one I highly recommend is the church of Santa Maria Gloriosa dei Frari. The exterior looks rather plain but once you set foot in, you'll be more than amazed. Jaw-dropping, really. They said it rivals St. Mark's Basilica for top billing and I completely agree. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Plush room”
Reviews.Author: skymasterztl
Reviews.Content: You couldn't beat the location of this hotel since there is no motorized transportion in the city. Walk out of St Lucia Termini, cross the bridge right outside the doors, take a right on the sidewalk on the other side of the bridge-and your home! There are boat taxi stands out front (since the hotel is right on the canal), or you can make the trek through Per Rialto on to Piazza San Marco where all the action is. It is about a 30-40 minute walk, but there is plenty to see along the way. The hotel was well maintaind and clean. We booked a suite from an adjacent building they had just renovated. The suite was average size with a bedroom seperate from the living area. There was a full kitchenette complete with dishware, stove, fridge and sink. This would be a great place to stay for several nights. Decor was very impressive with attention to every detail. The bathroom was standard with all new bathtub and fixtures. Breakfast was typical Italian breads, meats, and cheeses with fresh cappuccino. Customer service was very good with very helpful and polite reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: holly6holly
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this Lovely Hotel for my birthday, Great location, Very clean and tidy, Staff very friendly and helpful, the only disappointment was it RAINED !!!!! great Hotel, fantastic city would love to go back in the summer. Would definity book the Antiche Figure again. We asked the receptionist for any great vegetarian restaurants, he recommonded one, it was great. (got lost but had fun looking for it) When we arrive to Venice we took the water Taxi to the hotel (very over priced over 100 euro's) but was great to arrive in style. on the way home we took the bus and cost a couple of euro's each.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: hoopoe75
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure completely fulfilled all my hopes: the room was comfortable, beautifully furnished, large, clean with tea making facilities and lovely bathroom. Chocolates on the pillows everyday and a rose. The breakfast offered a wide choice and was delicious. The staff were friendly and very helpful at all times. We had a taxi trip to Murano courtesy of the Hotel and a visit to the Casino. It was very convenient being near the bus station. We took the public bus for only 2.50â‚¬ from Marco Polo bus station outside the airport which was fine. The vaporetto stops just opposite the hotel over the bridge. We would always go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Favolosso!”
Reviews.Author: meercat1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a brief weekend trip to Venice and have to say that the hotel was fabulous. I booked this based on other travellers reviews and would recommend it to anyone thinking of a trip to Venice. The staff were particularly great, very friendly, knowledgeable and always happy to help with a smile and great tips for walks and food. The room was spotless, extremely comfortable and attention to detail makes it one of prettiest i have stayed in! No traveller would be disappointed with a stay here! convenience to the bus station is a huge advantage as it was nice not to have to walk far with bags etc! and it is not at all noisy and being able to sit out side with a view of the grand canal watching the world go by was brilliant. Hope the owners are very proud of their staff as they really do make the hotel a very enjoyable spot to stay in and i have recommended it on to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: dadbee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, especially if you are arriving by train. It's also right across from the vaporetto stop. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and spacious. The marble bathrooms are top notch. The service was excellent, from the front desk to the breakfast room. Really a high quality hotel. I would return for a longer stay when in Venice again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: breakawayboy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews on TA.They are all true we loved every minute of our stay,the staff are the best we have ever encountered.Location is great for the station and exploring Venice.We had a blue room and it was worth it for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulineebee
Reviews.Content: We had three days in Venice, and I chose this hotel after reading the Tripadvisor reviews. I think this must be the perfect hotel in Venice, for the following reasons: Location - so easy to find, and only a few minutes from the excellent airport bus service. Welcoming - the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, with suggestions on what to do and see, also advising on nearby restaurants, which were excellent. Beautiful - we upgraded to a Deluxe room, which was palatial, and beautifully decorated and furnished, with direct views of the Grand Canal from the windows. I was delighted to find tea/coffee making facilities in the room - every detail had been thought of, right down to fluffy towelling robes and slippers. The breakfasts were far better than the average Venice hotels - a cold buffet with plenty of fresh croissants. The bar had tables outside on the canal-side - a perfect place to relax in the evening sunshine. Everything about this hotel is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Londonlover7977
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Antiche Figure. This first time we stayed in a red room (superior) which was fairly big with a good size bathroom, beautifully decorated, and if we stuck our head out of the window had a view of the canal. This last time I was there I was offered to upgrade for 20EUR more to the blue room (deluxe). I decided to go for it as we were only there for 1 night. Just gorgeous with a tiny balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. Large room and bathroom with double sinks. As others have said, it's directly across from Santa Lucia train station. You do have to cross a tall bridge so hopefully you packed lightly. To get to the bus stop to go the airport it's a few minutes walk away crossing 2 or 3 small bridges. It does take about 30 minutes to get to San Marco but you can take a vaporetto (the stop is in front of the train station) which takes about 25 minutes with the stops if you're tired of walking. The staff is wonderful. Free internet access in your room if you have a laptop and computer you can use in the lobby if you don't. In the lobby my daughter used her ITouch but could not access the internet from our room. I will definitely stay here again next time I go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beargonefishin
Reviews.Content: We booked based on TA reviews, and we were not disappointed! We were put in one of the "annex" rooms. I was a little hesitant at first, but it turned out to be perfect! Very quiet, great location, great staff, easy access to train.... Stay at this hotel, you will love it too.

Reviews.Title: “Just like viting mum's house and being pampered!!!”
Reviews.Author: pt190sl
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller with a few hotel loyaly cards for 5* hotels and that makes me a very diffucult customer due to my level of expectation. My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 11-13th of April and the service was PERFECT!!! The staff were GENUINELY friendly and always offered fo help the minute they noticed you looked a bit lost - they were not doing this because they had been told to be nice but because they took pride in keeping the customers happy.. Its nice to hear someone ask you: Are you happy with your room? It may rain, would upi like an umbrella? We were offered breakfast at â‚¬7 per person per day when we checked in but we didnt take it up at that point in time but decided to go for it the next morning, went to the reception to advise them but was told "enjoy breakfast and just tell us when you check out, we trust our guests" WOW!!! On checkout, we were asked "is there anything at all we can do to improve our hotel?" Will recommend this hotel over and over again - No i am not on commision!! Just a very happy customer. Its nice to experience the Italian Family spirit!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best affordable hotels in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetKen
Reviews.Content: My stay at Antiche Figure was amazing. The hotel is located in a very convenient section of the Grand Canal, close to Piazzale Roma, one of the main gateways to Venice (close to the train station, cruise terminals and ground transportation to the airport). The building itself is clean, cozy and warmâ€¦you really feel like youâ€™re entering someoneâ€™s home rather than a hotel. The rooms are standard European sizes (American would consider them small), but perfect for resting after walking all over the labyrinth that is Venice. The staff was extremely friendly and spoke English, which made things easier for us since we didnâ€™t speak Italian. The hotel actually has extra â€œapartmentsâ€� that are available for rent and I strongly recommend staying in one of them if you can â€“ they are large and roomy (separate living room, kitchen, bathroom and bedroom) and cheaper than the actual hotel rooms. I canâ€™t recommend this hotel enough...Venice can be a very expensive city and finding an affordable, nice hotel can be a challenge, but look no further than this hotel â€“ itâ€™s definitely a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for wonderful first visit”
Reviews.Author: Marge21
Reviews.Content: Just back from wonderful 4 days here, hotel deserves all the good reviews- staff delightful, had answer to any query, we did take upgrade to Grand Canal view, and were glad we did- you don't spend ages in your room in Venice, but it was brilliant to watch and listen to all the buzz on the water while getting ready!- and the decor and spaciousness were an extra treat. It was only towards the end of our stay that we fully appreciated just how good the location is, particularly for a first visit- you cannot get lost!!- and so, as it's a long enough walk from P. S Marco, you quickly become confident about exploring all the districts, and finding wonderful liitle squares, cafes and bars with a real local ambience. Re the many breakfast comments, by the way, the coffee machine is really for those who want top ups or aren't fussed about their coffee- you will be offered a delicious freshly made one!

Reviews.Title: “All the charm of Venice”
Reviews.Author: snarkyarchy
Reviews.Content: After reading extensive reviews of hotels in Venice, I chose this hotel for our two night stay in March 2008. We had requested a room for three people and I was a bit apprehensive of what we were going to get, but could not have been more pleased with the room we were given. Upon check in, the staff was very friendly and gave us a briefing of where we were in relationship to all the major attractions. We were offered an upgrade for a suite in an adjacent building for a few more Euro, but opted to keep the room we booked. It was a beautiful room that fit a queen size bed and roll-in twin comfortably with a very large bathroom that looked like it was recently renovated. It was done in beautiful stone tiling with ample counter space, glass sconces, a shower, and bidet. If you stuck your head out the bathroom window, you could actually see the Grand Canal. The room itself was very clean and decorated accordingly with the old world charm of Venice. To some, the location may seem far from places like the Rialto (a 10-15 minute walk) or Piazza San Marco (a 20 minute vaporetto ride), but it proved extremely convenient to the train station (from where we arrived) and to Piazzale Roma where all the taxis and shuttles depart from to the airport (from where we left.) The only word of warning is that you will need to carry your luggage over the Scalzi Bridge (around 80 steps) from the train station) and two other bridges if you're heading to Piazzale Roma. It's a small price to pay for the great location and sure beats rolling your luggage to a hotel around Piazza San Marco or lugging it onto a water taxi. The area felt very safe and easy to find your way back after wandering all the streets and canals (just keep following the signs that say Ferrovia). Getting lost is the quintessential experience in Venice and it's how you discover some amazing architecture, shops, and restaurants. We had breakfast at the hotel on our last day and enjoyed the simple buffet of pastries, fruit and coffee. The free internet terminal in the lobby was also a nice bonus. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone willing to stay a little bit away from the major sites, but appreciates great service, charming rooms, and is in need of some good cardio getting those bags over the bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a beautiful stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: weemurph
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over the Easter break. The staff were absolutely excellent, really pleasant and helpful. We were offered a room upgrade on arrival and we were allowed to view both rooms before making a decision but we stuck to our original booking as it suited our budget a little better. The hotel is very easy to find from the bus station and in a great location close to everything. Venice is a beautiful place and quite small so easily accessible by foot. I would recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, will return”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in March and would thoroughly recommend the hotel. We paid a little extra for a superior room which gave us a view of the Grand Canal, a bigger room, and breakfast, and I would recommend doing the same. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and charming. Breakfast good. Location excellent - only 2 minutes from vaporetto stop and 10 minutes from Piazzale Roma. Room beautifully decorated and spacious. Couldn't find anything negative to say about hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jersey45
Reviews.Content: On reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I booked Hotel Antiche Figure for three nights and we were very impressed. We were offered an upgrade for 25 euro a night for a Grand Canal view which we accepted. The room was very clean, tidy and spacious with a beautiful view. We had excellent service from all the staff and the continental breakfast was very good. Location of hotel was good and I would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: birdsontour
Reviews.Content: So convenient for the bus into Venice and a lovely location right on the Grand Canal and near to the less touristy part of Venice. We loved meandering the pathways and canals and found it easy to get to all the main sites from the hotel without feeling like we were in the middle of tourist madness! The staff were sooo friendly and helpful - they booked a fab restaurant for our first night and gave lots of top tips. The breakfast was simple but fine and again the waiting staff were delightful. Our room was spacious and clean and wow what a bathroom! All marble! Tripadvisor gave us a great steer yet again! I'm too scared to book anywhere without checking here first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Sesamedoor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 3 nights for our honeymoon. When we check in, the staff gave us a detail introduction of the area and tips on transportation. They also gave us good tips on dining. The room was good size, but our room was facing a wall (Rm. 216). We liked the Venetian decor. The room was very clean and has a good size bath tub. The location was great, 2 mins walk to the train station and water bus. Gondola service is right outside, although I would recommend to take the gondola ride near S. Marco's Square. It's about 10-15 mins walk to Rialto. There's free internet at the front desk, definetely a plus. They're also having a promotion to have a free tour to one of the glass factory in Murano island. We got a private water taxi to take us to the island. It was very nice. I also got flowers and chocolates in the hotel room during the Women's days. The price is quite expensive for a 3 star hotel but it is expensive everywhere in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Found nothing wrong here”
Reviews.Author: SFBayMommy
Reviews.Content: Am always interested in how hotels get such high rankings on tripadvisor. After staying here, i think the answer is: you walk away with nothing to complain about and you realize how rare that is. This hotel was great - not the best hotel of course - but for the price, it's great. I guess it is the absence of bad reviews that puts this hotel in such a high position. There wasn't any one thing that was great - but everything was above average. And if you're spending your own money, you won't feel like you overspent here. This hotel charges you for nothing extra (the internet wi-fi for free was a big plus) except late-afternoon beverages or drinks and mini-bar items. It's refreshing to walk away from a hotel and not have a bunch of extra charges on your bill. I've read all the reviews and everyone seems to be in agreement - staff is fabulous, location is excellent. The only things I'd add: yes, the floors/ceilings are thin. Hearing the water running (loudly) through the walls/ceiling was surprisingly loud. Not worth a bad review, but worth a mention. And yes, beds are extra firm - could have asked for another room probably, but wasn't worth the energy. Also, on the plus side: there's a laundromat right behind the hotel and right near the residences (where we stayed). It's great to have access to a washer/dryer even if you don't think you'll use it. And when you check out, they actually ask you if you have suggestions for them - and sound like they really want to know, which is great! Arrivaderci

Reviews.Title: “The very "Fabulous" Home from Home! Hotel Antiche Figure"!”
Reviews.Author: xxxaussie1968
Reviews.Content: Well have just returned from another wonderful trip to Venice Italy and as wonderful as Venice is it is the Fabulous Hotel Antiche Figure that makes you love it even more! I can not tell you how much of a wonderful stay my friend's and I had again at this lovely Hotel. The staff are what really give it that special feeling from the very charming and helpful manager Alessandro and of course the very helpful and charming Gianni who could not do enough for us while there from organising hairdresser's which was a real Italian experience and one of the best hair stylest I have ever been to! to organising advise on there lovely city! All of the front desk staff also especially the lovely Franseca are what give's this Hotel it's class. I do not know of any other Hotel I have stayed in that make you feel like a 5 star guest. The room we had again was the Resident suite room 511 which I have stayed in before but my 2 friend's had not, they were "very" impressed and just loved it. The room's are filled with every little luxury from chocklate's on your pillow's to fresh flower's put on our bed for a" festival for Women" while we were there.We were really looked after in every aspect of our trip. So once again I would absoultley recommend this wonderful Hotel to anyone going to Venice there are many hotel's to stay at in Venice but I can tell you for location service and just plain wonderful hospitality the Hotel Antiche Figure are in a class of there own! Thank you Hotel Antiche Figure for a wonderful break in the lovely Venice we will be back very soon! Suzanne Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, even lovelier service”
Reviews.Author: annabinnie
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Antiche Figure on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews, and I'm so glad we did. The Location is great, as the others say, near to the train station and perfect for the water ferries all around. We also upgraded to one of their suites - a junior suite, which is not in the hotel itself but down the adjoining street, tucked away in a very very quiet spot - I slept like a log every night. The suite was a little small, but very bright, with a lovely comfortable four-poster and a massage shower, and for a three night stay, a perfectly adequate size (especially somewhere like Venice, and especially for the price). The best thing though was the service: after arriving very tetchy and frazzled after the airline losing our luggage, we received the warmest welcome I can remember having in any hotel, and given a cup of coffee while the receptionist took the lost luggage report and said "We'll take care of that for you", and went off to ring them on my behalf. They kept an eye on the situation and phoned me as soon as the bag arrived (they did - not, say, the airline, who were supposed to) and sounded as happy as I did that it was there. The breakfast is simple but fine, the room (that we stayed in, at least) really quiet and lovely, the location excellent - far enough away to make a difference in terms of price, but easy to reach everything. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. I've been back 9 hours and already told three friends they should book there...

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: Dreagan
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was amazing. Nice and cozy. 5 min from train station and 10 mins from the bus station. The location was perfect. Right by the water and has an amazing view. I would only stay here next time I got to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mycaseispacked
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location fronting the Grand Canal and a short walk from the rail station and coach station. We arrived by bus from the airport - the number 5 from outside the arrival hall straight into the city bus station - The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the bus station. You only need to cross two bridges and then its pavements all the way to the hotel door. We stayed for one night at the end of our trip around the Veneto area. The reception staff were excellent - warm, welcoming and spoke excellent english. We were on a room only basis and decided not to have breakfast at the hotel (at a small additional cost) so cannot comment on the quality of the food. The room was large, well decorated and clean. We had a room on the first floor with windows to the side alley which meant it was quiet. We had a disabled equipped room so no bath but the bathroom was like a wet room with a walk in shower. Shower was nice and hot and plenty of towels. The lack of bath did not bother us. The bed was large and comfortable and we had a great nights sleep. The only minor thing that stops me giving the hotel an "excellent" rating is that we had a glass light fitting which clinked and rattled when ever the person in the room above walked around. This got a little annoying but not enough to ruin our stay. It might just be me being slightly intollerant and the person upstairs being a tad heavy footed!? There is a mini-bar in the room but no tea of coffee making facilities. On returning to the hotel late and cold at night we fancied a coffee and the bar man kindly made a silver tray up of tea and coffee for us to take up to our room. The cost was very reasonable (about 6 euro) given the cost of a coffee when out in the city during the day! Location wise, you exit from the front door and a bridge crossing the grand canal is just to the right. On the opposite side of the Canal is a vaporetti stop for most routes. We had a 36 hour ticket which covered us for unlimited travel on the bus from the airport to the city, access on all the vaporetti - even out to Murano and the Lido - and back to the airport. You can also follow the signs through the city on foot to San Marco, the Rialto etc... which are a nice walk away. Overall, we were very impressed with the hotel - its location, staff, decor and cleanliness and would certainly stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mark_S_Leeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for 4 nights, staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was exceptionally clean and well fitted, if not particularly large, and the bathroom had a bath and an excellent shower. The location is great, a short walk from both the Piazzale Roma (where all the buses stop) and the Ponte di Cannaregio (where the airport water bus stops), right opposite the Scalzi bridge to the train station and close to loads of good local restaurants and cafes in Santa Croce, San Polo and Cannaregio (in particular we liked Osteria 40 Ladroni in Cannaregio, which is a fantastic seafood restaurant with more locals than tourists, but still very friendly). St. Mark's Square is only a 30-40 minute walk away (or a Vaporetto ride for 6 Euros) but the walk is so picturesque it's well worth doing. If I was to stay in Venice again I'd definitely stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: salliefromthevalley
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic stay in Venice, and found this to be a fantastic, friendly, well located hotel. The convenience of being such a short walk from where the airport buses drop you off is great, as is the closeness of a Vaparetto stop - Ferrovia, and the Scalzi bridge for crossing the Grand Canal. We booked this hotel after reading reviews on here, and were not disappointed. The room (311) and bathroom were lovely, clean and well maintained. We booked with alpharooms, and paid Â£241 for 3 nights, Sun, Mon, Tues, then paid 25 euro a night to upgrade to a canal view room when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great Attitude!”
Reviews.Author: vinoperson
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from Venice(1 hour ago) and Antiche Figure. What a great place to stay. Outstanding management, Alessandro and staff were ready to help solve any problem. We were upgraded(complimentary) to a newly developed small suite that was just right. Two flat screens, shower-massage and small kitchenette all so tastefully done in Venetian elegance. Linda, the breakfast host was sensational. Good cappucino and a huge selection of cereals, yogurts, breads, meats and cheeses. The facility is spotlessly clean with all fine products and linens. Truly a GREAT three star. What a value! We have been to Venice before and will return to this terrific hotel. Vinoperson1

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grutledge
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to say that we had a great stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice.The staff were very helpful and polite,the location was great as it was near all the transport links and the rooms were spotless.If we return to Venice we will be booking at the Hotel Antiche Figure

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: amelia1730
Reviews.Content: There is little more to add to the great reviews Antiche Figure already has. Everything you read is true. We will most definitely be back (something my husband very rarely does, even if he really likes somewhere - he thinks there are more places to be explored, so why go somewhere you've already been?). I have no complaints whatsoever - just one request please, that can we have tea/coffee making in the room please? Talking of the room - fab bed, even for my restless hubby - big and comfortable! (The bed I mean, not my hubby!!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stuff”
Reviews.Author: Jillatron15
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay at the antiche figure. Beautiful room (we upgraded to a suite and it was well worth it - truly gorgeous) The location is great, just opposite the train station/ water bus stop. Easy to walk anywhere and, more importantly, easy to find your way back. The staff were very helpful - when we checked it they gave us a map and a really useful run through of the main attractions. Breakfast was adequate, probably not worth the 7 euros extra, but that's a minor point. In general, a fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: tingweng
Reviews.Content: The room we reserved is pretty small facing the alley.They proposed a new addition nearby,but we decided to stay in the original hotel.Breakfast is good.Staff are very friendly and warm.Room is clean and quiet(maybe it's not bad not facing the canal).Very good location near train station.Kind of pricey...(maybe it's carnival time.)Pretty good experience as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat.”
Reviews.Author: SE
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 2007. Arrived from Treviso airport by bus. A five minute walk over two bridges gets you to the hotel if you arrive this way. Fantastic location, close to a vaporetto "bus" stop, gives easy access to everywhere. The hotel and its staff are superb. It and they made the stay unforgettable. Well worth asking for restaurant advice. We were asked..." A good view, or good food?" We chose the latter and they did not let us down. The hotel was comfortable, clean and welcoming. If you can, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne1964
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just as many reviews have described it. Extremely clean, lovely room (we had a room overlooking the canal) and well appointed. Staff are exceptionally helpful and we had a wonderful time. The location of this hotel makes it a real winner too. Just across from the rail sation and the Piazzale Roma, where the buses arrive, means you are perfectly located for getting around Venice. Looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “perfect service”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterNeeti
Reviews.Content: my friend and I have been doing a winter weekend for the last two years and have been to rome and venice so far. we always look at trip advisor for recommended hotels. This last trip we chose the antiche figure a very cosy and welcoming hotel which made our stay. The rooms were clean and smart but it was the service from the reception staff that made our stay. They were polite and helpful and we will recommend this hotel to our friends. Venice is charming and full of history. We mostly ate at this canteen place called Brek where we could get a hearty meal for around 15 euros for both including some wine.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Canal Treat”
Reviews.Author: TexasPadre
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Venice, we couldn't imagine a better experience than the staff and accommodations at this comfortable hotel. The rooms are handsome, clean, and pretty classy; the free buffet breakfast was complete and tasty; the staff was entirely excellent in every regard, including help in any matters that might arise; the location is ideal [directly across the Grand Canal from the main train station] and the outside activity is reasonably quiet, with endless ways to find the glories of sights, restaurants, and shops. We researched Venice hotels on the Trip Advisor website...and those reviews helped us have a terrific experience! We hope that these words will help you in your own search. We doubt that there are many other "values for the money" like the Antiche Figure....

Reviews.Title: “In Venice stay here”
Reviews.Author: The Wright Family
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location on the Grand Canal across from the Santa Lucia train station. We were upgraded to for an extra â‚¬30.00 to apartments. The rooms have just recently been refurbished and are brand new with LCD televisions. The dÃ©cor wonâ€™t be to everyoneâ€™s liking, but forget about it. As the staff, service and the position of the hotel make up for it. A continental buffet breakfast in included in your room rate. Although you do have a kitchen in your room, if you get the apartments. Thereâ€™s free internet to the rooms and a PC in the lobby/check in area. The staff are only too willing to go out of their way to help and assist you with, bookings, travelling advice, tourist locations, train tickets, tours. Ask about the free tour of the Murano glass factory. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. It was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: outriggerkay
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is perfect if you are arriving in Venice by train as it is literally 400m walk across the Grand Canal. This is a saving of enough to buy you a meal out as a water taxi will not only be expensive but charges extra for each peice of luggage. The hotel is cosy and welcoming with a lavish but tasteful decor. The front office staff are all very welcoming and helpful and speak good English. The only thing I could find to complain about was the lack of tea making facilities in the room but as soon as I mentioned that I would like this they arranged an electric jug, cups, different teas, sugar & honey on a tray to the room - for no charge. The breakfast was excellent value so if you are given the option of including it then do so. It consists of sweet breads including pannettone and muffins. Dry toast, hard boiled eggs, cold meats, cheese, various fruits, cereals, juice, tea etc. They will make you a fresh cappucino at their little bar in the front of the hotel and bring it back to the breakfast room. The room was small but very comfortable with the best bed we had in Europe. We were offered a canal front room when we arrived for 30 euros extra but stayed with the smaller back room. It was just fine considering every waking moment we were out. The cheapest and easiest way to get around Venice is by buying a pass for the ferries that go about every 10 minutes. Buy a pass for the number of days you are there. It will save you heaps. If you are coming to Venice by plane it is cheapest (2 euros) and possibly quickest to catch a bus (15 minutes). The water taxi is 90 euros!!! Venice is a beautiful city no matter the weather. Allow a minimum of 3 days and include the Doges palace, Basilica and Murano Island (for the glass).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Khandea
Reviews.Content: We were amazed this hotel only has 3 stars. It's fantastic. The room we stayed in was large, clean, very well decorated with a huge bed and nice furnishings. The en-suite was spacious and of a high standard. We paid a little extra for a view of the Grand Canal - which we thought was worth it. It's got a great location - right opposite the main station and close to the main waterbus stops. It's an easy 15 minute walk to Rialto and St Mark's Square.
