We always thought hotel accommodation in Venice was overpriced. This little gem showed us that's not necessarily true.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth its 3 star+ rating”
Reviews.Author: KaB24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 6th-9th January 2008. I booked this hotel as a birthday surprise for my husband and although we had stayed in Venice before and loved the hotel we chose then, I decided on the Antiche Figure as the reviews were excellent and it was so central. We were not disappointed, it was an easy walk from the Bus station, over 2 small bridges. The welcome we received on arrival was very friendly and throughout our stay our every need was catered for even down to a chocolate on our pillows, reception staff organized the secret itinerary tour of Doges Palace (16 euros) which was fascinating, they also organized a free taxi transfer from the hotel's landing stage to a Murano glass factory & showroom which I would not recommend as although they say there is no obligation to buy we definitely felt uncomfortable not buying any of the beautiful glassware on display, also there was no route through to the rest of the island which meant we had a wait of 30 mins before we were picked up and dumped at Fondamente Nuove the nearest vaporetto stop on Venice. We later returned to Murano by vaporetto (No 42) and enjoyed walking through and seeing the rest of the island. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely use this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerry_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure for three nights from 3rd to 6th January and could not recommend this hotel highly enough. The staff were very welcoming on arrival and provided a map and advice on how to get around. The room was lovely and spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is directly across the way from a waterbus stop. We bought a 3 day pass for public transport for 30 Euro and this covered the bus from the airport and all travel on the waterbus - excellent value. The bus from the airport is just a 5 minute walk to the hotel. We travelled on the waterbus to St. Mark's Square, Rialto etc. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay there if we return to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: bfcfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in November and had such a lovely time, the room was simply stunning, right down to the fact that it had cushioned walls!!!! we originally booked one of the red rooms but moved to the blue room overlooking the grand canal, and worth every penny, location? OUTSTANDING!!!, we came in on the train like some others, from Milan, upon leaving the train station we could see the hotel right away, we dropped our bags and within minutes were exploring Venice. The funnt part, we bumped into the people we were on the train with and they were wandering around still looking for their hotel!!! Breakfast wasnt fantastic on English or American breakfast standards, i.e. no hot food, but what was their was fresh, and lots of it, the usual continental breakfast. You must cross the bridge and get the water bus over to Burano, its so idylic with its colourful houses and lazy village atmosphere, its so pretty, check the photos!!! Anyway, il sign off here, book yourself in here, its expensive but worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: pecinha
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed last cristmas at this hotel. as it was full the manager offered a new suite for the same price of my room, and I can tell you, this was my cristmas present. a new suite with separate room for my 13 year old child, 2 flat televisions, very silent, very good breakfast.,extremely clean. location ideal for a person who arrives from train staition,just cross one bridge. the rest you walk a lot during tha day or take the vapporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Throughly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Joanna36
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Antiche Figure purely based on the reviews I had read on Tripadvisor as I planned a trip for my husbands birthday in December. They were absolutely right and this hotel and the service they provide deserves every one of the 5 stars they gain via these reviews. We upgraded to a 'Red room' on arrival and had a beautiful view of the Grand Canal, the room was lovely with a very big bathroom. We had clean towels and sheets daily. The first morning we overslept and missed breakfast, having previously had a long day travelling and then sightseeing, we went to reception at 1130am and asked where we could get breakfast in Venice and they said it was no problem and served us a nice breakfast in the hotel bar area immediately! It has a perfect location, we walked miles and miles and did all of the top ten 'must dos' whilst in Venice, especially getting lost but that is part of the experience. The staff at the hotel are dedicated to their guests needs and will do anything to ensure you have a good stay in Venice. My husband and i throughly recommend The Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: PeterandChristel
Reviews.Content: I took my partner there for his birthday...and so what a birthday he had. We arrived about 21h00 on the Wednesday evening so I phoned just to let them know that we were still coming but just a little late so they wished us a great trip and not to worry about anything. When we arrived, the receptionist Eddi (not sure about the spelling, sorry) showed us a restaurant to go and grab a quick bite and told us about few things to do in the area, She was really nice and smiley...which is always nice. Our room was lovely and cosy ( the red one) with a great Chandelier in the room and Bathroom (I think probably from Murano Glass Factory) we even had a view over the grand canal...bonus... but still very quiet during the night.. In the morning breakfast was between 7-8h00 and 10h00 so you could have a little lying in bed...nice. The walk from the Piazzale Roma was really a 5 minutes walk tops...I was really worried to get lost but it is very easy to find the hotel, they have lovely christmas light on the front of the hotel so you can not miss it. Just look at the comments below someone gave great directions to get to the hotel. As long as you have a map of the island you really can't get lost .After a couple of days you really get the hang of it and it is pretty easy to find you way around. From the hotel to San Marco Square you are talking about a 20 minutes walk through the lovely street full of christmas lights and lovely little boutiques. Venice is a trully remarquable place, full of history and beautifull architecture, December is a great month to go as well as you get some very good deals on Gondola Ride, Place to Visit (Murano Glass Factory was free to visit....(to be honest it was a really quick visit with a quick demonstration of the blowing glass technique but very interesting). The only negative things I will have to say unfortunately is prepare yourself to fing some grumpy Italians in some places like restaurants ( oh another thing don't go for the Menu Touristico, it is much better to order from the main menu)or museem, we were very lucky because all the staff from the hotel made us feel very welcome and they were always really smiley and happy to help but it will not be the same everywhere. Anyway it was a very great romantic break for me and my husband to be...so can not wait to come back and of course stay again at the Antiche Figure...

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: andyandmella
Reviews.Content: Lovely small(ish) hotel on the Grand Canal. Completely renovated but charming and full of character. The hotel is situated close to the bus station - which is great if you have luggage to lug about. There is a vapareto stop just over the bridge, and the railway station is very close too. The reception staff are very helpful. They will book stuff for you and provide impartial advice. There's a PC in reception if you want internet connection. Our room was a bit small, (and warm), but perfectly decorated. The bathroom was great, though again not large. There is no evening restaurant. However breakfast is great value at 5 Euros (it can get a bit crowded at 9am). There is a great pizzaria round the corner called Al Forneo (?) - cheap and good quality, but very busy with locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: timdevil
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful stay at Antiche Figure. Such a quaint prefect romantic getaway right on the Grand Canal across from the train station. Away from the bustle of St. Mark's square, you still have access to the best of venice. We had a nice room on the side of the hotel with a partial view of the canal. The staff was amazing and arranged a free trip to Murano (obligation to buy partially). Had the breakfast one morning, basically consisted of pastries, fruit, and italian meats. Cappucinos were made upon request. Definitely a great getaway for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Rangas
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night stay at the hotel and couldn't wait to pen a review of this fabulous hotel.We booked this place purely based on other reviews written about this hotel before and we are glad that we did! We arrived about 2 hours ahead of normal check in time but didn't have to wait around as our room was ready.We were checked in by Francesca who was very helpful and gave us info on everything we needed to know.We asked for and stayed in a room overlooking the grand canal.I am attaching some photos of the room and the spectacular views it afforded.Breakfast is served from about 7 am and mainly consists of pastries , croissants and cold meat.There is 24 hour internet access down in the lobby and a small bar if you fancy a quick drink before retiring. To get to the hotel from: Piazzale Roma Bus Station: (You need to cross 2 bridges) Exit the bus station through a narrow row of souvenir shops.... as soon as you do that u come to a white bridge...up and across the bridge (of about 23 steps) and turn left and keep walking until you reach the grand canal...then turn right and walk along the grand canal until you reach another bridge (of about 30 steps)....cross it and keep walking along the canal.....the hotel is a further 100 meters on your right from the second bridge .....look across the canal and you should also see the FS railway station! ...Its a 6 - 10 minute walk depending on heavy your suitcases are!! The railway station (FS) : (You need to cross 1 bridge) You cant miss the hotel....its directly across the grand canal and you will see it as soon as you exit the station! The hotel is at the mouth of the canal grande and opposite the vaporetto stops....its about 30 mins by vaporetto down the grand canal to Piazza San Marco and about 35 to 45 mins if you wanna walk your way through the charming streets and alleys of Venice to San Marco....try and do both!! Cross the canal from the hotel and you are into the Canaregio district with its myriad of restaurants, shops and ice cream outlets! Overall its the perfect base for seeing all of Venice but the best thing about the hotel and one of the reasons its very good is the very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Taking a cruise from Venice?”
Reviews.Author: GerryRyeBrook_NY
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure is wonderful, particularly if you are taking a cruise from Venice, or arriving by ship to Venice. It is a short water taxi ride to the Piazza Roma, and then a five minute shuttle bus ride to the pier. The hotel staff is friendly and accomodating in every way. There is no reason to spend more money elsewhere. This is great value in a great location. Ask for a Grand Canal view room. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Venice's Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: scooterguy
Reviews.Content: The Antiche Figure delivers what it promises and more! The plain exterior of this hotel belies what is really inside. We stayed here for 3 nights following a 14-day cruise. We were amongst several other cruising families checking-in on Sunday morning. In spite of the hustle and bustle, we were still warmly greeted and served by cheerful Alessandro and Francesca. Throughout our stay, they were both anxious to assist us and tend to our needs and questions. We had booked a deluxe room and declined an upgrade to a beautiful suite next door, mainly because we wanted the convenience of being close to the breakfast dining area inside the hotel. We had room 112, which faces the Grand Canal. The vaparettos started running about at about 6:30 am but their noise did not really disturb us from sleeping (but, our windows were closed). The hotel does have a modern elevator/lift and the breakfast at 5 euros per person is one of the best deals in Venice. There is a small bar area adjacent to the lobby where we had coffee/tea on two occasions. Internet is complimentary in the lobby and it was very fast. We thought that the hotel's location was fine, given it's proximity to the vaporetto stop (across the canal), an easy 5 minute walk across the Scalzi Bridge. There are a number of restaraunts within easy walking distance. Also, we took a free shuttle bus from the cruise terminal to the Piazzale Roma. Plan on about a 10 minute hike from there to the hotel with luggage. We wished that the two bridges between the hotel and the Ple Roma had ramps on them! To get to the airport, use the B2 bus for 6 Euro per person-the ticket office is across the street from the Piazzale at the bus terminal. It was about a 30 minute ride on the bus to the airport. Venice is a wonderful city and our stay at the Antiche Figure was definitely one of the highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Echoknoll
Reviews.Content: Excellent service by everyone we encountered at this hotel. We were impressed! The staff speaks English very well, but indulged my desire to improve my Italian. Our room was comfortable with a view of the Grand Canal. Opening the windows at night provided a great breeze. We enjoyed having wine and coffee at the tables outside the hotel after a day of taking in the sights of Venice. We found the location of the hotel to be great for taking a water taxis. It is across from the train station and all water taxis make the station a stop. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Especially liked being able to get a cup of coffee to take to our room before going down to eat. The Hotel Antiche Figure was the first stop on our trip to Italy and no other hotel matched their service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful -- terrific location along the Grand Canal within walking distance of the Piazzale Roma and the train/bus stations, so that you don't have to worry about dragging your luggage all over Venice. The staff speak perfect English, are exceptionally friendly and helpful and the room I stayed in was spacious with all the amenities. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice, particularly those arriving in Venice by cruise ship (as I did) or train.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angusScotland
Reviews.Content: The first thing you see coming down the steps of the station at Ferrovia is the Grand Canal. the second thing, just over the bridge, is the Hotel Antiche Figure, and what a welcome sight! The location is perfect for bus and train station,and the water buses are right there. We found the staff at the hotel charming and helpful, and the accommodation very good.The recommended local restaurants were excellent. No better place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: WerdnaTrips
Reviews.Content: A very well situated hotel run by staff who are genuinely willing and happy to help you. Upon arrival we were given the option of upgrading to a suite which we were shown, but these are not directly connected to the main hotel, instead you walk a short way down the side of the hotel to another block. The suites were immaculate and contain their own kitchen areas if required. These were a little beyond our price range however so we opted for a room within the hotel itself, again, very well prepared and lovely decor, typical Venetian style. Our room was not directly overlooking the grand canal, but this could be seen from the bedroom window. With the window open you can hear the hustle and bustle of Venetian life, with them shut - not a sound. The staff were superb. Any questions you have about Venetian transport or tourist attractions you should ask the staff first! Also they were very useful in suggesting places to eat (off the tourist trail) and we never had a bad meal. Being on the grand canal, close to the bus/train depot but away from the expensive St. Marks Square region was ideal. Hardly any dragging of suitcases around Venice is needed and a short ride on the water bus gets you to the main attractions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything!”
Reviews.Author: lboyle79
Reviews.Content: November 12, 2007 We have just returned from a fantastic week in Italy. Our first stop was in Venice where we stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure for two nights. We loved everything about this charming, intimate hotel. Though small, the rooms were very pretty (and clean) and the marble bathrooms were so beautiful that we photographed them! Our room had a lovely view of the Grand Canal. The hotel is located almost directly across the Grand Canal from the train station, which was extremely convenient as we were planning to continue on to Florence by rail. Hotel Antiche Figure also has a charming Bar / Cafe area to accomodate their guests day and night with cafe tables located inside and outside the hotel. For a small fee you can include breakfast in the cafe during your stay...something I strongly recommend! As beautiful as the Hotel Antiche Figure was, it would just be like any other hotel without its wonderful staff! Everyone we came in contact with was friendly, polite and most important, helpful. From Alessandro and Francesca at the front desk, to Michele, who went out of his way to make my daughter 'the best hot cocoa she has ever tasted', to the chamber maids, everyone was fantastic! If you are looking for a small but lovely hotel with exceptional people to answer your questions and take care of all of your travel needs, Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice, Italy will be perfect for you . Lauri B. New Jersey, USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: valueaddedCanada
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place. Add "kind and patient" to the glowing reports for front desk personnel. Here is some extra info: 1. Booked 3 "superior" rooms 5 months in advance via hotel website and expedia for pre-cruise stay. Our rooms on the 2nd. 3rd and 4th floors appeared exactly as shown on website. Very firm beds. Adequate size for us. Anyone over 6'2" and 300 lbs might find the superior rooms a tad small. Walls are padded to reduce noise. There is a lift. Guests may use one computer in lobby for free internet access. TV has English language news channel. 2. Breakfast is included with room rate if booked via website but cost 5 euros ( a bargain) if booked on expedia. Ask server to make you a cappucino (no extra cost) or use the coffee machine. 3. Arrived via "blue bus" from Marco Polo airport to Piazzale Roma (bus terminal) in the pouring rain. Bus terminal is an open-air bus stop, not a building. Cheap plastic rain ponchos are assets during the rainy season. 4. To get to hotel by foot from Piazzale Roma, look for the white stone bridge or the green metal bridge directly in front of the "terminal exit." The exit is lined with small souvenir shops. There is a public WC. The bridges cross the Rio Nuovo (small canal) and consists of about 40 to 50 steps (no ramp). Once you cross either bridge, the Grand Canal will be on your left hand side (you can't miss it). Keep walking along the Grand Canal. The hotel will be straight ahead. You need to cross another small bridge (about 30 steps) before reaching the hotel. The walk takes about 10 minutes, depending on how well you drag your cases over the bridges. We had 3 elderly travellers who were able to negotiate the "step" bridges with their cases with assistance. 4. To get to hotel by vaporetto (public water bus) or water taxi: wouldn't recommend vaporetto. Too crowded. Water taxi stand is just steps from the terminal "exit", along the Rio Nuovo, and takes you to a landing right in front of the hotel. Costly but worth it if you have mobility problems and lots of luggage. 5. To get to the cruise port: there are two cruise ship ports. find out which one you need. Ask front desk about sharing water taxi to the port. Elderly members of our group rebelled against walking back to Piazzale Roma to catch free port shuttle. Shared taxi fare with 7 passengers- total cost of 110 euros (about 16 euros per person) to "Stazione Marittima." We were met at the port's water taxi landing by cruise staff who efficiently handled our cases.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Venice - Michele ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: Gerta01
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to ANYONE and EVERYONE traveling to Venice. Since we came in by train and available transportion in Venice is by boat or on foot, the location couldn't be more perfect. Not only is the termini an excellent reference point to always find your way back to the hotel, if you have heavy bags as we did, your only challenge is hauling luggage up and down the steps of the bridge! Michele was an excellent host and local resource for us. He recommended two wonderful restaurants which we enjoyed each night of our stay and Antiche Figure had a warm and inviting atmosphere. They are not kidding when they describe the balcony as "small" but having the view of the Canal and large windows to enjoy the canal activity and landscape of Venice was an excellent treat. A cautionary word for travelers interested in visiting Murano. One of the things that I really wanted to do while in Venice was a visit to a Murano glass factory. The front desk informed us that we could arrange a private pick up from outside of our hotel and the driver would take us directly to Murano, free of charge. If you are into handsome Italian men, this place is for YOU. Our Italian Stallion ushered us into the factory to watch a SHORT demonstration of glass blowing by a master (who was drinking beer at 10:30am inbetween demonstrations and seeking tips for his 5 minutes of work). Then we were escorted into the show room where a well-dressed 50-something man invited us to look around and choose something that we like without worring about cost. Although we chose a piece to remember our honeymoon trip, it felt a little like lambs to the slaughter. This became extremely evident when it was recommended that instead of returning to Venice right away, we should make our next stop (another free boat ride) Burano where they make lace. We only had 3 days/2 nights in Venice and didn't realize that this excursion would require 4+ hours. Burano is beautiful and we would say that this is worth the time if you have time. However, if you are limited and enjoy history and the landscape of Venice, we would suggest sticking with the cultural highlights and save Murano/Burano for a longer visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “full of charm”
Reviews.Author: belladonna01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the railway station on the relatively peaceful side of the canal. We loved the location because we could wander the back streets and avoid the hordes of day trippers and other tourists. We also used the vaporettos to explore Lido/Murano etc If you are mainly interested in St Mark's etc the hotel may feel a little remote. The corner canal view room we had was light, airy and exceptionally well maintained. Breakfast was great. The staff were first class. Another small elevator, however it seemed very well maintained - I took the stairs anyway !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Technical-Rose
Reviews.Content: Traveled through Italy during October and, yes, everything is expensive compared to American standards. So, we try not to break the bank so we can travel more often. Antiche Figure is a small hotel in Venice directly across the canal from the train station. It took us maybe 5 minutes to walk there. Don't waste the time or money on a water taxi. Keep in mind that the bridges have steps, not ramps. The room was cute and probably a normal size for a European hotel. The front rooms are suites and face the canal. Ours was off to the side but we could still see the canal well. Breakfasts were standard fare: cereal, pastries, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, cold cuts, coffee, tea, juice, etc. The staff is very nice and language is not a problem. There is a lounge on the first floor where guests would sometimes gather in the evening for a drink or just conversation. I think a major plus for this area is that it is on high enough ground where there is no flooding during high tide. We could tell who got flooded by where the elevated walkways were placed. All in all, we had a wonderful time, even in the rain. If returning to Venice, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass this up--Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bugs75
Reviews.Content: All of the glowing reports about this hotel is true. Beautiful hotel...clean...recently remodeled..friendly, helpful and professional staff.......great location on the Grand Canal across from the train station...water bus service is across the canal ..a 2 minutes walking distance. 30 --45 minutes walk to St. Mark or take a water bus to the Rialto Bridge and it will be a 10 minute walk to St. Mark. The hotel is in a great location....easy walking distance to all points Venice. We really enjoyed our stay here and if we do return to Venice this will be our hotel. Do not pass this up....you will truly enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel located on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: croesio
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The assistant manager, Gianni, was very helpful throughout our short stay. I am not going to repeat all of the great comments but add some that we found very helpful on our visit. We arrived in the dark and after settling in Gianni directed us to a lovely, local restaurant, very close to the hotel, where we were able to eat (shuts at 11pm). Our booking did not include breakfast but because we had booked through expedia breafast was only 5 Euros instead of the normal 15 Euros. There was ample to eat:- cereals, yoghurts, cheese, ham, boiled eggs etc. Coffee was from a machine but it was fine. The hotel also runs a free water taxi to and from the island of Murano where you can visit the glass factory. Our room did not have a canal view but we were shown rooms that did have this view. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and they spoke excellent English. This is information that I found extremely helpful when arriving in Venice. 1. After picking up your luggage turn left in Airport entrance and buy a 30Euro 3 day pass for the water buses (vaperetto) and the airport bus. This pays for itself after day 1. 2. This info was given to me by another trip advisor member but it was so handy. Take the number 5 bus from the airport to the Piazzale Roma (the main bus station). This takes about 25 minutes, runs every half hour and the 3 day pass covers the fare. Stamp your ticket in the orange box when you get on the bus. When you get off the bus, go straight ahead, down the steps towards the canal. Turn left, cross the bridge, turn left and then cross another bridge. The hotel is now only a short walk away. 3. If you have a short stay ,use a day to visit the islands in the lagoon. The hotel taxi service will take you to Murano, then you can use your 3 day pass to go to Burano. This is a must. A beautiful island which makes lace. The houses are all brightly coloured. Plenty of places to eat. From there a short hop to Torcello where you can see Venices oldest cathedral. Beautiful mosaics. Then back to Burano and the on to San Marco (St Marks Square). Allow a day. The journeys take longer than you expect. Enjoy Venice. We did and we would return to same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ddstiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel on the Grand Canal was beutifully decorated, comfortable and close to the many attractions in Venice. The staff helped in every way possible, from trips to the outlying islands to good restaurants near the hotel. We were able to get a top floor room facing the canal and the activity there and along the promenade great fun to watch. The hotel is quiet but from 7:30 am onward the canal gets very busy. Walking or taking the vaporeto to get arounfd the city was easy and convenient and a boat trip to a Murano glass furnce was arranged at no cost. Fabulous looking glassware and artistic pieces on the island. The staff at Antiche Figure were outstanding in their efforts to make our stay memorable but the informallity of the place was welcome as well. It definitely felt like "home" and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: SWB_7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3-night stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice, and were extremely impressed wirh the Hotel. It is situated on the Grand Canal, and is within easy reach of bus and train stations, as well as being close to vaporetta stops, making it easy to get around Venice. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we were always greeted with a smile. When we arrived at the hotel, a member of staff gave us a map, and spent about 10 minutes giving us useful information, such as how to use the local transport, things to do and see, and where to eat. As a result, we were able to make the most of our stay in Venice, and felt very comfortable about asking for information as and when we needed it. The hotel itself was stylishly decorated, clean, warm (the weather was quite cold when we visited Venice, so if you go in October like we did, take jumpers, scarves and gloves, as well as a good coat and sensible shoes!), and there was a good variety of fresh food for breakfast. We were upgraded to a newly refurbished room, with a canopied bed, and an ensuite with a power shower with side jets of water - very sumptuous, and romantic. The room had all the facilities we needed, including a safe, hairdryer and minibar. There were fresh towels , and even sweets on the pillows every day. Attention to detail, with Italian style and hospitality, is what made this hotel a real winner. We had a lovely time, and would certainly recommend it. Tips: Make sure you take mosquito repellant, and those plug-in things, as mosquitos are rife in Venice, and be aware that eating out can be quite expensive. A great restaurant to eat in is the Alla Madonna, on Calle Alla Madonna, close to the Rialto bridge, where the food is amazing - but get there early, as there are often queues to get in. (Opens at 6.45pm) Also, if you are staying for a few days, it is a good idea to buy a local transport ticket, which you can use on the vaporetta around Venice, and the bus service to and from the airport . We were hopping on and off the Vaporetta a lot, and we reckon it saved us a lot of money. (We paid 30 Euros each for a 72 hour ticket, but it paid for itself in the first day.) Also be aware that Venice can flood occasionally, making it difficult to get around. It wasn't too bad while we were there, but we could see that it could get quite tricky in places if there were exceptionally high tides. The locals put up raised wooden walkways when flooding occurs, which partially solve the problem, but could be difficult for some people to climb on to. There is so much to see, so plan your itinerary carefully. Hope you have as fabulous a time as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Mgt 101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antiche Figure for four nights in September. We booked this hotel in Venice because of the excellent Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The Antiche Figure is excellently located both for the bus and train stations. Having seen people lugging cases around in Venice looking for their accomodation on this occasion and on previous occasions, believe me that is a a major plus for the hotel. The hotel is also across (bridge nearby) the canal from the Vaporetto stop so access to the Rialto and St Mark's is very easy. It is also a fairly reasonable walk if you feel up to the 20-25 minutes or so it takes. The hotel is very clean, beautifully decorated and we upgraded to a beautiful room overlooking the canal. The staff were most pleasant and helpful in relation to directions, travel, advice on dining etc. A few pieces of advice 1) the three day vaporetto ticket is a great deal 2) if you have time take the No 1 from Piazzale Roma to the end of the line, it is a great way to orient yourself 3) go to Burano, it is a picturesque island and the trip across is very pleasant When I return to Venice it will definitely be to the Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “We would love to return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wintericecream
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. The staff is so friendly and helpful, treating us like family. The location is just perfect, just across the canal from the train station and within walking distance to all the attractions. The rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. We enjoyed having a Bellini in the small lounge adjacent to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Enhanced the Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: shuvfantastic
Reviews.Content: We were travellling with our two & half year old daughter and this hotel is perfectly located for travelling into and out of Venice, and for exploring the city hassle free. We arrived early for check-in but were offered a room upgrade to give us more space for three overlooking the grand canal. The bathroom, with bathtub had double basin. The staff were friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The location allowed us to get rid of our luggage within minutes of arrival in Venice so no time was lost. Similarly, we were departing Venice by train and the proximty to the station made for an easy transfer. On returning to the hotel in the evening, the canalside of the hotel was dotted with candlelit tables which made for a warm homecoming. This hotel contributed to a memorable trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, few quirks”
Reviews.Author: shorebound910
Reviews.Content: Antiche Figure has been reviewed many, many times so Ill try not to repeat what has already been said and focus on key points (good & bad) Good: LOCATION!!! Venice is a labyrinth, which is beyond obvious. (Quick tip: I used a compass way more then a map!) Finding your hotel is one aggravation that you donâ€™t want to deal with. Seeing this hotel is located right across the Canal from the train station all you have to look for is yellow signs that say "FERROVIA"....in English it means..."Hey, your hotel is thatta way!" This is a huge advantage. Plus, your right near a valperreto stop and a gondola hut. Stated many times but worth repeating...customer service. Very attentive, kind, and speak English very well. Overall appearance of the hotel is very nice. Everything is well maintained and very clean. Bad: hate to point these out... The church located right next door is going through a renovation. I am aware this is not their fault but still a little bit of an eye sore. Donâ€™t know how long this will take to complete but it appears might be awhile. Pillows are pretty bad...thin as a Kit-Kat and piling on top of each other makes it worse. For someone who loves the big fluffy pillows, this can be frustrating. Grand Canal....I really donâ€™t see the advantage of having a canal room. You have some nice views but honestly it can be a tad noisy and itâ€™s not exactly private. I would have preferred a hotel with a lagoon view but thatâ€™s just personal preference which leads to my final point. I requested a room on the highest floor possible almost 10 months in advance. We were put on the first floor, not exactly what I had in mind. Could they have been totally booked...possible but not probable. Overall Iâ€™m sure you will be very pleased if you choose this hotel. With such a high ranking I seriously doubt my 4 out of 5 will be that big of a deal in the big picture. Still I wanted to be honest about my stay. The location is a HUGE factor and pretty much trumps any other disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fiftieth!!”
Reviews.Author: GBartholomew
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Antiche Figure 11 - 14 October to celebrate my fiftieth. The hotel was chosen on the basis of the huge number of excellent reviews, and it certainly didn't disappoint! We arrived in style on the water taxi from the airport (definitely recommended!), and the staff were immediately welcoming and offered plenty of suggestions of places to go and things to do, an attitude which was typical throughout our stay. We were in a superior bedroom, but this was still furnished very tastefully and with the characteristic Murano chandeliers in the bathroom. Breakfast was included, and was more than enough to set us up for the morning. Getting to the sights was simple - just over the Scalzi Bridge to the vaporetto stop in front of the railway station. I had always wanted to visit Venice, and when we return, as we surely will, we'll definitely be booking the Antiche Figure again. Thank you for a truly memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: bodenbabe
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatley we never got to stay here. We were looking - very last minute -for a small hotel in Venice and saw this on trip advisor. I emailed the hotel direct and got an immediate email saying that they were fully booked. A little while later I received a second email with suggestions for alternative hotels - with names and contact numbers!..... and this was followed up by a third wishing us good trip. With that kind of servcie I am not surprised that people want to stay here. We did see the hotel on one of our (many) vaperretto rides and it did look lovely.Very near to train station if you want the convieience of being there.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ChicTravelerAlberta
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure is fully deserving of the praise it receives on this site. We thought the location was ideal - if you are carrying even a little bit of luggage, the steps and bridges of Venice can be a nightmare. Antiche Figure is steps away from the train station - cross one bridge and there you are. It is also close to some wonderful parts of Venice that are less touristy, such as Santa Croce. We had a lovely room with a canal view. The room was done in a classic Venetian style and looked pretty glam overall. We had no problems with canal noise, as the windows are likely soundproofed and had substantial shutters. The bathroom was spacious. There was plenty of closet space and a large desk in the room. They serve breakfast in a very nice dining area just off of the lobby. They made us a cappuccino every morning and the breakfast was quite good. The thing that makes this hotel a true gem is the service. The staff could not have been more helpful. The made dinner reservations for us, and then re-arranged them to accommodate the changes in weather so we could dine outside. One staff member actually remembered where we were having dinner one evening and took the time to ask us about it. They were also excellent about providing directions, which is a much needed service in a place like Venice. As we were checking out on our way to Florence, another member of the hotel staff gave us dining suggestions and even a few menu choices! These people are a class act. I would absolutely stay at Antiche Figure again - bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TTBoy1789
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a honeymooner and first time visitor to Venice. Venice can be intimidating for a first time visitor, trying to navigate bridges and canals without having to resort to water taxis that can cost 80 Euros one way. This hotel is conveniently located on the grand canal right across from the train station. We crossed the bridge, and there it was (this was perfect since it was raining and we had luggage). We had a lovely top floor room overlooking the canal. This is a very charming hotel, with only 12 rooms, perfect for the honeymooner!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small Hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: hughesphx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antiche Figure for 2 nights after a 12 night cruise. I booked the Antiche Figure for it's proximity to the Piazzale Rome (bus terminal). We got a bus ride from the port terminal to the Piazzale and walked with our bags (over 2 bridges) to the Hotel. It was a fairly easy walk even with 2 large bags and 3 carry on size bags. We had a canal view room on the third floor and it was breathtaking. The view up and down the Grand Canal was all I expected. There is some noise from the boats on the canal but with the windows closed it was not noticeable. The buzz on the Grand Canal was part of the "Venice experience", in my opinion. The water taxi is just across the canal and St. Mark's square is an easy 30-45 minute walk. The directions from the front desk are easy to follow and the walk is very worthwhile for the shopping and dining. This area of Venice is less crowded with tourists and has more local flavor than the area around St. Marks. When leaving, we walked back to the bus terminal and took a blue airport bus for 3 euros. (Beats the water taxi prices). The breakfast for 5 euros is very basic but still not bad considering the cost of breakfast elsewhere in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmbbostonma
Reviews.Content: We arrived in venice around 1130 am on a Monday morning. We were greeted by alessandro (sorry if i mispelled) who was quick to offer to have the room ready in 30 minutes for us even though we were there early. We stayed in room 212 which was right on the grand canal across from the train station. Fantastic location when you are lugging around heavy bags and much more cost effective then having to take a water taxi down to st marks sq. We spent one afternoon having a couple beers outside of the hotel while people watching and enjoying the weather. Our room was quite impressive. Loads of windows in the rooms. We would certainly stay at this hotel if we decide to ever go back to venice. Alessandro and Franchesca were very pleasant and made our stay unforgettable

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Misticat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure 14-16 Sep 07 mainly based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is well situated at the entrance of the Grand Canal near Piazzale Roma and the Cruise Terminal. The hotel is spotless and the service personalized. We throughly enjoyed our stay at Antiche Figure. This hotel enjoys a superb rating on Trip Advisor - and rightly so. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming and convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fallsers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at this most charming hotel located right across from the train Station in Venezzia. Having just completed a Holy LAnd cruise and a 5 hour train ride from Civitavecchia it was wonder ful to just land at the hotel in Venice. staff was courteous and so friendly and informative should you need it. Breakfast was quite good but got boring by day 3..would be good to vary it a bit for those staying more than a day or two. Rooms were clean and well decorated. Internet available too for no cost....The convenience of this hotel for the water taxi to anywhere was great and we were out of the noisy St . mark's square. area. Just loved all about it...highly recommended.Will return. Priced right too... Lorraine and Charles from Philadelphia, Pa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lenticular
Reviews.Content: We chose Antiche Figure for our third stay in Venice after reading previous reviews. It turned out to be even better than expected and well located for arrival by bus - or train or boat. All the staff were more than helpful including making a late booking for a concert on the first evening. The room was very good and, even though it was at the side of the hotel, we had a good view of the Grand Canal. The air conditioning and double glazing work well. Breakfasts were good. Although Antiche Figure is about 30 minutes stroll from San Marco - that's actually an advantage as you get see parts of the city you might otherwise miss and which have as much to recommend as the more famous sites. If or rather when we return to Venice, this hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Carlisle54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antiche Figure for 4 nights at the beginning of a two week trip to Italy. We were extremely impressed with the hotel, the rooms, its location, and the service provided. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal which was fabulous. I would recommend this hotel highly!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: fortwaynejerry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights on the 7th & 8th of September and absolutely loved it. We had a canal view room which I would highly recommend. The room was very nice and good sized as was the bath. There was a mini bar and nice toiletries for the bathroom, also houseslippers. The staff was excellent with very good English skills. The breakfast was not outstanding but was good by European standards. The hotel is right across the canal from the railroad station with a gondola station right in front of the hotel for 100 euros which was cheaper than the main tourist areas. An easy and delightful walk to the sights but be prepared to get lost, thats half the fun. We plan on staying here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Aleka2
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday and had spent three nights at the Hotel Antiche Figure. This is a little gem. I had a canal view on the first floor. It is busy and a lot of things happening out side your window which I actually liked. I stayed at the Westin in Florence for three nights and I actually prefered the charm of the AF. I would stay there again. I gave up on trying to find restuarants as recommended by tripadvisors. Seems like I would spend more time looking around for the restuarants and I would eventually end up at a restuarant that looked appealing. Stay a few minutes and look at the waiters attitudes. If I liked what I saw I would decide to eat there. There are several places in the back alley ways of the AF. Breakfast was not included in our package but they offered us a 5 euro per person deal being guests. Breakfast was continental but very well done. I fi booked again I would contact the hotel directly via email. The front desk english is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Antiche Figure - excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: brick33308
Reviews.Content: our room faced the grand canal. It was very clean, good size and well soundproofed so we couldn't hear any of the boat/pedestrian traffic just below our window. Staff was excellent and attentive. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maryefinucan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel pre/post on a cruise out of Venice. The location is great -- close to the bus terminal for transportation to/from the airport and cruise terminal. (Only needed to carry our luggage across two bridges.) It's a bit of a walk to the major attractions, but very close to the vaparetto stop. On the other hand, the neighborhood isn't nearly as crazy crowded as those nearer to San Marco. The staff couldn't have been nicer. Very friendly and helpful, excellent English. Gave us recommendations for restaurants in the area and good advice on how to get around. The rooms are fairly small, typical of Europe. Three of us were given a small suite in a beautifully renovated "annex" just down the calle from the main building. It had a bedroom and separate living room with a sofa bed. Perfect for us. (Not a lot of room for luggage, however.) The only problem was the shower in the bathroom which had no bracket for hanging the hose. Rather awkward. The staff assured us this will be fixed soon -- now that the August "everything closes down in Italy" season is over. All in all, we all enjoyed this hotel very much and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Juantwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful little hotel for 2 nights in early September. The staff is just great and the location is very good. The rooms are quite spacious and the bathrooms in particular are well appointed. The staff will go out of there way to make reservations for restaurants and any other services you may need. If at all possible go to the Osterio al Vecio Pozzo restaurant which is tucked into a side street behind the hotel. Absolutely fabulous and a great value. The hotel people recommended it to us! A word of caution to Venezia travelers. The train station is across the Canal from the hotel. However it is very difficult to get your baggage over the bridge especially if it is heavy.We hired a porter and paid him $8 euro per bag and it was well worth it. He put the luggage right on the train for us. This was all arranged by the hotel. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKMVirginia
Reviews.Content: Antiche Figure is in a terrific location and is in a lovely building with a lot of character. The proprietor and hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We do not have children, but Antiche Figure would be an excellent place for families as well. Breakfast at the hotel was very good and a real bargain. Although this hotel has a 3 star rating (from the Italian hotel board), it is clearly on the higher end of the 3 star band and has a number of amenities that 3 star hotels in Italy frequently do not have. We travel all over the world and normally stay at 5 star hotels, but absolutely loved Antiche Figure. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and best people”
Reviews.Author: emabbb
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Right by the train station and that was a blessing. The front desk so friendly. That made all the difference. They didn't nickle and dime us on anything. They loved their city and their work and it showed.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: Willitsgoodtotalk
Reviews.Content: We read Trip Advisor before booking the room and I must say that Im glad that we have found this little gem in Venice as we will return. The 4 of us arrived on the 19th easy to find, and was welcomed by a fantastic gentleman who showed us to our family room with a romeo and juliet balcony overlooking the grand canal, he also booked us a waterside table in a nearby restaurant for our evening meal. Breakfast was good, a charming lady made us real italian latte's The 24 hours we stayed in this hotel we were made to feel like family, nothing was any trouble, we crossed the bridge to the train station for our journey to lake garda. The hotel is very convienent for the train station and the bus terminus and for walking into venice as the gentleman behind the reception said to us go and have a walk around venice, explore the side streets you will never be lost how right he was, thank you to all at the antiche figure

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: swatts1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel months before our trip based on excellent reviews from this site. I was not disappointed in any way. This was our 2nd visit to Venice and Hotel Antiche Figure provided the perfect location for our stay. I contacted the hotel directly to make reservations. We needed a triple for two nights prior to our cruise and one additional night after the cruise. Normally they don't book one night on a Saturday night, but kindly made an exception since we were booked to stay several nights before the cruise. All dealings with them were timely, positive, and friendly. Several days before we were due to arrive a possible train strike in Germany meant that we needed to get to Venice a day early. An email to the hotel easily arranged an additional night. The location was very convenient to the train station, though we had to lug our heavy suitcases over a very steep bridge. We arrived late at night when restaurants were closed, but the management got some food and wine rustled up so that we didn't go to bed hungry. The room was absolutely beautiful, overlooking the Grand Canal. It was huge and the bathroom was also very large and very modern. The management of the hotel was accommodating in many ways. They suggested Osterias and Trattorias. They also arranged a water taxi to take us to the cruise ship as well as to the airport when we left Venice. I give this hotel and its management my highest praise and will stay there again any time I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noodlequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre and post cruise at this delightful hotel.Two rooms, family of four. Location is perfect, five minutes from Piazza Roma. Rooms were immaculate and breakfast was more than adequate. The reception was warm and friendly. They provided us with maps and even made dinner reservations for us! Internet was available in the lobby and it was free. We were in Venice for a Med cruise and this was the perfect beginning and ending for such a cruise. Thank you Alessandro and staff for a lovely stay. We will return to Venice and the Antiche Figure Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another 5* Review - One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Grux
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming hotel for two nights as a party of three. As usual we booked based on Tripadvisor reviews and were not dissapointed. We originally booked a triple room as my partner's mother was also travelling with us. When checking in we were warmly welcomed by Francesca and supplied a map of Venice and advised what to see and how. We were offerred to upgrade to the new suites for a very reasonable additional nightly cost and were very glad we did. The suite was not in the main hotel but in the adjoining lane and as such was very quiet (we never booked a canal view anyway). As previously reported the suite is fitted and decorated to a very high standard. It was extremely comfortable and felt like the lap of luxury! The bathroom in particular was something else!! Best of all the suite offered much more privacy for my partners mother (and us) than the triple room would have. The breakfast was also fantastic. A great range of cerial, yoghurts and pastries etc. More than enough to keep you going until lunch. The hotel is very easy to find from the airport. We bought the 3 day travel pass (at the airport on arrival) for â‚¬30 pp which covered all transport (including to/from the airport). The Blue No 5 bus took us to Piazza Roma and from there the hotel is approx 5-10 min walk. Much better than hauling luggage through Venice. We found the location to be great and lots of interesting little laneways to explore near the hotel. As others have said Piazza S. Marco etc are easily reached. On advice we ate at Ostaria Al Vecio Pozzo and really enjoyed the meal at very reasonable prices! Ask at the front desk they have great suggestions. I have stayed in many hotels all over Europe and the world and this was one of the best. If i return to Venice again, this is where I would stay!

Reviews.Title: “2 nights - nice and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Fwapsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in August and it was our first trip to Venice. Very nice hotel, convenient location right next to Piazza Roma (where you arrive when you take a bus from Marco Polo Airport). Hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful, bartender was interested in America, etc. The convenience is huge for first time visitors to Venice, because fighting the mobs through the narrow streets and on the Vaporetto may be intimidating and stressful with lots of luggage to get to another hotel. Vaporetto stops right across the canal for easy access throughout Venice, or you can walk through the meandering streets for a great experience. Venice is beautiful, but it is a 100% tourist destination so expect lots of people. Got to the island of Burano - its beautiful! Torcello is very quiet and remote and probably ok to miss.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic"”
Reviews.Author: RoyBristol
Reviews.Content: Everything has been said about this hotel in the last couple of reviews, but we felt we just had to add a few comments. My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the 4th August 2007 only for one night, before our cruise, but what a night it was, staying at the Hotel Antiche Figure. From the time we checked in, to the time we checked out, nothing was to much trouble. Francesca on reception made up most welcome, even helping with places to eat, see, etc. and pointing them all out on a map. The room was out of this world, over looking the Grand Canal. The hotel and Venice are both beautiful, and we shall be returning in the Autumn. If you have not been to Venice you should try this hotel the location is fantastic. Roy & Lesley

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base from which to explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: Based on the glowing user reviews at tripadvisor.com I decided early on that I wanted to stay here with my famiy when we visited Venice. I booked in early February after a long conversation during which I made clear that I wanted two joined rooms for our family of three. This turned out not to be possible (the hotel was planning to introduce apartments in a separate building, but they weren't in service at that point, I was told) so I settled for a three-person room overlooking the canal. The one big advantage of the Antiche Figure is that you can get there by foot in about three minutes from the station, saving you the need to fight your way onto a vaporetto with bags. The first impression of the room was not good, since we were bowled over by the smell of cigarette smoke when we opened the door. I went down to reception and was told they had no record of a specific request for a non-smoking room (although they knew we were travelling with a young child). Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The breakfasts were very good.The room was air conditioned, comfortable and not too noisy despite facing on to the canal, although you won't be able to sleep in much beyond 7.30 am when the boat traffic really starts up. There are plenty of vaporetto stops outside the station which makes exploring the city very easy. There also is a high-speed internet terminal in reception for clients, which I found useful. The one thing that did bug me was that every time I was in reception and guests came in, I seemed to hear them being told their apartments were ready or that they were being upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. The hotel had known in early February that I really wanted an apartment or suite-type arrangement and yet they made no effort to inform me when these types of accommodations became available. I'd willingly have paid the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night at the beginning of August after choosing it because of reviews on this site. Reviews are all very accurate - a fabulous little hotel with excellent service. We booked directly with the hotel through their website and had breakfast included. Were offered an upgrade on arrival which we took up and found the room to be very comfortable with a canal view. A nice touch is being able to have breakfast out on the canal side terrace. Would definately recommend the hotel and would stay here again if back in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MV21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July prior to a cruise. We chose this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and its location close to Piazalle Roma. We had a superior room overlooking the canal which is really 4 star standard. And I am told that very soon they will be offering tea and coffee making facilities in the room to make the rooms even better. Breakfast was fine with plenty of variety offered and we took it on the terrace. This small, apparently family run hotel deserves its reputation as everyone is smiling and accomodating. When we return to Venice this will definately be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: suzeclarke
Reviews.Content: An excellent little hotel. Stayed here with my boyfriend in March 2007 for a romantic getaway and it was ideal. The staff couldnt be any more helpful and the location was to die for, right on the grande canal! Couldnt ask for more out of a hotel - superb.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyJetLag
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a night stay in this excellent hotel. We've stayed there three times on three seperate occasions, and will deffinately stay here again the next time we're back in Venice. It's location is great for ease of access to the Bus Terminal, Train Station (directly opposite) and the majority of the major Vaporetto routes. There's a Gondola pick up point right outside too, which if you ask at the reception desk they can get you a discount. If you plan to visit Murano to see the glass blowing factories, It's also worth asking at reception as they can get you a free taxi ride to one of the factories on the island with no obligation to purchase anything. Of the three rooms that we've had, they've all been fantastic. Spacious by european standards, fully air conditioned and with a well appointed bathroom. Breakfast isn't included (I believe) in the normal price, but they do a deal with those that have booked through expedia (and maybe other online agencies) of a continental style buffet breakfast for â‚¬5. I think that's great value, as you'd be hard pressed to find this price anywhere else. The bar area is great, and they do have chairs and tables outside so that you can watch people passing and boats chugging up and down the grand canal. The adjacent reception area also has a free internet access point. Above all, this is a friendly and relaxing hotel that we will always come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: aphrodite100
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel as part of our Grand Tour of Europe honeymoon On arrival, we were given the choice of a room in the hotel, or, for the same price, a larger room in the annexe at the back. We were the first people to stay on the second floor and gave the room a "test drive". Room was charming, with canopied four-poster bed, huge shower with massage jets, and bath robes and slippers. Obviously no view of the Grand Canal, and no lift (unlike the main building) but extremely comfortable We found the 5 Euro breakfast excellent value - and took the advice of Tripadvisors to have non-machine made cappucinos. Cereal, fruit, croissants, eggs, cold meats, pastries, fruit juice - and we finished our breakfast by taking our last cappucino and a slice of fruit pie outside to watch the world go by on the Grand Canal (worth 5 Euros alone!) I have no idea where people would go to get a better value breakfast in Venice The hotel is a vaporetto ride from St Mark's Square, but we found this to be beneficial as the squares and canals behind the hotel were much less crowded and interesting to explore. Great location for the train station or the Piazza Roma where we left our car (just two bridges to negotiate) Staff were excellent and informative, and sitting at one of the tables in the evening drinking Prosecco or Peach Bellinis just people watching is one of the highlights of our honeymoon Absolutely intend to return, but with less baggage!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTampa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid-July based upon other reviews on Trip Advisor. Once again, we were not let down! This was the greatest hotel we stayed in out of 5 hotels during our trip to Europe. We drove a car to Venice and parked in the first public parking garage that you encounter on the right when coming in on SR 11. From there, it is about a 10 minute walk to the hotel, which is located on the Grand Canal. It was a bit of a haul, trying to pull our luggage across two bridges with stairs only, but well worth not having to catch a crowded water taxi boat. Upon arrival, the front desk staff ladies were extremely friendly and we were upgraded free of charge to their newly completed suite, located in a rear building back from the Grand Canal. The suite was beautiful, sparkling clean and had a great massage shower with several shower heads that shoot water out at you from the side of the shower. Video cameras at the entrance to the suite building and within the stair wells provide a sense of security and allow the staff to see who they let into the building after you push a button on a keypad. The bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in!! All of the staff went out of their way to accomodate us and were by far the best we encountered during our three week stay in Europe. One morning we missed breakfast by 45 minutes and the desk clerk personally served us cappucino's, croissants, and other pastries while we sat outside at a table people watching. For the best dining experience, don't eat around St. Mark's Square. Get off the tourist travelled paths and dine with the locals. Try Ristorante Bai Barbacani located at Calle del Paradiso, 5756 (telephone 041.521.02.34), north of St. Marks. We were walking along a canal when we saw a couple dining in an open window/terrace overlooking the canal. We walked in and were able to sit in the window as the guests were just leaving. The staff were extremely friendly and we had the most romantic, candlelight dinner of our entire trip! For an authentic Venetian hand crafted mask, visit La Bottega Dei Mascareri, located at the foot of the Rialto Bridge. Sergio and Massimo Boldrin are considered some of the best mask makers in Venice and made the masks used in the movie "Eyes Wide Shut". Again, Hotel Antiche Figure was absolutely fantastic and we will definitely stay here again if we ever return. One last comment. Many people told us to prior to our trip that Italians are rude to Americans. We did not encounter a single rude person in Italy (Verona, Florence and Venice), and in fact, our first encounter with a rude individual was upon our return to the US! If only American hotel staff could be as friendly as those we met in Italy!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: tandum
Reviews.Content: We had a king bed on the top floor facing the Grand Canal. The front desk staff was wonderful. The location of the hotel is close to everything. Breakfast was included. Booked through Expedia. This is a small charming hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Angelzoey2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure for three nights during our honeymoon and found it to be the perfect hotel for a stay in one of the most romantic cities in the world. While the hotel is located on the opposite end of all the attractions (St. Mark's Square, Doge's Palace, etc.), it was nice to be near the quieter part of the city, but yet still be on the Grand Canal. Plus, Venice is so small we had fun just walking to places like St. Mark's, being that it would only take about 20-25 minutes to walk there (And who doesn't love walking through Venetian cobblestone streets!) The hotel was a 5 minute walk to both the ATV (water bus) and to Piazzale Roma, which is where we had to pick up the shuttle to the cruise we were taking from Venice. To get to the airport you can either, very easily, take the ATV to the airport or pick up an actual taxi (driven) from Piazzale Roma, which is connected by bridge to the mainland. Another benefit was the hotel was right next to one of the only three bridges that crosses the Grand Canal, so we didn't have to walk far to get to the other side. The only downside to the hotel was the 5 euro breakfast. It served cold lunchmeat, cereal and fruit, not enough to fill our bellies before walking around for 10 hours. I would suggest saving your money for a slice of Italian pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Room Change otherwise very good”
Reviews.Author: holidayhelp
Reviews.Content: We booked through the internet and e.mailed the hotel we would be late and not to re-let our room. When we arrived they did not have a room except for an upgrade across the alley which would cost 50E a night extra! They did agree to one night at the old cost and then pay an extra 50E for the second night. Thought this was a bit of sharp practice. However room was excellent, shower etc very good, staff all very helpful and position very good. Make sure you get a good location map if you arrive in the dark. Most confusing as you leave p.roma where all the airport buses drop you. Air con was good which was needed as temps were in the high 30s when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: moltebene
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we booked this hotel, and what everyone said was right. The staff is outstanding, and bends over backward to make sure your stay is great. The room was clean and large, by Ventian standards (considering we had our two kids as well). Being across from the trainstation is what made it fun to sit and have a drink at the end of the day and watch the world go by. I would recommend the front rooms on the third floor facing the canal(we were on the 4th--the windows were smaller). There is really no roblem with noise at night, since most everyone seems to leave at night, and the AC was great. They have recently added a couple more suites that are just a short walk away with no canal view, but new, gorgeous and modern--would definitely recommend these as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Antiche Figure!!”
Reviews.Author: LITSBostonMA
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at Hotel Anitche Figure in Venice. We stayed there prior to boarding the Splendour of the Sea on a Greek Island cruise. The hotel is on the grand canal and beautifully maintained. The service is fantastic and all of the staff we met were charming and friendly. The hotel is right across from the train station and next to the major port and bus stop - we were able to walk with our luggages to get on the cruiseship. The four of us stayed in 2 separate rooms, I believe rooms can only accommodate a maximum of 3 people. My two daughters had their own room close by and the rooms are very comfortable with beautiful bathrooms. The included breakfast is simple but really tasty with enough items to keep us going for the whole day. We hiked/walked to the famous San Marco Square every day. It was an advanture to take a different route on a daily basis. We enjoyed sitting in front of the hotel in the late afternoon with wine and snack looking at all the passerbys. It was a positive that the hotel is not at the center of the tourist area around San Marco. The shops around tend to have better prices and are less crowded than around San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. The staff also showed us some new residential units, i.e., apartments that are part of the hotel in the street next to the hotel. Since it was our first time in Venice, we wanted to be overlooking the grand canal, but we will definitely consider staying at those units the next time. We will definitely go back to Hotel Anitche Figure when we plan on returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: sleepy510
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for one night last week and can absolutely say it is a wonderful hotel. Located straight across from the train station was one of the reasons I picked this hotel and I am happy I did. I saw people dragging their luggage through the crowed corridors of Venice and I was glad I did not have to do that. The hotel staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help in any way they could. Check in was quick and easy. Our hotel room overlooked the Canal and was clean, spacious and quiet. The hotel stored our luggage for us on check out day while we explored Venice until our 2:30 train departure. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “"wow factor"”
Reviews.Author: trippy22
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a superb stay in Venice.10/7-14/7.The hotel was one of the best we have visted around the world and the most helpful !! When we arrived we were offered an 515 upgraded room in a quite alley which had just been completed. The room had a large conopy bed and a massive massage shower. Venice is a wonderful place with beautiful architecture and plenty to do.The hotel staff are brilliant and nothing is ever too much trouble. We would definately recommend this hotel . Thanks to all the staff at "Antiche Figure" for a great stay to celebrate our 6th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Let-Down.”
Reviews.Author: YoungTravelersUsa
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure during our first stay in Venice together. We were so excited that the location was near the train station and therefore we wouldn't have to carry our luggage very far and of course Trip Advisor is usually right on the money! We were greeted pleasantly but were not offered our choice of rooms even though we booked our room way in advance. A previous reviewer mentioned that the concierge allowed them to choose a newer room; this was during the same time we were staying here! Our room was on the side of the hotel and we were told we'd have a great view of the canal if we stuck our head out of the window and twisted it around (this was true). While the room was clean, our bathroom smelled like mold and was not ventilated. The breakfast is not complimentary and is less-than-stellar. A coffee machine instead of home-brewed coffee, and a paltry selection of pastries and breakfast choices. We had a magnificent trip to Venice, but this was our least favorite hotel on our trip. It's okay but we would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: degsville
Reviews.Content: SIMPLY THE BEST! I really don't know what else I could say! From the warm welcome, to the English speaking staff, to the great breakfast, recommendations of fine restaurants, best gondola rides, best of everything, 24/7. I SIMPLY LOVE THIS PLACE. Clean, refreshing, great location! Don't pass this GEM up!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 2vaca
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous experience at this hotel. From check-in to check-out, we received nothing but excellent service. The staff there is friendly and will spend time explaining the area. We chose this hotel because of the closeness to the train station. We did not want to lug our suitcases in and out of boats. It was a quick walk over the bridge, and there we were! The water bus picks up at the train station, so we used it often. Walking to Rialto Bridge from there was memorable and not too hard to do. Our room was beautfully decorated with a real Venice feel. The bathroom was lovely as well. We have traveled all over Europe and have rarely found a hotel that was so concerned with meeting the needs of its visitors. We miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “everything perfect”
Reviews.Author: jaydave58
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel antiche figure about 10am on the 8th of july for 2 nights, after a quick and straight forward flight from liverpool to trivosa airport. The hotel and its staff are out of this world, nothing is too much trouble, after checking straight in, imagine our surprise to be offered a choice of rooms, we was shown the room in the hotel, which was lovely, but then we was shown a hidden gem!, we was taken outside the hotel, and taken down the side of the hotel to a door way, with its own enterance up the stairs and wow!!!!!!! this brand new set of rooms are out of this world..of course we opted for this one! We went back in to the hotel where we was given amap with lots of things to do, directions of places to go, and so much friendly advice.. nothing is too much trouble. this hotel deserves all the fantastic reviews. We are hoping to return to venice again, and would definately choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Antiche Figure is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: bbroomie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy and our stay at the Antiche Figure couldn't have been nicer. The location is perfect and the staff is wonderful. They have just opened up some rooms in the building next door to the hotel and we stayed in those brand new rooms. They were spacious, clean, and decorated very nicely. It was quiet and very peaceful in those rooms. I can't believe this is just a 3 star hotel, everything about it is well above that rating. Venice is truly magical and this hotel added to the charm of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't ask for anything more.”
Reviews.Author: PenderBender
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were just starting out on our holiday and were spending one night in Venice before embarking on a 15 day cruise around the Mediterranean and then north on the Atlantic to end up in Copenhagen. We were very tired upon arrival (after continuously flying from Vancouver to Calgary to Frankfurt and then on to Venice) and after a slow bus trip from the Venice airport on a hot day it was quite a relief to finally find this very attractive and comfortable little hotel. The reviews that I had read about this place were quite accurate. The Antiche Figure is a real gem and more than I had even expected. The room (311) that we stayed in was very classic with a lovely view out and down the Grand Canal. Everything is easily accessible. The breakfast was perfect! Everything we needed was there and it was super clean and very efficiently attended by a young female server. We know about the importance of packing lightly in Europe (particularly a city like Venice with all its bridges and canals) and pride ourselves on limiting our bags. Even with a pending cruise we were down to 2 bags so you can imagine our concern when only 1 of them accompanied our flight from Frankfurt! Some attention from the front desk to communicate with the airport ensured that our 2nd bag met us in our room onboard the ship the next afternoon! Also, some negotiations with a water taxi (by this same individual) got us a split fare to the cruise terminal with another couple heading that way. All in all, this excellent reception at the Antiche Figure got us off on the right foot to a very successful trip and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent Find!”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet55
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week trip to Italy where we ended our travels at the Antiche Figure in Venice.
