I commented to my husband that I have never experienced a better "service attitude" in all my global travels. At every turn, care was expressed to assure that everything met our expectations. We booked three rooms for seven of us and were very surprised at the ample size. The rooms and baths were spotless and had very quiet air conditioning! This is a hotel for people who want to experience the flavor of Venice...it is very quaint and the breakfast was very complete by European measures. We especially appreciated the very accomodating attitude of hotel staff when we asked if we could use one of their outdoor tables (normally for service from their bar inside) to have a bottle of our own wine. Absolutely no problem! While it is a hike to the main tourist attractions, the rates are favorable and we found its accessibility to the train station a major plus. We had no trouble with family ranging from 58 yrs. to 10 yrs. managing the walk across the bridge though we did make sure to pack appropriately throughout our journey. The water buses are a breeze so we would absolutely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: casa1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Antiche Figure for three nights in June in a Deluxe room overlooking the canal. We arrived in Venice via an overnight train from Paris and were thrilled that we had such a short walk to the hotel. Yes... the bridge is steep, but very manageable. Just rest at the top! The hotel is lovely downstairs. There is a small lobby and a bar area. The breakfast room is also on this floor and is very nice and quite adequate for all of the guests. But the best seats are outside at one of the many tables right on the canal. It was a lot of fun to sit and watch Venice go by! Our room was quite large with several windows which opened up to the canal. It was fun to sit in the window in the afternoon and watch the gondoliers get ready for the afternoon gondola rides. The room/bathroom was very clean and the bed was VERY comfortable. Our room had a King bed with sitting area and desk. We slept with the window open and could hear the water at night and in the morning. After 10pm, it was very quiet outside except for an occasional boat. I thought the room on the canal was worth the extra price. The location was great for us since we arrived and departed by train. I was also happy to retreat from the crowds and noise at San Marco's Square to our quiet hotel. Walking was not a problem in Venice since the city isn't that large. You will get lost, but that is part of the fun. Just relax. The best part of the hotel is the staff. We stayed in 6 hotels on our 3-week trip and the staff at Antiche Figure was by far the most helpful and conscience of all of the hotels we visited (and they were all nice hotels). We were spoiled by good service after leaving the Antiche Figure. The staff always made you feel as though you were the only one they were assisting. Even the young woman at breakfast was so friendly and helpful it made you look forward to breakfast each morning. Speaking of breakfast, I will have to disagree with a previous reviewer. As I said, we stayed in 5 other hotels on our trip and the breakfast at Antiche Figure was right on par with every other hotel. They offered a good variety with pasteries, meats, cheeses, eggs, cereal, yogurt, cookies, and various beverages. And we thoroughly enjoyed having our breakfast on the patio each morning and watching the city start to come to life. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: kissel
Reviews.Content: The AF did not disappoint, especially given our extremely high expectations from consistently strong reviews on TA. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a wonderfully large canal view room (with a surprisingly plush bathroom) on the top floor. We loved eating the fantastic breakfast buffet and enjoying pre-dinner cocktails outside along the grand canal. The hotel staff take their TA reputation extremely seriously, and could not be more friendly and accomodating to maintain their well deserved high grades. The AF is well located across the canal from the train station and vaporetto stop. However, while I felt the accomodations and service at the AF are excellent, I'm not sure I agree that the AF is deserving of its TA designation as "Best for Romance in Europe." I would expect this distinction to imply that there is something extremely special about the property itself (e.g. well-maintained grounds, charming public areas, or spectacular views) and I wouldn't say the AF offers this, relative to other properties we've stayed at in Europe. However, the AF is a great hotel and is highly recommended for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “some specifics”
Reviews.Author: AGTraveller
Reviews.Content: I agree that the location is a plus. But you should know that walking over the bridge to and from the train station is not the cinch that some seem to imply. The bridge that you need to cross is high and there are steps to climb up and down. Also, as Rick Steve points out in his guide book: staying in this area you are constantly jostling with a lot of people hauling their luggage to and from the train station. It's not a big detriment but still something to take into consideration. Also, this area is not known for great restaurants and as has been pointed out you need to take the vaporetto to go to the main tourist attractions. I don't mean to ding the hotel but its internet connection in the room is ethernet only. However, there is good wireless access downstairs in the lobby. The breakfast buffet is not something that I will remember with fond memory. I have not stayed in other hotels in Venice and perhaps by comparison this place is a gem, but for the money I pay I would expect a lot more elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Gem”
Reviews.Author: Rocky9740
Reviews.Content: The Antiche Figure and the people who work in this hotel made our stay in Venice memorable. From check in to check out they could not have been more accomodating. Alessandro was an absoute pleasure to deal with. His recommendations for activities, restaurants, and sight seeing were par excellance! Our room was clean and had a great view of the Grand Canal with easy access to the train station. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel for a future visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel, great room, great location great service”
Reviews.Author: Adrian_Joyce
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for an 8 day stay in Venice. The standard of our room, the service and the friendly informative staff surpased our best expectation. As it is right opposite the local railway station (the boat pickup point just opposite as well) and just down from the bus station you could not be closer to connect to anywhere. As well there is no downside to this convenience either. Buying a venice card for the durantion of our stay allowed us freedom to just hop on and hop off the excellent boat service as well as visit the islands of Murano, Burano, Torcello and the Lido. (If, and you should visit Torcello, make sure you have lunch at Villa600; the best meal of our lives, and if we'd been the Beckham's I'd doubt we would have received better service!!) We also very much enjoyed having buffet style breakfast and evening drinks outside the front of the hotel on the Grand Canal too. You won't regret booking this hotel and we will definately go back if we return to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DaJoos
Reviews.Content: We returned from Venice and the Hotel Antiche Figure a week or so ago, and as we found all the excellent hotels by using TA I thought I should at a miniumum add my review - I'm glad to for this very nice hotel. I chose the Antiche Figure after browsing TA for a reasonably priced (by summer Venice standards!) hotel that sounded like a good match for myself, wife and 11 year old daughter. The high rankings of the Antiche Figure made me book a room. Venice was the last stop on our Italy vacation and by the time we arrived we were dragging a bit - the proximity to the train station (where we arrived) was a BIG plus, as was the warm welcome of the front desk staff. (It should be noted, however, that even though the hotel is a short bridge crossing from the train station, the bridge has no ramps - you'll have to 'lug' your luggage up and down stairs. No slight on the hotel, of course, but older travelers may want to know this). As stated the front desk staff was friendly and professional througout our stay - they took the time to welcome us each time we entered, and spent a long time orienting us to Venice when we first arrived. The room we received was the smallest of the four we stayed at in Italy, and looked out on an alley rather than the Grand Canal. Although I'd asked and hoped for a front-facing room I was told (or interpreted from the web site?) that if you have more than 2 persons the rooms don't face the front (don't take this as absolute - I *think* this is the case). Our alley-facing room was not a surprise, but I would have preferred and paid for a front-facing room if it had been available. It was clear that the room we got, with a 'matrimonial bed' (two twins pushed together) and another twin for our daughter, was originally designed for just the matrimonial bed. The large bed was pushed out of alignment with the headboard (attached to the wall), and one side bedstand had been turned sideways so they could stuff the extra twin in. This made the drawers on the bedstand useless (they were blocked) and the extra twin blocked what would have been the desk area. Not a great setup but we didn't let it spoil our stay (perhaps we should have complained?). As long as we coordinated our movements through the room all was OK. The hotel is far from St. Marks, but as Venice is small and I enjoy the vaporettos anyway this wasn't really a negative - could have been a plus due to the relative quiet. On the other hand the hotel is very close to the train station (as noted), a major water taxi stand, and the Roma (?) parking lot/bus stand which we used for transportation to the airport. The hotel breakfast was standard Italian and was offered both inside and out on the patio - a nice touch. My wife and I found food we liked but they could probably provide a few different items for children (pre-sweetened cereal, for instance). A free computer with Internet access is available across from the front desk - though with just 1 computer we could have had problems waiting we didn't have this happen during our brief checks of email. I would recommend this hotel to others who like its convenience, and would suggest that time is taken to clarify just what kind of room you receive in advance, so as to assuage any disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “AN ITALIAN DREAM”
Reviews.Author: NewlandsLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this excellent hotel for a week and found the facilities excellent. Our room overlooking the Grand Canal was spacious and very well appointed. The breakfast buffet offered a great choice and was exceptionally reasonably priced. Best of all were the management and staff - friendly, helpful and always willing to go the extra mile for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “High marks to the Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: cmgp01
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to stay at this hotel. Location is very convenient to Venezia Santa Lucia train station and it was a great relief to get off the train, cross the bridge, and get to our hotel so fast. The reception staff was charming and very helpful. The room was very clean although not very spacious. Breakfast in the tables that face the canal was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Eveerything great”
Reviews.Author: RestlessinIndy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I couldn't have been more happy with our choice of hotel in Venice. The hotel staff is very friendly and gives great advice on restaurants etc. Also, our booking didn't have breakfast, but they offered us to add the breakfast buffet anyway. For 5 Euro the breakfast included hardboiled eggs, cereals, pastries, juices and cold cuts and was a true bargain. The hotel is conveniently close to the train station if you want to take a train ride. It is also close to water bus (vaporetto) stops. Of course, most everything in Venice eg. St Marcus place is in walking distance anyway. Our room didn't have a view, but was big enough and very nicely furnitured. Also the bathroom was quite beautiful with the multi-colored tiles. Everything was vey clean. There is a construction project of the sewer system going on in the vicinity of the hotel right now and workers' voices did wake us up around 7 am, but this is obviously outside of the control of the hotel and wasn't a big deal. Would definitely book this hotel again for our nex visit and recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - great staff”
Reviews.Author: Esquimalt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Hotel Antiche Figure, based on reviews in TripAdvisor, for two nights in May 2007. We arrived in Venice by train from Rome and departed Venice by cruise ship. In addition to being highly rated in TripAdvisor, the location was perfect for our arrival and departure because both the train station and the cruise ship terminal's shuttle bus stop are within easy walking distance from the hotel (we had one large rolling suitaces and one piece of hand luggage each). On arrival in mid-afternoon, we were warmly greeted and our room was ready. We had booked a non-smoking canal view room and were assigned room 212 at a cost of 279 euros per night. The room was everything we expected - very clean and pleasant with a decent view of the Grand Canal. Although the hotel might not be in the heart of the tourist attractions, e.g., St. Mark's Square, Venice is small (although you will definitely get lost at some point) and the location is very good and would, I think, suit most tourists.. The included self-service breakfast was what we expected - basic fare of coffee, pastries, cereal, some fruits - but might disappoint some North American travellers. The key attributes of this hotel are the clean pleasant rooms and the great staff. We would highly recommend the Hotel Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: chuckgnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before a Greek cruise. The staff, especially Gianni were very helpful both while booking the hotel and when we arrived. We were given a beautiful ttriple room with a tiny balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. What a view to have for our first, but certainly not last, visit to Venice. The room was clean and the bathroom large and well-equipped with two sinks. The breakfast room was a bit small, but the food was good. There are also several tables outside which can provide a good spot for people watching or just sipping a cocktail from the hotel bar after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is across from the train station and just a couple of blocks from the Piazzale Roma. Very convenient for travelers. It is about 25 minutes stroll to San Marco, but there is much less traffic and the prices for accommodations and food are cheaper in the area around the hotel. Let me say that Venice is NOT a cheap place to stay, but if you order meals carefully, you can avoid breaking the bank. All in all, the stay at the Antiche Figure was very enjoyable and I would suggest it for travelers to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: GrahamClarke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed in! My husband took me as a 40th birthday present and we chose the hotel on the strength of trip advisor reviews and we found them to be very accurate. Its location is perfect - just opposite the railway and vaporetto stations and only a short walk from the bus station- believe me when you're carrying luggage it's a brilliant place to be! We had a side room (314) which was a bit small, but beautifully appointed with fabric walls, murano glass chandelier and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in on holiday. The bathroom was beautiful and the towels were changed daily. I would say not having a room overlooking the canal was an advantage because the traffic on the canal can be noisy and is ceaseless - think of the M25! The staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful but not intrusive - spending time with you on arrival advising you of places to go and where to eat and will book tickets for concerts or the doges palace for you. Take advantage of this as we never got to the basilica because of the queues. Don't go to Venice expecting to be wowed by the cuisine. We found the restaurants to be plentiful, but mostly offering the same dishes and at very expensive prices. Expect to pay around 50 euros for a 2 course meal for 2 with house wine, but service charges are added usually at around 12% so there's no need to tip. Go over the Scalzi bridge outside the hotel to the Cannaregio district in the evening for a stroll. The area is lively and bright with glass shops and street artists. You can walk all the way to the Rialto bridge along a main street with wonderful shopping opportunities and views around every corner. We found the prices and variety here for glass and jewellery to be the best in Venice but don't be afraid to keep looking until you find what you really want as no two shops are quite the same. Murano is very pretty and very clean. There's an abundance of glass shops and we found the staff to be friendly and happy to let you look so don't be pressured into buying anything you don't want. The glass museum is worth a visit too for the 4m chandelier and the miniature formal garden all made out of glass.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend to remember”
Reviews.Author: fltraveler54
Reviews.Content: Our stay was amazing. The hotel staff is attentive to your needs and very helpful. The location is across from vaporetto stop so getting around was very easy. The room was charming and very clean with a balcony and view of the canal, ask for room 211. The breakfast was perfect. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Drzava
Reviews.Content: Like many here, I booked this hotel on the strength of its Tripadvisor ratings and they were spot on! Location is ideal, directly across from the train terminal and vaporetto stop - a good walk away from the main tourist action (about 30 min to the main square), but it saves dragging your bags over dozens of bridges! Staff were very friendly and gave some good sightseeing tips. We had one of the larger rooms which was a good size, with a nice view of the canal. Breakfast was your standard continental and the restaurant they recommended was indeed fine. The price, while expensive for many cities, is very cheap for Venice. Book this place well in advance because it fills up fast!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little gem”
Reviews.Author: LittleBritain
Reviews.Content: I booked this after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor - and am glad to report that everything good that I read is true. We stayed for just two nights precruise. The hotel is a short walk from Piazzale Roma over two small bridges, right opposite the train station. The staff are as friendly and welcoming as everyone has said. We were offered a choice of rooms and chose the smaller room with the 'view' of the canal. The restaurant that the hotel recommended was so good that we went there two nights running - Osteria al Vecio Pozzo just a few streets behind the hotel. Good cooking and the house 'white' wine [which is really a Prosecco] slid down easily at â‚¬13.50 a litre! Another very good restaurant we found was in San Tome Square right by the San Tome stop on the Grand Canal. Tables set up outside the church in a quiet area of town - well worth it. One reviewer was moaning that this hotel was not near St Marks Square and I can only say thank goodness it wasn't ,as that area was absolutely heaving with tourists, and the restaurants that we tried in the area were not as good and charged considerably more! The breakfast was good, ask for a proper cappucino instead of using the machine [no extra cost], and they are happy to serve drinks until the small hours in the small area outside! Hope you get your #1 rating on TripAdvisor back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: Coco#55
Reviews.Content: We were 5 ladies travelling throughout Italy and Venice was our first stop, arriving from Rome via train. I had contacted the hotel and told them we might be late in the evening as we were arriving from the US and taking the train from Rome to Venice. Well, we arrived around 10:30 pm and as soon as we walked in...the hotel is directly across the canal from the train station...we were greeted as long lost relatives. Tony, at the front desk was so welcoming and our rooms...we had a double and a triple...were all set and ready for us weary travellers. The rooms were perfect, not too small and nicely appoited. The bathrooms were an excellent size and the beds were comfortable. The rates included breakfast which was in the back room on the main floor, small but accomodating with the usual fare. There are also small tables and chairs outside to have a drink and watch the world go bye and a small bar in the lobby for a good cocktail at the end of the day. I asked the hotel in advance to get us reservations for the Secret Tour at the Dodge's Palace and we had reservations for the next day at 10:30. The also recommended a nice restaurant the next evening for dinner in the neighborhood, which was excellent. They have free internet in the lobby which is a nice touch, so we could all let our families know we arrived safely. They did mention to me that they are in the process of adding more rooms, but these would be mini-apt, ideal for families. The location of the hotel is perfect if you are using the train station, very easy to get to with luggage. I have stayed in Venice several times, and at hotels within this area and I like this hotel by far the best. The other hotels treat you like paying guests, this hotel treats you like family. While it is a walk from St. Mark's , you can easily hop on a vaporetto, directly across the bridge, and in no time you are there, or you can walk..a wonderful way to see the real Venice and all the interesting shops, etc. along the way. I will definately come back to the Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: horlicks1000
Reviews.Content: After reviewing Trip Advisor we decided on this Hotel based on the numerous good reviews it had received. We were certainly not dissapointed, the service at the hotel was excellent and the location whilst being at one of the busiest places of the Grand Canel opposite the train station was very good to access all the key areas of Venice. Would recommend the Bacaro Jazz bar for a lively dinner at reasonable prices and for a long lunch slightly off the beat and track try the restaurant on Murano island (located opposite the main glassworks a dozen yards from the main water taxi station)

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: Graham5253
Reviews.Content: A simply excellent hotel located right on the banks of the Grand Canal..Friendly helpful staff greet you who cannot do enough for you. The whole hotel is just immaculate throughout from the reception area to the room itself all of which is decorated in a period Venetian style. A real find if you are looking for a three star hotel in Venice which..in my opinion should be 4 star.. Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat_Berkshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice where we stayed at the Antiche Figure Hotel situated on the Grand Canal, a short walk from Pizzale Roma. The Antiche Figure was very welcoming and the hotel was spotless, well decorated, a peaceful haven away from the bustle of the Grand Canal. The Reception Staff went out of their way to be helpful and informative about Venice and we had a wonderful stay. Our bedroom was well decorated, well kept and there was a digital safe, mini bar and magnifying shaving mirror in the bathroom. They are also very open to new ideas and are taking on board a comment from a previous traveller and are going to put tea/coffee making facilities in the bedrooms. I really recommend this hotel and would ike to point out that this is the first hotel review that I have ever written so that should be seen as a measure on how well we enjoyed staying at the Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of all the praises !”
Reviews.Author: Heulwendeg
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read the reviews on Tripadvisor and it certainly lived up to all the previous praises. It is in an excellent position, near to the airport , the railway station and the vaporetti stops, facing the Grand Canal. We paid extra for a room overlooking the canal and it was well worth the extra cost -elegant furnishings, very good beds and spectacular views. The hotel is clean and very comfortable, it has a warm and welcoming atmosphere but its greatest strength is the staff. We arrived with a problem - Easyjet lost our suitcase for the duration of our stay. All the managerial staff speak excellent English and they took on the problem for us, ringing the airline everyday, sorting out our prebooked visit to the Doge's Palace (paperwork was in suitcase) and generally helping and supporting us. It was just like staying with friends and we are very grateful to them. We will certainly return there and until then, grazie Gianni, Francesca, Alessandro and all the staff at Hotel Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Keydet61
Reviews.Content: The Antiche Figure is truly a hidden gem. Great location along with a wonderful and caring staff. We stayed at this hotel twice and would highly recommend it to all wanting superb service and convenient location. Irene and John, Wilmington, NC

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Nige7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day stay and cannot rate this Hotel highly enough. We chose the Antiche Figure for our 20th wedding anniversary based upon other Tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. Having contacted the hotel directly to book they arranged flowers, chocolates and champagne in the room upon arrival and recommended restaurants in which to eat. The Hotel is situated at the quieter end of the Grand Canel and is about a 15 minute walk from the Rialto bridge and 25 minutes form St Marcs square. The breakfast is more than adequate and the bar is a welcome retreat at the end of a day or an evening out. The staff are friendly and helpful beyond the call and we will return. Alessandro - thank you !

Reviews.Title: “You're right - it really is nice”
Reviews.Author: LynMaidstone
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after a lovely weekend at the Antiche. All the good things said by previous reviewers are true. Location perfect - not near S.Marco but we liked the walk or the vaporetto ride and being away from the crowds was an advantage. The hotel staff were so pleasant and helpful and arranged tickets for the secret tour and gave excellent advice on Murano and gondolas. We also loved their restaurant recommendation - very simple style but excellent fresh food and very attentive service. we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. We booked a canal view room (212) which was perfect and we were not disturbed by noise, it was great to watch all the traffic going by outside. Thank you Antiche and Venice for a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Esther32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night and one long day in April 2007. The location was very good for what we wanted. It was located right on the Grand Canal but quite west right across the Scalzi Bridge. It is across the canal from the train station and a 7 minute walk from Piazzelle Roma. We arrived very early in the morning having just left a cruise ship. We did not expect to be able to get our room so early and were prepared to stash our bags and run. However, the woman at the front desk had knowledge of us from our email correspondence and told us to wait in the breakfast room and that she would send the housekeeper up immediately to do our room. She gave us the hotel brochure, circled the windows of our room and in a 1/2 hour we were in the room. All this before 9:30 am. The view from our room was breathtaking. The service otherwise was very helpful and warm. We would stay here again without hesitation. It is in the San Croce area right near a vaporetto stop. The breakfast was good, free internet access with a cable they supply. Bathroom with little crystal chandeliers, toothbruses and other nice ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKRAC
Reviews.Content: We booked the Antiche Figure based on the reviews we read here and we were very impressed. The hotel was beautiful, our room #311 had a terrific view of the Grand Canal and the bathroom was especially lovely. The hotel's breakfast area and bar were really nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The train station is right across the canal and the bus depot is a 5 minute walk away - these are important to consider in Venice - because it can be a long walk to your hotel with luggage. Beautiful place - really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lucyinbelfast
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel Antiche Figure on our honeymoon last month, I can honestly say it lived up to all its reviews. Great location the room was beautifully decorated with great view of the grand canal (room 111, we were offered a choice of room on arrival and were given the opportunity to view ) Central location within walking distance of all main attractions. All the staff were exceptional but we would have to thank Gianni who went out of his way to help us when we had a problem with a gondola ride and meal we had pre booked at home.Cant say enough good things and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrifice Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeleneDC
Reviews.Content: What a terrific hotel...excellent staff (especially Johnny); fine breakfasts, a room with a view (411), close to the train station. Hotel staff recommendations for restaurants were terrific. Can't say enough about the quality of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: andycrawf
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice, a special surprise birthday treat for my wife. Not many hotels have as many good reviews as the Antiche Figure and I did wonder if it might be a case of 'the emperors new clothes' but I decided to trust my fellow travellers... and I am glad I did. I was also a little concerned whether the view of the railway station might not exactly be the best in town, but I needn't have worried. The Grand Canal is something else, a liquid main street, and the hustle and bustle on the water and beside it is so engaging. Our hotel room was on the top floor at the front, overlooking the Grand Canal. It was beautifully decorated, very comfortable and, with the windows closed, completely peaceful. The bathroom was excellent. We received a lovely welcome from Francesca at reception who gave us lots of information about exploring the city. She advised us of two restaurants that are quite close to the hotel, both of which were excellent recommendations. They were booked for us by the hotel and the staff at the restaurants welcomed us and looked after us very well. I could wax lyrical about Venice - 3 days is just not enough and we will return... and to the Antiche Figure. It really is a great little hotel, with everything accessible, close enough to the city life yet away from the really touristy bits of San Marco. A couple of tips - take the bus from the airport to Piazzale Roma. The hotel is just 5 minutes walk from there. It is quick and cheap. Take a gondola ride, but book it yourself with the gondoliers outside the hotel, it is cheaper than the hotel arranging it. We did a night ride and I would thoroughly recommend doing it then, you see the city in a different light (excuse the pun). Take the free water taxi from the hotel to Murano (paid by the glass factory). The water taxi is a great ride but expensive if you have to pay it yourself. You just have to make your excuses at the factory for not buying their glass (phenomenally expensive, like thousands of Euros for a single piece) - but that was part of the fun! Use the Vaporettos - cheap, convenient and accessible from and to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ShaunandSam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location. Close to the taxi / watertaxi / bus stations but far enough not to be troubled by them. The service at the Hotel is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: rkdBeaconsfield
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!! It was our first trip to Venice and this hotel was the perfect ending to each beautiful day of exploring the city and sampling the wonderful food and wines. We had a canal view room with three large windows that was very tastefully furnished and spacious. The breakfast each morning was a pleasant way to start the day and the outdoor cafe tables were a enjoyable place for an afternoon drink or just a nice place to observe the canal and people walking by. The staff were tremendous from the minute we walked through the front door until the minute we left. Very helpful with directions (they provided a detailed map of Venice and a guidebook) and were very courteous and friendly. Hotel Antiche Figure will become our hotel of choice for future visits to Venice and a nice recommendation to our friends. DiMuzio Family, Beaconsfield, UK

Reviews.Title: “great place great staff”
Reviews.Author: px
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay first week of april. staff before and during were very friendly and informative. The location is great, i just dont get the gripes of some earlier reviews, i thought the view overlooking the canal was great...so there is a train station on the other side. Only gripes would be limited breakfast and the 3rd bed to make our room a triple wasnt the most comfortable in the world but everybody were agreed that they enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kfunknc
Reviews.Content: What a wonderul place! We stayed for two night in late March. From the time of booking until check out, the entire staff was the best I have ever dealt with. As I was planning my proposal to my now fiance, I asked a million questions which were all answered promptly. It went perfectly even though I didn't get to ask on a gondola. It was too cold! The bridge to the right of the hotel over the Grand Canal served just as well. I travel quite often to many places and can honestly say that this was overall the best place I've ever stayed (for the value). Communication was excellent (via email and in person at the hotel). Feel confident in the recommendation from the hotel; the restaurants, the Doge's Palace Secret Tour, etc. Alessandro was very accomodating and Francesca even booked our rail tickets leaving Venice for us! We had a second floor room with a balcony directly over the Grand Canal. Unbelievable views. Bathroom was largest European bathroom I've ever seen! When in Venice, stay at this hotel. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Easter break in Venice”
Reviews.Author: eeyoremad
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for our first trip to Venice, easy to find and well located for trips to all parts. The rooms are spacious, very nicely decorated, with comfortable beds. The bathrooms appear to be newly refurbished with beautiful venetian chandeliers on the mirrors. We paid a little extra in order to have a room facing the Grand Canal which had a view of the Scalzi Bridge. We found all the staff spoke good english and were very keen to please. We would definitely recommend this hotel to all who wish to visit Venice. Gill and Steve

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: UKNiclak
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel on the Grand Canal. Staff were very welcoming and on our arrival gave us lots of useful information about places to go and what to do during our stay. Room was nicely decorated and clean, the bathroom was also very nice. The hotel was ideally situated just across the bridge from the Vaporettas which took you into the centre of the city at regular intervals. I would stay here again most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Springfield-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our second trip to Italy, and our second stay at the Antiche Figure Hotel in Venice. The first trip, we relyed on Hotels.com to help us find a good hotel, and we were so pleased with this wonderful, little hotel. First of all, it has a fantastic location. Our first trip, we came in from Marco Polo Airport, via the bus, which dropped us off at Piazelle Roma, which is a transportation hub. We hopped a vaporetto (water bus) to find our hotel, and there it was, on the right side in full view! We got off at the first stop, Ferrovia,and walked across the bridge to the hotel. We couldn't believe that it was that convenient. It is also across the Grand Canal from the train station, which also came in handy for both of our trips to and from other cities. Remember that Venice is unlike other cities where one can hail a cab and be dropped right in front of your hotel. Their location is fantastic! As we walked trhrough the front door, we were greeted warmly by Alessandro, the hotel manager, who was very helpful in orienting us to the city of Venice, as well. During our three day stay, we were always treated like a member of the family by this warm and friendly staff. They all spoke English, too. The rooms are very pretty and comfortable. It is my understanding that the Grand Canal side rooms are larger, and that was where we stayed both visits. The bathrooms are very nice, too, with a bathtub and shower and a nice sized vanity. As I said earlier, we just returned from our second trip to Venice and a big reason for returning was the Antiche Figure. We have sent friends to stay there, as well, and I highly recommend this hotel. As a final note, I celebrated my birthday there last week and planned on a gondola ride, which Gianni, at the front desk, arranged for us. He escorted us to the gondola (again, right out in front of the hotel) and then quickly went back in to their bar and returned with an ice bucket and my favorite white wine, courtesy of the hotel! He even made me a birthday card on the hotel computer and presented it with the wine. Needless, to say, I was very touched by his thoughtfulness!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexcat
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in March. I selected it based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel but to be honest I was expecting a little bit more from the hotel based on the over the top reviews. We booked a canal view room (Room 111). It was a fairly large room with a view of the Grand Canal. It was clean & nicely decorated. The room looked just like it shows on the website. The bed we had was 2 twin beds pushed together (very normal in Europe) however the beds were not quite an equal height. The side closest to the door way was slightly lower and a bit worn. In fact the foot of the bed had a rather big indentation. I wanted to mention this to the hotel but my husband wouldn't let me (it was his side of the bed). I was just a little disappointed considering we paid 239 euros for the first night & 299 euros for each of the next two nights. I want to clarify that the hotel is nice but I didn't see why the reviews are as incredible as they are. I must give props to the staff. They were very helpful when we checked in - providing us with information about the vaperatos and also when we needed a water taxi for our very early flights home. I am in no way bad mouthing this hotel as it is a nice 3 star hotel. The location is perfect for those who have lots of luggage & don't want to haul them on a vaperato or pay for a water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection !”
Reviews.Author: pjdb5
Reviews.Content: My fiance booked a trip to Venice as a surprise trip over Valentines day - he couldnt have chosen a more perfect hotel! everything about the hotel was brilliant, location, staff, the room, etc etc etc! Staff were all so friendly and took time to tell us how to get places, recommendations of restaurants etc. We werent actually aware the Carnival was on when we arrived, but the staff took their time to explain all the goings on for the duration of our stay and supplied us with maps and info on the carnival. Only a short walk from the bus station over the river and afew little bridges and we were at the hotel! The Vaparetto station directly accross from the hotel, outside the train station, was very handy, we used it loads. Worthwhile getting a pass for your duration, especially since you can jump on off anywhere, all day, and although you can walk to St Marks Square, it does take about 30mins or so, depending on the pace. But the pass gives you the option of perhaps walking there and getting the vaparetto back. We got engaged over there, and hope to return to the Antiche Figure sometime in the future, maby even for our Honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “hotel antiche figure”
Reviews.Author: Breughel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March (13-17) and had a fantastic time. The staff could not have been more helpful. They booked us tickets for the Secret Itinery tour of the Doges Palace at our request over the net prior to arrival (well worth doing to avoid queues). They also booked us tickets to see a concert which was lovely and we really enjoyed a Vilvaldi concert one evening too. The location is excellant and we used our 3 day waterbus pass everywhere and felt it was good value. The weather was fab which helped, and we got a waterbus out to lido and hired bikes for an hour (which only cost 3 euros). Overall we loved the hotel. Thanks to all the staff. We loved Venice and hope to back soon. Claire and Niel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice; luxurious rooms with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Julieandchris
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very luxurious by Italian standards with carpeting instead of the usual hard floors and a co-ordinated decor. Bathrooms were good size and towels were changed every day. A nice touch were the chocolates on the pillow. Breakfast was only 5 E for usual condinental buffet style which was great value. All of the staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. We had taken my father in a wheel chair ( brave in Venice!!) and found the staff very happy to store the chair etc. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a visit to Venice. It can be reached within minutes from Piazale Roma, which is where the coaches arrive and is across the river from the railway station. The vaporetto's tend to be less crowded as this is the start of the Grand Canal, and this makes getting a good seat easier.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maria13
Reviews.Content: We went to visit Venice in February this year for the Carnival. After a long but interesting train trip from Vienna, we arrived at the Hotel located opposite Santa Lucia Train Station, which was great because we did not have to carry our luggage far. Getting to the Hotel, I was very impressed by the friendliness and professionalism of the staff. These people would do anything to make sure that your stay is perfect. We had the room with a view to the Grand Canal and that was truly magical especially in the evenings! It goes without saying that the room was impeccably clean and that it lived up to the reviews that I read before making the booking. Also, the Staff recommended a very good restaurant close by. This is a truly wonderful Hotel and I look forward to returning at Antiche Figure for the next Carnival!

Reviews.Title: “The Worlds Best!!”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Wall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first leg of our 3 month world tour honeymoon at this hotel and despite staying in some of the finest hotels in the world, I still can't find one that matches Hotel Antiche Figure.The staff are wonderful and went out of their way to make us feel right at home and even though we didn't tell them we were on our honeymoon I was beginning to wonder if somebody tipped them off as we have never been made feel more special in any other hotel. The view from our room was splendid and the location is second to none. The only reason I would hesitate in giving this hotel a five star rating is that I'd be afraid that the next time we go there we won't be able to get a room due to overwheming demand from people trying to stay there. Simply the best and we will be back as regular customers!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Westercraigs
Reviews.Content: Returned on 16 March having spent 4 nights. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is very well managed. It is spotless, immaculate bed linen and good quality bath towels etc. We were on the top floor looking across to Ferovia station and up to the bridge, the views from our windows were wonderful. The bedroom temperature was just right and the rooms were very quiet considering our location. The dining rooms are a little on the small side for me, I tend not to like seeing anyone in the morning so we sat at the front beside the reception area and that was just perfect. Very lovely lady in dining area who seemed to be in charge, nothing was a bother. We are pretty fussy about our food, they recommended a place quite close by for our first meal and it was just perfect, It was called the White Well or something like that, at least it had a well in front of it. You could not be dissapointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its high ranking!”
Reviews.Author: kauailoverfromdayone
Reviews.Content: GREAT things about this hotel: (1) Recently renovated - beautiful rooms, lobby, breakfast area. Rooms are small, but that is expected in Venice. Fabric covered walls, beautiful furniture, modern double-glass windows that seal tightly, beautiful marble bathroom. Elevator. (2) Great location near P. Roma and the train station - very convenient for arriving/departing. Any other area in the city and you will be schlepping your luggage on and off a vaporetto (crowded boat bus) or using an expensive private water taxi. 20 min walk to Rialto Bridge, 30 min to Piazza San Marco. Walking in Venice is wonderful. Surprisingly difficult to get lost, due to limited number of through routes and excellent directions painted on buildings. (3) Small, only 22 rooms. Very quiet inside in spite of bustling location. (4) Wonderful staff! When we arrived, the desk attendant took a long time with us discussing sites of interest, which vaporetto lines to use, recommended tours, trips to nearby islands, etc. He was very pleasant and helpful. Can't give him due credit because unfortunately we didn't catch his name. Afternoon/evening desk attendant, Francesca, was wonderful. Very helpful answering questions, booking tours and gondola, giving advice about restaurants. Always a warm smile and greeting. We had a very pleasant, long conversation with her one evening about the city and hotel. The woman staffer in the breakfast room was also very polite, cheerful, and helpful. Very welcoming. It was clear that the staff take great pride in the quality of service at the hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 day stay in Venice, and the Hotel Antiche Figure made it better in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: REALLYMR&MRSSMITH
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to find when dropped off by coach transfer to Piazzale Roma. Welcomed by friendly staff. Decided not to pay extra for room with a view, no regrets though, room very quiet, decor lovely, comfy bed, room spotless, just as in the pictures on web. Highly recommended, wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee76
Reviews.Content: This really is a fantastic hotel just what I was looking when arranging a romantic getaway to venice. I planned to propose to my girlfriend whilst we were away and I wanted everything to be just right, this included getting a great hotel. I couldn't have made a better choice than the Antiche Figure. I had booked through expedia a room facing the Grand Canal and emailed the hotel before my trip to see if I could get one of the rooms with the little balcony, I promptly got a reply from Alessandro who said they were both unfortunately booked. However upon our arrival we were greeted by Alessandro who remembered my earlier request and I was extremely pleased when he told us that one of these rooms with the balcony was now available( room 212). The room was immaculate in everyway with it's marble bathroom and great view of the grand canal it was just perfect. The hotels location is also great just 5mins walk from the bus station, and within easy access of the Vaparetto's. I would recommend buying a Venice card upon your arrival as it allows you to jump on and off the vaparettos as many times as you like, they are good value for money. Overall I can't recommend this hotel enough. Thanks to all the staff at the Antiche for making our stay one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best!”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - better than the two four stars I've stayed at previously. Excellent position, friendly staff, room comfortable and very clean. Lived up to the previous reviews and I will return at some point. Staff recommended an excellent restaurant - Osteria Il Veccio Pozzo - superb food and service.

Reviews.Title: “great-even for fussy travellers”
Reviews.Author: rob1908
Reviews.Content: Well I think all the other reviews say it all. I have to say with such good reviews you get suspicious that the hotel is commissioning people to write reviews-but it does actually live up to its reputation! The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Piazza Roma (bus station) and there are convenient buses from the airport. It was a relief that we only had to wheel the suitcases a short distance -with only two small bridges (&steps!). We had a room overlooking the canal which was magical -particularly opening the windows in the morning and seeing the buzz on the canal below. The room was beautifully decorated and of a good size. Minor gripe that the bathroom smelt a bit fusty but not because it wasn't clean as everything was spotless but more to do with the perils of shower curtains. The bed was really comfortable and this is coming from somebody who is obsessed with having proper cotton sheets and good pillows! The breakfast in the morning was great and well worth the 5euros (it costs that much for a coffee alone in some places!). It was approx 15 minute walk to St Marks Square but the walk was great-and it was nice to be away from the hectic atmosphere of the Square. Reception were really helpful with directions and recommended some great places to eat. For a special night we would definitely recommend " La Columbina"-fantastic food (best steak ever!) and enthusiastic service. What more can I say-we will definitely be back! See you soon Antiche Figure!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply the most charming romatic luxurious places in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PeterPan&Wendy
Reviews.Content: My now fiancee and I stayed there for 6 nights. We had a memorable time. Everything was quite perfect. As you spot the property up a cobbled street it looks warm and inviting and even better than any of the photos on their website. The reception staff, were all very welcoming and charming - any request was met with a smile and prompt response. We stayed in a luxurious room, generously sized with a great marble tiled bathroom and very opulent. The view from our room was of a wall but did not hinder our stay as this is common of most accomodations in Venice. The breakfast (included) was as fine as you'll find in a European hotel, although advertised as an American breakfast? This has to be one of the best hotels in Venice. We'll definitely go back. The staff were so nice, they'll do everything to satisfy.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Figure”
Reviews.Author: blundin
Reviews.Content: I happily recommend this hotel to you if you are planning a stay in Venice (at the same time envious that it is not my fortune to be returning). While not initially booking a canal side room, we did choose to upgrade when given the option on arrival. I am very glad that we did as it was a personal pleasure to awaken early to the sound of the city coming to life on the water, and to watch deliveries and commuters to and fro. We stayed for four nights at the end of February/ beginning of March. Our room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean, and prettily furnished. All of the staff members we encountered were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was ample for our needs with a good selection of pastries, cheese, meat, eggs, fruit, cereal, juice, coffee etc. etc. The hotel is well located for arrival in Venice by train (to Santa Lucia) or by bus to the Piazzale Roma and it isnâ€™t too much of a struggle with luggage from either. We also liked that that it was far enough away from St. Markâ€™s to allow us respite from the tourist throng (to which we contributed betimes), and to see a little of the more â€˜realâ€™ Venice, while the Basilica and the Palazzo Ducale were still perfectly accessible by waterbus, or indeed on foot, or by both means for a double perspective. Ciao! PS We booked directly via the hotelâ€™s own nicely-designed Website which we found cheaper than other Web accommodation booking services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Cassiu5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure at the end of February / beginning of March. The hotel is located opposite the train station, and about 5 minutes walk from the bus station. However, if you arrive by airport shuttle late at night be prepared to get lost between the bus station and the hotel. The hotel rooms are very clean and spacious, the beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms sparkling and well equipped with both bath and shower (but make sure you learn your 'C's and 'F's if you don't want a shock). The bedroom is equipped with an in room safe, basic TV stations (CNN and BBC World for English speakers) and chandalier lighting. You can pay extra for a view of the Grande Canal, however, my view of the building opposite let me know whether it was raining or not in the morning, which was important. While the hotel is 20 minutes or so from St Marks Square this does mean you have ample opportunity to explore the side alleys on the way and discover those quiet hidden 'village squares' with kids playing and locals chatting in cafes. Getting lost is a real treat in Venice, even at night. Also, being on the Grande Canal opposite the Ferrovia boat stop means there are no fewer than nine different boat routes that will take you back to the hotel (in fact every boat on the Grande Hotel stops opposite the hotel). This means you can enjoy the boat trip from St Marks Square to the hotel late at night, when Venice seems so much more peaceful. You wouldn't do this if you stayed in an expensive hotel near St Marks. You can also catch a boat direct to Murano from opposite the hotel. The hotel staff are very helpful, and can book almost any ticket for evening concerts (at no extra charge) as well as recommend excellent restaurants (usually those recommended by other visitors). The breakfast may be extra, depending on who you book with, but the buffet of rolls, orange juice, ham, cheese, yoghurts, croissants and various pastries provide an excellent start to the day (plus tea in a pot!). The foyer also has a laptop with internet access free of charge to residents. I would defintely stay here again on my next trip to Venice Finally, don't worry, the lift floor always makes that noise when you get in.

Reviews.Title: “Bella!”
Reviews.Author: Giddie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure is a little gem in a fantastically convenient location. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay here! The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and beautifully maintained. I have stayed in numerous hotels across Europe and further afield and would say that Antiche Figure is one of my very favourites. As it is a relatively small hotel, this guarantees you the best in personal service and attention to detail. The hotel's three star rating really does not do justice to the quality of the accomodation and finishing touches. As previous reviewers have pointed out, the hotel is not in the centre of San Marco, but we saw this as a big advantage. It was far enough away to prevent us from being overcome by tourists and ripped off, but perfectly located for the bus station at Piazzale Roma, the water bus at Ferrovia and local shops and restaurants. Alessandro and his staff did everything they could to ensure that we were well looked after and comfortable. The Hotel Antiche Figure has really proved to us that 'size doesn't matter!'

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel as expected from other Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Hilz57
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 day visit to Venice staying at the Antiche Figure, booking the hotel based on the reviews on Trip Adviser. We were not disappointed. Our room was small, but clean, tasteful & comfortable. It would have been nice to have a room overlooking the canal, but it is quite noisy with river boats running early to late at night, but that is probably the charm of Venice. The hotel is at the top of the Grand Canal near the bus station at Piazzale Roma, very convenient when arriving by bus from the airport. The staff were really friendly & helpful & we would definately stay there again. If anyone could recommend reasonably priced cafes & restaurants with good food in Venice - much appreciated as they are thin on the ground.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: norgroves
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through last minute.co. and then got in touch directly with the management who arranged an upgrade to our lovely canal view room on the 4th floor at a v good price. One of the best things about the hotel was its location- walking distance across 2 bridges approx 5 mins away from piazza roma. We got bus no 5 frm the airport to piazza roma for only 3 Eur. Did not have to drag suitcases across boats etc and through the small alleys. The 30min walk through santa croce and san polo to san marco was v atmospheric. Cannerigio and Murano were great too. We used the vaporetto to go to Murano- no 42 from opposite the hotel and no. 41 back from Murano which circumvented around Venice. The hotel staff were v helpful and gave us a map with excellent directions. The room was clean- definitely should have 4 star status. Alessandro was really friendly and check in and check out was carried out professionally. \\i

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ramchalice
Reviews.Content: Overall I agree with the tone of the majority of previous reviews. The hotel is well located (as long as you don't prefer the madness of St. Mark's) and very clean. Breakfast was quite good. Two minor problems (maid forgot bath towels one day and a tub stopper wouldn't release) were responded to and rectified quickly. This is a good, solid hotel which should satisfy most travelers.

Reviews.Title: “My "Home" in Venice”
Reviews.Author: REDGER
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay in Venice ! 1st year in 2005 a l weekend - at another hotel very near - as rates seemed too high, we booked for my 50th birthday, a 1 week stay at what seemed most convenient, pricewise and quality wise. We were really enthusiastic with all the services provided by the hotel - Friendly help, nice and very clean rooms, very nice furniture, great bathroom, luxury I may say, and a stunning view over the GRAND CANAL- Although packed with tourists runing around at this time of the year, the hotel offers calm and peaceful nights. Breakfast is really good, lots of choices, even for the late-rising tired tourist we were (far after 10am, and no one complains, just serve you a smile and friendly words, with a good breakfast !) Access to the Web is freely provided, and so on, So, we decided once more to spend another well earned vacation week in this hotel this february 2007 - This time, we booked directly by phone two days before the Carnival started. I was most anxious, as I knew everything was full, but they managed to get us a room, great as usual. Always friendly, and helpfull is the gentlmeman at the desk - Now back to work, in La Turbie, near Monte Carlo, for another year, I'm just longing to go back to Venice and in this hotel which I strongly recommend ! Daniele Cheret/M. Canovas La Turbie France

Reviews.Title: “Fine times at the Antiche Figure Venice”
Reviews.Author: Andty
Reviews.Content: Spent a romantic Valentines week in Venice, and the Hotel Antiche Figure was one of the high points. We were greeted by extremely friendly and helpful staff who were able to point us in the right direction for our first trip to Venice. The hotel itself is immaculately decorated, and kept in an extemely clean condition. We chose to upgrade to a larger room with a Grand Canal view, at it was difinitely worth it! All in all, one of the best hotels I've encountered on my travels, and we have already decided we will be staying there again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: grotbags
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 4 nights,we had a twin room on the 4th floor.The room was clean and well decorated and furnished to a high standard.Like the previous reviewer I have stayed in hotels all over the world and I am extremely fussy but I have no complaints about this hotel.The location is fine, I was aware it was not near St Marks Square,I did my research before I booked.The walk to the tourist sights was pleasant ,and what I expected for Venice. The staff were efficient and helpful. Breakfast was not included in my deal,but for an extra 5 euros was good value. We had a great time and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: BarDil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Antiche Figure from 7th to 11th Feb. First impressions were that it was just adequate. It was easy to get to from piazza roma where bus depot is. Right across grand canal from large unsightly train station which is not what you want to see when you look out of your bedroom window in Venice. My room was â‚¬239(â‚¬60 extra for canal view) a night plus basic breakfast. The hotel will probably dissagree but in my opinion it was basic. Now I have been in a lot of cities around europe and most hotels I have stayed in are of a much better quality for a more reasonable price. The noise levels throughout the night were overbearing, banging doors, drunken people on street, bin men empting bins etc.We asked for a restaurant recommendation and were sent down alleyways with open sewers(because of road works) and came to this dark empty restaurant beside roadworks. It was about as inviting as a morgue. We were disgusted with the restaurant recommendation by the hotel. Now this hotel is not I repeat not near St.Marks Square. Between walking to, waiting, travelling on water bus it takes about 45 mins. The hotels around St Marks Sq are a lot better value for money. They are near all the good restaurants, shops, attractions. Now I am not too particular but the restaurants around Hotel Antiche Figure are awful. Dirty, cheap furnishings, all obscure menus, ignorant staff. If you want to have a good a time as possible in Venice, stay near St.Marks Square not at Antiche Figure. Also when we were leaving we were asked was everything okay during our stay, we mentioned the noise and were told if we said something we could have swapped to another room.First of all hotel was fully booked(according to night porter) so how could we have, secondly why was a room with such bad soundproofing being rented by hotel, it should be worked on. Overall I felt it was terrible value for money and most certainly does not deserve its place as second best hotel in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvSanAnto
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (now fiancee) and I took our first trip together and stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure Mar 06. The location is just perfect for travelers leaving Venice by train, as it is just across the canal. There are numerous, excellent, and reasonably priced restaurants and "bars" very near. We were lucky enough to upgrade to a room with a view of the Canal for a low price. There is a traghetto stop just across the canal! We stayed for two nights...I wish we had more time. I loved the experience!! It's very easy to find and very convenent to where the bus leaves you from the airport. Every member of the staff were so nice and eager to make your experience in Venice a pleasant one. I can't wait to return! Although early Mar was still chilly, that is the best time for travel...no flooding, and not so many tourists!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Venetian place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Haymusos
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this fantastic little hotel enough. This was our second stay here, our first in the summer last year and most recently at the beginning of February with our parents. Both experiences were of the highest standard - where do I start? The hotel was so simple to find and incredibly convenient. It's directly opposite the train station (a very nice train station - not unsightly at all!) and just 5 minutes walk and a couple of small bridges away from the Piazzale Roma (the main bus station, connecting you to the mainland and airport). Right from the moment we arrived (we were early both times) we were greeted by Gianni who was very friendly and couldn't help us enough. We were shown immediately to our rooms. We paid extra for the canal view which I believe was definitely worth it. Room 412 on the top floor was particularly lovely. The rooms are clean and beautifully furnished in typical Venetian decor. Comfy beds, gorgeous bathroom, mini-bar, tv, hairdryer etc. Cleaned every day including little chocolates left on our pillows. Only TINY gripe was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Having said that, you're in Venice where there are more cafes than you could shake a stick at. There's only so much caffeine one can drink! I presume that the rooms over looking the very tiny side streets are just as beautiful - it depends whether or not a room with a view is important to you. If you didn't have a great view, no matter as there's a lovely little terrace downstairs from which to sip a coffee or a glass of prosecco and watch the world go by. Breakfast was a basic continental spread (cereals, yoghurt, juice, pastries, cheese, ham, eggs, bread rolls and tea/coffee) but there was plenty of it and it was fine for setting you up for a big day of sightseeing. We were recommended a fantastic restaurant around the corner (Osteria Veccio Pozzo) which apart from the incredible fish does the BEST steak ever (surprising for a small island!). Gianni also booked for us to see a wonderful concert in a palazzo 'La Traviata - Verdi' where we moved to a different room for each of the 3 acts. Alessandro (the manager) and Elena were both really helpful and couldn't do enough to make our stay more welcome. The rest of the staff were the same (sorry, don't know names!) This really was what made this place so special. We've stayed in some amazing hotels in our time and most would need to take lessons from Alessandro and the rest of the staff! We felt welcomed and comfortable and as if nothing was too much trouble. Our parents LOVED Venice and it was made that bit more special by having such a fabulous hotel from which to be based. We never return to the same hotel as we love to visit new places but we have made an exception in this case. We're very much looking forward to staying in the new suites (which are part of the hotel) and are currently under construction - ready in April 2007 I think. Thank you Hotel Antiche Figure, can't wait til next time!

Reviews.Title: “Going to Venice? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannella
Reviews.Content: Summary: Fantastic value, very highly recommended. My sister and I accompanied my mother on her first trip to Venice, to celebrate her 80th birthday. Mum is fit but has two artificial hips and finds steps difficult. From every point of view the Antiche Figure was the perfect choice of hotel for her and us. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Piazzale Roma where the airport buses terminate, and even less from the railway station. It is very easy to find, as it looks over the canal opposite the station. It is almost at one end of the Grand Canal, so you can hop on a vaporetto and travel the length of the canal in one journey. At the same time it is not so far on foot to Rialto, with its shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is run to the highest standards. It is clean, comfortable, tastefully and appropriately decorated. We had a triple room, and whilst not large, it was adequate. The bathroom was beautiful (though I would agree with a previous reviewer that a shower screen would be an improvement). The linen was spotless, snowy and luxurious and was changed daily. The staff were all helpful and friendly and ready to help with restaurant suggestions, and other enquiries. The breakfast was varied and plentiful. The amenities it offers may warrant a 3 star grading, but their quality is well in excess of that. At the price we paid, it was amazing value. It is hard to fault the hotel. As an Englishwoman, my mother would have liked to find tea-making equipment in the room on arrival - but when in Venice....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure has the warmest welcome in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Settles
Reviews.Content: We returned to Venice to stay at the delightful little Hotel Antiche Figure. We had our usual wonderful experience. The room was perfect. The staff is exceptional. There was nothing they would not do to make our stay perfect. They are very knowledgeable, extremely helpful and they always give everyone a very warm welcome. The location of this little gem is extremely handy to shopping, great restaurants and the various Palazzos anyone would want to visit while in Venice. There is even a Gondola stand just in front of the hotel. We travel extensively all year everywhere. This is definitely one of my favorite Boutique Hotels anywhere. They are almost always full, so one needs to book as early as possible. As we were checking out some guests were arriving early in the morning, long before check-in: we heard them say to the front desk " I am sorry we are so early" and the reply was "you are always welcome". This perfectly describes this elegant little hotelâ€™s attitude towards all their guests. We will always stay there when we can.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SusanRicketts
Reviews.Content: Neither of us ever having visited Venice before, I was anxious that my husband's birthday treat should be memorable for all the right reasons! We are both regular users of all the best hotels in the world and although this time we were on a budget, we were highly impressed by the standards that the Antiche Figure offered. Don't be put off that it is only a 3 star listing! The room was spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. We paid the extra for a deluxe canal view room, which are bigger, but on the whole this was an unnecessary extravagance. (In fact, I would imagine that in the high season, it would be a disadvantage, as you are right on the street and the edge of the Grand Canal) I am fanatical about the bed, linen and bathrooms in hotels, but this was all once again well above 3star expectations. The bed was most comfortable and the linen was of superb quality and changed each day. My only reservation about the bathroom, that the shower was screened by a shower curtain (which always have an unpleasant aroma associated with them!) - Why not have a glass screen, this would have been much more fitting with the marble and the "murano" chandeliers! The hotel was only a 5 minute walk from the bus terminal in Piazzale Roma and surprisingly easy to find. The staff and management were extremely polite and helpful. I would definitely recommend the Antiche Figure to anybocy. Susan Ricketts

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: travelworlduk
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say the service offered was great, staff were very helpful, as a honeymoon couple or anyone visiting Venice I would recommend this hotel. The Location was great. The hotel is located at the top of the Grand Canal directly opposite the railway station and few mins walk to the waterbus and 5 min walk from the bus station. Really good restaurants near by, the hotel staff will point you in the right direction. I will def be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysawaay
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in January 2006. We booked on Expedia and were offered an upgrade to a canal view room for a very reasonable 30 Euros a night (half of what Expedia charge) including breakfast which was great. The hotel is located in a perfect place at the top of the Grand Canal directly opposite the railway station. If you are arriving by train (or bus) it's a 3 min walk. Bear in mind that unless you want to use the rather expensive water taxis it is very handy to be able to walk to the hotel on arrival/departure without having to lug your cases up and down too many bridges. For getting around Venice we found the water busses excellent. 12 euro buys a 24 hour pass so you can hop on and off as you like. The hotel itself was very clean, the reception staff spoke good English and they were very happy to help with any questions. The room was recently decorated and of a good size with modern double glazing. Very nice. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absoluely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SusieAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a 2 nights stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure (1-19 & 1-20) and all I can say is WOW. From the time we checked into the hotel to the time we left everything was wonderful. The rooms are very clean and beautiful decorated. I would recommend this hotel to any one. It is in a great location and easy to find and if you have ever been to Venice you know what I mean about being able to find you hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Dolce1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in late November. The location is very convenient to the train station as well as Piazzale Roma (if arriving/departing by car or bus). We stayed in a superior room on the top floor with a great view of the Grand Canal. The room was nicely decorated and very clean. The bed was very comfortable. The windows were well soundproofed (very quiet during the night). The bathroom was very clean and well equipped. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They made reservations for us for the â€œSecret Itinerariesâ€� tour at the Dogeâ€™s Palace (very well worthwhile). Breakfast was fine and included cereal, yogurt, fruit, cold meats, cheese, pastries, and more. Hotel Antiche Figure is a great value for Venice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, quality, quality”
Reviews.Author: Pressure_Drop
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with all the other reviews. Quality hotel in excellent location. Staff superb and with great sense of humour - see Allesandro's reply to the 'wall' review! However directions to nearby restaurant left lot to be desired, got totally lost and ended up eating at 'Oche' pizza house - which as it turned out was perfect anyway! The room was superb with a huge bed - could have done with coffee/tea making facilities in room and our room (111) being directly above the bar/reception meant a little noise and smokey smell, which was odd because the hotel was non smoking I believe? The only other slight grumble was the noise of the water going down the internal pipes from the other rooms which seemed to be located in the wardrobe space - this actually was quite loud and woke us up on the first morning but you soon got used to it. All in all though we had a really great time at a really great hotel, would highly recommend it. Would also recommend Ignazia restaurant (the one the hotel recommends) for great traditional service, La Patatina for reasonably priced pasta, the Jazz bar for a late drink and San Lucia snack bar over the Scalza bridge for a decent priced drink (Guinness 5 euros, Peroni 3 euros) and a warm welcome, also small Italian snack bar directly in front of you as you go over the Scalzi for coffee and marmalade brioches for breakfast but not Harry's Bar, I know every one says you just have to have a Bellini, but it's a total rip off and as cocktail bars go it's pretty basic and grossly overrated - 32 euros for 2 Bellini's - they're having a laugh. Don't be afraid to barter for a gondola ride, knocked it down to 70 euros but I'm sure they just do a shortened version if you do succeed in knocking them down, but it's a fair trade off. Venice is one big open museum, but don't go looking for much of a nightlife, after 12 the city virtually shuts and bars are as rare as a poor gondolier...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFHBerks
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the other reviews about the location of this hotel. Less than 5 minutes walk from both the railway and bus stations and waterbuses just across the bridge. I spent the weekend there with my 13 year old son and we had a first floor room overlooking the canal. The views were terrific and being just above street level gave us a great feel of being in the thick of it. However the Water buses run through the night so if you need complete silence to sleep perhaps a room higher up or not over looking the canal would be better. But you can't have your cake and eat it and for our part the hustle and bustle was part of the overall great experience. The room was clean tidy and well equipped for a 3* Hotel - my son thought the chocolate each night on the pillow was really cool. As has been said many times the staff were friendly and helpful, even to the extent of phoning the transport department to find out what the orange travel card could be used for. We both thought the breakfast was just right, typical continental and plenty of it. The waitress was diligent in making sure everything was topped up and I thought the orange juice was fine (so full marks to the hotel for taking note of previous reviews). I would wholeheartedly recommend the hotel and should I be lucky enough to visit Venice again I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Stuart (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews! They are right on the money!”
Reviews.Author: Jorge&Jeanette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure for our 3 days in December during our Italian Honeymoon and made the decision to book it based on the great reviews here on Tripadvisor, boy we were glad we did!
