The hotel is a solid 3 star with 4 star service.The hotel is located literally right in front of the train station so if your coming by train it's perfect. It's location is great as you will avoid alot of the tourist crowds, and the vaporetto stops are right there as well. The hotel was very clean and the staff was exceptional especially Alessandro, who was a tremendous help during our stay and gave us the inside info on how best to get around and what to see and what to avoid. The breakfast was quaint but good and the juices were fresh and delicious.Our room overlooked the canal and it was worth it to us. We highly recommend this hotel to all who are considering it. We will defintiely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A good three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mijit
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel, with very pleasant and helpful staff. Not a lot I can really add to everything many others have written here, except perhaps to emphasize that if you want to be able to see the Grand Canal from your room you will need to be sure that you get (and pay the extra for) a room overlooking the canal. The other rooms (at least the one we were in) are facing a wall just a few feet away (see photo) - this means no view, and a pretty dark room. This is a three star hotel, and you have to remember that. Don't expect a luxury hotel. But for a three star hotel it does try very hard, and the rooms are nicely done. Check before you book whether the air conditioning will be switched on when you go if that's important to you. It may not be, and if you have to leave the windows open for ventilation you are likely to get bitten by mosquitos. Breakfasts are simple but perfectly adequate (and reasonable for the small charge made). Real fruit juices are not expensive these days, though, and the 'juice' provided was not very pleasant. The location, as others have said, is excellent. Plenty to see and do in the area, without being overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: jwgatorgirl
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on this website and the reviews were all very good. We stayed here for one night at the beginning of our honeymoon. I was a little nervous about trying to find a hotel in Venice with our luggage after a long flight. It was so easy to find, we went straight there from the airport shuttle drop off. When we first got to the hotel, the reception was very nice and helpful. Our room was probably one of the nicest I have stayed at in Europe. The furnishings were very nice. The bathroom was nice, with a very large tub and a window that opened. This hotel is a good walking distance from St. Marks, but the walk was one of our favorite parts. There were lots of cute shops, markets and restaurants on the way to all the major sights. I would stay here again if returning to Venice. Don't waste your time looking at other hotels. This hotel has it all; great location, service and price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AggieKJM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a trip to Italy with a one night stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure. We loved this hotel and have nothing but wonderful things to say. Great location, great staff, clean, comfortable and just a nice place to come back to at the end of the day! It was a great plus to come out of the train station and see our hotel across the Grand Canal. After traveling all over by train it was so nice just to walk to the hotel in 5 minutes! Especially helpful in Venice. Also, the water buses are very easy to get around the city and pick up right outside the hotel across by the station. We had a great view with a small balcony in our room. We overlooked the Grand Canal and the Gondola boats outside...perfect and romantic! The city is so neat, especially at night. Our only wish was that we had longer in Venice, but we will definitely be back and when we do we'll be booking at the Hotel Antiche Figure. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a nice stay in Venice. It's a good value compared to so many others that we looked at and you get great, personal service too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, easy to find and friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: djdawnie
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in Venice, 3* prices, 4* interior and service. Staff are friendly, Francesca on Reception particularly helpful during our stay. Rooms are tasteful, clean and furnished to high standard, top floor (4th) have great beamed ceilings, heating and a/c with double glazed windows if you dont like the sound of church bells! Great location, just across from the train and bus station, 5 mins walk and very easy to find (which is a great start to your city break). Nice little bar in the hotel for coffee or a nightcap and a great breakfast set us up for the day. All sights are within 20 - 30 mins walking distance over the canals if you want an alternative to the vaporettos. Lots of local restaurants without tourist prices close to hand, great for exploring. Can't recommend this hotel enough. Dawn & Linda, Scotland 3rd Jan 2007

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, rooms are excellent very clean , comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ThePoint
Reviews.Content: Great little Hotel! Very convenient, rooms are very comfortable, clean, well appointed. The hotel was recently renovated. The hotel staff went out of their way to assist with directions and restaurant suggestions. We were at the Figure three nights and I wished we could have spent a week.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nacneil
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending three nights in the hotel. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a canal view room at a very reasonable price which we took. The hotel is very convenient to reach from the bus terminal which is useful if you are arriving in the evening as we were. The rooms were very well proportioned and comfortable. Breakfasts were adequate and the dining room was of a reasonable size. The staff were very helpful; we were given a map and advised on where to go to eat. each of the staff on duty was very helpful and spoke perfect English. I would have no hesitation in staying there again and would thoroughly recommend the hotel for anyone visiting venice. I can see why it has such a high rating on trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “It Lives Up to the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: KSchmidt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Antiche Figure lived up to all the excellent reviews I read here. I had friends who stayed here in Feb. 2006 who also raved, so I felt confident in my choice. The staff is superb (that means you Francesca and Alessandro!) and the facilty clean, charming and top-notch. Our room and bathroom were plush, stately and refined (a wonderful king size bed). This 3-star hotel makes some 4-stars look shabby. We had a 4th floor room with large windows overlooking the rooftops of Venice- beautiful, and seemed quieter than the front Grand Canal rooms. The breakfast served was great as well. I wish I was sitting at a cafe table outside the front of the hotel, sipping a latte and watching the city wake up on the Grand Canal right now! I was concerned that the location might be too far away from "the action", but trust me, it's perfect. When arriving (and leaving) Venice via train or bus or taxi, walking to the hotel with your luggager is a breeze. And the 20 minute walk from the hotel to the sights closer to St Mark's, Rialto or Accademia bridges is nothing short of fabulous. You'll be glad to have a hotel away from the crowds and mayhem. I know Rick Steves writes that staying by the train station isn't so great but I disagree. My partner and I discovered charming, uncrowded areas as we walked to and from the hotel: Campo San Giacomo dell' Orio, Campo Santa Margherita and Campo San Barnaba. Walking across the Scalza Bridge into the Cannaregio "Ghetto" district in the evenings was magical: great restuarants, shops, bakeries and gelato stands.

Reviews.Title: “Highy recommended”
Reviews.Author: bennyd
Reviews.Content: Pretty much perfect in every way - friendly, helpful staff, spotlessly clean room, elegant decor, good breakfast, good location. Can't say much more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and service”
Reviews.Author: brucej
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent, and the staff very friendly and helpful, speaking perfect English. They also arranged a doctor to visit the hotel to see our young daugther, and then also interpreted. My only observation is that you probably don't need to book a canal room as there's not a huge amount to see out of the windows. You'll enjoy the stay

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AnnSea
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of other reviews here, and because of the care that had obviously been taken over the hotel's own website. So often they promise more than they deliver but that's certainly not the case with the Antiche Figure. It is a beautiful hotel in a lovingly restored historic building. The hotel is in a very good location, on the Grand Canal, right opposite the Railway Station and Vaparetto stop and just a short walk from the Airport Bus Terminal in Piazzale Roma, although if you're not fit, you should be aware that there are two small bridges to cross, which is tricky with heavy luggage. When we arrived we were given a very warm welcome by Gianni and he explained about the hotel and gave us maps with the phone number of the hotel in case we got hopelessly lost during our stay and needed rescuing. My friend and I both had double rooms for single use, at an excellent 'Winter Special' rate of 72 euros a night, including breakfast. We chose superior rooms as we didn't want to pay more for canal view deluxe rooms but we were very pleased with what we got. They were beautifully furnished, spotlessly clean and the large beds were comfortable. There was plenty of wardrobe space, an electronic safe big enough to accommodate my laptop, a suitcase rack and a minibar/fridge. The TV had CNN and BBC World in English. The marble bathrooms were lovely with full baths and efficient showers. Breakfast was the usual continental buffet and was served in two pretty rooms at the back of the hotel. Each morning we were warmly greeted by a lovely smiling lady who made sure there was ample food for everyone. The bar is adjacent to the front desk and there are also tables and chairs outside where you can sit and watch the world go by on the Grand Canal. It's also handy for smokers since Italy implemented a smoking ban. There is a free Internet terminal in the lobby for guests' use and free broadband Internet is also available in the rooms if you have your own laptop. The hotel is totally delightful but what makes it so special is the staff - Alessandro (the Manager), Francesca and Gianni on the front desk, the lovely men who served us in the bar in the evenings and the friendly lady who cleaned our rooms. Nothing was too much trouble and they offered extra touches that make you feel like a truly valued guest. For instance, I didn't have the correct cable for my laptop so Alessandro lent me one for the duration of my stay; when it was raining, we were offered hotel umbrellas without asking; it was pouring when we left but Alessandro came out with us, right to the water taxi and helped us on board with our luggage. I have been to Venice before, and stayed in a hotel with more stars, but for future trips, I will always choose the Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: RobDam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Antiche Figure for 3 nights at the beginning of December. It was our first time in Venice and we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. We chose the hotel based on the recommendations of this site and we were very happy with our selection. The staff are very helpful in all respects and went out of their way to ensure that we enjoyed our stay They made good recommendations for dinner and gave helpful travel and sightseeing advice. We had Room 211 which was a large room with a small balcony and a lovely view over the Grand Canal. It had a really nice bathroom, with marble floors, his and hers basins and even a bidet. It was also useful having a minibar fridge in the room to store small food items. Our room had a safe for any valuables. The location of the hotel is superb if you are travelling into Venice by bus. It is literally a 5 minute walk from the main bus terminal at Piazalle Roma. With its location directly opposite the Rail terminal (Ferrovia), it is easy to find after your days sightseeing. The vaporetto (water bus) is less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel and will take you to Rialto and St Marco in less than 20 and 40 minutes respectively. Its really easy to walk around Venice as it is very flat, so we appreciated Francesca's advice to only buy a vaporetto ticket for one day for 12 Euros. I thought that the breakfast was great, with cereals, fruits, cold meats, yoghurts, hard boiled eggs, biscuits and plenty more! The lady serving breakfast is very sweet (sorry I don't know her name) and helpful. It was good having access to the internet in the lobby. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again when I return to Venice. For those of you who are still thinking about whether to stay here, don't waste any more time looking elsewhere -just book here - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Canal with a view”
Reviews.Author: josh_and_robin
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with character and friendly staff. The location is convenient and centralized. It sits right on the bank of the Grand Canal across from the train station. The walk to the hotel from the train station is about 150 yards over a bride of stairs (that lack a ramp or handicap access). Neither my wife nor I are handicapped, but I sure felt immobile after dragging 5 luggage bags up and over the stairs. In Venice, you apparently have to have a license to transport luggage or goods over a certain distance. Our options were to take the water Taxi across the 10 yards (I could literately throw a rock at the hotel) of water to the other side for 35 Euros or drag the luggage over the bridge. As you can tell I am still happy about it. The hotel has a small bar and breakfast area on the first floor with a public computer. Our room was on the second floor over looking the Canal. The view is great, but I would recommend a room at the back of the hotel because of the noise from the boats. The room was clean and adequate. It had a tub/shower and large sink. The lighting is poor for women, but it was clean and covered is nice grey marble. The bed was firm, but comfortable. The hotel has free DSL internet and local TV. If you like to watch movies bring your laptop because CNN World news was the only station in English. Overall I would recommend the hotel. Be clear about non-smoking requirements though. FYI: Take a taxi to Murano and donâ€™t get strong armed into buying from a factory on the spot. Shop around for glass that you like. Once you look in enough stores and factories you will realize that there is a lot of the same stuff for varying prices. If you buy anything over 400 Euros make sure itâ€™s real Murano glass certified by Vetro Artistico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: scjones8
Reviews.Content: It was nice getting off the train and being right at your hotel. We were greeted by Johnny who was extremely helpful in setting up our Venice Itinerary. This part of Venice was pretty quiet, but a little far from things, but the "express vapporetto" made everything very convienient. I will definitely stay here again. The room was big enough and the bathroom was very spacious. Breakfast was not the best we had, but it wasn't horrible either. Thanks Johnny, see you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the position and the staff”
Reviews.Author: Huddos
Reviews.Content: The Huddos. Paynesville. Victoria. Australia We have returned to Australia after 6 weeks travelling overseas, we stayed at some wonderful places but our favorite place was Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice. Our stay was made so memorable by the receptionist who made us so welcome and looked after all our needs, the position right on the Grand Canal and the service. We stayed with two other couples and all agreed that we would recommend this hotel to all our friends back in Australia. The breakfast was fine and the rooms were very clean, one of our group had upgraded to a balcony room looking over the canal and l would recommend that it is well worth paying the extra for the view of all the activity that happens on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: ennisgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently. Absolutely loved it. It is has everyone on the reviews has mentioned wonderful. The staff are friendly and can't be more helpful. we had a small room which by other standards really wasn't that small. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Close to where the Ryan Air bus stops and within walking distance of all the major sites. Again Fab hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good”
Reviews.Author: RÃ³isin
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is beautifully decorated, and a five minute walk away from the train station and bus terminal. Breakfast was not included with our acccomodation, but they have a deal with Hotels.com that offers a buffet breakfast for â‚¬5. This was a great deal, it was self service, which meant unlimited coffee, tea, cereal, juices, crossaints, bread rolls, fruit, ham,cheese, yoghurts etc. It was a really fantastic experience staying here, and the staff were so helpful and friendly. Please take my advice and stay here if you are planning a trip to Venice, you really won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Our dream came true”
Reviews.Author: Popeye&Mozzie
Reviews.Content: We had just left beautiful Tuscony to visit Venice with a group of six. Not knowing the area all that well we were so pleased to find that the Antiiche was only a short walk from car park and bus terminal. Our very freindly driver even carried that ladies bags to the motel where we were met by the most professional and helpful receptionist. She was just so delightful and really couldn't do enough for us. We had free internet access in our rooms with our own laptop. We were made welcome to drink wine that we had bought with us from Tuscony in their bar area. (No extra charge.) The rooms were excellently presented and very comfortable, the breakfast was pleasant and more than adequate. The best thing of all was the location. How central do you want to be. Three cheers to the Antiche and a very big thank you to the young lady on reception. You made our stay in Vencie a very enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel for quick visit”
Reviews.Author: ejs
Reviews.Content: This is a solid but not spectacular hotel. The best thing about this hotel is the location. When people say it is across from the train station next to the green dome, they mean directly across the grand canal from the train station. I forgot my watch and looked out the window at the train station clock for the time. When leaving by train, just walk across the bridge, no hassle worrying about being late for the train. If getting in by bus it is a block or two walk so if your luggage has wheels, no problem. I went to the right instead of straight and to the left where the bus dropped us off and went to the side canal which is pretty big and thought it was the grand canal. Just asked where the train station was and got pointed in the right direction. If staying for a long time, there are better hotels in quieter areas on side canals. There are no real balconies where you can hang out and watch the grand canal and the windows are just a little too high to get a good view. Breakfast is plain, don't think of it as a big meal.. just enough to get you to lunch. The staff is very nice. They will only recommend two restaurants and the one in back which is accessed on the alley is cheaper and I thought it was better than the more expensive one by the first bridge which is a step up in class but harder to find. They were just puttin up their website and it wasn't in English yet but should be ready by now. If you book directly with them they will give you a better deal if you upgrade your room. The room they booked for us was too small and we upgraded to a bigger room with a canal view. If anyone makes a suggestion they try and implement it. Someone wanted internet access so they put a laptop by the front desk you can use free of charge to access your email. There are better hotels, but if you only have a few days, the location and clealiness make this a solid choice. It takes you a day to figure out the vaporeto schedule, but they start the line a block away by the bus stop so walk down there and you always get a good seat, often in the front or back rather than inside. Avoid the #1, take the #86 whenever possible and don't worry, almost every one stops at the train station to get back if you don't want to walk. As you are at the far end of town, it makes you get out and travel. We walked from here to St. Marks but only one way and takes awile. Get off at the Rialto bridge which is the most crowded stop and walk to St. Marks. Safe at night so we went there every day and night and usually got back midnight to 1am and the desk clerk didn't mind. Posting an arrow above streets telling you how to get to major areas is a big plus, I wish they did that in Rome. You never feel you are lost and always felt safe even walking around after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajay88
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 weeks of planning for this anniversary trip and reading 100's of reviews i finally picked this hotel to stay in whilst in Venice. I was looking for 4 or 5 star hotels but none of the reviews were as good as this hotel. The staff were fluent in english and were always willing to help. The room was beautiful and the view of the canal was wonderful. On Arrival at the aiport we took a bus which costs us only 3 euros each this was dirt cheap compared to a water taxi which was 100 euros or a normal taxi which was 70 euros and the bus ride was only 15 minutes away. It stopped at one stop only which was the Santa Lucia station and from there the hotel was only a 5 minute walk. Across the hotel was the waterbus stop where we could access all areas of Venice like the Rialto Bridge, St. Marks Sqaure etc. Would recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone. Ajay Sagar - London UK

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickylove
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice & The Antiche Figure....this is how all small hotels should be. We booked the hotel after reading reviews on this site and all was as others have wrote. The position is excellent opposite the rail station ( we were lucky enough to arrive by Orient Express) and only 25 mins walk from everywhere! The hotel is spotless and clean with polite and informative staff. From when we booked in to when we left nothing was too much trouble for Gianni, Linda and all the staff. Breakfast was good, the usual continental ham cheese eggs etc. Hotel bar as cheap as local bars, which were all charging 5euros a beer etc. Hotel recommended restraunts nearby which were good. Best restraunt was Lineadegra a modern restraunt at the bottom of Venice on the east end of Giudea Canal

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ZakiaKatya
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about finding a good hotel in Venice. I had heard that most of them were expensive and not always worth the cost, so when I saw the reviews on this site I thought that it was worth a try. It's easy to find if you come into Venice on the bus from the airport, which is a bonus when it is late and you are dragging your suitcase behind you! It is also a great spot from which to explore the rest of Venice. The staff are really helpful. It is great to get people on the reception desk who want to help you. The rooms are comfortable, clean and really well decorated. Next time I will spend a little bit more for a canal view without a doubt. If they recommend you eat at the Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo (literally five minutes round the corner), do! The food was amazingly good at a great price and, again, the staff were friendly and helpful. I'm already counting the days until my next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Karen and John Adamthwaite, Newcastle, NSW Australia - Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Whitebridge
Reviews.Content: Antiche Figure, Venice, Italy. Date 26/27October 2006. What a great hotel. We had a booking for four couples, two had booked canal view rooms and the other two normal rooms. We had just arrived off the Marco Polo Cruise and had to walk from the overseas terminal to the hotel as no transport was available so we just followed the signs to Piazzale Roma and then followed the signs to the trains station. Only took 15 minutes in total. Ten of us arrived at the hotel at 9.30am, eight were staying and the other couple we travelling from Venice to Rome by train at 1pm. On our arrival Alessandro was marvellous he allowed our other friends to leave their luggage until they left on the train and that allowed them to explore Venice for a few hours. From the moment we walked in Alessandro was only too pleased to assist us with maps and information on Venice. We stayed two nights (not enough) and that afternoon we bought a 24 hour Vaporetta ticket from across the Canal, good value. Only takes 10 minutes to get to St Mark's Square and it is an exciting way to travel around Venice, especially when you do not have much time. We also used the ticket to go over to the island of Lido, what a pretty place, it even has cars and buses. Before our arrival at the Antiche Figure I emailed them and asked if they could book the Secret Itinerary of Doge's Palace which they did so without any bother. Francesca emailed me a booking number and all we had to do was arrive there and go to the Information desk and get out tickets. This tour takes you to parts of Doge's Palace that the general tours do not take you. Well worth it. Two of us had canal view rooms, and the other two couples had the other rooms. All four rooms we great. My room was 411 and every morning I would stand at the window and look at all the traffic and goings on on the grand canal, loved it. Bathroom was huge and our bedroom was huge. It is lovely to sit out at the tables out the front of the hotel and have a few glasses of wine and just people watch. This hotel has everything, even free internet access in the lobby. How good is that., especially when internet cafes charge so much throughout Italy. This was the best hotel we stayed at during our 4 weeks away and would have no hesitation in staying there again, even if I couldn't get a canal view room. All four couples found this to be the best, not one complaint. Congragulations Alessandro, Francesca, and the lovely lady who served us our wine of an afternoon, I'm sorry I didn't get your name. Antiche Figure exceeding all our expectations and thank you for your hospitality. Karen And John Adamthwaite, Newcastle, NSW, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Quality accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Saesnes
Reviews.Content: This is a really good little hotel - just a 10 minute walk from the bus station at Piazzale Roma (across a couple of stepped bridges), and just across the Grand Canal from the train station (didn't hear any train noise while we were there). Our room was on the 1st floor at the side of the hotel and was spotlessly clean. It had everything today's travellers need, even down to wireless internet access in the room. The double glazing is excellent and there was no noise in our room from the busy Canal Grande. All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. I was a little disappointed with the breakfast, but this was mainly because on the first morning I hadn't realised that there was a different selection of foods available in each of the two breakfast rooms. On the second morning I knew where everything was (cereals and yoghurts in one room, croissants and rolls in the other - could have done with a little fresh fruit salad though). I would certainly recommend the Antiche Figure to anyone visiting Venice. OK, it's a little walk to St Mark's Square but Venice isn't a big place and it's delightful to explore it on foot. The vaporetti run from just over the Ferrovia bridge, and there's so much more to see in Venice than just the main tourist traps. We did a 'ghost walk' on one of our evenings, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. It wasn't scary (like, say, Edinburgh) but told gentle and interesting stories about people who used to live in Venice long ago and took us to atmospheric spots we couldn't have found on our own (free from the hordes of tourists too).

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: angbrand
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in October 2006 for three nights, and we were blown away. It was just gorgous. Our room was on the top floor and we paid extra for Canal views and it was worth every euro! The room was big, the bed was big and comfortable, the bathroom was big and all marble and glass. The view was big, everything was just fantastic. The staff were terrific and on arrival organised a trip to the Murano Island to see glassworks. Also a gondola ride which we took in the evening - a tad expensive but worth it (E90). Very romantic and lovely to see the canals at night. The hotel also recommended some excellent restaurants. This hotel was easily the best hotel we stayed in during our European trip. I would go back there in a flash! Especially since I have absolutely fallen in love with Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Spirit of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Boulevardier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently situated, close to the railway station all the important vaporetti stops are just over the canal. The rooms are superb, elegantly and well appointed, the staff friendly, efficient and fun. The georgeous Francesca managed my late request for the laundering of my shirts with great alacrity. It is a great place for people watching, a Birra Moretti, or Campari Soda taken on the tables outside in the evening provide an insight into the protocol of the gondoliers who operate from their well-appointed cabin on the quay. They always seem pre-booked when asked by middle-aged couples, but are, nor surprisngly, available when requested by skimpily-clad antipodean girls! C'est la vie - or the Venetian equivalent! Although a busy frontage, there is no street crime and the ambience is is one of studied insoucience. Good restaurants close by - the Ostaria Vecio Pozzo just around the corner in Corte Canal is excellent - the mussels are a treat and thr range of wines interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and impeccible cleanliness in a dirty city”
Reviews.Author: JMG44
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel across the Grand Canal from the train station and about a 30 minute walk to St. Marks Square, staffed by very nice and friendly people. We had a standard room which was well furnished and maintained, and immaculately clean. Unfortunately our room looked out onto a side street with a blank wall to look at only about 5 feet from our windows. The included breakfast was standard in Italy and OK.

Reviews.Title: “All we'd hoped for”
Reviews.Author: citeseer
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews - and are glad we did. It was all we'd hoped for. We arrived by train and it's very reassuring to see the hotel as soon as you emerge from the Station. Venice is a maze and full of people dragging luggage over cobblestones and up and down steps, we were glad this wasn't us! The location of Antiche Figure is excellent. It's just far enough from the Station (on the other side of the Grand Canal) not to be a "Station Hotel" but is within easy walking or vaporetto distance to all the sights. After our forays to Piazza San Marco and the Rialto, we were glad that our hotel wasn't there! All of Venice is crowded with tourists but some parts are even worse than others. Our room was quite small, Alessandro said we could change if we wanted to but we chose to stay as, although we hadn't paid for a canal view, this room did, in fact, have a good view of the canal from the side windows. Reception were very helpful and made us feel most welcome. On arrival, hours before check-in, Alessandro took in our luggage, gave us a map and pointed out our Venice familiarisation tour via vaporetto! On his suggestion we bought a 3-day vaporetto pass which turned out ot be an excellent investment. Later he made bookings for us on the Secret Itinerary Tour at the Palazzo Ducale so we didn't have to queue. My husband and I would happily recommend Antiche Figure as THE place to stay on a trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with Hotel Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: swy94611
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about the hotel! The location was perfect for us as we were there for a pre-cruise stay. Everything is within walking distance and it's so easy to catch the water buses. Regarding the noise - If you don't leave any of the windows open, you don't hear any of the canal or street noise as all the windows are double paned. (Also the mosquitoes don't come in!!) The canal rooms are worth the upgrade as they are slightly larger than the interior rooms. Breakfast was good. There were fresh fruits, yogurt, cheese, cold cuts and bread/pastries. Can't comment on the coffee as I didn't have any. There were at least two juice selections. Hard-boiled eggs were available, but I don't recall if they served scrambled eggs or not. The selection of food is much better than some of the other hotels I stayed at in Europe from previous trips. The staff made sure that there was enough food selection for everyone. Alessandro and Francesca were extremely helpful. They answered all my e-mails promptly and even helped in getting some tickets for us. The only thing that I didn't quite understand was that when we booked 11 rooms nine months ago, 4 were for canal view rooms. When we arrived, we were informed that they had overbooked the canal view rooms the following day and wanted to know if anyone in our party was interested in moving to an interior room. One member in our party volunteered to move and in fact, he liked his second room better than the canal view room he had on the first floor! Again, this hotel is great. You will enjoy your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this beautiful hotel and its fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: AdamZach
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the rave reviews on TripAdvisor, I booked this hotel for our trip to Venice to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary, and were thrilled with everything about it! Our room (311) looked out over the Grand Canal, yet we did not hear any noise at night. The room itself was spacious, immaculate, with a modern bathroom (and two sinks!). The general manager, Alessandro, was absolutely terrific, the staff at the front desk, the bar, and the breakfast room could not have been more welcoming, and even the other guests were so friendly! I think we were all enjoying the hotel and the city so much, everyone was in a great mood. Most of those we spoke with identified Antiche Figure through TripAdvisor, and we all agreed this hotel is a gem! Thanks to Alessandro and his superb team!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect European Experience”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMama
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more pleased with our stay at this hotel. The rooms were lovely. We did upgrade to a canal view which were very bright. Since we were towards the entrance to Venice's Grand Canal, it was quite quiet at night and in the morning. The staff was excellent, always prepared to give us some honest, helpful recommendations or impeccable service. Breakfast could be taken inside or sitting along the canal edge. Again, the waitstaff were friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: borris
Reviews.Content: Well..what can I say? This hotel was absolutely fantastic! It was in a great location, away from the main tourist attractions, but they were easily accessiable by water taxi, which suited us better as we found st marks square very busy and could have potentially been noisy at night! The bus stop that goes to/from the airport is literally 5 minutes away, and although the railway station is oppsoite, you cannot hear any trains what so ever. The room was clean and fairly big, it felt quite luxurious. The breakfast was good and adequate. The staff were very helpful and friendly, gave us a lot of tourist information upon arrival and happy to answer any questions through out our stay. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holroyd
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay at this cute little hotel. We had a blue room on the second floor with a balcony, from which we had a beautiful view. Unlike others, we didn't find it noisy at all. The location was terrific not too busy, but within easy walking distance to restaurants and shopping. We took a shuttle bus from the airport to Piazza Roma and then walked over two small bridges to the hotel. Pack lightly. We bought a three-day pass for the vaporetto and went all over Venice. What a beautiful city. When we left, to go on a cruise, we could have walked from the hotel to the free shuttle to the port, but it was raining, so we took a water taxi (60 euros). The staff at the hotel couldn't have more friendly or helpful. We would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value in very city with too many tourists”
Reviews.Author: DERH50
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Antiche and would certainly recommend it. The hotel started welcoming guests on 14th Feb 2003; they state that meeting/exceeding customer expectation is their #1 priority and every member of staff adhers to this principle. Effort has been made to use traditional fittings inside to match the external facade. Our room was on the small size but it was similar to anything (3star hotel) in Paris, Rome etc We were unsure about the air conditioning on the first night and left the windows open for air - a BAD mistake due to constant noise from the canal. The only downside was breakfast - only â‚¬5 but not worth more. Venice is FULL of tourists - and the single experience was probably enough for us. We found 2 excellent traditional restaurants - Osteria Alba Nova (sea food) and All ANFORA Trattoria (best pizza in Venice, Europe. .. the World?). We had a single drink in Harrys Bar (â‚¬36.50 for 2 Vodka and Tonics) In 45 minutes, we never saw anyone purchase a second drink!!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: bredo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located across the street from the train station. Rick Steve doesn't suggest staying in this area, but I'm not sure why. We would gladly stay at this hotel on a return trip to Venice. The Vaporetto stop was just a few steps away as were plenty of restaurants and shopping. The rooms were larger than any other we had while in Italy. They were also very clean, which is of utmost importance to us. The staff was very helpful in reccomending restaurants and offering tips for our stay in Venice. We also enjoyed the outdoor tables for a late night coffee and some people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: lek23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! We chose it because it was a reasonable price and seemed to be a good location - when you've never been before you can't be sure. It is on the Grand Canal within easy reach of the buses, trains and a vaporetto station just over the bridge. The staff were lovely - especially the poor woman doing breakfasts all by herself each morning! The only thing I would say is that if you have long hair take a hand towel with you because theirs (and this may be a Venetian thing) are just like large fabric napkins- absorb no water!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Schmoop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure 17-20 August 2006 as a part of our 1-month European honeymoon. We arrived in the early evening and were immediately checked into our room on the 1st floor (floor 0 is street level in Europe). When we opened the door to our room we both stood there smiling ear-to-ear....it was huge! And, well appointed and comfortable and clean. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal and the walkway below so our view was amazing. I'm a light sleeper so I was a little concerned about the potential for excess noise. But the windows were well insulated and had exterior shutters too. The recommendation from the young lady at the front desk for where to have dinner could not have been better. We ended up going to that same restaurant 2 of the 3 nights we were in Venice - Trattoria Borghi (I believe). The morning breakfast was a good assortment of pastries, meats, cheeses, cafe, fruit, and juice. We enjoyed a glass of wine each evening as we sat outside and watched the sunset. *sigh* I can't wait to go back and will definitely stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure. In fact, I loved this hotel so much that I've recommended it to my new mother-in-law!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its rating”
Reviews.Author: spankypants
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay based on the tripadvisor rating and were not disappointed. We knew what to expect in Venice and were happy to be near the train, the vaporetto, piazza di Roma and away from San Marco. The room was nice though not large, the bed and pillows very good and the bathroom excellent. The breakfast was varied and tasty. The decor is understated and the staff was absolutely first class and without attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel But SO Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: HLinkowich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. Upon arrival, we were given a Canal View room which is what we paid for on the first floor. I was concerned about the noise level since there seemed to be a lot of activity outside, but I was assured that there are no cars in Venice so it would be quiet. During the day, the view from our room was great and the location was fantastic. The people were friendly and helpful and the room was spacious. They definitely have a mold problem at least in our bathroom in room 112 in which they may want to invest in a Bleach pen. We fight mold at our house, too, but this did not seem to be in control. We returned to our room at 9:30 pm to settle in for the evening and between the foot traffic and boats on the canal, it seemed to be noisier than a freeway. In addition, people stopped at the hotel tables outside to have a drink on the canal and were not very respectful to those of us who were exhausted from a long day of sightseeing. It finally calms down after 11 pm and starts right back up at 4 am when I heard the rolling of suitcases heading toward the bus stop and the vaporetti begins again. We would have changed rooms the next evening but our flight was at 6 am from Venice airport so we knew we wouldn't need to sleep later than 4 am, so we just stuck it out. If you are a heavy sleeper and can sleep through anything, this hotel is wonderful. However, if you are a light (me) to moderate (my husband) sleeper, do not get a canal view room. You will not sleep or even rest due to the noise level.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: airphobic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this delightful hotel for 4 nights, as an 18th birthday treat for my daughter. We had two lovely canal view rooms and the view was fascinating. The location was amazing. It was an easy walk to all of the main tourist attractions and when the feet were tired, it was central for the main water boat routes. It was extremely pleasant to sit outside in the evenings to enjoy a drink and to watch the gondoliers. I would have no hesitation at all in recommending this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “splendid facility, staff and experience”
Reviews.Author: chmod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three great nights at this facility, arriving via water taxi from the airport two doors from the front of the entrance. As we planned to leave Venice via train, the location was perfect to minimize navigation anxiety. As we left for Salzberg on Austrian Rail at the end of our visit, I realized the wisdom of having booked this hotel. It was so easy, all of it, from the way we were greeted, to the quality of the facility, to the friendliness of the staff. I cannot recall a nicer overall experience.Staff was always willing to assist or serve. The location was great, far from the utter chaos of the more crowded areas. We received a great recommendation for a local Venetian meal, enjoyed our breakfast in the cool of the morning outside, and after a day of walking (and you do walk in Venice) we were grateful to have a seriously strong air conditioner. Our canal-facing room, I believe it was on floor 3 , ( I am still traveled out!) was just great. The dual-glazed windows made the room, and building, completely silent. Highly recommened, for any travelers. Thanks to all who previously reviewed the site as you were on the money. patrick

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: CBSulli
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the Hotel Antiche Figure at the the end of our three weeks in Italy. We had a wonderful room overlooking the canal and it was fabulous. We loved looking out the window in the early morning and watching Venice go by on the canal. The staff was wonderful and always helpful to us. We saw many people trying to find their hotel with luggage in tow, and we were very grateful to be across from the train station. Using the water taxis or walking, gave us easy access to all the sites. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. You will have the time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Diggerr
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and we stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure. There are so many hotels in Venice and so many reviews - and I think we read most of them before taking the plunge and booking this hotel! If you are in the same situation as we were and wondering where to stay, stop dithering and book here - you will not regret it. The majority of the reviews say it all. St Marks Square is about a half hour walk or you can catch the water bus which stops very near to the hotel. We both thought that the distance from St Marks Square was a benefit - the walk was lovely, it was quieter and the prices of everything a lot lower... Although we travelled to Venice on the ferry from Croatia (highly recommended!), we caught the train to Treviso and flew back to the UK from Treviso airport; however, for people arriving in Venice by train, being directly opposite the Railway Station makes the hotel very accessible and easy to find. When researching where to stay in Venice a recurring theme was the difficulties people had finding their hotels (particularly in the dark) and also carrying their luggage around Venice. You will not have those problems here.

Reviews.Title: “Great after a long flight!”
Reviews.Author: gaudifan
Reviews.Content: My husband ,son and I spent a night here after an overnight flight from New York. We were to board a cruise the following day. The hotel was perfect for us. We took a bus from the airport to Piazza Roma and were at the hotel after a very short walk. The following morning we had another easy walk back to the Piazza to catch the bus to the ship. The hotel was clean, the bathroom wonderful and breakfast was good. I would highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, with a lot of charm”
Reviews.Author: TLIII
Reviews.Content: My family and I (6 people in total) stayed at the Antiche Figure on the night of August 30th (following our 12 night Mediterranean cruise). We chose this classy small hotel based on the glowing reviews we'd read on trip advisor. The hotel lived up to our expectations because it truly is a charming little hotel (more like a B&B), dramatically located on the Grand Canal - offering breathtaking views of the Grand Canal. Our family had two rooms (#412 and #211). Both were beautifully furnished with stylish fabrics and were very spacious as far as European rooms go. They each overlooked the Grand Canal and had elegant bathrooms. The television sets are tiny (they should consider adding 25" tv's), however, we weren't there to watch tv. The tv's carried CNN News and BBC (really the only two English speaking channels available to us). The best thing about the hotel - other than its favorable canal front setting - is their personable front office staff. Elena, Franchesca and Alessandro were top notch! They were friendly, informative and helpful. Franchesca recommended a nice little restaurant to us which was located only a couple of minute stroll from the hotel (the "Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo"). Its nothing fancy, as its located in a small alley way, however, the food was very good and reasonably priced. One of the things we learned while dining at restaurants around the Mediterranean during our cruise is that you should expect to pay a "cover charge" to eat in the restaurant. Most of the cover charges ranged from 2 to 3 euros per person (that's right, it typically costed us $2.50 to $3.50 per person just to sit down in the restaurant - a ridiculous fee, but one that seemed to be standard wherever we ate). Plus, you could expect to pay a "service charge" of 10 to 13 percent (which we were consistently told was to pay for the restaurant "ambiance" and the rolls they brought us when we sat down). THEN, you are expected to leave a tip for the waitstaff! Europeans should never complain about eating in U.S. restaurants because they won't be hit with these same types of fees! The Antiche Figure has a small breakfast room where a complimentary continental breakfast is served (traditional european style continental breakfast with hams, cheeses, cereals, croissants, rolls, juices, coffee, teas, etc). Nice, but nothing fancy. Elena was very helpful in arranging a water taxi for us to go to the airport in the morning. Let me point out a few things which will be helpful to you in terms of the best ways to get around Venice from this hotel...As you know, probably the best way to explore Venice is by foot! The hotel is a 15 minute leisurely walk from the Rialto Bridge (a very overrated sightseeing attraction!). The Rialto Bridge is a 15 minute walk from San Marco Square (the major tourist attraction in Venice which was always mobbed with tourists). We had fun feeding the pigeons there and shopping in the seemingly endless glass boutiques! As previous reviews have mentioned, it is VERY EASY to find your way back through the maze of small side streets, because you simply follow the signs for "Ferrazzi" (not sure on the spelling of it) - which means "train station". The train station is located directly across the canal from the hotel, however, you really don't hear any noise from there other than the occasional street singers/musicians who perform at the base of the steps. Franchesca advised us to take Water Taxi #1 (located only a two minute walk from the front of the hotel) in order to have a nice cruise down the Grand Canal. The water taxi ride was 5 euros per person and enabled us to go down the entire Grand Canal (we got off at San Marco Square and walked back). She also recommended that we use the services of the gondoliers located outside the front entrance of the hotel, since we wanted to experience one of Venice's famous gondola rides. The 40 minute gondola ride we opted to take cost us 100 euros (which seemed on par with what two other gondoliers near San Marco Plaza had quoted me). The gondola ride was very fun and definitely worth taking in order to experience Venice's small canals! Plus, if you take the gondola ride from the guys located in front of the hotel, you know you'll get your money's worth! The most economical way to get to Marco Polo Airport is via bus (the bus fare is only 3 euros per person from the bus terminal to the airport). The bus depot is only a five minute walk from the hotel - however, if you are dragging/carrying luggage, be advised that you have to cross two small bridges. Our family opted for the much pricier private water taxi ride (which cost us 120 euros in total) only because of the convenience of it. The water taxi picked us up right outside the hotel entrance and only took 25 minutes to get to the airport! We had lots of luggage, so it made sense to take the water taxi (despite the much higher cost). Allesandro was very helpful getting us settled into the water taxi in the morning. If you are travelling alone or with one or two other people, I would strongly advise just taking the bus. Also, please be aware that once you get to the airport via water taxi, you still have to walk about four minutes from the dock area to the airport terminal. It's a very ease walk though. When our water taxi pulled in, we were asked if we wanted help taking our luggage over to the airport. Be aware that the porters/luggage handlers were looking to charge us 4 1/2 euros per bag for this service. We quickly decided to haul our own luggage instead (the airport has small luggage carts that you can use at no extra charge). We enjoyed our stay in Venice very much. It's such a quaint little city and truly unique with its endless canal system. Like nothing you'll ever see anywhere else in the world! We all said that we'd definitely return to stay at the Antiche Figure hotel when we return to Venice. If you are looking for a hotel with more amenities (like fitness equipment, a dinner restaurant, etc), you are probably better off staying at a bigger property. However, the Antiche Figure is a great value because of its high level of personal service and great canal location (even if it is a 30 minute walk from the main tourist area of San Marco).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Venice”
Reviews.Author: Porsche_Guy
Reviews.Content: In early June we spent several nights at the Hotel Antiche Figure. We arranged to have in one of the rooms at the front of the hotel that overlook the Grand Canal, room 312 I believe. We have no regrets about our experience at the hotel. The room was very nice and quite well appointed. The hotel staff was helpful and attentive, and the buffet breakfasts were varied and tasty. The hotel has a nice small bar across from the lobby, and wonderful espresso is always available. There are vaperrato stops near the hotel so you get around the entire island with no trouble from the hotel. And one very nice thing about the location of Hotel Antiche Figure is that it is directly across the canal from Santa Lucia train station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure is the place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Patagonia8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure is a small lovely hotel with a great location at a quieter end of the Grand Canal and perfectly located to take the vaparetto to go where ever you want (get a 3 day pass and you save money). I don't think you could find a lovelier hotel with rooms facing the Grand Canal even if you were to spend mega dollars. The fact that you look across at the unattractive train station is mediated by having a room that faces the Grand Canal and seeing all the action that takes place on the Canal. The airconditioning is excellent. The major downside is that there is no internet available in the hotel and the internet cafe has unbearably slow processing which really means no internet while you are in Venice. We just returned from staying there 7 nights and were delighted to be there. All of the staff is delightful. The breakfast is adequate (5 Euro when you book with Expedia) but there is nothing hot like eggs or really good Italian cheese, etc. Take your food to the outside tables overlooking the canals! We were thrilled to have chosen this hotel! A trip advisor member, Los Angeles, CA.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonanne
Reviews.Content: The location was great as we arrived by ferry from Greece and left by train. The area around the hotel is wonderful. We did walk to St Mark's Square one day and walked straight through and onto a water taxi to go back!. We knew Venice would be crowded and hot in August but we had no choice but to travel then. I wish we had just stayed near the hotel and wandered. The management was very helpful when we checked in. They had tickets to the Vivaldi concert I wanted to see. Our rooms were clean and nicely decorated. I felt we had more space than in some hotels. There was even a tub! Our rooms looked out onto a small street but we hadn't asked for a view. There was no issue with noise. The breakfast was pretty standard Italian. We asked for espresso and had it served promptly even though the one server was VERY busy. I do agree about the fake juice but it seems freshly squeezed juice is less common in Italy than in North America. We had the pleasant option of eating outside right beside the grand canal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: AllyMac11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 night stay with teenage son. Our first time to Venice, and booked this hotel based on previous reviews. This is a fabulous hotel with a great location and wonderful staff. Venice is absolutley unique! The hotels have to be unique too. This hotel is wonderfully located at the top of the Grand Canal. It says it is in a residential area, however you are a minute away from a fabulous restaurant as recommended by Alessandros, or a pizzeria, or a bar, or numerous other restaurants, or shops...This is a beautifully appointed hotel from which to explore Venice. You are 2 bridges, 5 minutes walk from the bus staion that will bring you in from Marco Polo or Treviso, or just across the canal is the railway station with its elegant front, buskers and stalls. I never saw or heard a train the whole time and we had a canal view room! The breakfasts at 5 euros are a bargain! Rolls, coffees, juices, cereals, yoghurts, cheese, ham.. Across the road you would pay 8 euoros for less in a cafe. Our room was spotlessly clean, air conditioning, safe. Without anty hesitation I would recommend this hotel and its wondrful staff, and will be coming back again to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel on the Grand Canal with great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Grumpathome
Reviews.Content: I am going to sum up this review first, then if it still interests you, you can read the rest: : If you are looking for a Big American style hotel - then Antiche Figure is not for you. But if you want a charming boutique style hotel with clean comfortable accomodations, the charm of Venice, Murano glass fixtures, a great location to explore Venice from and incredibly friendly customer service (with excellant English) then the Antiche Figure is for you ! I need to start by telling you about booking our rooms. I read all the reviews in TA before emailing Antiche Figure - all the reviews that raved about this hotel were right. Customer service began with the emails we exchanged. I was booking rooms for 10 people and was trying to make everyone happy, Antiche Figure did. Not only did Alessandro answer all my questions about the hotel and its' accommodations, but he answered lots of questions about Venice. He could not have been any more helpful! Also check out their website for lots of pictures and their email address. My family stayed here in the middle of July after a cruise ending in Venice. We had 4 rooms, (3 doubles and one quad). They were all nicely decorated, with comfortable beds (they even have kings), very clean, with working air conditioning, nice bathrooms and a fridge ( it was stocked, but we were told we could move stuff to make room for our water bottles). The hotel is wonderful, in a wonderful location, especially if you want to get away from the noise and tourists around San Marco. There is even a lovely patio with tables in front of the hotel where you can sit and enjoy the gondolas etc. on the Grand Canal. It is a 5 min. walk from Piazzale Roma ( we had a lot of luggage, but were able to to get over the two walking bridges with a little extra effort - it is still easier to walk to the Antiche Figure than to get to most hotels in Venice. You can also leave your luggage at the P. Roma where there is a boat that will deliver it to the hotel for several Euros a bag - but the walk was not too bad. The hotel is also across the canal from the train station. It is also near a waterbus stop We went to the hotel to check it out on our first day in Venice ( we had one night on ship and then disembarked the next morning). Alessandro helped us with maps, directions, suggestions about where to go and where to get lunch - and we weren't even checking in until the next day. We arrived the next morning around 8:30 AM (the ships gets you off early) with at least 24 bags, since it was still early and the rooms were not ready, Alessandro helped us stack all our bags next to the desk in the lobby, this is a small hotel with a small lobby so we took up a lot of space. He arranged a free taxi to take us to a glass factory in Murano. The factory and showroom were great and not high pressure, but I decided to keep looking at other shops, so I passed on purchasing a bowl that I liked, since I thought we might see something similar for less money elsewhere. We shopped some more in Murano, then took a waterbus back. I had not found anything I liked better and regretted not buying it and told Francesca about it at the front desk, she offered to get another water taxi to take me back to the glass factory, but since it was late, I did not want to do that, she called the factory for me, found out which salesman had helped me, I talked to him and with some faxing back and forth, I was able to order my murano glass and have it shipped to the USA. ( he had quoted me a price before we left that morning - he remembered the bowl as "the one he was trying to give to me....") this was another example of how helpful and nice they are at AF! When we returned, all our bags were in the right rooms - a real feat, since most ot them had the same last name. That evening we were able to walk from AF to the Ponte Vecchio in about 15 - 20 mins. with lots of shopping and browsing on the way. To get to San Marco, you can waterbus or walk it in about 30 mins. Walking in Venice is a must! Lots of interesting little streets, but signs on the corner of building to point you in the right direction. The breakfast is served in two small rooms and was a nice little buffet with enough choices to fill you up. Everything was fresh and nicely displayed. Overall we could not have picked a better place to end our cruise of the Mediterranean and we will go back! Kudos to Alessandro and Francesca for all their help!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Grande Canal”
Reviews.Author: cornbread35
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice early in the morning after a Ryanair flight from Rome ($4.95 on-line sale- see more below). The flight goes into Treviso Airport, so you have a 5 Euro, 45 minute bus ride to the Piazza Roma in Venice. As noted in other reviews, the Antiche Figure is a quick 5 minute walk from the bus station, although I will note that you do have to carry your bags over two bridges. Our room was not yet ready, but reception was very accomidating and took care of our bags and gave us maps and hints to start our exploration of the area. When we returned mid afternoon, our room was ready, on the top floor in the corner, so we had three windows overlooking the Grande Canal. No balcony, but the view was really neat. The room was very, very nice. One quirky thing I had never seen before was a key card slot near the door to operate the lights in the room. They had not told us about that at check in, and we could not at first figure out why the light in the room did not work. Then I saw the key slot on the wall by the door, inserted my room key and all the lights came on. We had planned to get a waterbus pass for our time in Venice, but after that first day we realized with a good map, knowing your primary end destination (i.e. San Marco) and willing to make a few wrong turns, you can travel the city pretty well on foot, so we skipped the water bus passes. Venice streets were very crowed, but it appeared that so were the water busses. I did not give this hotel an excellent rating, as my wife and I agreed that the breakfast, which was included, was only so so. The juice was only red juice, the coffee came from a push button machine and was not very good, and the food selection was pretty bland. Breakfast did not compare favorably at all to the other places we stayed in Italy during out trip. We took a gondola ride from one of the boats right in front of the hotel. We went about 5 o'clock and they were not particularly busy. It was 80 euro for 40 minutes or 120 euros for an hour. He showed us on a map what the difference was, and we did the hour. Even though they start in the Grande Canal, you soon get off the busy routes and into the smaller, more intimate canals. Our gondalier was pleasant, informative and made our ride very memorable. I had read horror stories about grouchy operators, but when we noticed the lines of people waiting near St Marks for rides, it was no wonder. Our operator said that he knows that he could make more money if he took over his father's permit at St. Marks, but he prefers to take life a little slower. RyanAir- By taking a 7 a.m. flight to Venice we were at our hotel by 9:30 a.m. vs. a 6 hour drive in the car. For others in the U.S., RyanAir is like Southwest without the frills(?). They are full size jets, but fly from regional airports. You take a bus from the terminal to your jet on the tarmac. I had never heard of them, but would not hesitate to fly them again if I needed an economy flight.

Reviews.Title: “OK but a couple of niggles...”
Reviews.Author: lc1502
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about this hotel and whilst it was good it wasn't as good as we were expecting. We paid for the deluxe canal view, just under Â£150 a night and stayed 2 nights. The staff were helpful and gave us a choice of 2 rooms, we chose the top floor as it would be quieter which I have to say it was very quiet. The view was ok but not as good as the pictures from another visitor on here. We looked directly over the train station but could see down the canal if we leant out the window, not something you do all the time though and the train station isn't really picturesque. The location was ideal for when you arrive and leave Venice as its so close to the bus and train station but when you're out and about it is really at the opposite end of where the action is, however, the water bus stop is right opposite so it's not a big deal and it's quite nice to travel up and down the canal on the bus. The rooms were large and clean but the bathroom had mould, it wasn't bad but I was surprised by that for a Â£150 a night deluxe room. Also the breakfasts were raved about in previous reviews, again I was a bit surprised to see that it was a self service, coffee from a vending machine and pre-packaged muffins and yoghurts with a few slices of cheese and ham thrown in. Overall it wasn't a bad hotel at all and not one to complain about but I definitely expected more following these reviews so was left feeling a bit disappointed and probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: JE-PE
Reviews.Content: We had read many reviews of the Antiche Figure before going, so it had a lot to live up to!! We were delighted with our four night stay. Venice was absolutely wonderful....but tiring...and our beautiful top floor, canal facing room was a joy to return to. It was explained to us that the owner could afford to be lavish when furnishing and decorating..so all the decore is of a wonderful standard...beyond what one would expect of a 3* hotel. Other reviewers major on great location, cleanliness, really helpful service...and all we can do is confirm what they have said. Before going I e-mailed a couple of requests / queries and they were dealt with in a very friendly and efficient way. Whilst there, we requested that breakfast be bagged up for us one morning as we intended to walk to the Rialto and St. Mark's at 6 o clock!! This was sorted out in the same helpful way. Would recommend the Antiche Figure wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: erem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Antiche Figure for three nights at the end of July 2006. Our stay was absolutely wonderful. Everyone at the hotel was very, very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The hotel was very pretty and the view over the canal was outstanding. The location is very convenient to the train station. It's all been said in other reviews. All-in-all, completely deserving of it's great rating. We would stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: Jigsawman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche lives up to all of the positive reviews that have been written abuot it. The main advantage as far as I am concerned is its location right on the Grand Canal directly opposite the Santa Lucia railway station and within 100 metres or so of the main (only!) bus station. When you arrive in Venice the vast majority of travellers will arrive at one of these two locations. Then you are set loose into the MAZE that is Venice! When you witness the poor travellers who go round in circles trying to find their hotel, it is comforting to have a hotel that is located in such fine position. As for the accomodation itself, it has all been said previously.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NessW
Reviews.Content: We loved this small hotel. The staff were wonderful, friendly, professional. Rooms were spacious for europe standard, very very clean, lovely details such as furnishings, glass light fittings, linen. Very large windows with lovely view of grand canel. Not noisy (we shut our shutters at night) Huge bed, very comfy!! Breakfast great & has packaged options to takeaway which is great when your in a hurry to get out and see the sights! Was amazed to find such a great hotel in such a convenient location when arriving by train. The canel bus is very convenient for getting to Rialto or St Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of the high ratings given here”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSteve
Reviews.Content: Superior experience at this hotel. Great location (you can see it from the train station). Modern, clean rooms, bathroom especially nice. Good breakfasts. Good air conditioning. Best part about this hotel was the staff, though. Very helpful, recommended restaurants (that were exceptional, and not touristy), gave directions, just generally went out of their way to provide a great experience. Stayed here with my two teen-age daughters. They loved it, too. And we chose this hotel based on prior ratings at this site. Lived up to the billing---

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melibi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is good but beware if you are travelling with lots of luggage as there are two bridges you have to cross. The breakfasts were good and included in the price. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitty_Falol
Reviews.Content: We chose Antiche Figure on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews and we were so pleased that we did. We booked through Alpharooms and couldn't believe that we could actually afford the 'number 1' hotel in Venice. Firstly, the only down side was that we were given a side room (room 114) so our main view was of a plaster wall and a window, but if you leaned out of the window you could see the grande canal, with the gondaliers at their posts. The view didn't spoil it too much for us as the room was so beautifully decorated and comfortable. We stayed 7 nights here and we found the location to be perfect. Ideal for getting on a train to Verona or Padova, walking to the Piazzale Roma for the bus station, or hopping on the Vaporetta. It was also lovely to sit out in the morning for breakfast and in the evening with a drink, just watching the gondoliers at work. (The only down side to this was that musicians would often serenade you, even if you did not want them to and would then ask for money for the song.) All the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the breakfast staff, who always greeted you with a warm smile every morning. On the first day, we mentioned to Alessandro that our TV set wasn't working. It was quite late, but he apologised profusely and promised to have it fixed the next day - which it was. There is also a broadband connection in the rooms if you have your laptop with you, you just need to ask the desk staff to set it up for you. I could continue to expound about how lovely it was, but it has all been said before! We'd certainly stay here again, but maybe pay a little more and stay in one of the blue rooms with a better view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: wreimer
Reviews.Content: Just need to say what a wonderful place this was to stay. It was our first stop in Europe, and after missing a connection, our luggage being lost...I can't think of a warmer welcome. The service was extraordinary!!! The rooms were beautiful, I would however recommend getting the blue rooms overlooking the canal. We decided too late and they were all booked. The red rooms are small but certainly very well appointed. I hope to return to Venice when I can take more time enjoying the sites rather than looking for clothes...there is something magical about this city and about Hotel Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous oasis on the Grande Canal”
Reviews.Author: hesperus
Reviews.Content: We had just disembarked from a cruise liner in the port of Naples, en route to our home in Ireland. We found the hotel a short stroll from the bus station, just under 5 minutes ,and directly opposite the rail station. When we entered reception we were most courteously welcomed. The receptionist immediately suggested we should deposit our luggage and set off to enjoy Venice. His suggestions for local walking, water bus tours and travel routes were enormously practical and helpful . Our room, Canal View was very well appointed well soundproofed and air conditioned it was exceedingly comfortable. Breakfast was fresh and delicious. We were so pleased with our one night stay that we intend to return in the Autumn for a mid week break.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever and clean and the staff was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: angel731
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for 4 nights, when checking in Alesandro was very friendly and very helpful as well as all the staff here. The airlines had lost our luggage in Rome and this was our 4th night in Italy with no luggage, we were traveling with our 2 kids also. The staff here was very helpful in calling the airport and helping us out with this situation as well as giving recommndations on where to go and visit, shop for clothes, which we had none, and food great dining. Cute local place we enjoyed and even watched the world cup soccer game was Eclipse. Very good and great place to mingle with some locals. The Breakfast was plentiful and again the staff very pleasant and always had a smile on their face. We were late to breakfast one morning and they still with a smile let us sit and eat. This Hotel is right on the Grand Canal and close to the train if traveling from another city which we did. Our room was beautiful with double sinks in the bathroom and overlooked right onto the Canal with our big double bed and two single beds, the room was large enough to walk around. Our children were with us ages 10 and 12 and they also loved this place. Gondola's right ouside our window, very romantic. I would highly recommned this hotel to anyone, as I love hotels and this is by far better than the 3 stars it gets. Enjoy we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, unforgettable stay”
Reviews.Author: DinGeo
Reviews.Content: Date: 9-10 July 2006. Our family of four (two teenagers) stayed at the hotel for two magnificent nights. We were given a huge quadrable room facing the Grand Canal. The hotel is just opposite the train station and across the bridge. Travel light since all bridges in Venice are made of steps. The room was spotlesly clean, with a very good bathroom, a huge queen bed and two singles. Excellent decoration and a very effective air-conditioning (a must in Venice's humidity). The staff very friendly and helpful. Good breakfast and possibility to have it outside near the canal. The same with a drink from the bar. The bar of the hotel is, supprisingly, cheaper than most cafeterias and bars in the city and definitely with a better view.

Reviews.Title: “A marvelous hotel in magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: txgrl99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure on May 15, 2006. Our only complaint about our stay was that it was far too short. The hotel is conveniently located directly on the Grand Canal, right across the bridge from the train station. We paid for the canal view â€œblueâ€� room, and thought it was worth the extra cost. It was lovely to look out the windows and see the gondolas and vaporettos in the Canal. The rooms were lovely and very clean. The bathroom was quite large with two sinks and Venetian glass chandeliers. It was so lavish, I joked that I felt compelled to â€œthank the Academyâ€� in the large mirrors every time I went in there. We had two closets and a very comfortable bed. They serve drinks and appetizers at sidewalk tables in front of the hotel. We enjoyed two nice bellinis at sunset. The staff was extremely gracious and helpful. They arranged a gondola ride for us down the Grand Canal at a good rate (95 Euro for 45 minutes guaranteed, plus no bargaining on our part) with a charming gondolier, Stefano. It was, as it turned out, the perfect setting for my boyfriendâ€™s proposal. We could not have asked for a nicer hotel in which to celebrate our engagement. They also recommended two good restaurants and made lunch and dinner reservations for us. For breakfast, they served a traditional European Continental breakfast. The food was acceptable, and the kitchen staff was very friendly. They let us leave our bags at the hotel while we spent the day discovering the city. We picked them up and made the five minute walk to our train platform, sad to leave the city after too short a visit. Several people recommended staying closer to St. Markâ€™s Square, but we couldnâ€™t disagree more. Venice is small enough to easily traverse by foot and navigating the winding streets is part of the fun. Plus, the Antiche Figure provides a peaceful respite from the throngs of tourist in the square, but is still in the thick of things. The staff told us they provide a discount to repeat visitors. We cannot wait to take them up on their offer for our five- or ten-year anniversary, or sooner if weâ€™re lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
