Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay with friends (Woodley). After our visit last year we made a promise to return, not only to Venice, but to The Hotel Antiche Figure. All of the staff were helpful and very informative. Being situated opposite the railway station makes the hotel ideally appointed, as it is not right in the middle of all that goes on! however you will not be disappointed as life seems to carry on throughout the night, but after a few beers and a very good malt you won't hear a thing. The standard of the hotel cannot be faulted, it is clean, the rooms are of a generous size, and I would thoroughly recommend spending that little bit extra to book the rooms overlooking the Grand Canal, You will NOT be disappointed! If I was pressed to make any complaint it would only be that tea making facilities would be a bonus. I suppose only an Englishman could make such a comment, but that first cup in the morning reallly needs to be before breakfast!! And do please ask the hotels advice with regards as to where to eat, you will not be disappointed and you will not be ripped off as you could well be if you are attracted by the bright lights of the canal and the persuavive patter of some of the other restaurants close by! Enjoy your stay at the Hotel Antich Figure, perhaps we might meet you there as we will bet returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Monty-Basset
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 days at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice. Friends had warned us not to return to the same place/hotel (we first stayed there last year and liked it so much that we had booked again for this year) as they are never as good as you remember - they could not have been more wrong. This time we had booked the rooms overlooking the Grand Canal and it was worth every penny. In addition, the hotel and the staff were just as good as we remembered, if not better. The hotel is ideally situated right on the Grand Canal close to all facilities, bridge, train, bus (water and auto), water taxi and gondola stations are all within easy reach. A lot of hotels claim to be on the canal, which they are, but not the Grand Canal, so be careful. The Hotel Antiche Figure provides an excellent continental spread at breakfast time and although they do not provide evening meals this is not a problem as there are plenty of excellent restaurants close by, but be sure to ask the staff which they recommend, and be sure to follow their advice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with exemplary staff”
Reviews.Author: jamezyjamez
Reviews.Content: Selected based on reviews posted here. Enjoyed my stay in Venice and this hotel was a big reason. The city can be a little overwhelming when you get off the bus in the Piazzale Roma with large luggage. Thankfully the hotel is a quick walk - there are two little bridges, but overall easier than having to take a water bus/taxi. The hotel itself is nicely decorated, extremely clean, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. You are right on the canal, and directly across the bridge from a vaparetto stop. If course, it's fun to wander through the streets and see where you end up. Breakfast is a great value and the recommendations for dinner were spot-on. I will definitely be staying here again on my return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff made my stay !”
Reviews.Author: jwilli3470
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has the most accomadating staff I have ever encounterd. Helped with taxi, water taxi reservations, let me check in early and stay late etc. I stayed there on both ends of a cruise. Rooms are fine. Excellent A/C. Rooms have safe, reasonable mini-bar, CNN. Bar is expensive. Neighbood is not the best but perfectly safe. Close to transportation-train, boats etc. But beware if you have lots of luggage. You have to cross two bridges with many steps to get there from Piazza Roma (buses) and one steep bridge from the train station. It was hard with two big suitcases. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the City. Loved the Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful weekend break in Venice. What a magical place. Loved the City. Loved the Hotel. We arrived late at night (after a 2hr delay), and received a lovely warm welcome and within minutes of checking in, were directed to a lovely local restaurant, which even though it was late, was still buzzing - an excellent recommendation. Our room was delightful, spotlessly clean and overlooked the Canal as requested. The staff were all so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We enjoyed breakfast outside and early/late evening drinks watching the world go by. The location was great, with access to the vaporettas, on the other side of the canal. It was a totally relaxing and stress free break and we would definitely go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will come again”
Reviews.Author: LongPaddock
Reviews.Content: With some trepidation we arrived at the AF with our 2 friends early in a 5 week combined 30th wedding anniversay European tour. Would our friends find the hotel OK after assuring them that all my research said it would be? It was and they did! In fact it was much better than 'OK' and truly deserves its high Trip Advisor rating. Arriving by train and with 5 weeks worth of luggage including formal wear for the upcoming Mediterranean cruise, our only surprise was the steps on the bridge that separates the hotel and the station. We had imagined a smooth surface to glide the wheels over and had to carry them. Over 3 nights we stayed in the canal view rooms and smaller ones down the side. All have fairly recently been fitted out, and were clean. The welcome by John was friendly and the restaurant recommendation excellent. The female party members' already high estimation of the hotel climbed even higher when they met Alessandro next day - so charming, so handsome, so helpful! Location was fine and we walked or vaporettoed everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Glad we took your advice !”
Reviews.Author: citi-tripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel AF for 4 nights at the beginning of June 2006 (2 adults + teenage son) and we can highly recommend it. The hotel itself is small but spotlessly clean with very hard working staff who make you feel very welcome. We met Alessandro the manager and Francesa who gave us lots of advice to make our trip enjoyable. We had an excellant room (211) with a large double and a single bed, large marble bathroom and small balcony. We really enjoyed watching the world go by from the balcony - either standing on it or sitting in our room at the open balcony door with our feet up after a hard days sight seeing. The mini bar prices for water (2 euro) beer (4 euro) were about 80 cents higher than in shops but a cold beer in the comfort of your own room was worth it. We saw other hotels that we had been tempted to book but were very relieved that we hadn't as none of them had a prime spot on the grand canal like the AF, so our advice is to look no further than this hotel. It's location by the bus / train stations is ideal and despite being on the canal side once the shutters were closed at night there was no noise preventing a good nights sleep - especially after a lovely hot chocolate in the bar. We booked direct through the hotel's web site having checked tripadvisor reviews and exchanged friendly emails with Gianni before our visit. Breakfast was very good and at busy times guests sat in the bar area or outside to eat and the staff worked very hard to keep up with demand (and always with a smile). Our favourite restaurant was Marciana, in Calle Lunga Chioverette. Turn right out of the hotel walk to the Scalzi bridge; do not cross the bridge but turn right again at the bridge and it is the second restaurant on the right. The waiter Leon was very friendly and amusing and I had a complimentary cocktail for my birthday. Top tips. When arriving at the airport, do not stand in a long queue / line at the window marked public transport, but walk past to the tourist information desk where without waiting we bought bus tickets to Venice (the No 5 at 2 euros) and a three day vaporetto pass that will take you anywhere on the water as often as you like. Gondolas extra (but you have to do it!!). Outside hotel the price was 80 euros. Forget Murano and the Lido!!! DO visit Burano with it's pretty painted houses. DO book the secret tour of the Doges Palace through the hotel. You will miss very long queues and actually see far more of the palace! Wandering around Venice can be a challenge, but DO try it. Many Calles end in a canal with no bridge or a dead end. You will make friends with other lost souls. Just follow the signs to 'Ferrovia' and you WILL be fine. We have never written a review before, but on this occasion felt we had to join others in recommending this lovely hotel and say thank you for the advice from other reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel and its Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Italy for our 1 year anniversary from May 29th to June 7th. Our first stop was Venice and we stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure for one night and two days. (As you'll find, you really need just a couple days to see Venice). We arrived here around 8 in the morning from Germany and we're concerned that we wouldn't be able to check-in right away as most check-ins are usually not til the afternoon. To our surprise, Alessandro, who was at the front desk, was able to check us in and gave us an option of which room we'd like. We chose one of the bigger rooms, over looking the Grand Canal. Our room was big and so was the bathroom! It was our home away from home for the next two days. We were very comfortable here and had no problems w/ the noise, didn't hear a peep. And the view of the Grand Canal was breath taking. Alessandro was very helpful showing us where things were on the map. We walked all over Venice and we were very happy to come "home" to our nice room at the end of the day. The breakfast was great! They had a variety of foods. This hotel is also conveniently located acrross the train station which was good for us because we were heading to Florence from here via the Eurostar. We didn't have to haul our luggages across the city as we saw a lot of people of doing. And the price was very reasonable for the service we received. We'd definitely come back here again. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and eager to speak to us in English. Alessandro and Gianni were great! Also, while here, make sure you visit Ostaria al Garanhelo near Pointe Realto. It's a family owned Ostaria and Anna Lisa and the Chef, Rennato, were very friendly and most of all the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris RJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my wife to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and this was an ideal location. Staff were friendly and attentive, room superbly furnished and decorated and overlooked the Grand Canal. Breakfast good value. Would like to see tea/coffee making facilites in room though suspect this is not usual in Italy. Overall a lovely Hotel offering a high level of service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel...the whole experience was great, from check-in to check-out..... The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful with great information. I cannot say enough about the room. It was absolutely spotless, tastefully decorated and the bathroom was enormous. For the small added charge, the breakfast each morning was delightful. The location was excellent, quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of St. Mark's square, but still very convenient to all attractions. The water bus stop was a very short walk away....I would hightly recomment this hotel and can hardly wait for a return visit......

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: jryanlb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure on May 24th and 25th and I must say it far surpassed our expectations. We were on a two week trip through Italy, and this hotel was definitely the highlight. The rooms were beautifully decorated and immaculate. The staff were friendly and always helpful. The breakfast was the best of all the hotels we visited on our trip. The location of this hotel is perfect. If you arrive by train, you will see it accross the canal as soon as you step out of the train station and take in the beauty of Venice. I look forward to staying at this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!!!”
Reviews.Author: bugsybudd
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the beautiful Antiche Figure Hotel for 2 nights, May 23 and 24. I had been so excited to stay at this hotel, and was not disappointed! The room was simply gorgeous, large, beautifully furnished in venetion period style, and even had a murano glass chandelier over the king bed, as well as 3 murano glass sconces in the marble bathroom. We had a canal view room on the third floor, with a lovely view of the bridge nearby, and the parade of gondolas and various other boats of every kind below. The hotel provided nightly turndown service, with lemoncello candies on our pillow, and the even laid out our jammies! (I thought that was a nice touch!) The breakfast was good, much like our other hotels in Italy, coffee, juice, yogurt, pastries, croissants, ham, cheese, cereals, etc. The location couldn't be better, over the bridge, across the canal from the train station where we arrived from, easily spotted from the station, and a 5 minute easy walk to the airport bus station, (tickets only 3 euro, don't waste money on a water taxi!) Close to a variety of restaurants, shopping, etc. A great experiance!

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember!”
Reviews.Author: THindCornwall
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day break, staying at the antiche figure. It was a surprise gift for my 40th birthday, from my husband, and he had requested a balcony if possible. I was delighted to be told on arrival that we were allocated a room with "a 15th century balcony" for my special birthday!!!!! Our room, overlooking the grand canal was beautiful. huge bed, lovely bathroom and so clean! They even left us a sweet on our pillow each evening! The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful, and nothing is too much trouble. They are keen to know your thoughts and how they can improve things but we couldn't give them an answer on that one because there is nothing to improve!! The only thing i would say is if they offer you a complimentary visit to Murano, and the glass factory, be warned...!! The water taxi ride is great but unless you have Â£Â£Â£Â£Â£'s to spend on the very beautiful, but very expensive glass, they are not interested in you once you get to the factory!!!!! We politely left, once it was clear to the "hard sales" staff that we were not going to purchase, and walked around independently, then caught another vaparetto to Burano, which is well worth a visit!! We had a fabulous and very memorable time and would return to the hotel antiche figure without a second thought! It may not be the largest, grandest hotel in Venice, but if you want to feel that they really care about making your holiday special, then this is the place to go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Venice”
Reviews.Author: glp4bama
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with my wife for our 25th anniversary. It was away from the hustle of San Marco and Rialto but right by two water taxi stops. Great spot for arriving and departing Venice. It is just across from the train station and about 7 minutes walk from the bus station(rode bus to airport). I don't know if I could find other hotels that were farther into town as this wa our first visit to Venice. The hotel staff was superior. Provided all the useful help about what to see and how to get there. Breakfast was super! The room was large and the bathroom was the largest we had while in Italy. I don't know whatelse we could have asked for from a hotel. We were very pleased with the price, room, service and value we received. We were treated extremely well by everyone. We would stay here again and would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Antiche Figure for three nights in early May. Our room was on the first floor (one above street level) , was quite large and overlooked the canal. It's a busy location, so if you don't like street noise (voices, laughter, gondolas - no cars!) ask for a room either higher up or off the canal. The location across the canal from the train station was great - except for lugging our bags up the bridge stairs. Oh well. The staff was great - Francesca especially. Breakfast was fine, except for the coffee from the automatic machine in the dining room. AVOID IT if you consider yourself a coffee lover. Ask the staff to make you an espresso or americano from the real machine at the bar. Trust me. Oh, and try the little cafe down the alley adjacent to the hotel - the cafe right next to the laundry facility. They make excellent sandwiches!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is second to none!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say - the best hotel I ever stayed in. I've been to Tokyo, London, Rome, Sydney and nothing compares to the service and genuinely friendly and helpful atmosphere in this hotel. My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in early April purely on the strength of the reviews and comments on this site. From the moment we arrived we were treated so well it was unbelievable. We realised that maybe our experience wouldnt be quiet as good as everyone who posted here, but we were blissfully wrong. The gentleman who checked us in was so helpful and gave us loads of info on the immediate area. We had booked the famous blue room with balcony and it was a joy to behold. With marvellous views overlooking the Grand Canal, it was very spacious with lots of storage spaces and a beautiful and spotless marble bathroom. The breakfast was the usual continental style, but the young lady who ran the breakfast room was so kind and gave a warm and individual welcome every morning. She ran the place like clockwork and was so efficient and we began to think could this place get any better. It did. Unfortunately my wife was ill for a day or two during our stay, but the staff arranged for a doctor to visit her at the hotel. We obviously had to pay for this ourselves, but it was the kind and understanding way in which the staff assisted us which I will never forget. A lesser hotel might not want to know about your problems. As if that wasnt enough to recommend this hotel, the location was excellent. A short two minute walk over Scalzi bridge and you're at the St Lucia Train Station. During our stay we travelled to Milan, Florence and Vicenza on day trips and the close proximity to the station meant that we had lots more time to relax at our destination. Arriving back from Florence at 11.30pm, we were sipping a gorgeous hot chocolate at the bar in our hotel at 11.35pm! There are many fine restaurants (and an Irish bar) within a few footsteps of the hotel. I would recommend Gino's on the Rio Terra Lista di Spagna. They do a marvellous Pizza Calzone. St. Marks Square and Rialto Bridge are about a 20 minute walk from the hotel, but walking is the only true way to experience this city. Our trip was truely memorable and this was in no small part to the wonderful hotel. We will definately be returning to this hotel in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Lizard1
Reviews.Content: May 5 to May 8, 2006 The Hotel Antiche Figure delivered on it's well deserved reputation !! The rooms are quite large for Europe, the bathrooms are very fancy. The continental breakfast was excellant !! The hotel location, just steps away from the train station and vaparetto stop, is a big plus. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The desk clerks spoke wonderful English and accomodated our every need. My only complaint about our room was the large window next to the shower which required a 2nd shower curtain be pulled over it. While showering you were between 2 shower curtains, one of which would be sticking to your skin.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 8 of us have just returned from the Hotel after 4 days of of an excellent experience. The hotel was brilliantly situated on the Grand Canal opposite the railway station and the Ferrovia Water Bus stop which made travelling around easy. there was also a gondola station outside the hotel which made sitting outside with a drink after a long day very interesting. The rooms were nicely decorated with chandaliers in the room and even in the bathroom. You could pay extra for a Canal view but we didn't bother. We enjoyed a lovely breakfast each morning for which we paid 5 Euros as Expedia travellers consisting of cold meat, cheese, boiled eggs, pastries, tea, coffee and orange juice. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Whilst not in the main area of venice this was quite nice as you could get away from the larger crowds. We shall certainly be recommending this hotel to our friends and booking again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Prior to moving into an apartment for a week, we spent a night in the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice. It is located on the Grand Canal, across from the train station, admittedly not the most charming view, which may account for its price being more reasonable.It does make it easy to find and handy if you will be taking trains. Our room was small, but attractive with a fine bathroom and closet space. The breakfast was typical of our experience with Italian hotel breakfasts; baked goods, fruit, cereal, slices of ham and cheese, etc. There was a neat self-service coffee machine from which you could get a selection of coffees. The desk staff spoke fabulous English, putting we Americans to shame. as usual. Allejandro (sp.?) made the phone call for us to contact the landlord of the apartment , a task I had been dreading . He also allowed us to store our luggage for several hours after we had checked out. As you leave the hotel take a left and walk into that pretty, less comercial area. This is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Itravl2
Reviews.Content: Across the canal from the train station - you'd think it would noisy, but the room was quiet, well-appointed, and very comfortable. The staff was top notch - emailed questions were answered sometimes within an hour - when I phoned when we were in Italy already, the person who I talked to said, "when you get here, tell us what you want to do, and we will help you make it happen". What more could you want? We were only there for two days in Venice, but had great meals at small restaurants (suggested by the hotel), had a great gondola ride (with a gondolier who was 4th generation, spoke good English, and knew an amazing amount of Venetian history), went to Murano, ate dessert in front of St. Marco square (expensive, but very much part of the Venice experience), and still had time to people watch and wander around. We had an early morning flight out of Marco Polo airport - the hotel arranged a taxi (the driver walked over to the hotel to help one of our group, who needed assistance, with their bag). The breakfast, which was included with the room, was good - pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, and assorted teas, juices, and coffees. We splurged for this last hotel on our trip and had their best rooms on the top floor facing the canal, still not as expensive as staying at many other hotels. It was a great, comfortable, relaxing place to finish our 2 week trip to Italy. We hope to return to Venice and the Hotel Antiche Figure for a longer stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surrey-Bluebell
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, great location. Can't fault the hotel in any way. Didn't eat there though so can't comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: safa_in_England
Reviews.Content: I'm a tripadvisor fan and use it to decide on hotels around the world. It proved itself again in our choice of Hotel Antiche Figure for the May 1 long weekend. The hotel is lovely, it's location is excellent and its staff very helpful. We arrived a day late to the hotel, after BA cancelled our flight the previous night. When we arrived the staff were very apologetic (although it clearly wasn't their fault), and offered us free breakfast for the remainder of our stay (our expedia rate did not include breakfast) to make up for the lost day. To get to the hotel take the bus from the airport to the bus terminal in Venice. It only costs 2 euro's per person and it's only a 5 min walk from the bus terminal to the hotel. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: misterc6
Reviews.Content: Glad to see that the Antiche Figure has reached number one! We spent three days here around Liberation Day (25th April) and couldn't have wished for better. The Hotel is ideally situated for both the bus from the airport, the Ferrovia train station and the Ferrovia vaporetto stop. There is even a gondola stand immediately outside. Great breakfast (only â‚¬5 for Expedia customers, more for others) with a good selection of croissants, rolls, ham, cheese, hard boiled eggs and a wonderful panatone. Even the coffee machine produces an acceptable capaccino. Clean rooms and very helpful staff. The location is a little way away from the main attractions but we see that as a benefit especially when you can just hop on a vaporetto and get anywhere you want.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I've stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure is the most excellent hotel in every respect that I've stayed in so far. The accomodation was absolutley superb and luxurious, the staff treated me as though I was a favourite member of their family. They were helpful and courteous - nothing was too much trouble. I am intending to revisit this hotel during the next few weeks. Thanks so much for a memorable and lovely break.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel; perfect position”
Reviews.Author: annesh
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our first trip to Venice after reading Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. We travelled from the airport on the bus which stops 5 minutes away. the staff were friendly and helpful, the room beautifully furnished, the bed comfortable and enormous and these two duvet-haters both appreciated the fact that there were sheets and blankets. we also had fun getting lost in the backstreets nearby. If we ever get to Venice again (and there is a lot we didn't have time to see) we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: mdvlage
Reviews.Content: As many of us do, I count on the feedback I read on TA to decide on hotels. I want to say thanks to all the others who take time to write about their experiences. I chose the Antiche Figure for a week long visit to Venice based on TA notes and could not have picked a better hotel! Our next stay will absolutely be booked at this hotel. Roxanne

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!!”
Reviews.Author: HCn_11
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a real gem. It is only 5 minutes walk from the bus station(airport shuttle - 3 euros each way!!) and 2 minutes walk from the train station and the nearest vaporetto. The hotel is brilliantly placed for exploring Venice without the constant bustle of the central attractions. Our room was beautifully appointed with a georgeous and fully functional bathroom. Breakfast, for a small surcharge, was varied and fresh and made a great start to the day. What makes this hotel special above all else is the staff. They were unfailingly friendly, polite and helpful. They made you feel special and were cearly pleased that we had chosen the Antiche Figure. I have stayed in many hotels. Despite(or perhaps because of) its size,this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. If you want a really comfortable, accessible and friendly place to stay, you will not find better. I spent hours readng reviews before I picked this hotel. Save yourself the effort and worry. Just book it!! We will return to Venice and we will stay at the Antiche Figure.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Figure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous find! I loved the Antiche Figure in so many ways, the Grand Canal view, the Gondolas at the doorstep, the beautifully appointed bedroom & magnificient bathroom, the tasty breakfast and the most charming and helpful staff and manager. I highly recommend checking this chic hotel out. Shame my visit was only for 4 days, I could have stayed in this small Venetian palace a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DowningUk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got back late last night from a two night stay in Venice on 9th and 10th April using this hotel. Venice exceeded our expectations - and the hotel made our stay extra special. Well done to all the staff at Hotel Antiche Figure for reaching No 1 in Tripadvisor! Location - excellent as it is a 5 min walk from coach station at Piazzale Roma, opposite the train station, adjacent to the Ponte d Scalzi Bridge (one of the three bridges to cross the Grand Canal) and opposite the Ferrovia waterbus stop. Hotel - extremely well maintained, spotlessly clean, excellent decor and furnishings throughout. We arrived on an early flight, and as a room had already been cleaned, it was made available to us early so we were able to settle in, freshen up and go straight into Venice. We had a red room to the rear on the 4th floor, which had a lovely view of the Grand Canal. Staff - they were all extremely welcoming, polite and helpful. The hotel receptionist booked the Ducale Palace secret tour for us (which is well worth visiting). Breakfast - this is provided in two small beautifully decorated rooms. Plenty of choice ie: rolls, ham, cheese, cereal, croissants, muffins, eggs, yoghurts, orange juice and coffee/tea etc. Recommendations - use the vaporetta (waterbuses) - buy the tickets at the booths entering the main landing stages ie: Ferrovia (single fare E5, 24 hr ticket E12, 72 hr ticket E25) and pickup a timetable. Don't just stick to main sights ie: Piazza San Marco (St Marks), Rialto Bridge etc, but meander the back streets by foot. We also took the waterbus to other islands ie: Burano (famous for lace and has wonderfully coloured houses), and Murano (famous for glass blowing). We used a local restaurant recommended by the hotel which was very nice, and also a restaurant using their tourist menu which was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel - made our stay really special”
Reviews.Author: wellfmj
Reviews.Content: Have been reading the reviews of this hotel - stayed there March 28th for 2 nights - wonderful - excellent location, friendly and helpful staff and amazing room - upgraded to look out over the Grand Canal - never expected to have such a luxurious room in Venice - well done trip advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Charlie-Sam
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are spot on. The hotel is in a perfect location. Great rooms, friendly staff and close to lots of good restaurants. Being opposite one of only 3 bridges that crosses the Grand canal and a main Vaporetto stop it is very easy to explore Venice from this hotel. There are so many nice walks from Rialto Bridge to the hotel- make sure you explore the canals behind the hotel. The Scalzi restaurant opposite the bridge serves great food and is good value for money. A good tip- wherever you are in Venice there are numerous signs for "Ferrovia" (Train Station) which will always lead you back to the hotel. If we go back to Venice, we wouldn't stay anywhere else! PS Avoid Harry's bar- Overpriced and nothing to see!!

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Venice, for so many reasons.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research, and I am not really sure why we ended up choosing the Antiche Figuera. When you plan this kind of short trip in advance, you have loads of time to think and worry about the hotel you've booked, no matter how much you think you have made the right decision. Will it be clean, what will the rooms/beds/breakfast etc be like. Well we needn't have worried. What a great little hotel, we had a wonderful bed in good spacious room and a fantastic 'twin' bathroom. The buffet style breakfast in the little breakfast room was great as well, just what we wanted for a weekend break. A superb location for traveling into Venice, being just opposite the main railway station. It was great to walk out of the Railway station and see the hotel just across the canal (with one of the bridges just there as well). And from the moment we checked in the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We arrived in the morning as rooms were being prepared, and as we the first guest of the day, we were give a few sets of keys and invited to check out a few different rooms. We opted to pay a small additional supplement and took a large room on the top floor (there is a lift), with wonderful views out of 3 window over the canal. It was a birthday weekend for me, and the hotel accommodation made it for me, it could not have been better. We definitely plan to go back for my 40th birthday next year and take some friends and family with us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about Hotel Antiche Figure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure. The hotel is directly across from the train station, just walk down the front steps and look across the Grand Canal. You couldn't ask for a more convenient location! The rooms were impeccably clean, well furnished and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. We were there for Carnival and the hotel offered capes and hats to rent (extremely inexpensive) for the day so we could enjoy the celebrations. I have travelled extensively throughout Europe and would recommend this hotel in a heart beat to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: rthManteca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the Antiche Figure. The room was fantastic. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. The location is wonderful with a beautiful view of the grand canal and very close to the S. Lucia train terminal. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great especially for late night arrival at Santa Lucia”
Reviews.Author: vibiaron
Reviews.Content: The reviews don't lie - this hotel is really a find. The location is great - it's literally across the Grand Canal from the Santa Lucia train station. We had a red room (not a canal view) and it was quite small, but clean and charming. The bathroom had all the amenities and was really nice for a 3-star hotel. One world of caution, though. While it is literally steps from the station, it's the "steps" you need to keep in mind. To get over the canal, you need to go over a bridge that is all steps up and down. If you're over 50 and you're carrying a small suitcase and a tote bag, you'll be puffing by the time you get to the other side. I think it was worth it. We arrived at 8:30 p.m., checked in, dropped our bags, and went to find a pizzeria. That in itself is a typically Venetian adventure at night. To keep your bearings, just keep looking up to follow the signs for Rialto and make sure that the Grand Canal (the water) is always on your left. The rooms have high-speed internet access, but you must remind them when you check in to enable it. Also, the ethernet jack in our room was behind the TV armoire which we had to move to find. The gentleman who checked us in forgot to mention that little tidbit! We took the ATVO bus from the Piazzale Roma (10 min. walk with luggage and 2 bridges - remember the steps) to Marco Polo the next morning. CAUTION: You must buy your ticket for this bus in the ticket office at the plaza before you board the bus. The only time they allow you to buy your ticket on the bus is when the office is closed. We found out the hard way, although the driver very kindly and patiently waited for us (and about 5 other unaware tourists) to run and buy the tickets at the office. Imagine an American bus driver doing that!

Reviews.Title: “deserves every bit of praise”
Reviews.Author: traveldawg
Reviews.Content: Everything that you've read about the Antiche Figure is true. It is truly an amazing find. At the time I booked, Trip Advisors had it listed as their #2 hotel in Venice, and when I searched several hotels and sites for prices, the Antiche Figure also came up as one of the best rates. (I found a wide variation of rates on various sites - it may be worth searching thoroughly.) I require internet connection when traveling to be able to work, and I found one site listed this as a feature but all others didn't. I emailed the hotel and got a friendly response almost instantly. When I checked in, they knew my name and had an internet cord waiting for me with my room key. The staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel was beautiful. The room and the beds are huge - even for American hotels. The bathroom is large and spacious with marble floors. Everything is immaculately clean. I truly cannot find a single thing to list as even a mild negative. I opted for the canal view upgrade when checking in and was glad I did. I was on the upper floor so my windows were smaller than the other floors, but i found that cozy. The location is the only thing that I can think that may keep the prices low at this hotel, but I found it to be an advantage, not a negative. It is literally right across from the train station and anywhere in Venice, you have to haul your bags by hand. It was nice to have a short walk from the station to the hotel when I arrived. Vaparettos are right at the train station, so getting on one to journey anywhere you wanted in Venice was easy and efficient. Enjoy the Antrche Figure. It was the best part of my stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure in March 2006. Unfortunately, it was only for one night. Our stay was fantanstic. Everyone was so helpful and kind. When asked where to eat, we were pointed in the direction of a local pizzeria/restaurant. It was great also. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The location was great. We had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: elaine-7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay in venice- made all the more perfect with the Hotel Antiche Figure! What more can i add to what has already been written - the views onto the grand canal from our 4th floor room were amazing! Service was impecable. It is well worth paying the five euro for breakfast if you book with expedia; lots of choice and it really sets you up for the day ahead. Highlights of the trip for us were St Marks Square (obviously), The Basillica - although if you don't have a head for heights avoid climbing up to the balcony, my knees would not stop wobbling! Doge's palace was great for a rainy day. Do not miss Titian's Assumption of Mary in Santa Maria Gloriosa dei frari - it is truely a masterpiece! The Rialto Bridge is worth a photo opportunity but the crowds do get busy here, even in March. To get away from all the hustle and bussle of venice, a trip on the direct vaporetta to the islands of Murano, Burano and Torcello is recomended. A haven of peace and quiet but not too far away from all the action back in venice. Finally do not miss grabbing a front seat of the vaporetta, (Numbers 1 or 82), sailing up the grand canal with a birds eye view of venice laid out before you! - Fantastic! N.B don't bother with a map - they are useless,just follow the crowd and be prepared to get wonderfully lost!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bash1
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all expectations! It is superbly located just 5 minutes walk from the piazza roma - no need to try and travel on the vaperetto with your luggage. The staff are more than welcoming and remember all guests individually - this really adds to the holiday making you feel special and valued. They can't do enough for you and have a couple of restaurants they recommend which are superb. The accommodation itself is spotless and has a luxurious feel - we were lucky enough to stay in a blue room with stunning views overlooking the grand canal. The breakfast room is small but quaint and there is a good variety of breakfast items on offer following a continental theme. The location also ensures you discover the whole of Venice - if staying in/near St Marks Square it would be too easy not to venture further afield. The hotel istelf is located not too far from a hidden gem in Venice - the Frari Church, which is definately worth a visit. All in all a fantastic holiday which would not have been the same if not for the stay in the Antiche Figure - we will definitely be returning one day!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel, from a seasoned traveller”
Reviews.Author: PaulJP
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend staying at this hotel. Rooms very clean, beautifully decorated, and excellent value for money. Receptionist gave a detailed, useful and friendly introduction to Venice on arrival. Unfortunately, I did not receive a wake-up call on my last day (as requested), but this will not detract from a wonderful 4 day break.

Reviews.Title: “Little Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Bart_ollie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in Venice. I love Venice anyway but the Hotel Antiche Figure made the stay even more special. The hotel and rooms look immaculate as if only recently decorated. Our room had a huge comfortable bed and the bathroom was luxurious and spotless. Breakfast buffet was generous. All the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. Recommend getting the 3 day bus pass as it doesn't matter if you get on the wrong boat occasionally as we did. Although generally all travel was really easy to understand including buses back to the airport. Just remember the hotel is opposite the railway station and you can't go wrong. We found the location good as it was easy to find when we arrived and easy to get to the airport from. It also overlooked the Grand Canal which was a bonus. It is a little way from the main attractions but nowhere is difficult to get to in Venice as the bus services are so good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Treatment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! We booked with no real prior knowledge through Expedia. The bus from the airport cost a mere two Euros and dropped us just round the corner from this hotel. We received five star treatment ( in this three star hotel ). The desk staff were outstanding in their helpfulness and their recommendation of a local trattoria was so good we went there every evening. The room was beautifully appointed and we even had Venetian glass chandeliers in the bathroom. The breakfast was invoiced separately, but at five euros each was superb value with a choice of yoghurt, fruit, cereals, cold meats, cheese, various breads and croissants, preserves, etc. etc. The hotel is superbly situated for the water buses ( vaporetto ) and the main train station, enabling us to explore the entire Venetian lagoon and some cities inland too. I would more than happily stay at the Antiche Figure anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tostka
Reviews.Content: We booked our first trip to Venice last December, and just arrived back from our trip last night. We booked 6 nights at Antiche Figure based completely on the high-praise for the hotel found in the posts here. Our experience is that AF is a stellar value. The day we arrived we were offered either a red room (on the side away from the Grand Canal) at our booked rate, a blue room (top floor front facing the canal, as a 25eur/day upgrade), or since we were staying so many days, the apartment the hotel owns. We took the top floor front blue room, so I have no details about the apartment, although other folks have mentioned it in these reviews. We simply decided that the original Pallazzo windows and longer/better view from the fourth floor sounded too good to pass up. *The hotel is incredibly convenient to the 3euro airport atvo-bus drop at Piazalla Roma (5mins walk down the canal to the landmark 'big green dome church' across the Grand Canal from the modern "Ferrovia" train station) *The room was spotless. *The bathroom was great: marble floors, walls, sizable tub with hand-shower. Nice modern fixtures. And of course the oft-mentioned beautiful murano crystal fixtures. *king-size bed (dbl-twin) mattresses). *mini-bar hidden in the desk (not cheap: 4euro cokes, but hey, it's extremely convenient and nothing in Venice is cheap :D) *a few foibles - not issues, as these aren't essential or even wanted items -- just differences compared to what you may see in western hotels: no alarmclock/radio (but wakeup calls are avail), no iron, no vending machines, no ice machine (that we saw). I mention these simply so that you can bring suitable items if you want them... *we booked through travelocity and the included continental breakfast was good. Nice array of options (croissants, meat, cheese, a nice rolled coffee cake,cereals,soft-boiled eggs in the shell, a variety of yogurts, etc...), all tasted very good, and you could eat as much as you wanted - no reason for anyone to go hungry. The lady policing the breakfast room was a pleasant blur of motion as she sailed around keeping the tables cleared & stocked. Yes the coffee from the machine is very strong, and be sure to use the 'stop' button to keep it from over-filling your cup.:D We got a table daily around 9:40am in the breakfast room. Except one day, when they had very few people checking out, all but two rooms booked and everyone decided to eat between 9 & 10 -- that was the only day that we actually saw they'd had to expand service to the tables out in the bar out front... We were there during the very slow period in Feb, but I could see where it could be a real scramble to get in for breakfast in July/Aug. Also, I can't for the life of me believe there's a review here from someone that sat in the breakfast room and waited for "service". It's pretty clear it's a self-serve breakfast with several buffet tables of things to eat. *the staff is great. From management to the lady that cleaned our room. They were very interested in how happy we were, actively solicited ideas for improvements, and suggested several wonderful restaraunts when we asked. On serveral occasions they offered to make reservations for their recommendations. *When you're in Venice, USE THE VAPPRETTOS and available multi-day passes! We walked everywhere for five of the six days and my feet took a heck of a beating (still got the blisters to show for it). Not to mention, Venice can be a pretty tough town to navigate in on-foot, as the chains of signs leading you from "Ferrovia" (the landmark train station near hotel) to "Rialto" & "S. Marco" can be very easy to lose track of as you're navigating. We got solidly lost at least once a day -- found ourselves coming back to the hotel through the soon-all-too-familiar Cannaregio section instead of the shorter Rialto route, on several ocassions. It can get frustrating. The vapprettos are easy, fast, and largely fool-proof. Just sit down and watch things go by. Not to mention they're alot less excertion than hiking.:D *We loved Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo! Ended up eating there FOUR TIMES! We had some difficulty with book-recommended restaraunts all over town (all but one of the 7 we tracked down on foot from Rick Steves' 2006 & Knopf Cityguide were permanently/seasonally closed). So whenever we got tired of tracking around town to restaraunts that may or may not be open, we just went to Vecio Pozzo! They always recognized us and greeted us warmly each visit. They've even got a web site with a large gallery of pictures, although it doesn't show the best part: the wonderful food or the people!: ---. Map at the site. As others have mentioned, it's a few blocks along the street on the right of the hotel, on Corte Canal # 656. *Another restaraunt recommended by the manager was Trattoria Antica Besseta. Very nice seafood, although the restaraunt was hard for us to find. We had both directions on our map (drawn by AF's manager) and a map on the back of the Besetta business card he gave us, and we still got completely lost and had to ask directions. 1395 Salizada de CÃ  Zusto (3-4 blks NE of the hotel). *Finally, another good spot from the Knopf Cityguide, that was open not very expensive and had great food, though not particularly close to the hotel, was Osteria Ai Assassini, in San Marco, On Rio Tera Dei Assassini, #3695 (several blks north of the Fenice Opera house off of Calle D. Verona).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mebsy
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel very much. The position is ideal, just 5 minutes walk from Piazza La Roma where the buses stop from the airport. The decor is lovely, the place is spotlessly clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nice with a lot of things to choose from. We will be going there again, no doubt, watch out here we come!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: Hertzdonut
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across from the main train station and is in easy walking distance from the main bus depot. The hotel is among the best value I have found at after staying in about 100 hotels across Europe. It was recently renovated and everything is clean and the staff is incredibly helpful. It was the first time I have ever been asked by any hotel employee "How could we improve the experience for future guests". Such a profound concept coming from a European, as customer service is typically lacking in many establishments.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience for us!”
Reviews.Author: Susan_Norfolk_07
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 3 months ago after reading good reviews on Tripadvisor and it lived up to all expectations. The room was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful. We "splashed out" and booked a canal view room for 4 nights and it was definitely worth it. Watching Venetian life pass by from our duel aspect 3rd floor room added an extra dimension to our holiday. Many hints and tips can be found in previous reviews but the ones I would particularly endorse include: Buying the 3 day waterbus ticket. The free trip to Murano by watertaxi (bookable at the hotel reception). Eating at the Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo a few minutes walk away (again, bookable at reception) If you're visiting the Doge's Palace consider buying a Museum ticket which will also give free access to other museums in the city. We spent an enjoyable (and inexpensive!) final day hopping on and off the vaporettos visiting those we had previously missed. Another invaluable tip was to follow the signs to "Ferrovia" (station) to find your way back to the hotel. Finally - we paid an extra 5 euros each for breakfast which was good value. I had read in previous reviews about the infamous coffee machine. I have to say it was fine for our morning tea but the coffee was not good! However,when I mentioned it on departure, I was informed by a member of staff that a freshly made coffee may be ordered and brought on request. So that's my main new tip to pass on to future guests! We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this place....”
Reviews.Author: JohnandEileen
Reviews.Content: Thank you to contributors to Tripadvisor - we booked this hotel for a long weekend in Venice in January and we really could not fault it. Don't be put off by the 3* superior rating, the price or the photos, it is excellent. Arriving into the bus station/railway station (can't stand the boarding scrum for Ryanair but that is another issue) go over the bridge, turn left along the canal, walk 100 metres and you are there. It is not the best end of the city, but you will be smiling watching the other passengers struggle to St Mark's Square. The hotel is warm and friendly. We booked a canal view room, which was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The marble bathroom was excellent and the whole place just looks new and well cared for. The staff were so helpful, booking restaurants and concerts for us and nothing was too much trouble. They also take a pride in maintaining standards and know how highly they are rated on Tripadvisor. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anybody. Points to note - Expedia bookings do not include breakfast which is 5 euros and worth it. The view over the Grand Canal is mostly of the train station which isn't the prettiest view in Venice. You may get a little noise from the river buses but this quietens down at night and shouldn't put you off. You will also notice that the lift makes an annoying noise when it arrives but again these are only minor issues. If you want a reasonable break in Venice definitely book this place. Get the Time Out guide as it was briliant for restaurants, also get a 22 euro boat pass when you arrive which is great value. Take some very warm clothes if you go in January. If you can, avoid Treviso airport until they have built the new terminal - the current one is a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Antiche Figure was perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Antiche Figure right after Christmas, 2005. STAFF- front desk, housekeepers, breakfast room attendants... ALL were always very nice and helpful. Front desk staff all spoke excellent english. LOCATION - PERFECT location. Right on the canal. Right across (literally) from the train station and vaperreto stop. 30 minute stroll (timed it) from Plaza San Marco. ROOMS - beautiful, clean and comfortable. BREAKFAST - Great! for a continental breakfast, they had a wide variety of foods. Coffee machine was a bit wonky, but nothing's perfect. Breakfast room attendant was incredibly nice and helped me put together a breakfast tray for my husband when he was sick. Even ran out to open the elevator for me!!! RETURN? - in a heartbeat!!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Waldorf Astoria!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last weekend we arrived in a very cold and misty Venice, but what a warm welcome we got in hotel Antiche Figure! At the reception Alessandro patiently and kindly informed us about the hotel, breakfast etc. We had booked one of the spacious canal view rooms (blue room, nr. 211), preferably with balcony and so we got it! The room was beautifully furnished, very clean with excellent king size beds and a super luxurious marble bath room with Venetian chandeliers. We have also stayed at the Waldorf in NY, but the room we had there was not as well maintained as ours in Antiche Figure! The location of the hotel is also perfect: the vaporetto and railway station just in front. The area is more quiet but when you cross the bridge you are in a lively area with shops, restaurants etc., but not as expensive as in the San Marco area (E 10,-- for a sip of coffee, shame on them; please make sure you also double check the bill!!). We can really recommend this lovely hotel with very service minded staff: the breakfast lady (we think she's called Linda) fulfils are your breakfast wishes with pleasure, she's great and very hardworking. Unfortunately we missed Francesca, who was on a holiday. Gianni who helped us check-out was also a very service minded and kind guy and helped us efficiently with our transfer to the airport. We can highly recommend this lovely hotel and we would like to thank the wonderful staff and send them regards from Holland. We think Antiche Figure should be ranked no. 1 on Trip Advisor for Venice hotels! Josephine & Barbara

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Peewak
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from the very helpful staff and we upgraded,on arrival,to Grande Canal view,for very reasonable price. Room was clean,nicely furnished ,and the view..... well,what can I say?... Breakfast was basic ,but,ok..hotel bar prices very reasonable,and the offer of a free trip to Murano was available but,due to restricted time,and the fact that it was snowing,didn't go this time. Would recommend la Zucca restaurant (@10 mins walk from hotel) and Canneraggio district seems lively (some great little bars). The hotel is ideally placed,very handy for train station and coach depot (P.le Roma) = 5 min. walk max. When we return,as we surely will,the Antiche Figure will be top of the list,and we have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: micniclongo
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we chose the hotel Antiche Figure. The hotel is conveniently situated near the Piazzale di Roma and just opposite the train station. The staff was very helpful, and a special mention should go to Linda in the breakfast room who was very attentive and went "that extra mile". We upgraded to a room overlooking the canale grande and that was certainly an excellent move for only EUR 30.00 a day extra. A lovely little hotel and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For Venice the staff was very couteous and friendly, which in my opinion says a lot. The hotel was a great find. We were upgraded to a canal view room upon check in for only 20 euros more. Excellent location on the Grand Canal and right across from Santa Lucia Station. I would recommend and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very special for us - Hong accepted my marrage proposal while at this hotel. I believe this hotel room facing the water had more to do with her yes decision than me. > I would like to make a formal recommendation for two > workers at the hotel while I visited. > > Alexandro and Francesco were the exceptional during > our stay and were able to talk very well in English to > help us visit Venezia. > > Thank you very much and I would recommend this hotel > to anyone. > > We plan to return again and stay with you. thanks > This hotel has top quality materials, and experienced people that are motivated and happy to help their guest. /mpd

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Venice at Piazzale Roma by bus from the airport and were able to walk to Antiche Figure Hotel with our luggage and, later, to return to the Piazzale for our rental car when we left Venice. The hotel is also across the Grand Canal from the train station and from a vaporetta stop. For us, it was very well situated. The accommodations were very comfortable and the staff helpful. It is an excellent place to stay while in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the great reviews about this hotel on tripadvisor, my wife and I decided to book this hotel for a short 3 night city break. This is certainly an impressive hotel with service to match. The staff were always helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble which of course made our stay all the more comfortable and enjoyable. To see many of the tourist sights, walking really is the best way to get around Venice (together with a good map-which the hotel provided) and with that in mind, the location of this hotel couldn't be better. The room we had was spotless. In summary, we have no hesitation in recommending this first-class hotel to anyone wishing to enjoy the splendour of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, excellent rooms, excellent and friendly staff, you cant go wrong is right in the heart of everything overlooking the canal. Would definately stay there again, made our stay in Venice brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Such a loverly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic Hotel to stay in. Staff very helpful and friendly. The location is great only 5 mins away from where the bus dropped us off. All attractions close enough to walk to so very little money needs to be spend on water buses. The view of the canel was out of this world. venice is an excellent place, so much to see and explore. The rooms in the Hotel Antiche Figure are just right large beds and lots of storage space. The decoration is beautiful. The whole atmosphere was very romanic. Would definatly recommend and hope to go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Antiche Figaro in November and found it to be perfect for our needs. Excellent, canal view room and friendly staff who helped no end. We would not hesitate to return, and recommend it!! Take advantage of the Hotel recommendations with regard to food and you won't be disappointed. Vaperetto stop outside the hotel, however we used this rarely as it was easily walkable to all major sights. Fantastic location close to the Piazza de Roma, so only a 5 min walk to the hotel from where the bus drops you off.

Reviews.Title: “As Per Great Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Izz30
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of the consistantly good reviews given to it via Trip Advisor. The best thing about the hotel is the honesty and integrity of the staff which I have found lacking in some Venetian Hotels. I suppose this is understandable with the huge number of tourists there. It was very clean, quiet, the staff appear to enjoy their job and your presence and very good value for money. I will stay here again if I get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to Venice for a short two night stay on our way to Rome. Venice overall, is not for me. I was bored to tears after the first night. I think after you do Saint Mark's square, feed the pigeons, and do the gondola, not sure what else there is to do. Of course we are two females (28 and 29), and not romantics, or honeymooning. We were looking to party and there was no partying to be had in Venice. Anyway, the location of this hotel CANNOT be beat, it was so nice to hop off the train (from Florence and Milan respectively), and cross the bridge and we are at our hotel. Of course we over packed and had to negotiate the stairs, but that's ok, we didn't have to hassle with the water taxi's or figure out the water bus schedules. That was great! I got to the hotel first and my room was ready on the first floor and we were pleasantly surprised. The use of a full length mirror with two females was very handy. Also, liked having the use of a safe in the room, and we loved the shower/tub combo, since this is rare. The location of the hotel is near restaurants and the concierge was very helpful and went above and beyond. They translated for us, when my girlfriend picked up a Milan soccer player that only spoke Italian; we only spoke English and some Spanish/French. Other than the concierge telling us he was a millionaire (NOT), she was a good sport about relaying messages. The b-fast was average, but this is a real deal and we booked it on Travelocity for like $125/night, so we were happy with our hotel choice. Thanks tripadvisor community, you got this one right. choice. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyingmikewhisky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a weekend at the Hotel Antiche Figure, which we booked entirely on the basis of the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were delighted with the hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it very highly. It is small, intimate, decorated to a very high standard and has very helpful, charming, English-speaking staff. It is located on the side of the Grand Canal in Santa Croce, right next door to San Simeone Piccolo (large church with green dome). It is easily walked from either the train station (directly opposite the hotel via the Scalzi Bridge), or from the bus station in Piazzale Roma. If you are coming in from Marco Polo airport, take the blue ATVO bus (3 euro)which takes about 20 minutes. When you disembark the bus in Piazzale Roma, walk down the steps at the side of the Santa Chiara Hotel on to the banks of the Grand Canal. It's about a five minute walk (across two small bridges). The location is great, because you're not reliant on the vaporetto and a long walk before you get to your hotel. The restaurants recommended are cheaper and friendlier than those in the touristy areas around the Rialto bridge and San Marco. Just be prepared to walk a fair amount but we certainly felt that it was worth it, and we'd have no hesitation in going back to Hotel Antiche Figure!

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate - book it!”
Reviews.Author: PETPOP
Reviews.Content: This is the ideal place to stay in Venice - a little away from the main tourist sites and the crowds but close enough to get to them easily and quickly by boat. The bus from Treviso airport stops 5 minutes walk away so there are just two small bridges to haul your luggage over - and the railway station is opposite if you come by train - again just 5 minutes walk over the Scalzi bridge. Your luggage can be stored if necessary after check out. There are plenty of quaint little alleyways, squares, shops, churches etc to explore [and get lost in!] close by after you have done the major sights. The view from the front [blue] rooms over the Grand Canal is well worth paying a bit extra for - the rooms are larger, not noisy, and watching the busy river traffic can be quite entertaining. We learned that the hotel was renovated and opened about three years ago - the rooms are spotless, very well equipped, comfortable and cosy with well designed quality fittings and fabric wallpaper [unmarked!] - even glass chandeliers over the two sinks in our large bathroom! Breakfast was certainly more than adequate - but there are no hot cooked eggs/bacon/sausage etc - previous writers comments have either been noted or expectations were too high. Staff are friendly - position is ideal - just note that there is no hotel lounge or restaurant so in bad weather the bar or your room is the only place to relax. Hence the three rather than five stars the hotel deserves. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights (two couples) at the end of October. Great rooms with balconies overlooking the Grand Canal. Nice breakfasts. Staff very helpful - would definitely go again, and recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “This is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: deeva72
Reviews.Content: Once again, based on TripAdvisor's recommendation, we booked a winner! We arrived in Venice during a terrential downpour of rain after getting off of the train. It was nice to see that the Hotel Antiche Figure was just across the canal (which took us 5 minutes to walk to). We were greeted by the staff who were super friendly and the best service we had so far during our Europe trip. We booked a room facing the Grand Canal and it was definitely worth it as the view was beautiful! Venice is a truly romantic city and the Hotel Antiche Figure lived up to the romantic mood. Our room was large and the murano chandeliers in the room and in the washroom was a nice added touch. Our washroom was large with a double sink. We were very comfortable in this hotel as the soundproofing was quite good as well. The breakfast was good with a fair selection. The boat trip to Murano island was free and worthwhile to visit. All in all, we loved Venice and we would like to thank the staff at Hotel Antiche Figure for making our stay such a memorable one. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best place we stayed at in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: minnowlam28
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms are smaller, similar to every hotel room in Italy but it was beautifully decorated. There were Venetian glass fixtures in the room and the bathroom, which added to the charm. The bed was a king size bed which provided us lots of room to relax at the end of a busy day sight-seeing. The location is right across from the train station, which was perfect since we spent 12 days in Italy traveling from city to city by train. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They really wanted to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The breakfast provided lots of choices and for an extra $5 Euros/day, it was of great value. The area around the hotel was wonderful and safe unlike other hotels in Italy by the train station. We enjoyed sitting in front of the hotel, having a drink at the end of the night and enjoying the canal view. We loved the atmosphere of this hotel and would recommend it to anyone going to Venice. By far our favourite hotel in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, convenient location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: khc425
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with our stay at this property. The room was large and beautifully decorated with furniture that was well matched to the romantic venetian vibe. The bathroom was large, clean, and even had venetian glass light fixtures. This was the nicest room we stayed in while in Italy. The location across from the the modern looking train station on the Grand Canal was not entirely romantic, but extremely practical. It allowed us to avoid lugging our luggage around on foot or on the often crowded vapporettos. Service was always friendly if not entirely knowledgable. The hotel provided umbrellas in the lobby for their guest when it rained, and we got a great restaurant recommendation for a place frequented by locals.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, lovely gem”
Reviews.Author: RonPaxton
Reviews.Content: For your first nights in Venice, after an overnight flight or a long train ride, I cannot conceive of a nicer intro to Venice. This lovely, quaint gem is close to the bus and train stations and to a major vaporetta stop. The management was extreemly gracious and helpful. While a bit pricey, this is Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo magnifico!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bkgolfer
Reviews.Content: The vast majority of responders here are in total agreement that Antiche Figure is one of the best!!! If it were in New York City, it would be a five star establishment. Put it in the top 10 as Manager, Alessandro, hopes it will soon be placed. It deserves it. Antiche is a definitive part of the joy of Venice. The staff, especially Alessandro(you can tell by the gentlemanly way he responds to those who ran into difficultly), Francesca, and Gianni, were always available, helpful and very communicative(in either English or Italian!). The breakfast was more than adequate(would agree that a specially brewed cup of coffee would improve things slightly-but the machine provided some mirth when clients found it difficult to operate and had it run over on them! Nothing serious, but a delightful way to wake up in the morning!). The views, area in Venice, accessibility to everything, and the benefits of using the hotel for trips to Murano, etc. are all splendid! Room was well attended, carefully groomed, large enough for two of us, with a more than adequate bathroom. The setting reminded us of our stay in the Hotel Riva in Giardini, Sicily. Similar hotel, similar staff, all top drawer. Thank you, Alessandro, Francesca, and Gianni for a wonderful four day stay! We will try to get back to see you, but if we are delayed, don't forget, we would love to extend the flavor to you should you decide to visit our New York area. Ti saluto affettuosamente, Bob and Vicki

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winelover10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 2 other couples just returned from a whirlwind trip to Italy!! We stayed 2 nights in Venice at the Antiche Figure Hotel located right on the Grand Canal!! It is just across from the train station and very convenient !! We had a Canal view room located on the 4th floor and it was absolutely wonderful! Nice and spacious with a large bathroom with double vanities. The service was excellent and the staff was courteous-helpful and went above and beyond to make our stay one that we wiill never forget!! When I return to Venice, Antiche Figure will be the place where I will stay again!! Thank You, A Very Satisfied Customer

Reviews.Title: “This is a great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel in a location convenient to vaporetti, the train station and the bus terminal. They serve a delicious breakfast, included in the room rate. Rooms are clean and comfortable. It is the staff, however, that is the hotel's prize asset - very friendly, very helpful, and anxious to make your stay a pleasant and memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure, Location is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Shaz E
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Antiche Figure, what a wonderful location as it's only a 10 min walk from the bus station situated right by the Grand Canal, as you get off the coach at the bus station look along the canal for the church with the green dome and you will find the hotel right next door. So while everyone else is walking past with their suitcases you are already settled in, and sat at your table outside the hotel with a glass of Prosecco relaxing and reflecting on what a gem of a hotel you have found, because it is a gem. The staff are very accomodating, as soon as you walk through the door of this wonderful hotel it feels like home, the room we had was a triple, very well decorated with a stunning bathroom, soft towels, plenty of hot water and a hairdryer. The beds were a good size and the room had a fridge and a safe for no extra charge. Breakfast, although it was only a continental was adequate and a welcome start to the day in a pleasant environment, the staff again very friendly. I could not rate this hotel highly enough and it's a wonderful base for anyone visiting Venice. Some other information I would like to share if you are planning a trip to Venice and landing at Marco Polo Airport walk out to where the buses stop and take the Blue ATVO coach to Piazzale Roma only 3 euros, a cheap way to get to the above hotel and it only takes 20 mins. Also if you choose to stay at the above hotel and want to try a lovely restaurant walk down the alley way to the left of the hotel as you walk out of the front entrance and part way down on the left is a restaurant called Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo, the food is mouth watering and used alot by the locals, which is always a good sign. This hotel and the location of it made our trip to Venice as I am sure it would for anyone reading this review.

Reviews.Title: “5 star accommodation for a 3 star price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our tour of Europe and were so impressed with this hotel. All the staff could not have been more helpful with directions, sight seeing recommendations and restaurants. We had a blue room as we felt we needed a little bit of room and preferred a view of the Grand Canal We were certainly not disappointed. After a busy day shopping and sighteeing we would arrive back to our beautiful room with a bottle of vino, open our windows to the Grand Canal and watch Venetian life pass by, it was brilliant! The twin basin bathroom with beautiful chandeliers was a little luxury also when there is two of you. After choosing this hotel from many on tripadvisor we were so relieved to find it was everything we had hoped, read and wished for. Thank you Alessandro and Gianni for a memorable stay! I hope to one day return with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend Antiche Figure”
Reviews.Author: 1buckley
Reviews.Content: We were just in Venice for 2 nights (far too brief). The weather was poor, but the hotel more than made up for that, being the nicest hotel of our entire trip to Italy. We had a large room overlooking the canal, with a great bathroom. I found this hotel to be as asthetically pleasing as it was friendly and comfortable. We were a party of 3 couples and we all agreed the location was very good. We really enjoyed Gianni, who helped us with everything, right down to providing me information on how to purchase one of the beautiful light fixtures I admired there. Another highlight was an Enoteca (wine bar/restaurant) we went to that friends had recommended. Gianni said it is well-known and can help you find it. The owner is a real character and has written a guide book on Enoteca's throughout Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Antiche Figure the BEST”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was hard to believe this Hotel was only rated a "3"! My husband & I started our European vacation with a cruise to the Greek Islands and finished with 3 days at this hotel. It is located so close to the port that we were able to check out the hotel before we even took off for Greece. As such, we were able to look forward to even more luxury, comfort and entertainment once disembarked. This hotel has an excellent location for purposes of transportation to anywhere/anything. The staff were not only exceptional in demeanor and helpfulness, but also in timely direction to our every need. ALWAYS presented with a smile! They even extended this service and characteristic to anyone coming in off the walkway to get information! Our room was extremely accommodating/comfortable and even 'quiet,' as it faced the Grand Canal. We WILL come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel...very close to the train station which is great. Pretty far from the main tourist sights (i.e. San Marco Piazza). You can go to Murano and watch glass blowing completely free of charge through the hotel. Small hotel, small room, and small bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billrover
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Antiche Figure and I have to say that it lived up to all the previous Trip Advisor reviews I'd read before going. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The bedroom was a gem, overlooking the Grand Canal and was extremely well decorated and was spotlessly clean. The TV broke on day 1 and a brand new one was delivered within the hour. The breakfast room is small but the buffet breakfast is excellent. The hotel is easy to find near to the Railway station and The Piazzala Roma where the airport bus arrives.
