I would advise you to get the bus in from the airport - 3 Euros as you will have plenty of opportunities to use the Vaporettos (water buses) during your stay and a Water taxi will cost 80 Euros from the airport and take longer to get there.The best value and most interesting trip was the Secret Itineries Tour of the Doges Palace. Only 25 people on the tour and only in 3 languages so the English tour gets booked up with Americans, Dutch, Germans Scandinavians etc. You therefore must book in advance on the internet as the tour will be full on the day. Walking to the Rialto will take 15 mins from the hotel and St Marks will take 25mins and it is quite easy to get lost in the small alleyways. However if you follow the yellow signs its easy and its also easy getting back to the hotel as you just follow the Railway signs (Ferrovia) which are all over town.

Reviews.Title: “Film set stuff !”
Reviews.Author: UK-LV-FAN
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from 3 nts in Venice. Hotel was excellent and we felt in fab area. Staff all seemed friendly and helpful.Enjoyed sitting canalside at the hotel with a prosecco watching the world go by..would recommend Antiche Figure ! Just off the main area(of Santa Croce) discovered great restaurants in what felt like a film set...sitting out by a tiny canal with just the odd gondoler passing by was wonderful! Would love to return anytime of year !! Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Venice was like eating an entire box of chocolate liqueurs in one go, Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the title of my review is incredibly appropriate; Firstly I think Venice is the most amazing city in the World, it's unlike any other place I've been and is completely unique. Secondly our stay in Hotel Antiche Figure was without fault. The location of the hotel is excellent; on the Grand Canal and opposite of the main "taxi station" and Train station. It is also only a short walk from the Bus station which means easy access from the airport. The interior design of the Hotel is beautiful in a traditional Venetian style. Our bedroom was grand with a double bed and beautiful Chandelier. I could not fault any of the lovely staff who went out of their way too help us with our every request. (Before our stay in Venice my fiance emailed Antiche Figure to request 6 red roses be laid out on the bed for myself on our arrival. The Hotel replied promptly and the roses were there on the bed waiting for me! It was really lovely) I would highly recommend this Hotel to anybody thinking of staying in Venice. The location is ideal and the hotel incredibly beautiful and efficient. Well done Antiche Figure, and thankyou... 10/10! (I have included a photo of myself and my roses!) Louise Todd.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me recently visited Venice. As our first trip away i decided to try and get some roses laid out on the bed before arrival - the hotel managed this perfectly and got our holiday off to the best possible start! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms delightful and as for the location you cannot get much better! Right on Grande Canal, right next to one of only 3 bridges over it, opposite a water bus station, the train station and less than 5 minutes from where the coaches arrive. I would definitely definitely stay there again and your recommend it to anyone going to Venice. SMH UK

Reviews.Title: “A highlight of Venice”
Reviews.Author: EHB
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. It is small, clean, beautifully decorated, and the staff are so kind and professional. The location is amazing on the Grand Canal. It is just far enough away from St. Marco's Square to give you some relaxation and it it very easy to get from the train/bus station to the hotel (no expensive water taxis or lugging your bags all over the city). You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Antiche Figure, absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sarahog
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel Antiche Figure over the bank holiday weekend at the end of August with my mother, having done much research on Tripadvisor for the right place to stay. We couldn't have picked anywhere better. Rooms: The room we had was very large by european standards, it was a twin bedded room overlooking the Grand Canal. We had paid in advance for a grand canal room and definitely felt it was worth the extra 50 euros per night. In total, the room cost 180 euros per night and we were there for four nights. The beds were huge for single beds, very comfortable and fresh. They were made up everyday by the friendly maid. The room also had a TV and an internet socket. It was decorated in a traditional italian style with beautiful furnishings and exceptional attention to detail. The room also has a minibar, safe and large cupboards. The bathroom was equally as lovely and was again large by european standards, decorated all in marble with two sinks, a toilet and a bath with shower. The lights were all traditional Murano glass lights. Both the room and bathroom were cleaned to a very high standard every day. Even though the room was over looking the canal, once the windows are shut you hear nothing. We could not hear the amazing storm we had, let alone the rumble of waterbuses. Staff: were incredibly accommodating. Prior to the trip they answered all email correspondances very quickly and if you phone them they speak perfect english and are more than helpful. I also heard the staff speak very good spanish and french while we were there. When we arrived, we were supplied with a map of Venice and were pointed in the direction of the main sites. We were also given a free trip to Murano and tour around one of the glass factories, which was really lovely. It was very nice to be able to arrive by water taxi, which are otherwise horrendously expensive! We just went down one morning to inquire about the trip assuming we'd have to give notice but they booked it there and then and 15 minutes later we were in the taxi. The lady that served the breakfast in the morning was always so polite, happy and helpful, as were all the other staff. Breakfast itself was a small buffet, consisting of croissants, rolls, cheeses, meats, cereals, yoghurts, eggs, fruit, juices and hot drinks. A great way to start a long days sightseeing! Location: The hotel Antiche Figure is situated exactly opposite the railway station and about 5 minutes walk from Piazzale Roma (the last place that cars are allowed in the city). It was so convenient. From Marco Polo airport just take the ATVO bus costing 3 euros to Piazzale Roma (it takes about 20 minutes) and then head for the green domed church and scalzi bridge on the grand canal. You can also get a road taxi to piazzale roma but it will cost about 30 euros. Alternatively you can arrive by water taxi, but they are incredibly expensive, usually about 80 euros from the airport. If arriving from Treviso airport, you can get the ATVO bus from there for about 4.50 euros which arrives in the same place. Always remember to buy airport bus tickets from the office at the airport or, for the return journey, from the office in piazzale roma in advance. Although on the map the hotel looks like it is far from the main hub of Venice, this is simply not true. Venice is a small place and it only takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to the Rialto and St Marks area. It is a benefit to be far away from St Marks Square as you will find that the restaurants further out give much better value for money. If you can't face the walk, the waterbus stop is right outside the hotel across the bridge. You can buy a one day ticket for 10.50 euros or 3 day ticket for 22 euros. You can also buy a card called the VeniceCard blue/orange which give waterbus use and discounts at many museums and churches. If you head up to the Cannareggio region to the north there are some lovely restaurants. One restaurant which i WOULD NOT recommend is the Mirabar between the hotel and piazzale roma. It is poor value for money and the service is appauling too! Another nice thing about the hotel is that it has a small bar which is lovely at night. You can sit outside and watch the world go by. Although not to do with the hotel, I must recommend a particular tour at the Doge's Palace, called the 'Secret Itineries' tour. This needs ot be booked a few days in advance, and can be done so on the internet or by phone. The official price is 15 euros per adult, though some websites charge a lot more. We phoned up the palace 4 days before arrival but when we arrived they had lost the reservation number and claimed it was our fault and handed it back to us. It took about 25 minutes of 'discussions' to sort it out but eventually they let us go anyway even though they said it was all our fault and not their responsibility. Half way around the tour, the guide presented us with a reference number asking if it was ours, which it matched exactly, it had been lost in the office, no apology... The tour itself however is fantastic, it takes you to all the locked rooms in the doge's palace. You get to see the torture chambers, learn all about the system and hear Casanova's tale and see the cells where he was kept prisoner. I would also recommend a tour of the theatre La Fenice. It costs 7 euros each (6 euros on presentation of a waterbus ticket at the ACTV office in piazzale roma). it is very good value and they run tours in all different languages. So, the reason I have given the Antiche Figure 5/5 is because it is exceptional value for a 3* superior hotel. I doubt you would find another hotel at this price to match the Antiche Figure. Sorry to also include other information, but felt it might be useful!!! I would recommend the hotel's website for pictures of the rooms and location etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: etw57
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Antiche Figure at the end of March. We booked the hotel after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor, and couldn't have picked a better hotel. The location is perfect and only a few minutes walk from the bus terminal (Direct bus from the airport for about 3 euros). The hotel is a charming old building situated on the Grand Canal, and throughout our stay the staff were friendly and more than helpful. Our room on the second floor was beautifully decorated, very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was as expected for a three star hotel and a welcome start to the day! We easily managed to walk all over Venice from here (about 15 minutes to St Marks), it was nice to return to an area not so crowded with tourists after a busy day sightseeing. We would definately stay at this hotel again on returning to Venice as we had such a fantastic time here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Antiche Figure is a marvelous small hotel. Our room faced the Grand Hotel, and although this meant that it was occasionally noisy, I enjoyed having the view. The room was very comfortable. The bathroom was quite large for a European hotel. The staff were accommodating, although some were more helpful and knowledgable than others. I made the reservations directly with the hotel, with ease, and was provided the same rate as an online service had advertised. The hotel is located a bit far from the "action" in Venice (the Piazza), but we did not mind walking. Others might find the distance to be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “If only all 3 star hotels were like this”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. We stayed just two nights in Venice at the end of a long European vacation. We had a room with a view of the Grande Canal--which I would recommend spending the extra for. The room was great. We had stayed in five star hotels which were not a whole lot better than this one. The staff was wonderful, the room was very clean, the location was great, and of course Venice was awesome. The hotel exceeded our expectations and we would stay there again without even looking at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Antiche Figure! Located directly across the Grand Canal from the train station, it was convenient for our arrival to and departure from the city, in addition to providing a great base for exploring all areas of Venice. There are vaporetto stations directly across the water, a bridge 50 m away, and restaurants and stores close by. The staff were friendly and spoke English well, and the breakfast the hotel provided was nice. The room was spacious, as was the shower--something we did not find in other Italian hotels. Excellent for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Could'nt have been better”
Reviews.Author: ayejay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June and could'nt have picked a better location. The staff were very friendly and helpful when required, the room was outstanding with a full view of the canal it was very entertaining just to lean out the window and watch all the boats and people going by. They certainly go all out with decoration in venice even the bathroom had a chandelier it was all very posh. The breakfast provided was good to always nice to have it included. The location was great for restaurants or just wandering around siteseeing. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Little Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: cami612
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a long weekend in Venice, and were very pleased with the Hotel Antiche Figure. The rooms are not huge, but very clean and well-appointed. The staff are friendly, professional, and very helpful (special thanks to Gwendolina (sp?) and Alessandro). It is well worth booking a canal view room. We arrived before our room had been vacated (checkout is noon), and agreed to stay our first night in a non-canal view room, which was small, but we wanted to get out and about. The next day we were moved to room 412, which is one of the largest rooms, canal view, no balcony, non-smoking. The buffet breakfast, which is included in the price, is from 7 until 10, and includes croissants, rolls, yogurt, cheese, fruit, cereal, cold cuts, etc. The hotel is across the Grand Canal from the railway station, and a short walk from the bus station in Piazzale Roma, but our room was quiet nevertheless. If you arrive by train, walk over the Scalzi bridge -- the hotel is next to the church with the green dome. If you arrive by bus (take the blue ATVO express bus from Marco Polo airport, 3 euros) just walk down the Grand Canal toward the aforementioned church. We highly recommend Ristorante Ribo, which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, in Fondamenta Minotto. It isn't cheap (dinner for two, with antipasto, pasta, main course, a bottle of wine and dessert costs about 140 euros) but well worth it-- we ate dinner there twice, and the seafood is delicious. We will certainly stay at Antiche Figure again.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect introduction to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has been our first trip to Venice and indeed Italy, we wanted somewhere cosy, clean, good value and close to the railway station for our onward journey to Tuscany, we weren't dissapointed! the hotel is tastefully decorated, everything was spotlessly clean and worked as it should, the staff were very friendly and helpful but still remained very professional. We were so impressed with the Hotel (and Venice!) we decided to cut short our wonderful holiday in Tuscany and (luckily) booked back into the hotel for one last night in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We looked and looked on the internet for a reasonable but nice Hotel in Venice.We went with friends so we were both looking.We wanted something special but not the expensive rates that Many hotels in Venice charge. We arrived tired,but what a wonderful surprise!! We requested one of the Balcony rooms,WOW!!! worth the extra money! Looking out below on to the Grand Canal,I had to pinch myself! The rooms were 5* standard.Gorgeous Bathroom with Murano Chandelers! Restaurant very small,only breakfast available but very nice.Staff extremley friendly and very helpful.Ideal Location,some good restaurants nearby. If you book this Hotel you will not be sorry!!! I have told my Husband he has to take me back for a Romantic Break!

Reviews.Title: “Problems with reservations - again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked a four night stay at the hotel I was a little nervous at comments about reservations - therfore I did e-mail about four weeks before arrival. However on arrival at the hotel we were told there was problems with the booking and we had been 'upgraded' to the Bellini - which was just across the bridge. Therefore I cannot rate the hotel. Where we transferred was adequate though the rooms were small. I would say though that Venise was absolutely stunning. The three day pass on the vaporetto was probably the best bargain of the holiday. And we were treated to an amazing thunder storm on the Thursday night. All I can say is check your booking carefully

Reviews.Title: “Number 11? Don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: Pilatus
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this hotel ranks number 11 of all hotels in Venice. The rest must be pretty poor then as this is just your average bland hotel. The rooms are a reasonable size, but cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired. We actually found traces of "poo" on the toilet after checking in! Disgusting. Reception staff are nice, but the waitress in the breakfast area was unbelievably unfriendly and seemed to get great pleasure in trying to make as much noise as possible when setting or cleaning the tables. She never even made the effort to come round and offer us any coffee or tea. Most guests had to ask for plates, orange juice was not refilled etc. The breakfast was the most dissapointing I've ever had. Cheap quality and little selection. The one good thing about this hotel is its location (right accross the train station). All in all a very unimpressive hotel and I will not bother returning. Sooooo not worth the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Antiche Figure
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce, 687 | Fondamenta S. Simeon Piccolo, 30135 Venice, Italy
